18960       tool_specified="$COMM"
18961       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
18962       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
18963         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
18964         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool COMM=$tool_basename" >&5
18965 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool COMM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
18966         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
18967 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
18968 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
18969 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
18970 if ${ac_cv_path_COMM+:} false; then :
18971   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
18972 else
18973   case $COMM in
18974   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
18975   ac_cv_path_COMM="$COMM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
18976   ;;
18977   *)
18978   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
18979 for as_dir in $PATH
18980 do
18981   IFS=$as_save_IFS
18982   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
18983     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
18984   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
18985     ac_cv_path_COMM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
18986     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
18987     break 2
18988   fi
18989 done
18990   done
18991 IFS=$as_save_IFS
18992 
18993   ;;
18994 esac
18995 fi
18996 COMM=$ac_cv_path_COMM
18997 if test -n "$COMM"; then
18998   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $COMM" >&5
18999 $as_echo "$COMM" >&6; }
19000 else
19001   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19002 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19003 fi
19004 
19005 
19006         if test "x$COMM" = x; then
19007           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
19008         fi
19009       else
19010         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
19011         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool COMM=$tool_specified" >&5
19012 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool COMM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
19013         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for COMM" >&5
19014 $as_echo_n "checking for COMM... " >&6; }
19015         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
19016           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
19017 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
19018           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool COMM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
19019         fi
19020         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
19021 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
19022       fi
19023     fi
19024   fi
19025 
19026 
19027 
19028   if test "x$COMM" = x; then
19029     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for COMM" "$LINENO" 5
19030   fi
19031 
19032 
19033   fi
19034 
19035   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
19036 
19037 
19038 
19039   # Publish this variable in the help.
19040 
19041 
19042   if test "x$DSYMUTIL" = x; then
19043     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
19044     for ac_prog in dsymutil
19045 do
19046   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19047 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19048 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19049 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19050 if ${ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL+:} false; then :
19051   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19052 else
19053   case $DSYMUTIL in
19054   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19055   ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$DSYMUTIL" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19056   ;;
19057   *)
19058   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19059 for as_dir in $PATH
19060 do
19061   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19062   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19063     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19064   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19065     ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19066     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19067     break 2
19068   fi
19069 done
19070   done
19071 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19072 
19073   ;;
19074 esac
19075 fi
19076 DSYMUTIL=$ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL
19077 if test -n "$DSYMUTIL"; then
19078   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DSYMUTIL" >&5
19079 $as_echo "$DSYMUTIL" >&6; }
19080 else
19081   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19082 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19083 fi
19084 
19085 
19086   test -n "$DSYMUTIL" && break
19087 done
19088 
19089   else
19090     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
19091 
19092     # Try to remove the string !DSYMUTIL! from our list.
19093     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!DSYMUTIL!/}
19094     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
19095       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
19096       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
19097       if test "xDSYMUTIL" != xBASH; then
19098         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of DSYMUTIL from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
19099 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of DSYMUTIL from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
19100       fi
19101       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
19102       for ac_prog in dsymutil
19103 do
19104   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19105 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19106 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19107 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19108 if ${ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL+:} false; then :
19109   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19110 else
19111   case $DSYMUTIL in
19112   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19113   ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$DSYMUTIL" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19114   ;;
19115   *)
19116   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19117 for as_dir in $PATH
19118 do
19119   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19120   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19121     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19122   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19123     ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19124     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19125     break 2
19126   fi
19127 done
19128   done
19129 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19130 
19131   ;;
19132 esac
19133 fi
19134 DSYMUTIL=$ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL
19135 if test -n "$DSYMUTIL"; then
19136   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DSYMUTIL" >&5
19137 $as_echo "$DSYMUTIL" >&6; }
19138 else
19139   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19140 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19141 fi
19142 
19143 
19144   test -n "$DSYMUTIL" && break
19145 done
19146 
19147     else
19148       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
19149       # for the tool.
19150 
19151       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
19152       # for unknown variables in the end.
19153       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
19154 
19155       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
19156       tool_specified="$DSYMUTIL"
19157       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
19158       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
19159         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
19160         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool DSYMUTIL=$tool_basename" >&5
19161 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool DSYMUTIL=$tool_basename" >&6;}
19162         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
19163 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
19164 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19165 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19166 if ${ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL+:} false; then :
19167   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19168 else
19169   case $DSYMUTIL in
19170   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19171   ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$DSYMUTIL" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19172   ;;
19173   *)
19174   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19175 for as_dir in $PATH
19176 do
19177   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19178   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19179     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19180   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19181     ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19182     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19183     break 2
19184   fi
19185 done
19186   done
19187 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19188 
19189   ;;
19190 esac
19191 fi
19192 DSYMUTIL=$ac_cv_path_DSYMUTIL
19193 if test -n "$DSYMUTIL"; then
19194   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DSYMUTIL" >&5
19195 $as_echo "$DSYMUTIL" >&6; }
19196 else
19197   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19198 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19199 fi
19200 
19201 
19202         if test "x$DSYMUTIL" = x; then
19203           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
19204         fi
19205       else
19206         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
19207         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool DSYMUTIL=$tool_specified" >&5
19208 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool DSYMUTIL=$tool_specified" >&6;}
19209         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for DSYMUTIL" >&5
19210 $as_echo_n "checking for DSYMUTIL... " >&6; }
19211         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
19212           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
19213 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
19214           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool DSYMUTIL=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
19215         fi
19216         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
19217 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
19218       fi
19219     fi
19220   fi
19221 
19222 
19223 
19224   if test "x$DSYMUTIL" = x; then
19225     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for DSYMUTIL" "$LINENO" 5
19226   fi
19227

19230 
19231 
19232   # Publish this variable in the help.
19233

19260     break 2
19261   fi
19262 done
19263   done

19265

19267 esac

19280 done

19287     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
19288       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
19289       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
19290       if test "xXATTR" != xBASH; then
19291         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of XATTR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5

19293       fi

19323

19411       fi

19418     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for XATTR" "$LINENO" 5

19438   case $CODESIGN in
19439   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)

19523 else
19524   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19525 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19526 fi
19527 
19528 
19529   test -n "$CODESIGN" && break
19530 done
19531 
19532     else
19533       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
19534       # for the tool.
19535 
19536       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
19537       # for unknown variables in the end.
19538       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
19539 
19540       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
19541       tool_specified="$CODESIGN"
19542       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
19543       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
19544         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
19545         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_basename" >&5
19546 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_basename" >&6;}
19547         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
19548 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
19549 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19550 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19551 if ${ac_cv_path_CODESIGN+:} false; then :
19552   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19553 else
19554   case $CODESIGN in
19555   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19556   ac_cv_path_CODESIGN="$CODESIGN" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19557   ;;
19558   *)
19559   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19560 for as_dir in $PATH
19561 do
19562   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19563   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19564     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19565   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19566     ac_cv_path_CODESIGN="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19567     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19568     break 2
19569   fi
19570 done
19571   done
19572 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19573 
19574   ;;
19575 esac
19576 fi
19577 CODESIGN=$ac_cv_path_CODESIGN
19578 if test -n "$CODESIGN"; then
19579   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CODESIGN" >&5
19580 $as_echo "$CODESIGN" >&6; }
19581 else
19582   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19583 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19584 fi
19585 
19586 
19587         if test "x$CODESIGN" = x; then
19588           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
19589         fi
19590       else
19591         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
19592         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified" >&5
19593 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified" >&6;}
19594         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CODESIGN" >&5
19595 $as_echo_n "checking for CODESIGN... " >&6; }
19596         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
19597           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
19598 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
19599           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
19600         fi
19601         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
19602 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
19603       fi
19604     fi
19605   fi
19606 
19607 
19608     if test "x$CODESIGN" != "x"; then
19609       # Verify that the openjdk_codesign certificate is present
19610       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if openjdk_codesign certificate is present" >&5
19611 $as_echo_n "checking if openjdk_codesign certificate is present... " >&6; }
19612       rm -f codesign-testfile
19613       touch codesign-testfile
19614       codesign -s openjdk_codesign codesign-testfile 2>&5 >&5 || CODESIGN=
19615       rm -f codesign-testfile
19616       if test "x$CODESIGN" = x; then
19617         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19618 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19619       else
19620         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19621 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19622       fi
19623     fi
19624   fi
19625 
19626 
19627   # Test if bash supports pipefail.
19628   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if bash supports pipefail" >&5
19629 $as_echo_n "checking if bash supports pipefail... " >&6; }
19630   if ${BASH} -c 'set -o pipefail'; then
19631     BASH_ARGS="$BASH_ARGS -o pipefail"
19632     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19633 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19634   else
19635     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19636 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19637   fi
19638 
19639   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if bash supports errexit (-e)" >&5
19640 $as_echo_n "checking if bash supports errexit (-e)... " >&6; }
19641   if ${BASH} -e -c 'true'; then
19642     BASH_ARGS="$BASH_ARGS -e"
19643     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19644 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19645   else
19646     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19647 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19648   fi
19649 
19650 
19651 
19652 
19653 # Check if pkg-config is available.
19654 
19655 
19656 if test "x$ac_cv_env_PKG_CONFIG_set" != "xset"; then
19657         if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
19658   # Extract the first word of "${ac_tool_prefix}pkg-config", so it can be a program name with args.
19659 set dummy ${ac_tool_prefix}pkg-config; ac_word=$2
19660 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19661 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19662 if ${ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG+:} false; then :
19663   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19664 else
19665   case $PKG_CONFIG in
19666   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19667   ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG="$PKG_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19668   ;;
19669   *)
19670   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19671 for as_dir in $PATH
19672 do
19673   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19674   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19675     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19676   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19677     ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19678     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19679     break 2
19680   fi
19681 done
19682   done
19683 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19684 
19685   ;;
19686 esac
19687 fi
19688 PKG_CONFIG=$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG
19689 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
19690   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PKG_CONFIG" >&5
19691 $as_echo "$PKG_CONFIG" >&6; }
19692 else
19693   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19694 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19695 fi
19696 
19697 
19698 fi
19699 if test -z "$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG"; then
19700   ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG=$PKG_CONFIG
19701   # Extract the first word of "pkg-config", so it can be a program name with args.
19702 set dummy pkg-config; ac_word=$2
19703 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19704 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19705 if ${ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG+:} false; then :
19706   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19707 else
19708   case $ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG in
19709   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19710   ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG="$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19711   ;;
19712   *)
19713   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19714 for as_dir in $PATH
19715 do
19716   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19717   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19718     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19719   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19720     ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19721     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19722     break 2
19723   fi
19724 done
19725   done
19726 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19727 
19728   ;;
19729 esac
19730 fi
19731 ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG=$ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG
19732 if test -n "$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG"; then
19733   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" >&5
19734 $as_echo "$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" >&6; }
19735 else
19736   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19737 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19738 fi
19739 
19740   if test "x$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" = x; then
19741     PKG_CONFIG=""
19742   else
19743     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
19744 yes:)
19745 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
19746 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
19747 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
19748 esac
19749     PKG_CONFIG=$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG
19750   fi
19751 else
19752   PKG_CONFIG="$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG"
19753 fi
19754 
19755 fi
19756 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
19757         _pkg_min_version=0.9.0
19758         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking pkg-config is at least version $_pkg_min_version" >&5
19759 $as_echo_n "checking pkg-config is at least version $_pkg_min_version... " >&6; }
19760         if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version $_pkg_min_version; then
19761                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19762 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19763         else
19764                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19765 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19766                 PKG_CONFIG=""
19767         fi
19768 
19769 fi
19770 
19771 # After basic tools have been setup, we can check build os specific details.
19772 
19773   ###############################################################################
19774 
19775   # Note that this is the build platform OS version!
19776 
19777   OS_VERSION="`uname -r | ${SED} 's!\.! !g' | ${SED} 's!-! !g'`"
19778   OS_VERSION_MAJOR="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 1 -d ' '`"
19779   OS_VERSION_MINOR="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 2 -d ' '`"
19780   OS_VERSION_MICRO="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 3 -d ' '`"
19781 
19782 
19783 
19784 
19785 
19786 # Setup builddeps, for automatic downloading of tools we need.
19787 # This is needed before we can call BDEPS_CHECK_MODULE, which is done in
19788 # boot-jdk setup, but we need to have basic tools setup first.
19789 
19790 
19791 # Check whether --with-builddeps-conf was given.
19792 if test "${with_builddeps_conf+set}" = set; then :
19793   withval=$with_builddeps_conf;
19794 fi
19795 
19796 
19797 
19798 # Check whether --with-builddeps-server was given.
19799 if test "${with_builddeps_server+set}" = set; then :
19800   withval=$with_builddeps_server;
19801 fi
19802 
19803 
19804 
19805 # Check whether --with-builddeps-dir was given.
19806 if test "${with_builddeps_dir+set}" = set; then :
19807   withval=$with_builddeps_dir;
19808 else
19809   with_builddeps_dir=/localhome/builddeps
19810 fi
19811 
19812 
19813 
19814 # Check whether --with-builddeps-group was given.
19815 if test "${with_builddeps_group+set}" = set; then :
19816   withval=$with_builddeps_group;
19817 fi
19818 
19819 
19820 
19821 
19822   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
19823     if test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
19824       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for supplied builddeps configuration file" >&5
19825 $as_echo_n "checking for supplied builddeps configuration file... " >&6; }
19826       builddepsfile=$with_builddeps_conf
19827       if test -s $builddepsfile; then
19828         . $builddepsfile
19829         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: loaded!" >&5
19830 $as_echo "loaded!" >&6; }
19831       else
19832         as_fn_error $? "The given builddeps conf file $with_builddeps_conf could not be loaded!" "$LINENO" 5
19833       fi
19834     else
19835       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for builddeps.conf files in sources..." >&5
19836 $as_echo_n "checking for builddeps.conf files in sources...... " >&6; }
19837       builddepsfile=`mktemp`
19838       touch $builddepsfile
19839       # Put all found confs into a single file.
19840       find ${SRC_ROOT} -name builddeps.conf -exec cat \{\} \; >> $builddepsfile
19841       # Source the file to acquire the variables
19842       if test -s $builddepsfile; then
19843         . $builddepsfile
19844         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: found at least one!" >&5
19845 $as_echo "found at least one!" >&6; }
19846       else
19847         as_fn_error $? "Could not find any builddeps.conf at all!" "$LINENO" 5
19848       fi
19849     fi
19850     # Create build and target names that use _ instead of "-" and ".".
19851     # This is necessary to use them in variable names.
19852     build_var=`echo ${OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19853     target_var=`echo ${OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19854     # Extract rewrite information for build and target
19855     eval rewritten_build=\${REWRITE_${build_var}}
19856     if test "x$rewritten_build" = x; then
19857       rewritten_build=${OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME}
19858       echo Build stays the same $rewritten_build
19859     else
19860       echo Rewriting build for builddeps into $rewritten_build
19861     fi
19862     eval rewritten_target=\${REWRITE_${target_var}}
19863     if test "x$rewritten_target" = x; then
19864       rewritten_target=${OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME}
19865       echo Target stays the same $rewritten_target
19866     else
19867       echo Rewriting target for builddeps into $rewritten_target
19868     fi
19869     rewritten_build_var=`echo ${rewritten_build} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19870     rewritten_target_var=`echo ${rewritten_target} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19871   fi
19872   for ac_prog in 7z unzip
19873 do
19874   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19875 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19876 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19877 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19878 if ${ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP+:} false; then :
19879   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19880 else
19881   if test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP"; then
19882   ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP="$BDEPS_UNZIP" # Let the user override the test.
19883 else
19884 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19885 for as_dir in $PATH
19886 do
19887   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19888   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19889     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19890   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19891     ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP="$ac_prog"
19892     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19893     break 2
19894   fi
19895 done
19896   done
19897 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19898 
19899 fi
19900 fi
19901 BDEPS_UNZIP=$ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP
19902 if test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP"; then
19903   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BDEPS_UNZIP" >&5
19904 $as_echo "$BDEPS_UNZIP" >&6; }
19905 else
19906   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19907 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19908 fi
19909 
19910 
19911   test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP" && break
19912 done
19913 
19914   if test "x$BDEPS_UNZIP" = x7z; then
19915     BDEPS_UNZIP="7z x"
19916   fi
19917 
19918   for ac_prog in wget lftp ftp
19919 do
19920   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19921 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19922 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19923 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19924 if ${ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP+:} false; then :
19925   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19926 else
19927   if test -n "$BDEPS_FTP"; then
19928   ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP="$BDEPS_FTP" # Let the user override the test.
19929 else
19930 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19931 for as_dir in $PATH
19932 do
19933   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19934   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19935     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19936   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19937     ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP="$ac_prog"
19938     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19939     break 2
19940   fi
19941 done
19942   done
19943 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19944 
19945 fi
19946 fi
19947 BDEPS_FTP=$ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP
19948 if test -n "$BDEPS_FTP"; then
19949   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BDEPS_FTP" >&5
19950 $as_echo "$BDEPS_FTP" >&6; }
19951 else
19952   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19953 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19954 fi
19955 
19956 
19957   test -n "$BDEPS_FTP" && break
19958 done
19959 
19960 
19961 
19962 ###############################################################################
19963 #
19964 # Determine OpenJDK variants, options and version numbers.
19965 #
19966 ###############################################################################
19967 
19968 # We need build & target for this.
19969 
19970 
19971   ###############################################################################
19972   #
19973   # Should we build a JDK/JVM with headful support (ie a graphical ui)?
19974   # We always build headless support.
19975   #
19976   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking headful support" >&5
19977 $as_echo_n "checking headful support... " >&6; }
19978   # Check whether --enable-headful was given.
19979 if test "${enable_headful+set}" = set; then :
19980   enableval=$enable_headful; SUPPORT_HEADFUL=${enable_headful}
19981 else
19982   SUPPORT_HEADFUL=yes
19983 fi
19984 
19985 
19986   SUPPORT_HEADLESS=yes
19987   BUILD_HEADLESS="BUILD_HEADLESS:=true"
19988 
19989   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xyes; then
19990     # We are building both headful and headless.
19991     headful_msg="include support for both headful and headless"
19992   fi
19993 
19994   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xno; then
19995     # Thus we are building headless only.
19996     BUILD_HEADLESS="BUILD_HEADLESS:=true"
19997     headful_msg="headless only"
19998   fi
19999 
20000   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $headful_msg" >&5
20001 $as_echo "$headful_msg" >&6; }
20002 
20003 
20004 
20005 
20006 
20007   # Control wether Hotspot runs Queens test after build.
20008   # Check whether --enable-hotspot-test-in-build was given.
20009 if test "${enable_hotspot_test_in_build+set}" = set; then :
20010   enableval=$enable_hotspot_test_in_build;
20011 else
20012   enable_hotspot_test_in_build=no
20013 fi
20014 
20015   if test "x$enable_hotspot_test_in_build" = "xyes"; then
20016     TEST_IN_BUILD=true
20017   else
20018     TEST_IN_BUILD=false
20019   fi
20020 
20021 
20022   ###############################################################################
20023   #
20024   # Choose cacerts source file
20025   #
20026 
20027 # Check whether --with-cacerts-file was given.
20028 if test "${with_cacerts_file+set}" = set; then :
20029   withval=$with_cacerts_file;
20030 fi
20031 
20032   if test "x$with_cacerts_file" != x; then
20033     CACERTS_FILE=$with_cacerts_file
20034   fi
20035 
20036 
20037   ###############################################################################
20038   #
20039   # Enable or disable unlimited crypto
20040   #
20041   # Check whether --enable-unlimited-crypto was given.
20042 if test "${enable_unlimited_crypto+set}" = set; then :
20043   enableval=$enable_unlimited_crypto;
20044 else
20045   enable_unlimited_crypto=no
20046 fi
20047 
20048   if test "x$enable_unlimited_crypto" = "xyes"; then
20049     UNLIMITED_CRYPTO=true
20050   else
20051     UNLIMITED_CRYPTO=false
20052   fi
20053 
20054 
20055   ###############################################################################
20056   #
20057   # Enable or disable the elliptic curve crypto implementation
20058   #
20059 
20060 
20061   ###############################################################################
20062   #
20063   # --enable-rmiconnector-iiop
20064   #
20065   # Check whether --enable-rmiconnector-iiop was given.
20066 if test "${enable_rmiconnector_iiop+set}" = set; then :
20067   enableval=$enable_rmiconnector_iiop;
20068 fi
20069 
20070   if test "x$enable_rmiconnector_iiop" = "xyes"; then
20071     RMICONNECTOR_IIOP=true
20072   else
20073     RMICONNECTOR_IIOP=false
20074   fi
20075 
20076 
20077   ###############################################################################
20078   #
20079   # Compress jars
20080   #
20081   COMPRESS_JARS=false
20082 
20083 
20084 
20085 
20086   # Source the version numbers
20087   . $AUTOCONF_DIR/version-numbers
20088 
20089   # Get the settings from parameters
20090 
20091 # Check whether --with-milestone was given.
20092 if test "${with_milestone+set}" = set; then :
20093   withval=$with_milestone;
20094 fi
20095 
20096   if test "x$with_milestone" = xyes; then
20097     as_fn_error $? "Milestone must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20098   elif test "x$with_milestone" != x; then
20099     MILESTONE="$with_milestone"
20100   fi
20101   if test "x$MILESTONE" = x; then
20102     MILESTONE=internal
20103   fi
20104 
20105 
20106 # Check whether --with-update-version was given.
20107 if test "${with_update_version+set}" = set; then :
20108   withval=$with_update_version;
20109 fi
20110 
20111   if test "x$with_update_version" = xyes; then
20112     as_fn_error $? "Update version must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20113   elif test "x$with_update_version" != x; then
20114     JDK_UPDATE_VERSION="$with_update_version"
20115     # On macosx 10.7, it's not possible to set --with-update-version=0X due
20116     # to a bug in expr (which reduces it to just X). To work around this, we
20117     # always add a 0 to one digit update versions.
20118     if test "${#JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}" = "1"; then
20119       JDK_UPDATE_VERSION="0${JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}"
20120     fi
20121   fi
20122 
20123 
20124 # Check whether --with-user-release-suffix was given.
20125 if test "${with_user_release_suffix+set}" = set; then :
20126   withval=$with_user_release_suffix;
20127 fi
20128 
20129   if test "x$with_user_release_suffix" = xyes; then
20130     as_fn_error $? "Release suffix must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20131   elif test "x$with_user_release_suffix" != x; then
20132     USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX="$with_user_release_suffix"
20133   fi
20134 
20135 
20136 # Check whether --with-build-number was given.
20137 if test "${with_build_number+set}" = set; then :
20138   withval=$with_build_number;
20139 fi
20140 
20141   if test "x$with_build_number" = xyes; then
20142     as_fn_error $? "Build number must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20143   elif test "x$with_build_number" != x; then
20144     JDK_BUILD_NUMBER="$with_build_number"
20145   fi
20146   # Define default USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX if BUILD_NUMBER and USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX are not set
20147   if test "x$JDK_BUILD_NUMBER" = x; then
20148     JDK_BUILD_NUMBER=b00
20149     if test "x$USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX" = x; then
20150       BUILD_DATE=`date '+%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M'`
20151       # Avoid [:alnum:] since it depends on the locale.
20152       CLEAN_USERNAME=`echo "$USER" | $TR -d -c 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789'`
20153       USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX=`echo "${CLEAN_USERNAME}_${BUILD_DATE}" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20154     fi
20155   fi
20156 
20157   # Now set the JDK version, milestone, build number etc.
20158 
20159 
20160 
20161 
20162 
20163 
20164 
20165 
20166 
20167 
20168 
20169 
20170 
20171 
20172 
20173 
20174 # Check whether --with-copyright-year was given.
20175 if test "${with_copyright_year+set}" = set; then :
20176   withval=$with_copyright_year;
20177 fi
20178 
20179   if test "x$with_copyright_year" = xyes; then
20180     as_fn_error $? "Copyright year must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20181   elif test "x$with_copyright_year" != x; then
20182     COPYRIGHT_YEAR="$with_copyright_year"
20183   else
20184     COPYRIGHT_YEAR=`date +'%Y'`
20185   fi
20186 
20187 
20188   if test "x$JDK_UPDATE_VERSION" != x; then
20189     JDK_VERSION="${JDK_MAJOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MINOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MICRO_VERSION}_${JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}"
20190   else
20191     JDK_VERSION="${JDK_MAJOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MINOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MICRO_VERSION}"
20192   fi
20193 
20194 
20195   COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER=`$ECHO $JDK_BUILD_NUMBER | $SED -e 's/^b//' -e 's/^0//'`
20196 
20197 
20198 
20199 ###############################################################################
20200 #
20201 # Setup BootJDK, used to bootstrap the build.
20202 #
20203 ###############################################################################
20204 
20205 
20206   BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20207 
20208 # Check whether --with-boot-jdk was given.
20209 if test "${with_boot_jdk+set}" = set; then :
20210   withval=$with_boot_jdk;
20211 fi
20212 
20213 
20214   # We look for the Boot JDK through various means, going from more certain to
20215   # more of a guess-work. After each test, BOOT_JDK_FOUND is set to "yes" if
20216   # we detected something (if so, the path to the jdk is in BOOT_JDK). But we
20217   # must check if this is indeed valid; otherwise we'll continue looking.
20218 
20219   # Test: Is bootjdk explicitely set by command line arguments?
20220 
20221   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20222     # Now execute the test
20223 
20224   if test "x$with_boot_jdk" != x; then
20225     BOOT_JDK=$with_boot_jdk
20226     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20227     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using configure arguments" >&5
20228 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using configure arguments" >&6;}
20229   fi
20230 
20231 
20232     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20233     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20234       # Do we have a bin/java?
20235       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20236         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20237 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20238         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20239       else
20240         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20241         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20242           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20243 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20244           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20245 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20246           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20247         else
20248           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20249           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20250 
20251           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20252           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20253           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20254             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20255 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20256             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20257 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20258             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20259           else
20260             # We're done! :-)
20261             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20262 
20263   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20264 
20265   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20266   # unix format.
20267   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20268   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20269 
20270   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20271   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20272   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20273   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20274   #
20275   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20276   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20277   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20278   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20279     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20280 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20281     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20282   fi
20283 
20284   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20285   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20286 
20287   input_path="$new_path"
20288   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20289   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20290   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20291   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20292   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20293   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20294     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20295     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20296     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20297     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20298       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20299       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20300       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20301       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20302       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20303       new_path="$input_path"
20304     fi
20305   fi
20306 
20307   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20308   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20309     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20310     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20311       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20312       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20313       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20314     fi
20315   fi
20316 
20317 
20318   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20319     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20320     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20321 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20322   fi
20323 
20324   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20325 
20326   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20327   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20328   new_path="$path"
20329   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20330     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20331     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20332   fi
20333 
20334 
20335   input_path="$new_path"
20336   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20337   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20338   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20339   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20340   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20341   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20342     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20343     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20344   fi
20345 
20346 
20347   windows_path="$new_path"
20348   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20349     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20350     new_path="$unix_path"
20351   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20352     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20353     new_path="$unix_path"
20354   fi
20355 
20356   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20357     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20358     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20359 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20360   fi
20361 
20362   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20363   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20364 
20365   else
20366     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20367     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20368     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20369     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20370       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20371 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20372       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20373     fi
20374 
20375     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20376     eval path="$path"
20377     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20378       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20379     fi
20380 
20381     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20382   fi
20383 
20384             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20385 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20386             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20387 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20388             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20389 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20390             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20391             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20392 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20393           fi # end check jdk version
20394         fi # end check javac
20395       fi # end check java
20396     fi # end check boot jdk found
20397   fi
20398 
20399   if test "x$with_boot_jdk" != x && test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20400     # Having specified an argument which is incorrect will produce an instant failure;
20401     # we should not go on looking
20402     as_fn_error $? "The path given by --with-boot-jdk does not contain a valid Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20403   fi
20404 
20405   # Test: Is bootjdk available from builddeps?
20406 
20407   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20408     # Now execute the test
20409 
20410 
20411 
20412   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
20413     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
20414     . $builddepsfile
20415     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
20416     eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
20417     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20418       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
20419       eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
20420     fi
20421     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20422       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
20423       eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
20424     fi
20425     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20426       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
20427       # (The bootjdk comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
20428       resource=${builddep_bootjdk}
20429     fi
20430     if test "x$resource" != x; then
20431       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for bootjdk" >&5
20432 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for bootjdk" >&6;}
20433       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
20434       # for example /java/linux/cups
20435       if test -d ${resource}; then
20436         depdir=${resource}
20437       else
20438 
20439   # bootjdk is for example mymodule
20440   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
20441   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
20442   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
20443   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
20444   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
20445   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
20446   filename=`basename $resource`
20447   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
20448   filebase=${filename%%.*}
20449   extension=${filename#*.}
20450   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
20451   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
20452     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency bootjdk from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
20453 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency bootjdk from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
20454     if test ! -d $installdir; then
20455       mkdir -p $installdir
20456     fi
20457     if test ! -d $installdir; then
20458       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
20459     fi
20460     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/bootjdk.XXXXXXXXX`
20461     touch $tmpfile
20462     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
20463       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
20464     fi
20465 
20466   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
20467   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
20468   VALID_TOOL=no
20469   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
20470     VALID_TOOL=yes
20471     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
20472   fi
20473   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
20474     VALID_TOOL=yes
20475     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
20476   fi
20477   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
20478     VALID_TOOL=yes
20479     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
20480     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
20481     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
20482     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
20483       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
20484       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
20485       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
20486     else
20487       FTPUSER=ftp
20488       FTPPWD=ftp
20489     fi
20490     # the "pass" command does not work on some
20491     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
20492     # passive mode is better!
20493     ( \
20494         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
20495         echo "pass"                         ; \
20496         echo "bin"                          ; \
20497         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
20498     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
20499   fi
20500   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
20501     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
20502   fi
20503 
20504     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
20505     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
20506       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
20507     fi
20508     case "$extension" in
20509       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
20510         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20511         ;;
20512       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
20513         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20514         ;;
20515       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
20516         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20517         ;;
20518       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
20519         ;;
20520     esac
20521   fi
20522   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
20523     depdir=$installdir
20524   fi
20525 
20526       fi
20527       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
20528       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
20529       . $builddepsfile
20530       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
20531       theroot=${builddep_bootjdk_ROOT}
20532       thecflags=${builddep_bootjdk_CFLAGS}
20533       thelibs=${builddep_bootjdk_LIBS}
20534       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
20535         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency bootjdk" "$LINENO" 5
20536       fi
20537       BOOT_JDK=$depdir
20538       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
20539         BOOT_JDK="$theroot"
20540       fi
20541       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
20542         BOOT_JDK_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
20543       fi
20544       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
20545         BOOT_JDK_LIBS="$thelibs"
20546       fi
20547       BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20548       else BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20549 
20550     fi
20551     else BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20552 
20553   fi
20554 
20555 
20556 
20557     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20558     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20559       # Do we have a bin/java?
20560       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20561         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20562 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20563         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20564       else
20565         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20566         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20567           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20568 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20569           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20570 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20571           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20572         else
20573           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20574           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20575 
20576           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20577           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20578           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20579             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20580 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20581             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20582 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20583             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20584           else
20585             # We're done! :-)
20586             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20587 
20588   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20589 
20590   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20591   # unix format.
20592   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20593   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20594 
20595   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20596   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20597   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20598   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20599   #
20600   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20601   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20602   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20603   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20604     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20605 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20606     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20607   fi
20608 
20609   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20610   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20611 
20612   input_path="$new_path"
20613   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20614   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20615   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20616   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20617   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20618   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20619     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20620     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20621     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20622     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20623       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20624       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20625       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20626       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20627       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20628       new_path="$input_path"
20629     fi
20630   fi
20631 
20632   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20633   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20634     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20635     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20636       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20637       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20638       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20639     fi
20640   fi
20641 
20642 
20643   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20644     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20645     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20646 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20647   fi
20648 
20649   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20650 
20651   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20652   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20653   new_path="$path"
20654   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20655     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20656     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20657   fi
20658 
20659 
20660   input_path="$new_path"
20661   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20662   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20663   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20664   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20665   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20666   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20667     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20668     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20669   fi
20670 
20671 
20672   windows_path="$new_path"
20673   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20674     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20675     new_path="$unix_path"
20676   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20677     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20678     new_path="$unix_path"
20679   fi
20680 
20681   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20682     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20683     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20684 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20685   fi
20686 
20687   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20688   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20689 
20690   else
20691     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20692     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20693     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20694     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20695       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20696 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20697       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20698     fi
20699 
20700     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20701     eval path="$path"
20702     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20703       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20704     fi
20705 
20706     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20707   fi
20708 
20709             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20710 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20711             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20712 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20713             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20714 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20715             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20716             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20717 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20718           fi # end check jdk version
20719         fi # end check javac
20720       fi # end check java
20721     fi # end check boot jdk found
20722   fi
20723 
20724 
20725   # Test: On MacOS X, can we find a boot jdk using /usr/libexec/java_home?
20726 
20727   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20728     # Now execute the test
20729 
20730   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
20731     # First check at user selected default
20732 
20733   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20734     # Now execute the test
20735 
20736   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
20737     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home `
20738     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20739     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home " >&5
20740 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home " >&6;}
20741   fi
20742 
20743 
20744     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20745     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20746       # Do we have a bin/java?
20747       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20748         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20749 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20750         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20751       else
20752         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20753         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20754           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20755 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20756           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20757 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20758           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20759         else
20760           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20761           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20762 
20763           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20764           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20765           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20766             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20767 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20768             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20769 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20770             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20771           else
20772             # We're done! :-)
20773             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20774 
20775   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20776 
20777   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20778   # unix format.
20779   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20780   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20781 
20782   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20783   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20784   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20785   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20786   #
20787   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20788   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20789   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20790   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20791     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20792 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20793     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20794   fi
20795 
20796   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20797   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20798 
20799   input_path="$new_path"
20800   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20801   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20802   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20803   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20804   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20805   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20806     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20807     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20808     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20809     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20810       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20811       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20812       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20813       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20814       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20815       new_path="$input_path"
20816     fi
20817   fi
20818 
20819   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20820   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20821     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20822     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20823       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20824       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20825       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20826     fi
20827   fi
20828 
20829 
20830   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20831     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20832     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20833 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20834   fi
20835 
20836   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20837 
20838   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20839   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20840   new_path="$path"
20841   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20842     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20843     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20844   fi
20845 
20846 
20847   input_path="$new_path"
20848   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20849   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20850   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20851   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20852   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20853   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20854     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20855     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20856   fi
20857 
20858 
20859   windows_path="$new_path"
20860   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20861     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20862     new_path="$unix_path"
20863   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20864     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20865     new_path="$unix_path"
20866   fi
20867 
20868   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20869     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20870     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20871 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20872   fi
20873 
20874   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20875   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20876 
20877   else
20878     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20879     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20880     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20881     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20882       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20883 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20884       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20885     fi
20886 
20887     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20888     eval path="$path"
20889     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20890       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20891     fi
20892 
20893     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20894   fi
20895 
20896             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20897 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20898             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20899 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20900             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20901 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20902             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20903             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20904 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20905           fi # end check jdk version
20906         fi # end check javac
20907       fi # end check java
20908     fi # end check boot jdk found
20909   fi
20910 
20911     # If that did not work out (e.g. too old), try explicit versions instead
20912 
20913   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20914     # Now execute the test
20915 
20916   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
20917     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9`
20918     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20919     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9" >&5
20920 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9" >&6;}
20921   fi
20922 
20923 
20924     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20925     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20926       # Do we have a bin/java?
20927       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20928         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20929 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20930         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20931       else
20932         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20933         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20934           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20935 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20936           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20937 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20938           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20939         else
20940           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20941           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20942 
20943           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20944           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20945           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20946             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20947 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20948             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20949 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20950             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20951           else
20952             # We're done! :-)
20953             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20954 
20955   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20956 
20957   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20958   # unix format.
20959   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20960   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20961 
20962   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20963   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20964   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20965   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20966   #
20967   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20968   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20969   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20970   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20971     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20972 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20973     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20974   fi
20975 
20976   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20977   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20978 
20979   input_path="$new_path"
20980   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20981   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20982   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20983   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20984   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20985   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20986     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20987     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20988     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20989     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20990       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20991       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20992       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20993       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20994       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20995       new_path="$input_path"
20996     fi
20997   fi
20998 
20999   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
21000   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
21001     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
21002     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
21003       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
21004       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
21005       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
21006     fi
21007   fi
21008 
21009 
21010   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21011     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21012     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21013 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21014   fi
21015 
21016   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21017 
21018   path="$BOOT_JDK"
21019   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
21020   new_path="$path"
21021   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
21022     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
21023     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
21024   fi
21025 
21026 
21027   input_path="$new_path"
21028   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
21029   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
21030   # take no chances and rewrite it.
21031   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
21032   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
21033   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
21034     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
21035     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
21036   fi
21037 
21038 
21039   windows_path="$new_path"
21040   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
21041     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
21042     new_path="$unix_path"
21043   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21044     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
21045     new_path="$unix_path"
21046   fi
21047 
21048   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21049     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21050     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21051 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21052   fi
21053 
21054   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
21055   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
21056 
21057   else
21058     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
21059     path="$BOOT_JDK"
21060     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
21061     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
21062       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
21063 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
21064       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
21065     fi
21066 
21067     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
21068     eval path="$path"
21069     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
21070       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
21071     fi
21072
