27535   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27536   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
27537     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27538 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27539     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of ipath" "$LINENO" 5
27540   fi
27541 
27542   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
27543   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
27544 
27545   input_path="$new_path"
27546   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27547   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27548   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27549   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27550   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
27551   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27552     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27553     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
27554     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27555     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
27556       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
27557       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
27558       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27559       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
27560       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27561       new_path="$input_path"
27562     fi
27563   fi
27564 
27565   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
27566   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
27567     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
27568     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
27569       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
27570       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
27571       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
27572     fi
27573   fi
27574 
27575 
27576   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27577     ipath="$new_path"
27578     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27579 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27580   fi
27581 
27582   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27583 
27584   path="$ipath"
27585   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
27586   new_path="$path"
27587   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
27588     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
27589     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
27590   fi
27591 
27592 
27593   input_path="$new_path"
27594   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27595   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27596   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27597   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27598   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
27599   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27600     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27601     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27602   fi
27603 
27604 
27605   windows_path="$new_path"
27606   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27607     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27608     new_path="$unix_path"
27609   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27610     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27611     new_path="$unix_path"
27612   fi
27613 
27614   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27615     ipath="$new_path"
27616     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27617 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27618   fi
27619 
27620   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
27621   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
27622 
27623   else
27624     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
27625     path="$ipath"
27626     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
27627     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27628       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27629 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27630       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
27631     fi
27632 
27633     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
27634     eval path="$path"
27635     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
27636       as_fn_error $? "The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
27637     fi
27638 
27639     ipath="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
27640   fi
27641 
27642         IFS=";"
27643         SYSROOT_CFLAGS="$SYSROOT_CFLAGS -I$ipath"
27644       done
27645       # Convert VS_LIB into SYSROOT_LDFLAGS
27646       for i in $VS_LIB; do
27647         libpath=$i
27648         IFS="$OLDIFS"
27649 
27650   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27651 
27652   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
27653   # unix format.
27654   path="$libpath"
27655   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27656 
27657   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
27658   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
27659   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
27660   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
27661   #
27662   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
27663   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
27664   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27665   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
27666     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27667 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27668     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of libpath" "$LINENO" 5
27669   fi
27670 
27671   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
27672   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
27673 
27674   input_path="$new_path"
27675   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27676   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27677   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27678   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27679   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
27680   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27681     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27682     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
27683     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27684     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
27685       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
27686       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
27687       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27688       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
27689       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27690       new_path="$input_path"
27691     fi
27692   fi
27693 
27694   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
27695   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
27696     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
27697     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
27698       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
27699       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
27700       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
27701     fi
27702   fi
27703 
27704 
27705   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27706     libpath="$new_path"
27707     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27708 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27709   fi
27710 
27711   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27712 
27713   path="$libpath"
27714   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
27715   new_path="$path"
27716   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
27717     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
27718     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
27719   fi
27720 
27721 
27722   input_path="$new_path"
27723   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27724   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27725   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27726   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27727   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
27728   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27729     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27730     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27731   fi
27732 
27733 
27734   windows_path="$new_path"
27735   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27736     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27737     new_path="$unix_path"
27738   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27739     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27740     new_path="$unix_path"
27741   fi
27742 
27743   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27744     libpath="$new_path"
27745     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27746 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27747   fi
27748 
27749   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
27750   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
27751 
27752   else
27753     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
27754     path="$libpath"
27755     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
27756     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27757       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27758 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27759       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
27760     fi
27761 
27762     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
27763     eval path="$path"
27764     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
27765       as_fn_error $? "The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
27766     fi
27767 
27768     libpath="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
27769   fi
27770 
27771         IFS=";"
27772         SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="$SYSROOT_LDFLAGS -libpath:$libpath"
27773       done
27774       IFS="$OLDIFS"
27775     fi
27776   else
27777     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
27778 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
27779 
27780     if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
27781       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio or Windows SDK installation on disk," >&5
27782 $as_echo "$as_me: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio or Windows SDK installation on disk," >&6;}
27783       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: nor is this script run from a Visual Studio command prompt." >&5
27784 $as_echo "$as_me: nor is this script run from a Visual Studio command prompt." >&6;}
27785     else
27786       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Running the extraction script failed." >&5
27787 $as_echo "$as_me: Running the extraction script failed." >&6;}
27788     fi
27789     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&5
27790 $as_echo "$as_me: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&6;}
27791     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&5
27792 $as_echo "$as_me: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&6;}
27793     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
27794   fi
27795 
27796     # Reset path to VS_PATH. It will include everything that was on PATH at the time we
27797     # ran TOOLCHAIN_SETUP_VISUAL_STUDIO_ENV.
27798     PATH="$VS_PATH"
27799     # The microsoft toolchain also requires INCLUDE and LIB to be set.
27800     export INCLUDE="$VS_INCLUDE"
27801     export LIB="$VS_LIB"
27802   fi
27803 
27804   # autoconf magic only relies on PATH, so update it if tools dir is specified
27805   OLD_PATH="$PATH"
27806 
27807   # For solaris we really need solaris tools, and not the GNU equivalent.
27808   # The build tools on Solaris reside in /usr/ccs (C Compilation System),
27809   # so add that to path before starting to probe.
27810   # FIXME: This was originally only done for AS,NM,GNM,STRIP,MCS,OBJCOPY,OBJDUMP.
27811   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xsolaris; then
27812     PATH="/usr/ccs/bin:$PATH"
27813   fi
27814 
27815   # Finally add TOOLCHAIN_PATH at the beginning, to allow --with-tools-dir to
27816   # override all other locations.
27817   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
27818     PATH=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$PATH
27819   fi
27820 
27821 
27822   #
27823   # Setup the compilers (CC and CXX)
27824   #
27825 
27826   COMPILER_NAME=C
27827   SEARCH_LIST="$TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY"
27828 
27829   if test "x$CC" != x; then
27830     # User has supplied compiler name already, always let that override.
27831     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied compiler CC=$CC" >&5
27832 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied compiler CC=$CC" >&6;}
27833     if test "x`basename $CC`" = "x$CC"; then
27834       # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
27835 
27836       for ac_prog in $CC
27837 do
27838   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27839 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27840 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27841 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27842 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC+:} false; then :
27843   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27844 else
27845   case $POTENTIAL_CC in
27846   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27847   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$POTENTIAL_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27848   ;;
27849   *)
27850   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27851 for as_dir in $PATH
27852 do
27853   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27854   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27855     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27856   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27857     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27858     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27859     break 2
27860   fi
27861 done
27862   done
27863 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27864 
27865   ;;
27866 esac
27867 fi
27868 POTENTIAL_CC=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC
27869 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC"; then
27870   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CC" >&5
27871 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CC" >&6; }
27872 else
27873   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
27874 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
27875 fi
27876 
27877 
27878   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC" && break
27879 done
27880 
27881       if test "x$POTENTIAL_CC" != x; then
27882         CC=$POTENTIAL_CC
27883       else
27884         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CC=$CC could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
27885       fi
27886     else
27887       # Otherwise it might already be a complete path
27888       if test ! -x "$CC"; then
27889         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CC=$CC does not exist" "$LINENO" 5
27890       fi
27891     fi
27892   else
27893     # No user supplied value. Locate compiler ourselves.
27894 
27895     # If we are cross compiling, assume cross compilation tools follows the
27896     # cross compilation standard where they are prefixed with the autoconf
27897     # standard name for the target. For example the binary
27898     # i686-sun-solaris2.10-gcc will cross compile for i686-sun-solaris2.10.
27899     # If we are not cross compiling, then the default compiler name will be
27900     # used.
27901 
27902     CC=
27903     # If TOOLCHAIN_PATH is set, check for all compiler names in there first
27904     # before checking the rest of the PATH.
27905     # FIXME: Now that we prefix the TOOLS_DIR to the PATH in the PRE_DETECTION
27906     # step, this should not be necessary.
27907     if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"; then
27908       PATH_save="$PATH"
27909       PATH="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
27910       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
27911 do
27912   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27913 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27914 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27915 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27916 if ${ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC+:} false; then :
27917   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27918 else
27919   case $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC in
27920   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27921   ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27922   ;;
27923   *)
27924   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27925 for as_dir in $PATH
27926 do
27927   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27928   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27929     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27930   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27931     ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27932     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27933     break 2
27934   fi
27935 done
27936   done
27937 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27938 
27939   ;;
27940 esac
27941 fi
27942 TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC=$ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC
27943 if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC"; then
27944   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" >&5
27945 $as_echo "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" >&6; }
27946 else
27947   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
27948 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
27949 fi
27950 
27951 
27952   test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" && break
27953 done
27954 
27955       CC=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC
27956       PATH="$PATH_save"
27957     fi
27958 
27959     # AC_PATH_PROGS can't be run multiple times with the same variable,
27960     # so create a new name for this run.
27961     if test "x$CC" = x; then
27962       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
27963 do
27964   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27965 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27966 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27967 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27968 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC+:} false; then :
27969   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27970 else
27971   case $POTENTIAL_CC in
27972   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27973   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$POTENTIAL_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27974   ;;
27975   *)
27976   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27977 for as_dir in $PATH
27978 do
27979   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27980   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27981     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27982   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27983     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27984     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27985     break 2
27986   fi
27987 done
27988   done
27989 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27990 
27991   ;;
27992 esac
27993 fi
27994 POTENTIAL_CC=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC
27995 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC"; then
27996   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CC" >&5
27997 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CC" >&6; }
27998 else
27999   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
28000 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
28001 fi
28002 
28003 
28004   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC" && break
28005 done
28006 
28007       CC=$POTENTIAL_CC
28008     fi
28009 
28010     if test "x$CC" = x; then
28011 
28012   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
28013   # devkit is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
28014   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=devkit
28015 
28016   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28017     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
28018   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28019     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
28020   else
28021     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
28022 
28023     case $PKGHANDLER in
28024       apt-get)
28025         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28026       yum)
28027         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28028       port)
28029         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28030       pkgutil)
28031         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28032       pkgadd)
28033         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28034     esac
28035 
28036     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
28037       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
28038     fi
28039   fi
28040 
28041       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a $COMPILER_NAME compiler. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
28042     fi
28043   fi
28044 
28045   # Now we have a compiler binary in CC. Make sure it's okay.
28046 
28047   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28048 
28049   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28050   # space.
28051   complete="$CC"
28052   path="${complete%% *}"
28053   tmp="$complete EOL"
28054   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28055 
28056   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28057   # unix format.
28058   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28059 
28060   # Now try to locate executable using which
28061   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28062   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28063   # to not find them
28064   if test "x$new_path" = x \
28065       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28066       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28067     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28068   fi
28069   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28070     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28071     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28072     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28073     # argument.
28074     path="$complete"
28075     arguments="EOL"
28076     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28077     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28078     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28079     # to not find them
28080     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28081         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28082         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28083       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28084     fi
28085     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28086       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28087       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28088 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28089       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28090       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28091         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28092 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28093       fi
28094       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28095     fi
28096   fi
28097 
28098   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
28099   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
28100   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
28101   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
28102   #
28103   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
28104   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
28105   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28106   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
28107     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
28108     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
28109     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
28110       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
28111     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
28112       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
28113     else
28114       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
28115 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
28116       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
28117 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
28118       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28119     fi
28120   else
28121     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
28122   fi
28123 
28124   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
28125   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
28126   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28127 
28128   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28129   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28130   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28131   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28132   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28133   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
28134   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28135     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28136     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
28137     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28138     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
28139       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
28140       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
28141       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28142       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
28143       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28144       new_path="$input_path"
28145     fi
28146   fi
28147 
28148   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
28149   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
28150     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
28151     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
28152       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
28153       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
28154       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
28155     fi
28156   fi
28157 
28158   # remove trailing .exe if any
28159   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28160 
28161   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28162 
28163   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28164   # space.
28165   complete="$CC"
28166   path="${complete%% *}"
28167   tmp="$complete EOL"
28168   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28169 
28170   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28171   # unix format.
28172   new_path="$path"
28173 
28174   windows_path="$new_path"
28175   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28176     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28177     new_path="$unix_path"
28178   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28179     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28180     new_path="$unix_path"
28181   fi
28182 
28183 
28184   # Now try to locate executable using which
28185   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28186 
28187   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28188     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28189     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28190     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28191     # argument.
28192     path="$complete"
28193     arguments="EOL"
28194     new_path="$path"
28195 
28196   windows_path="$new_path"
28197   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28198     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28199     new_path="$unix_path"
28200   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28201     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28202     new_path="$unix_path"
28203   fi
28204 
28205 
28206     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28207     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
28208     # to not find them
28209     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28210         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28211         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28212       new_path="$path"
28213 
28214   windows_path="$new_path"
28215   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28216     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28217     new_path="$unix_path"
28218   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28219     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28220     new_path="$unix_path"
28221   fi
28222 
28223     fi
28224 
28225     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28226       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28227       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28228 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28229       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28230       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28231         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28232 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28233       fi
28234       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28235     fi
28236   fi
28237 
28238   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
28239   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
28240     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
28241     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28242     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
28243   else
28244     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
28245     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
28246 
28247   input_path="$new_path"
28248   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28249   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28250   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28251   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28252   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
28253   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28254     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28255     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28256   fi
28257 
28258     # Output is in $new_path
28259 
28260   windows_path="$new_path"
28261   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28262     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28263     new_path="$unix_path"
28264   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28265     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28266     new_path="$unix_path"
28267   fi
28268 
28269     # remove trailing .exe if any
28270     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28271 
28272     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
28273     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
28274   fi
28275 
28276   else
28277     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
28278     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28279     # space.
28280     complete="$CC"
28281     path="${complete%% *}"
28282     tmp="$complete EOL"
28283     arguments="${tmp#* }"
28284 
28285     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
28286     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
28287     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
28288       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
28289       IFS_save="$IFS"
28290       IFS=:
28291       for p in $PATH; do
28292         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
28293           new_path="$p/$path"
28294           break
28295         fi
28296       done
28297       IFS="$IFS_save"
28298     else
28299       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
28300       new_path="$path"
28301     fi
28302 
28303     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28304       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28305 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28306       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28307       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28308         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
28309 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28310       fi
28311       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28312     fi
28313   fi
28314 
28315   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
28316   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
28317     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
28318   else
28319     new_complete="$new_path"
28320   fi
28321 
28322   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
28323     CC="$new_complete"
28324     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
28325 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
28326   fi
28327 
28328   TEST_COMPILER="$CC"
28329   # Don't remove symbolic links on AIX because 'xlc_r' and 'xlC_r' may all be links
28330   # to 'xlc' but it is crucial that we invoke the compiler with the right name!
28331   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xaix; then
28332     # FIXME: This test should not be needed anymore; we don't do that for any platform.
28333     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking resolved symbolic links for CC" >&5
28334 $as_echo_n "checking resolved symbolic links for CC... " >&6; }
28335 
28336   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
28337     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
28338     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
28339     # complicated shell code.
28340     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
28341       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
28342       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
28343       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
28344       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
28345         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
28346         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
28347         READLINK_TESTED=yes
28348         READLINK=
28349       fi
28350     fi
28351 
28352     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
28353       TEST_COMPILER=`$READLINK -f $TEST_COMPILER`
28354     else
28355       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
28356       STARTDIR=$PWD
28357       COUNTER=0
28358       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $TEST_COMPILER`
28359       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $TEST_COMPILER`
28360       cd $sym_link_dir
28361       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
28362       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
28363       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28364       # Resolve file symlinks
28365       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
28366         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
28367         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
28368           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
28369           break
28370         fi
28371         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
28372         # link could be in a different directory
28373         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
28374         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28375         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
28376         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
28377       done
28378       cd $STARTDIR
28379       TEST_COMPILER=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
28380     fi
28381   fi
28382 
28383     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TEST_COMPILER" >&5
28384 $as_echo "$TEST_COMPILER" >&6; }
28385   fi
28386   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if CC is disguised ccache" >&5
28387 $as_echo_n "checking if CC is disguised ccache... " >&6; }
28388 
28389   COMPILER_BASENAME=`$BASENAME "$TEST_COMPILER"`
28390   if test "x$COMPILER_BASENAME" = "xccache"; then
28391     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&5
28392 $as_echo "yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&6; }
28393     # We /usr/lib/ccache in the path, so cc is a symlink to /usr/bin/ccache.
28394     # We want to control ccache invocation ourselves, so ignore this cc and try
28395     # searching again.
28396 
28397     # Remove the path to the fake ccache cc from the PATH
28398     RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH="$PATH"
28399     COMPILER_DIRNAME=`$DIRNAME $CC`
28400     PATH="`$ECHO $PATH | $SED -e "s,$COMPILER_DIRNAME,,g" -e "s,::,:,g" -e "s,^:,,g"`"
28401 
28402     # Try again looking for our compiler
28403     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
28404   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY
28405   do
28406     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28407 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28408 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28409 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28410 if ${ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC+:} false; then :
28411   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28412 else
28413   if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28414   ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" # Let the user override the test.
28415 else
28416 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28417 for as_dir in $PATH
28418 do
28419   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28420   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28421     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28422   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28423     ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
28424     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28425     break 2
28426   fi
28427 done
28428   done
28429 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28430 
28431 fi
28432 fi
28433 PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28434 if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28435   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28436 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28437 else
28438   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
28439 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
28440 fi
28441 
28442 
28443     test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" && break
28444   done
28445 fi
28446 if test -z "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28447   ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28448   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY
28449 do
28450   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28451 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28452 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28453 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28454 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC+:} false; then :
28455   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28456 else
28457   if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28458   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" # Let the user override the test.
28459 else
28460 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28461 for as_dir in $PATH
28462 do
28463   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28464   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28465     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28466   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28467     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_prog"
28468     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28469     break 2
28470   fi
28471 done
28472   done
28473 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28474 
28475 fi
28476 fi
28477 ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28478 if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28479   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28480 $as_echo "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28481 else
28482   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
28483 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
28484 fi
28485 
28486 
28487   test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" && break
28488 done
28489 
28490   if test "x$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" = x; then
28491     PROPER_COMPILER_CC=""
28492   else
28493     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
28494 yes:)
28495 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
28496 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
28497 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
28498 esac
28499     PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28500   fi
28501 fi
28502 
28503 
28504   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28505 
28506   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28507   # space.
28508   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28509   path="${complete%% *}"
28510   tmp="$complete EOL"
28511   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28512 
28513   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28514   # unix format.
28515   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28516 
28517   # Now try to locate executable using which
28518   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28519   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28520   # to not find them
28521   if test "x$new_path" = x \
28522       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28523       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28524     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28525   fi
28526   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28527     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28528     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28529     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28530     # argument.
28531     path="$complete"
28532     arguments="EOL"
28533     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28534     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28535     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28536     # to not find them
28537     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28538         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28539         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28540       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28541     fi
28542     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28543       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28544       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28545 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28546       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28547       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28548         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28549 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28550       fi
28551       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28552     fi
28553   fi
28554 
28555   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
28556   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
28557   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
28558   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
28559   #
28560   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
28561   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
28562   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28563   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
28564     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
28565     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
28566     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
28567       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
28568     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
28569       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
28570     else
28571       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
28572 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
28573       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
28574 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
28575       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28576     fi
28577   else
28578     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
28579   fi
28580 
28581   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
28582   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
28583   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28584 
28585   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28586   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28587   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28588   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28589   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28590   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
28591   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28592     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28593     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
28594     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28595     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
28596       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
28597       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
28598       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28599       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
28600       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28601       new_path="$input_path"
28602     fi
28603   fi
28604 
28605   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
28606   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
28607     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
28608     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
28609       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
28610       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
28611       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
28612     fi
28613   fi
28614 
28615   # remove trailing .exe if any
28616   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28617 
28618   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28619 
28620   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28621   # space.
28622   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28623   path="${complete%% *}"
28624   tmp="$complete EOL"
28625   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28626 
28627   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28628   # unix format.
28629   new_path="$path"
28630 
28631   windows_path="$new_path"
28632   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28633     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28634     new_path="$unix_path"
28635   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28636     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28637     new_path="$unix_path"
28638   fi
28639 
28640 
28641   # Now try to locate executable using which
28642   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28643 
28644   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28645     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28646     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28647     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28648     # argument.
28649     path="$complete"
28650     arguments="EOL"
28651     new_path="$path"
28652 
28653   windows_path="$new_path"
28654   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28655     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28656     new_path="$unix_path"
28657   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28658     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28659     new_path="$unix_path"
28660   fi
28661 
28662 
28663     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28664     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
28665     # to not find them
28666     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28667         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28668         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28669       new_path="$path"
28670 
28671   windows_path="$new_path"
28672   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28673     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28674     new_path="$unix_path"
28675   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28676     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28677     new_path="$unix_path"
28678   fi
28679 
28680     fi
28681 
28682     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28683       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28684       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28685 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28686       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28687       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28688         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28689 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28690       fi
28691       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28692     fi
28693   fi
28694 
28695   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
28696   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
28697     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
28698     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28699     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
28700   else
28701     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
28702     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
28703 
28704   input_path="$new_path"
28705   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28706   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28707   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28708   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28709   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
28710   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28711     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28712     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28713   fi
28714 
28715     # Output is in $new_path
28716 
28717   windows_path="$new_path"
28718   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28719     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28720     new_path="$unix_path"
28721   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28722     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28723     new_path="$unix_path"
28724   fi
28725 
28726     # remove trailing .exe if any
28727     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28728 
28729     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
28730     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
28731   fi
28732 
28733   else
28734     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
28735     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28736     # space.
28737     complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28738     path="${complete%% *}"
28739     tmp="$complete EOL"
28740     arguments="${tmp#* }"
28741 
28742     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
28743     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
28744     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
28745       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
28746       IFS_save="$IFS"
28747       IFS=:
28748       for p in $PATH; do
28749         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
28750           new_path="$p/$path"
28751           break
28752         fi
28753       done
28754       IFS="$IFS_save"
28755     else
28756       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
28757       new_path="$path"
28758     fi
28759 
28760     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28761       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28762 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28763       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28764       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28765         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
28766 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28767       fi
28768       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28769     fi
28770   fi
28771 
28772   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
28773   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
28774     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
28775   else
28776     new_complete="$new_path"
28777   fi
28778 
28779   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
28780     PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$new_complete"
28781     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
28782 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
28783   fi
28784 
28785     PATH="$RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH"
28786 
28787     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for resolved symbolic links for CC" >&5
28788 $as_echo_n "checking for resolved symbolic links for CC... " >&6; }
28789 
28790   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
28791     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
28792     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
28793     # complicated shell code.
28794     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
28795       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
28796       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
28797       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
28798       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
28799         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
28800         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
28801         READLINK_TESTED=yes
28802         READLINK=
28803       fi
28804     fi
28805 
28806     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
28807       PROPER_COMPILER_CC=`$READLINK -f $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28808     else
28809       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
28810       STARTDIR=$PWD
28811       COUNTER=0
28812       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28813       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28814       cd $sym_link_dir
28815       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
28816       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
28817       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28818       # Resolve file symlinks
28819       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
28820         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
28821         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
28822           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
28823           break
28824         fi
28825         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
28826         # link could be in a different directory
28827         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
28828         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28829         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
28830         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
28831       done
28832       cd $STARTDIR
28833       PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
28834     fi
28835   fi
28836 
28837     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28838 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28839     CC="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28840   else
28841     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, keeping CC" >&5
28842 $as_echo "no, keeping CC" >&6; }
28843   fi
28844 
28845 
28846   COMPILER=$CC
28847   COMPILER_NAME=$COMPILER_NAME
28848 
28849   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
28850     # cc -V output typically looks like
28851     #     cc: Sun C 5.12 Linux_i386 2011/11/16
28852     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -V 2>&1`
28853     # Check that this is likely to be the Solaris Studio cc.
28854     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "^.*: Sun $COMPILER_NAME" > /dev/null
28855     if test $? -ne 0; then
28856       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28857       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28858 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28859       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28860 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28861       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28862 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28863       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28864     fi
28865     # Remove usage instructions (if present), and
28866     # collapse compiler output into a single line
28867     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28868         $SED -e 's/ *[Uu]sage:.*//'`
28869     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28870         $SED -e "s/^.*[ ,\t]$COMPILER_NAME[ ,\t]\([1-9]\.[0-9][0-9]*\).*/\1/"`
28871   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
28872     # xlc -qversion output typically looks like
28873     #     IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V11.1 (5724-X13)
28874     #     Version: 11.01.0000.0015
28875     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -qversion 2>&1`
28876     # Check that this is likely to be the IBM XL C compiler.
28877     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "IBM XL C" > /dev/null
28878     if test $? -ne 0; then
28879       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28880       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28881 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28882       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28883 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28884       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28885 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28886       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28887     fi
28888     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28889     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28890     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28891         $SED -e 's/^.*, V\([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
28892   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
28893     # There is no specific version flag, but all output starts with a version string.
28894     # First line typically looks something like:
28895     # Microsoft (R) 32-bit C/C++ Optimizing Compiler Version 16.00.40219.01 for 80x86
28896     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
28897     # Check that this is likely to be Microsoft CL.EXE.
28898     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Microsoft.*Compiler" > /dev/null
28899     if test $? -ne 0; then
28900       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28901 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28902       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28903 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28904       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28905     fi
28906     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28907     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28908     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28909         $SED -e 's/^.*ersion.\([1-9][0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
28910   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
28911     # gcc --version output typically looks like
28912     #     gcc (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.8.1-10ubuntu9) 4.8.1
28913     #     Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
28914     #     This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
28915     #     warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
28916     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28917     # Check that this is likely to be GCC.
28918     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Free Software Foundation" > /dev/null
28919     if test $? -ne 0; then
28920       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28921 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28922       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&5
28923 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&6;}
28924       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28925     fi
28926     # Remove Copyright and legalese from version string, and
28927     # collapse into a single line
28928     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28929         $SED -e 's/ *Copyright .*//'`
28930     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28931         $SED -e 's/^.* \([1-9]\.[0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
28932   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
28933     # clang --version output typically looks like
28934     #    Apple LLVM version 5.0 (clang-500.2.79) (based on LLVM 3.3svn)
28935     #    clang version 3.3 (tags/RELEASE_33/final)
28936     # or
28937     #    Debian clang version 3.2-7ubuntu1 (tags/RELEASE_32/final) (based on LLVM 3.2)
28938     #    Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
28939     #    Thread model: posix
28940     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28941     # Check that this is likely to be clang
28942     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "clang" > /dev/null
28943     if test $? -ne 0; then
28944       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28945 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28946       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28947 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28948       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28949     fi
28950     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28951     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28952     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28953         $SED -e 's/^.*clang version \([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
28954   else
28955       as_fn_error $? "Unknown toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE." "$LINENO" 5
28956   fi
28957   # This sets CC_VERSION_NUMBER or CXX_VERSION_NUMBER. (This comment is a grep marker)
28958   CC_VERSION_NUMBER="$COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER"
28959   # This sets CC_VERSION_STRING or CXX_VERSION_STRING. (This comment is a grep marker)
28960   CC_VERSION_STRING="$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING"
28961 
28962   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&5
28963 $as_echo "$as_me: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&6;}
28964 
28965 
28966   # Now that we have resolved CC ourself, let autoconf have its go at it
28967   ac_ext=c
28968 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
28969 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
28970 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
28971 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
28972 if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
28973   for ac_prog in $CC
28974   do
28975     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28976 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28977 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28978 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28979 if ${ac_cv_prog_CC+:} false; then :
28980   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28981 else
28982   if test -n "$CC"; then
28983   ac_cv_prog_CC="$CC" # Let the user override the test.
28984 else
28985 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28986 for as_dir in $PATH
28987 do
28988   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28989   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28990     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28991   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28992     ac_cv_prog_CC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
28993     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28994     break 2
28995   fi
28996 done
28997   done
28998 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28999 
29000 fi
29001 fi
29002 CC=$ac_cv_prog_CC
29003 if test -n "$CC"; then
29004   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CC" >&5
29005 $as_echo "$CC" >&6; }
29006 else
29007   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29008 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29009 fi
29010 
29011 
29012     test -n "$CC" && break
29013   done
29014 fi
29015 if test -z "$CC"; then
29016   ac_ct_CC=$CC
29017   for ac_prog in $CC
29018 do
29019   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29020 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29021 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29022 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29023 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC+:} false; then :
29024   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29025 else
29026   if test -n "$ac_ct_CC"; then
29027   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC="$ac_ct_CC" # Let the user override the test.
29028 else
29029 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29030 for as_dir in $PATH
29031 do
29032   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29033   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29034     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29035   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29036     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC="$ac_prog"
29037     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29038     break 2
29039   fi
29040 done
29041   done
29042 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29043 
29044 fi
29045 fi
29046 ac_ct_CC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC
29047 if test -n "$ac_ct_CC"; then
29048   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_CC" >&5
29049 $as_echo "$ac_ct_CC" >&6; }
29050 else
29051   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29052 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29053 fi
29054 
29055 
29056   test -n "$ac_ct_CC" && break
29057 done
29058 
29059   if test "x$ac_ct_CC" = x; then
29060     CC=""
29061   else
29062     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
29063 yes:)
29064 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
29065 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
29066 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
29067 esac
29068     CC=$ac_ct_CC
29069   fi
29070 fi
29071 
29072 
29073 test -z "$CC" && { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29074 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29075 as_fn_error $? "no acceptable C compiler found in \$PATH
29076 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29077 
29078 # Provide some information about the compiler.
29079 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C compiler version" >&5
29080 set X $ac_compile
29081 ac_compiler=$2
29082 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
29083   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
29084 case "(($ac_try" in
29085   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29086   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29087 esac
29088 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29089 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29090   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
29091   ac_status=$?
29092   if test -s conftest.err; then
29093     sed '10a\
29094 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
29095          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
29096     cat conftest.er1 >&5
29097   fi
29098   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
29099   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29100   test $ac_status = 0; }
29101 done
29102 
29103 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29104 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29105 
29106 int
29107 main ()
29108 {
29109 
29110   ;
29111   return 0;
29112 }
29113 _ACEOF
29114 ac_clean_files_save=$ac_clean_files
29115 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files a.out a.out.dSYM a.exe b.out"
29116 # Try to create an executable without -o first, disregard a.out.
29117 # It will help us diagnose broken compilers, and finding out an intuition
29118 # of exeext.
29119 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether the C compiler works" >&5
29120 $as_echo_n "checking whether the C compiler works... " >&6; }
29121 ac_link_default=`$as_echo "$ac_link" | sed 's/ -o *conftest[^ ]*//'`
29122 
29123 # The possible output files:
29124 ac_files="a.out conftest.exe conftest a.exe a_out.exe b.out conftest.*"
29125 
29126 ac_rmfiles=
29127 for ac_file in $ac_files
29128 do
29129   case $ac_file in
29130     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj ) ;;
29131     * ) ac_rmfiles="$ac_rmfiles $ac_file";;
29132   esac
29133 done
29134 rm -f $ac_rmfiles
29135 
29136 if { { ac_try="$ac_link_default"
29137 case "(($ac_try" in
29138   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29139   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29140 esac
29141 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29142 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29143   (eval "$ac_link_default") 2>&5
29144   ac_status=$?
29145   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29146   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29147   # Autoconf-2.13 could set the ac_cv_exeext variable to `no'.
29148 # So ignore a value of `no', otherwise this would lead to `EXEEXT = no'
29149 # in a Makefile.  We should not override ac_cv_exeext if it was cached,
29150 # so that the user can short-circuit this test for compilers unknown to
29151 # Autoconf.
29152 for ac_file in $ac_files ''
29153 do
29154   test -f "$ac_file" || continue
29155   case $ac_file in
29156     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj )
29157         ;;
29158     [ab].out )
29159         # We found the default executable, but exeext='' is most
29160         # certainly right.
29161         break;;
29162     *.* )
29163         if test "${ac_cv_exeext+set}" = set && test "$ac_cv_exeext" != no;
29164         then :; else
29165            ac_cv_exeext=`expr "$ac_file" : '[^.]*\(\..*\)'`
29166         fi
29167         # We set ac_cv_exeext here because the later test for it is not
29168         # safe: cross compilers may not add the suffix if given an `-o'
29169         # argument, so we may need to know it at that point already.
29170         # Even if this section looks crufty: it has the advantage of
29171         # actually working.
29172         break;;
29173     * )
29174         break;;
29175   esac
29176 done
29177 test "$ac_cv_exeext" = no && ac_cv_exeext=
29178 
29179 else
29180   ac_file=''
29181 fi
29182 if test -z "$ac_file"; then :
29183   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29184 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29185 $as_echo "$as_me: failed program was:" >&5
29186 sed 's/^/| /' conftest.$ac_ext >&5
29187 
29188 { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29189 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29190 as_fn_error 77 "C compiler cannot create executables
29191 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29192 else
29193   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
29194 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
29195 fi
29196 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C compiler default output file name" >&5
29197 $as_echo_n "checking for C compiler default output file name... " >&6; }
29198 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_file" >&5
29199 $as_echo "$ac_file" >&6; }
29200 ac_exeext=$ac_cv_exeext
29201 
29202 rm -f -r a.out a.out.dSYM a.exe conftest$ac_cv_exeext b.out
29203 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
29204 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for suffix of executables" >&5
29205 $as_echo_n "checking for suffix of executables... " >&6; }
29206 if { { ac_try="$ac_link"
29207 case "(($ac_try" in
29208   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29209   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29210 esac
29211 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29212 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29213   (eval "$ac_link") 2>&5
29214   ac_status=$?
29215   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29216   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29217   # If both `conftest.exe' and `conftest' are `present' (well, observable)
29218 # catch `conftest.exe'.  For instance with Cygwin, `ls conftest' will
29219 # work properly (i.e., refer to `conftest.exe'), while it won't with
29220 # `rm'.
29221 for ac_file in conftest.exe conftest conftest.*; do
29222   test -f "$ac_file" || continue
29223   case $ac_file in
29224     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj ) ;;
29225     *.* ) ac_cv_exeext=`expr "$ac_file" : '[^.]*\(\..*\)'`
29226           break;;
29227     * ) break;;
29228   esac
29229 done
29230 else
29231   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29232 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29233 as_fn_error $? "cannot compute suffix of executables: cannot compile and link
29234 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29235 fi
29236 rm -f conftest conftest$ac_cv_exeext
29237 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_exeext" >&5
29238 $as_echo "$ac_cv_exeext" >&6; }
29239 
29240 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext
29241 EXEEXT=$ac_cv_exeext
29242 ac_exeext=$EXEEXT
29243 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29244 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29245 #include <stdio.h>
29246 int
29247 main ()
29248 {
29249 FILE *f = fopen ("conftest.out", "w");
29250  return ferror (f) || fclose (f) != 0;
29251 
29252   ;
29253   return 0;
29254 }
29255 _ACEOF
29256 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files conftest.out"
29257 # Check that the compiler produces executables we can run.  If not, either
29258 # the compiler is broken, or we cross compile.
29259 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are cross compiling" >&5
29260 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are cross compiling... " >&6; }
29261 if test "$cross_compiling" != yes; then
29262   { { ac_try="$ac_link"
29263 case "(($ac_try" in
29264   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29265   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29266 esac
29267 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29268 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29269   (eval "$ac_link") 2>&5
29270   ac_status=$?
29271   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29272   test $ac_status = 0; }
29273   if { ac_try='./conftest$ac_cv_exeext'
29274   { { case "(($ac_try" in
29275   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29276   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29277 esac
29278 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29279 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29280   (eval "$ac_try") 2>&5
29281   ac_status=$?
29282   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29283   test $ac_status = 0; }; }; then
29284     cross_compiling=no
29285   else
29286     if test "$cross_compiling" = maybe; then
29287         cross_compiling=yes
29288     else
29289         { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29290 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29291 as_fn_error $? "cannot run C compiled programs.
29292 If you meant to cross compile, use \`--host'.
29293 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
