29294     fi
29295   fi
29296 fi
29297 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $cross_compiling" >&5
29298 $as_echo "$cross_compiling" >&6; }
29299 
29300 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext conftest$ac_cv_exeext conftest.out
29301 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
29302 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for suffix of object files" >&5
29303 $as_echo_n "checking for suffix of object files... " >&6; }
29304 if ${ac_cv_objext+:} false; then :
29305   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29306 else
29307   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29308 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29309 
29310 int
29311 main ()
29312 {
29313 
29314   ;
29315   return 0;
29316 }
29317 _ACEOF
29318 rm -f conftest.o conftest.obj
29319 if { { ac_try="$ac_compile"
29320 case "(($ac_try" in
29321   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29322   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29323 esac
29324 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29325 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29326   (eval "$ac_compile") 2>&5
29327   ac_status=$?
29328   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29329   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29330   for ac_file in conftest.o conftest.obj conftest.*; do
29331   test -f "$ac_file" || continue;
29332   case $ac_file in
29333     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM ) ;;
29334     *) ac_cv_objext=`expr "$ac_file" : '.*\.\(.*\)'`
29335        break;;
29336   esac
29337 done
29338 else
29339   $as_echo "$as_me: failed program was:" >&5
29340 sed 's/^/| /' conftest.$ac_ext >&5
29341 
29342 { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29343 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29344 as_fn_error $? "cannot compute suffix of object files: cannot compile
29345 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29346 fi
29347 rm -f conftest.$ac_cv_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29348 fi
29349 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_objext" >&5
29350 $as_echo "$ac_cv_objext" >&6; }
29351 OBJEXT=$ac_cv_objext
29352 ac_objext=$OBJEXT
29353 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU C compiler" >&5
29354 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C compiler... " >&6; }
29355 if ${ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
29356   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29357 else
29358   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29359 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29360 
29361 int
29362 main ()
29363 {
29364 #ifndef __GNUC__
29365        choke me
29366 #endif
29367 
29368   ;
29369   return 0;
29370 }
29371 _ACEOF
29372 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29373   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
29374 else
29375   ac_compiler_gnu=no
29376 fi
29377 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29378 ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
29379 
29380 fi
29381 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu" >&5
29382 $as_echo "$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
29383 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
29384   GCC=yes
29385 else
29386   GCC=
29387 fi
29388 ac_test_CFLAGS=${CFLAGS+set}
29389 ac_save_CFLAGS=$CFLAGS
29390 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $CC accepts -g" >&5
29391 $as_echo_n "checking whether $CC accepts -g... " >&6; }
29392 if ${ac_cv_prog_cc_g+:} false; then :
29393   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29394 else
29395   ac_save_c_werror_flag=$ac_c_werror_flag
29396    ac_c_werror_flag=yes
29397    ac_cv_prog_cc_g=no
29398    CFLAGS="-g"
29399    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29400 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29401 
29402 int
29403 main ()
29404 {
29405 
29406   ;
29407   return 0;
29408 }
29409 _ACEOF
29410 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29411   ac_cv_prog_cc_g=yes
29412 else
29413   CFLAGS=""
29414       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29415 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29416 
29417 int
29418 main ()
29419 {
29420 
29421   ;
29422   return 0;
29423 }
29424 _ACEOF
29425 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29426 
29427 else
29428   ac_c_werror_flag=$ac_save_c_werror_flag
29429          CFLAGS="-g"
29430          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29431 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29432 
29433 int
29434 main ()
29435 {
29436 
29437   ;
29438   return 0;
29439 }
29440 _ACEOF
29441 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29442   ac_cv_prog_cc_g=yes
29443 fi
29444 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29445 fi
29446 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29447 fi
29448 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29449    ac_c_werror_flag=$ac_save_c_werror_flag
29450 fi
29451 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cc_g" >&5
29452 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cc_g" >&6; }
29453 if test "$ac_test_CFLAGS" = set; then
29454   CFLAGS=$ac_save_CFLAGS
29455 elif test $ac_cv_prog_cc_g = yes; then
29456   if test "$GCC" = yes; then
29457     CFLAGS="-g -O2"
29458   else
29459     CFLAGS="-g"
29460   fi
29461 else
29462   if test "$GCC" = yes; then
29463     CFLAGS="-O2"
29464   else
29465     CFLAGS=
29466   fi
29467 fi
29468 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $CC option to accept ISO C89" >&5
29469 $as_echo_n "checking for $CC option to accept ISO C89... " >&6; }
29470 if ${ac_cv_prog_cc_c89+:} false; then :
29471   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29472 else
29473   ac_cv_prog_cc_c89=no
29474 ac_save_CC=$CC
29475 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29476 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29477 #include <stdarg.h>
29478 #include <stdio.h>
29479 struct stat;
29480 /* Most of the following tests are stolen from RCS 5.7's src/conf.sh.  */
29481 struct buf { int x; };
29482 FILE * (*rcsopen) (struct buf *, struct stat *, int);
29483 static char *e (p, i)
29484      char **p;
29485      int i;
29486 {
29487   return p[i];
29488 }
29489 static char *f (char * (*g) (char **, int), char **p, ...)
29490 {
29491   char *s;
29492   va_list v;
29493   va_start (v,p);
29494   s = g (p, va_arg (v,int));
29495   va_end (v);
29496   return s;
29497 }
29498 
29499 /* OSF 4.0 Compaq cc is some sort of almost-ANSI by default.  It has
29500    function prototypes and stuff, but not '\xHH' hex character constants.
29501    These don't provoke an error unfortunately, instead are silently treated
29502    as 'x'.  The following induces an error, until -std is added to get
29503    proper ANSI mode.  Curiously '\x00'!='x' always comes out true, for an
29504    array size at least.  It's necessary to write '\x00'==0 to get something
29505    that's true only with -std.  */
29506 int osf4_cc_array ['\x00' == 0 ? 1 : -1];
29507 
29508 /* IBM C 6 for AIX is almost-ANSI by default, but it replaces macro parameters
29509    inside strings and character constants.  */
29510 #define FOO(x) 'x'
29511 int xlc6_cc_array[FOO(a) == 'x' ? 1 : -1];
29512 
29513 int test (int i, double x);
29514 struct s1 {int (*f) (int a);};
29515 struct s2 {int (*f) (double a);};
29516 int pairnames (int, char **, FILE *(*)(struct buf *, struct stat *, int), int, int);
29517 int argc;
29518 char **argv;
29519 int
29520 main ()
29521 {
29522 return f (e, argv, 0) != argv[0]  ||  f (e, argv, 1) != argv[1];
29523   ;
29524   return 0;
29525 }
29526 _ACEOF
29527 for ac_arg in '' -qlanglvl=extc89 -qlanglvl=ansi -std \
29528         -Ae "-Aa -D_HPUX_SOURCE" "-Xc -D__EXTENSIONS__"
29529 do
29530   CC="$ac_save_CC $ac_arg"
29531   if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29532   ac_cv_prog_cc_c89=$ac_arg
29533 fi
29534 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext
29535   test "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" != "xno" && break
29536 done
29537 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext
29538 CC=$ac_save_CC
29539 
29540 fi
29541 # AC_CACHE_VAL
29542 case "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" in
29543   x)
29544     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: none needed" >&5
29545 $as_echo "none needed" >&6; } ;;
29546   xno)
29547     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unsupported" >&5
29548 $as_echo "unsupported" >&6; } ;;
29549   *)
29550     CC="$CC $ac_cv_prog_cc_c89"
29551     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" >&5
29552 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" >&6; } ;;
29553 esac
29554 if test "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" != xno; then :
29555 
29556 fi
29557 
29558 ac_ext=cpp
29559 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
29560 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
29561 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
29562 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
29563 
29564 
29565 
29566   COMPILER_NAME=C++
29567   SEARCH_LIST="$TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY"
29568 
29569   if test "x$CXX" != x; then
29570     # User has supplied compiler name already, always let that override.
29571     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied compiler CXX=$CXX" >&5
29572 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied compiler CXX=$CXX" >&6;}
29573     if test "x`basename $CXX`" = "x$CXX"; then
29574       # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
29575 
29576       for ac_prog in $CXX
29577 do
29578   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29579 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29580 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29581 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29582 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX+:} false; then :
29583   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29584 else
29585   case $POTENTIAL_CXX in
29586   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29587   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$POTENTIAL_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29588   ;;
29589   *)
29590   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29591 for as_dir in $PATH
29592 do
29593   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29594   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29595     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29596   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29597     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29598     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29599     break 2
29600   fi
29601 done
29602   done
29603 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29604 
29605   ;;
29606 esac
29607 fi
29608 POTENTIAL_CXX=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX
29609 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX"; then
29610   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CXX" >&5
29611 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CXX" >&6; }
29612 else
29613   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29614 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29615 fi
29616 
29617 
29618   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX" && break
29619 done
29620 
29621       if test "x$POTENTIAL_CXX" != x; then
29622         CXX=$POTENTIAL_CXX
29623       else
29624         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CXX=$CXX could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
29625       fi
29626     else
29627       # Otherwise it might already be a complete path
29628       if test ! -x "$CXX"; then
29629         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CXX=$CXX does not exist" "$LINENO" 5
29630       fi
29631     fi
29632   else
29633     # No user supplied value. Locate compiler ourselves.
29634 
29635     # If we are cross compiling, assume cross compilation tools follows the
29636     # cross compilation standard where they are prefixed with the autoconf
29637     # standard name for the target. For example the binary
29638     # i686-sun-solaris2.10-gcc will cross compile for i686-sun-solaris2.10.
29639     # If we are not cross compiling, then the default compiler name will be
29640     # used.
29641 
29642     CXX=
29643     # If TOOLCHAIN_PATH is set, check for all compiler names in there first
29644     # before checking the rest of the PATH.
29645     # FIXME: Now that we prefix the TOOLS_DIR to the PATH in the PRE_DETECTION
29646     # step, this should not be necessary.
29647     if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"; then
29648       PATH_save="$PATH"
29649       PATH="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
29650       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
29651 do
29652   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29653 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29654 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29655 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29656 if ${ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX+:} false; then :
29657   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29658 else
29659   case $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX in
29660   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29661   ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29662   ;;
29663   *)
29664   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29665 for as_dir in $PATH
29666 do
29667   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29668   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29669     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29670   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29671     ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29672     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29673     break 2
29674   fi
29675 done
29676   done
29677 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29678 
29679   ;;
29680 esac
29681 fi
29682 TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX=$ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX
29683 if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX"; then
29684   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" >&5
29685 $as_echo "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" >&6; }
29686 else
29687   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29688 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29689 fi
29690 
29691 
29692   test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" && break
29693 done
29694 
29695       CXX=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX
29696       PATH="$PATH_save"
29697     fi
29698 
29699     # AC_PATH_PROGS can't be run multiple times with the same variable,
29700     # so create a new name for this run.
29701     if test "x$CXX" = x; then
29702       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
29703 do
29704   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29705 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29706 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29707 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29708 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX+:} false; then :
29709   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29710 else
29711   case $POTENTIAL_CXX in
29712   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29713   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$POTENTIAL_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29714   ;;
29715   *)
29716   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29717 for as_dir in $PATH
29718 do
29719   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29720   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29721     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29722   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29723     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29724     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29725     break 2
29726   fi
29727 done
29728   done
29729 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29730 
29731   ;;
29732 esac
29733 fi
29734 POTENTIAL_CXX=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX
29735 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX"; then
29736   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CXX" >&5
29737 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CXX" >&6; }
29738 else
29739   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29740 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29741 fi
29742 
29743 
29744   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX" && break
29745 done
29746 
29747       CXX=$POTENTIAL_CXX
29748     fi
29749 
29750     if test "x$CXX" = x; then
29751 
29752   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
29753   # devkit is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
29754   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=devkit
29755 
29756   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29757     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
29758   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29759     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
29760   else
29761     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
29762 
29763     case $PKGHANDLER in
29764       apt-get)
29765         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29766       yum)
29767         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29768       port)
29769         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29770       pkgutil)
29771         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29772       pkgadd)
29773         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29774     esac
29775 
29776     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
29777       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
29778     fi
29779   fi
29780 
29781       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a $COMPILER_NAME compiler. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
29782     fi
29783   fi
29784 
29785   # Now we have a compiler binary in CXX. Make sure it's okay.
29786 
29787   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29788 
29789   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
29790   # space.
29791   complete="$CXX"
29792   path="${complete%% *}"
29793   tmp="$complete EOL"
29794   arguments="${tmp#* }"
29795 
29796   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
29797   # unix format.
29798   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29799 
29800   # Now try to locate executable using which
29801   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29802   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
29803   # to not find them
29804   if test "x$new_path" = x \
29805       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29806       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29807     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29808   fi
29809   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29810     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
29811     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
29812     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
29813     # argument.
29814     path="$complete"
29815     arguments="EOL"
29816     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29817     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29818     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
29819     # to not find them
29820     if test "x$new_path" = x \
29821         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29822         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29823       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29824     fi
29825     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29826       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
29827       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
29828 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
29829       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
29830       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
29831         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
29832 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
29833       fi
29834       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29835     fi
29836   fi
29837 
29838   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
29839   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
29840   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
29841   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
29842   #
29843   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
29844   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
29845   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29846   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
29847     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
29848     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
29849     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
29850       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
29851     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
29852       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
29853     else
29854       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
29855 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
29856       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
29857 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
29858       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29859     fi
29860   else
29861     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
29862   fi
29863 
29864   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
29865   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
29866   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
29867 
29868   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
29869   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
29870   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
29871   # take no chances and rewrite it.
29872   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
29873   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
29874   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
29875     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
29876     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
29877     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
29878     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
29879       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
29880       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
29881       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
29882       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
29883       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
29884       new_path="$input_path"
29885     fi
29886   fi
29887 
29888   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
29889   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
29890     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
29891     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
29892       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
29893       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
29894       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
29895     fi
29896   fi
29897 
29898   # remove trailing .exe if any
29899   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
29900 
29901   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29902 
29903   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
29904   # space.
29905   complete="$CXX"
29906   path="${complete%% *}"
29907   tmp="$complete EOL"
29908   arguments="${tmp#* }"
29909 
29910   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
29911   # unix format.
29912   new_path="$path"
29913 
29914   windows_path="$new_path"
29915   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29916     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29917     new_path="$unix_path"
29918   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29919     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29920     new_path="$unix_path"
29921   fi
29922 
29923 
29924   # Now try to locate executable using which
29925   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29926 
29927   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29928     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
29929     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
29930     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
29931     # argument.
29932     path="$complete"
29933     arguments="EOL"
29934     new_path="$path"
29935 
29936   windows_path="$new_path"
29937   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29938     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29939     new_path="$unix_path"
29940   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29941     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29942     new_path="$unix_path"
29943   fi
29944 
29945 
29946     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29947     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
29948     # to not find them
29949     if test "x$new_path" = x \
29950         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29951         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29952       new_path="$path"
29953 
29954   windows_path="$new_path"
29955   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29956     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29957     new_path="$unix_path"
29958   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29959     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29960     new_path="$unix_path"
29961   fi
29962 
29963     fi
29964 
29965     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29966       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
29967       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
29968 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
29969       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
29970       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
29971         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
29972 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
29973       fi
29974       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29975     fi
29976   fi
29977 
29978   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
29979   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
29980     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
29981     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
29982     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
29983   else
29984     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
29985     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
29986 
29987   input_path="$new_path"
29988   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
29989   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
29990   # take no chances and rewrite it.
29991   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
29992   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
29993   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
29994     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
29995     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
29996   fi
29997 
29998     # Output is in $new_path
29999 
30000   windows_path="$new_path"
30001   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30002     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30003     new_path="$unix_path"
30004   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30005     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30006     new_path="$unix_path"
30007   fi
30008 
30009     # remove trailing .exe if any
30010     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30011 
30012     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
30013     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
30014   fi
30015 
30016   else
30017     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
30018     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30019     # space.
30020     complete="$CXX"
30021     path="${complete%% *}"
30022     tmp="$complete EOL"
30023     arguments="${tmp#* }"
30024 
30025     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
30026     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
30027     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
30028       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
30029       IFS_save="$IFS"
30030       IFS=:
30031       for p in $PATH; do
30032         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
30033           new_path="$p/$path"
30034           break
30035         fi
30036       done
30037       IFS="$IFS_save"
30038     else
30039       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
30040       new_path="$path"
30041     fi
30042 
30043     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30044       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30045 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30046       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30047       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30048         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
30049 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30050       fi
30051       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30052     fi
30053   fi
30054 
30055   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
30056   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
30057     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
30058   else
30059     new_complete="$new_path"
30060   fi
30061 
30062   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
30063     CXX="$new_complete"
30064     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
30065 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
30066   fi
30067 
30068   TEST_COMPILER="$CXX"
30069   # Don't remove symbolic links on AIX because 'xlc_r' and 'xlC_r' may all be links
30070   # to 'xlc' but it is crucial that we invoke the compiler with the right name!
30071   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xaix; then
30072     # FIXME: This test should not be needed anymore; we don't do that for any platform.
30073     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking resolved symbolic links for CXX" >&5
30074 $as_echo_n "checking resolved symbolic links for CXX... " >&6; }
30075 
30076   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
30077     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
30078     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
30079     # complicated shell code.
30080     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
30081       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
30082       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
30083       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
30084       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
30085         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
30086         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
30087         READLINK_TESTED=yes
30088         READLINK=
30089       fi
30090     fi
30091 
30092     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
30093       TEST_COMPILER=`$READLINK -f $TEST_COMPILER`
30094     else
30095       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
30096       STARTDIR=$PWD
30097       COUNTER=0
30098       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $TEST_COMPILER`
30099       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $TEST_COMPILER`
30100       cd $sym_link_dir
30101       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
30102       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
30103       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30104       # Resolve file symlinks
30105       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
30106         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
30107         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
30108           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
30109           break
30110         fi
30111         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
30112         # link could be in a different directory
30113         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
30114         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30115         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
30116         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
30117       done
30118       cd $STARTDIR
30119       TEST_COMPILER=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
30120     fi
30121   fi
30122 
30123     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TEST_COMPILER" >&5
30124 $as_echo "$TEST_COMPILER" >&6; }
30125   fi
30126   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if CXX is disguised ccache" >&5
30127 $as_echo_n "checking if CXX is disguised ccache... " >&6; }
30128 
30129   COMPILER_BASENAME=`$BASENAME "$TEST_COMPILER"`
30130   if test "x$COMPILER_BASENAME" = "xccache"; then
30131     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&5
30132 $as_echo "yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&6; }
30133     # We /usr/lib/ccache in the path, so cc is a symlink to /usr/bin/ccache.
30134     # We want to control ccache invocation ourselves, so ignore this cc and try
30135     # searching again.
30136 
30137     # Remove the path to the fake ccache cc from the PATH
30138     RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH="$PATH"
30139     COMPILER_DIRNAME=`$DIRNAME $CXX`
30140     PATH="`$ECHO $PATH | $SED -e "s,$COMPILER_DIRNAME,,g" -e "s,::,:,g" -e "s,^:,,g"`"
30141 
30142     # Try again looking for our compiler
30143     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
30144   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY
30145   do
30146     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30147 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30148 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30149 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30150 if ${ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX+:} false; then :
30151   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30152 else
30153   if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30154   ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30155 else
30156 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30157 for as_dir in $PATH
30158 do
30159   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30160   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30161     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30162   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30163     ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
30164     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30165     break 2
30166   fi
30167 done
30168   done
30169 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30170 
30171 fi
30172 fi
30173 PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30174 if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30175   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30176 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30177 else
30178   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30179 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30180 fi
30181 
30182 
30183     test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" && break
30184   done
30185 fi
30186 if test -z "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30187   ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30188   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY
30189 do
30190   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30191 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30192 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30193 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30194 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX+:} false; then :
30195   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30196 else
30197   if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30198   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30199 else
30200 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30201 for as_dir in $PATH
30202 do
30203   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30204   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30205     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30206   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30207     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_prog"
30208     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30209     break 2
30210   fi
30211 done
30212   done
30213 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30214 
30215 fi
30216 fi
30217 ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30218 if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30219   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30220 $as_echo "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30221 else
30222   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30223 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30224 fi
30225 
30226 
30227   test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" && break
30228 done
30229 
30230   if test "x$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" = x; then
30231     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=""
30232   else
30233     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
30234 yes:)
30235 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
30236 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
30237 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
30238 esac
30239     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30240   fi
30241 fi
30242 
30243 
30244   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30245 
30246   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30247   # space.
30248   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30249   path="${complete%% *}"
30250   tmp="$complete EOL"
30251   arguments="${tmp#* }"
30252 
30253   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
30254   # unix format.
30255   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30256 
30257   # Now try to locate executable using which
30258   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30259   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
30260   # to not find them
30261   if test "x$new_path" = x \
30262       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30263       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30264     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30265   fi
30266   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30267     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
30268     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
30269     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
30270     # argument.
30271     path="$complete"
30272     arguments="EOL"
30273     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30274     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30275     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
30276     # to not find them
30277     if test "x$new_path" = x \
30278         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30279         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30280       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30281     fi
30282     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30283       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
30284       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30285 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30286       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30287       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30288         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
30289 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30290       fi
30291       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30292     fi
30293   fi
30294 
30295   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
30296   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
30297   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
30298   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
30299   #
30300   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
30301   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
30302   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30303   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
30304     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
30305     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
30306     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
30307       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
30308     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
30309       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
30310     else
30311       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
30312 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
30313       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
30314 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
30315       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30316     fi
30317   else
30318     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
30319   fi
30320 
30321   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
30322   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
30323   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
30324 
30325   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
30326   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
30327   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
30328   # take no chances and rewrite it.
30329   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
30330   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
30331   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
30332     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
30333     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
30334     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
30335     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
30336       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
30337       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
30338       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
30339       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
30340       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
30341       new_path="$input_path"
30342     fi
30343   fi
30344 
30345   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
30346   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
30347     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
30348     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
30349       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
30350       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
30351       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
30352     fi
30353   fi
30354 
30355   # remove trailing .exe if any
30356   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30357 
30358   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30359 
30360   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30361   # space.
30362   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30363   path="${complete%% *}"
30364   tmp="$complete EOL"
30365   arguments="${tmp#* }"
30366 
30367   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
30368   # unix format.
30369   new_path="$path"
30370 
30371   windows_path="$new_path"
30372   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30373     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30374     new_path="$unix_path"
30375   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30376     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30377     new_path="$unix_path"
30378   fi
30379 
30380 
30381   # Now try to locate executable using which
30382   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30383 
30384   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30385     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
30386     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
30387     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
30388     # argument.
30389     path="$complete"
30390     arguments="EOL"
30391     new_path="$path"
30392 
30393   windows_path="$new_path"
30394   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30395     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30396     new_path="$unix_path"
30397   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30398     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30399     new_path="$unix_path"
30400   fi
30401 
30402 
30403     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30404     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
30405     # to not find them
30406     if test "x$new_path" = x \
30407         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30408         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30409       new_path="$path"
30410 
30411   windows_path="$new_path"
30412   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30413     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30414     new_path="$unix_path"
30415   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30416     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30417     new_path="$unix_path"
30418   fi
30419 
30420     fi
30421 
30422     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30423       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
30424       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30425 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30426       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30427       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30428         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
30429 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30430       fi
30431       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30432     fi
30433   fi
30434 
30435   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
30436   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
30437     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
30438     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30439     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
30440   else
30441     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
30442     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
30443 
30444   input_path="$new_path"
30445   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
30446   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
30447   # take no chances and rewrite it.
30448   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
30449   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
30450   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
30451     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
30452     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
30453   fi
30454 
30455     # Output is in $new_path
30456 
30457   windows_path="$new_path"
30458   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30459     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30460     new_path="$unix_path"
30461   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30462     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30463     new_path="$unix_path"
30464   fi
30465 
30466     # remove trailing .exe if any
30467     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30468 
30469     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
30470     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
30471   fi
30472 
30473   else
30474     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
30475     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30476     # space.
30477     complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30478     path="${complete%% *}"
30479     tmp="$complete EOL"
30480     arguments="${tmp#* }"
30481 
30482     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
30483     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
30484     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
30485       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
30486       IFS_save="$IFS"
30487       IFS=:
30488       for p in $PATH; do
30489         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
30490           new_path="$p/$path"
30491           break
30492         fi
30493       done
30494       IFS="$IFS_save"
30495     else
30496       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
30497       new_path="$path"
30498     fi
30499 
30500     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30501       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30502 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30503       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30504       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30505         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
30506 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30507       fi
30508       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30509     fi
30510   fi
30511 
30512   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
30513   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
30514     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
30515   else
30516     new_complete="$new_path"
30517   fi
30518 
30519   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
30520     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$new_complete"
30521     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
30522 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
30523   fi
30524 
30525     PATH="$RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH"
30526 
30527     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for resolved symbolic links for CXX" >&5
30528 $as_echo_n "checking for resolved symbolic links for CXX... " >&6; }
30529 
30530   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
30531     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
30532     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
30533     # complicated shell code.
30534     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
30535       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
30536       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
30537       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
30538       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
30539         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
30540         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
30541         READLINK_TESTED=yes
30542         READLINK=
30543       fi
30544     fi
30545 
30546     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
30547       PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=`$READLINK -f $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30548     else
30549       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
30550       STARTDIR=$PWD
30551       COUNTER=0
30552       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30553       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30554       cd $sym_link_dir
30555       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
30556       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
30557       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30558       # Resolve file symlinks
30559       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
30560         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
30561         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
30562           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
30563           break
30564         fi
30565         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
30566         # link could be in a different directory
30567         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
30568         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30569         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
30570         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
30571       done
30572       cd $STARTDIR
30573       PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
30574     fi
30575   fi
30576 
30577     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30578 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30579     CXX="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30580   else
30581     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, keeping CXX" >&5
30582 $as_echo "no, keeping CXX" >&6; }
30583   fi
30584 
30585 
30586   COMPILER=$CXX
30587   COMPILER_NAME=$COMPILER_NAME
30588 
30589   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
30590     # cc -V output typically looks like
30591     #     cc: Sun C 5.12 Linux_i386 2011/11/16
30592     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -V 2>&1`
30593     # Check that this is likely to be the Solaris Studio cc.
30594     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "^.*: Sun $COMPILER_NAME" > /dev/null
30595     if test $? -ne 0; then
30596       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30597       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30598 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30599       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30600 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30601       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30602 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30603       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30604     fi
30605     # Remove usage instructions (if present), and
30606     # collapse compiler output into a single line
30607     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30608         $SED -e 's/ *[Uu]sage:.*//'`
30609     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30610         $SED -e "s/^.*[ ,\t]$COMPILER_NAME[ ,\t]\([1-9]\.[0-9][0-9]*\).*/\1/"`
30611   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
30612     # xlc -qversion output typically looks like
30613     #     IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V11.1 (5724-X13)
30614     #     Version: 11.01.0000.0015
30615     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -qversion 2>&1`
30616     # Check that this is likely to be the IBM XL C compiler.
30617     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "IBM XL C" > /dev/null
30618     if test $? -ne 0; then
30619       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30620       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30621 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30622       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30623 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30624       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30625 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30626       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30627     fi
30628     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30629     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30630     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30631         $SED -e 's/^.*, V\([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
30632   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
30633     # There is no specific version flag, but all output starts with a version string.
30634     # First line typically looks something like:
30635     # Microsoft (R) 32-bit C/C++ Optimizing Compiler Version 16.00.40219.01 for 80x86
30636     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
30637     # Check that this is likely to be Microsoft CL.EXE.
30638     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Microsoft.*Compiler" > /dev/null
30639     if test $? -ne 0; then
30640       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30641 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30642       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30643 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30644       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30645     fi
30646     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30647     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30648     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30649         $SED -e 's/^.*ersion.\([1-9][0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
30650   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
30651     # gcc --version output typically looks like
30652     #     gcc (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.8.1-10ubuntu9) 4.8.1
30653     #     Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
30654     #     This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
30655     #     warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
30656     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30657     # Check that this is likely to be GCC.
30658     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Free Software Foundation" > /dev/null
30659     if test $? -ne 0; then
30660       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30661 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30662       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&5
30663 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&6;}
30664       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30665     fi
30666     # Remove Copyright and legalese from version string, and
30667     # collapse into a single line
30668     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30669         $SED -e 's/ *Copyright .*//'`
30670     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30671         $SED -e 's/^.* \([1-9]\.[0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
30672   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
30673     # clang --version output typically looks like
30674     #    Apple LLVM version 5.0 (clang-500.2.79) (based on LLVM 3.3svn)
30675     #    clang version 3.3 (tags/RELEASE_33/final)
30676     # or
30677     #    Debian clang version 3.2-7ubuntu1 (tags/RELEASE_32/final) (based on LLVM 3.2)
30678     #    Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
30679     #    Thread model: posix
30680     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30681     # Check that this is likely to be clang
30682     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "clang" > /dev/null
30683     if test $? -ne 0; then
30684       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30685 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30686       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30687 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30688       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30689     fi
30690     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30691     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30692     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30693         $SED -e 's/^.*clang version \([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
30694   else
30695       as_fn_error $? "Unknown toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE." "$LINENO" 5
30696   fi
30697   # This sets CC_VERSION_NUMBER or CXX_VERSION_NUMBER. (This comment is a grep marker)
30698   CXX_VERSION_NUMBER="$COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER"
30699   # This sets CC_VERSION_STRING or CXX_VERSION_STRING. (This comment is a grep marker)
30700   CXX_VERSION_STRING="$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING"
30701 
30702   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&5
30703 $as_echo "$as_me: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&6;}
30704 
30705 
30706   # Now that we have resolved CXX ourself, let autoconf have its go at it
30707   ac_ext=cpp
30708 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
30709 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30710 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30711 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
30712 if test -z "$CXX"; then
30713   if test -n "$CCC"; then
30714     CXX=$CCC
30715   else
30716     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
30717   for ac_prog in $CXX
30718   do
30719     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30720 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30721 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30722 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30723 if ${ac_cv_prog_CXX+:} false; then :
30724   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30725 else
30726   if test -n "$CXX"; then
30727   ac_cv_prog_CXX="$CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30728 else
30729 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30730 for as_dir in $PATH
30731 do
30732   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30733   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30734     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30735   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30736     ac_cv_prog_CXX="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
30737     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30738     break 2
30739   fi
30740 done
30741   done
30742 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30743 
30744 fi
30745 fi
30746 CXX=$ac_cv_prog_CXX
30747 if test -n "$CXX"; then
30748   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CXX" >&5
30749 $as_echo "$CXX" >&6; }
30750 else
30751   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30752 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30753 fi
30754 
30755 
30756     test -n "$CXX" && break
30757   done
30758 fi
30759 if test -z "$CXX"; then
30760   ac_ct_CXX=$CXX
30761   for ac_prog in $CXX
30762 do
30763   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30764 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30765 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30766 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30767 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX+:} false; then :
30768   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30769 else
30770   if test -n "$ac_ct_CXX"; then
30771   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX="$ac_ct_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30772 else
30773 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30774 for as_dir in $PATH
30775 do
30776   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30777   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30778     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30779   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30780     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX="$ac_prog"
30781     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30782     break 2
30783   fi
30784 done
30785   done
30786 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30787 
30788 fi
30789 fi
30790 ac_ct_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX
30791 if test -n "$ac_ct_CXX"; then
30792   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_CXX" >&5
30793 $as_echo "$ac_ct_CXX" >&6; }
30794 else
30795   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30796 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30797 fi
30798 
30799 
30800   test -n "$ac_ct_CXX" && break
30801 done
30802 
30803   if test "x$ac_ct_CXX" = x; then
30804     CXX="g++"
30805   else
30806     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
30807 yes:)
30808 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
30809 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
30810 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
30811 esac
30812     CXX=$ac_ct_CXX
30813   fi
30814 fi
30815 
30816   fi
30817 fi
30818 # Provide some information about the compiler.
30819 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C++ compiler version" >&5
30820 set X $ac_compile
30821 ac_compiler=$2
30822 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
30823   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
30824 case "(($ac_try" in
30825   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
30826   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
30827 esac
30828 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
30829 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
30830   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
30831   ac_status=$?
30832   if test -s conftest.err; then
30833     sed '10a\
30834 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
30835          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
30836     cat conftest.er1 >&5
30837   fi
30838   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
30839   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
30840   test $ac_status = 0; }
30841 done
30842 
30843 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler" >&5
30844 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler... " >&6; }
30845 if ${ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
30846   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30847 else
30848   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30849 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30850 
30851 int
30852 main ()
30853 {
30854 #ifndef __GNUC__
30855        choke me
30856 #endif
30857 
30858   ;
30859   return 0;
30860 }
30861 _ACEOF
30862 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30863   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
30864 else
30865   ac_compiler_gnu=no
30866 fi
30867 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30868 ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
30869 
30870 fi
30871 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu" >&5
30872 $as_echo "$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
30873 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
30874   GXX=yes
30875 else
30876   GXX=
30877 fi
30878 ac_test_CXXFLAGS=${CXXFLAGS+set}
30879 ac_save_CXXFLAGS=$CXXFLAGS
30880 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $CXX accepts -g" >&5
30881 $as_echo_n "checking whether $CXX accepts -g... " >&6; }
30882 if ${ac_cv_prog_cxx_g+:} false; then :
30883   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30884 else
30885   ac_save_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_cxx_werror_flag
30886    ac_cxx_werror_flag=yes
30887    ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=no
30888    CXXFLAGS="-g"
30889    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30890 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30891 
30892 int
30893 main ()
30894 {
30895 
30896   ;
30897   return 0;
30898 }
30899 _ACEOF
30900 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30901   ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=yes
30902 else
30903   CXXFLAGS=""
30904       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30905 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30906 
30907 int
30908 main ()
30909 {
30910 
30911   ;
30912   return 0;
30913 }
30914 _ACEOF
30915 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30916 
30917 else
30918   ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_save_cxx_werror_flag
30919          CXXFLAGS="-g"
30920          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30921 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30922 
30923 int
30924 main ()
30925 {
30926 
30927   ;
30928   return 0;
30929 }
30930 _ACEOF
30931 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30932   ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=yes
30933 fi
30934 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30935 fi
30936 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30937 fi
30938 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30939    ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_save_cxx_werror_flag
30940 fi
30941 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cxx_g" >&5
30942 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cxx_g" >&6; }
30943 if test "$ac_test_CXXFLAGS" = set; then
30944   CXXFLAGS=$ac_save_CXXFLAGS
30945 elif test $ac_cv_prog_cxx_g = yes; then
30946   if test "$GXX" = yes; then
30947     CXXFLAGS="-g -O2"
30948   else
30949     CXXFLAGS="-g"
30950   fi
30951 else
30952   if test "$GXX" = yes; then
30953     CXXFLAGS="-O2"
30954   else
30955     CXXFLAGS=
30956   fi
30957 fi
30958 ac_ext=cpp
30959 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
30960 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30961 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30962 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
30963 
30964 
30965   #
30966   # Setup the preprocessor (CPP and CXXCPP)
30967   #
30968   ac_ext=c
30969 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
30970 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30971 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30972 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
30973 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
30974 $as_echo_n "checking how to run the C preprocessor... " >&6; }
30975 # On Suns, sometimes $CPP names a directory.
30976 if test -n "$CPP" && test -d "$CPP"; then
30977   CPP=
30978 fi
30979 if test -z "$CPP"; then
30980   if ${ac_cv_prog_CPP+:} false; then :
30981   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30982 else
30983       # Double quotes because CPP needs to be expanded
30984     for CPP in "$CC -E" "$CC -E -traditional-cpp" "/lib/cpp"
30985     do
30986       ac_preproc_ok=false
30987 for ac_c_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
30988 do
30989   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
30990   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
30991   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
30992   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
30993   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
30994   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
30995   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30996 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30997 #ifdef __STDC__
30998 # include <limits.h>
30999 #else
31000 # include <assert.h>
31001 #endif
31002                      Syntax error
31003 _ACEOF
31004 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31005 
31006 else
31007   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31008 continue
31009 fi
31010 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31011 
31012   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31013   # can be detected and how.
31014   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31015 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31016 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31017 _ACEOF
31018 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31019   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31020 continue
31021 else
31022   # Passes both tests.
31023 ac_preproc_ok=:
31024 break
31025 fi
31026 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31027 
31028 done
31029 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31030 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31031 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31032   break
31033 fi
31034 
31035     done
31036     ac_cv_prog_CPP=$CPP
31037 
31038 fi
31039   CPP=$ac_cv_prog_CPP
31040 else
31041   ac_cv_prog_CPP=$CPP
31042 fi
31043 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CPP" >&5
31044 $as_echo "$CPP" >&6; }
31045 ac_preproc_ok=false
31046 for ac_c_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31047 do
31048   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31049   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31050   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31051   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31052   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31053   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31054   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31055 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31056 #ifdef __STDC__
31057 # include <limits.h>
31058 #else
31059 # include <assert.h>
31060 #endif
31061                      Syntax error
31062 _ACEOF
31063 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31064 
31065 else
31066   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31067 continue
31068 fi
31069 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31070 
31071   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31072   # can be detected and how.
31073   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31074 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31075 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31076 _ACEOF
31077 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31078   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31079 continue
31080 else
31081   # Passes both tests.
31082 ac_preproc_ok=:
31083 break
31084 fi
31085 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31086 
31087 done
31088 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31089 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31090 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31091 
31092 else
31093   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
31094 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
31095 as_fn_error $? "C preprocessor \"$CPP\" fails sanity check
31096 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
31097 fi
31098 
31099 ac_ext=cpp
31100 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31101 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31102 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31103 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31104 
31105 
31106   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31107 
31108   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31109   # space.
31110   complete="$CPP"
31111   path="${complete%% *}"
31112   tmp="$complete EOL"
31113   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31114 
31115   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31116   # unix format.
31117   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31118 
31119   # Now try to locate executable using which
31120   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31121   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31122   # to not find them
31123   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31124       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31125       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31126     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31127   fi
31128   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31129     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31130     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31131     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31132     # argument.
31133     path="$complete"
31134     arguments="EOL"
31135     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31136     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31137     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31138     # to not find them
31139     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31140         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31141         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31142       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31143     fi
31144     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31145       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31146       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31147 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31148       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31149       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31150         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31151 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31152       fi
31153       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31154     fi
31155   fi
31156 
31157   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31158   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31159   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31160   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31161   #
31162   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31163   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31164   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31165   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31166     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31167     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31168     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31169       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31170     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31171       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31172     else
31173       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31174 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31175       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31176 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31177       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31178     fi
31179   else
31180     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31181   fi
31182 
31183   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31184   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31185   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31186 
31187   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31188   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31189   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31190   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31191   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31192   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31193   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31194     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31195     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31196     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31197     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
