31198       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31199       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31200       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31201       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31202       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31203       new_path="$input_path"
31204     fi
31205   fi
31206 
31207   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31208   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31209     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31210     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31211       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31212       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31213       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31214     fi
31215   fi
31216 
31217   # remove trailing .exe if any
31218   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31219 
31220   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31221 
31222   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31223   # space.
31224   complete="$CPP"
31225   path="${complete%% *}"
31226   tmp="$complete EOL"
31227   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31228 
31229   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31230   # unix format.
31231   new_path="$path"
31232 
31233   windows_path="$new_path"
31234   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31235     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31236     new_path="$unix_path"
31237   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31238     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31239     new_path="$unix_path"
31240   fi
31241 
31242 
31243   # Now try to locate executable using which
31244   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31245 
31246   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31247     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31248     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31249     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31250     # argument.
31251     path="$complete"
31252     arguments="EOL"
31253     new_path="$path"
31254 
31255   windows_path="$new_path"
31256   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31257     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31258     new_path="$unix_path"
31259   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31260     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31261     new_path="$unix_path"
31262   fi
31263 
31264 
31265     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31266     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
31267     # to not find them
31268     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31269         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31270         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31271       new_path="$path"
31272 
31273   windows_path="$new_path"
31274   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31275     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31276     new_path="$unix_path"
31277   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31278     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31279     new_path="$unix_path"
31280   fi
31281 
31282     fi
31283 
31284     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31285       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31286       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31287 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31288       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31289       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31290         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31291 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31292       fi
31293       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31294     fi
31295   fi
31296 
31297   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
31298   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
31299     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
31300     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31301     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
31302   else
31303     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
31304     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
31305 
31306   input_path="$new_path"
31307   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31308   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31309   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31310   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31311   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
31312   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31313     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31314     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31315   fi
31316 
31317     # Output is in $new_path
31318 
31319   windows_path="$new_path"
31320   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31321     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31322     new_path="$unix_path"
31323   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31324     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31325     new_path="$unix_path"
31326   fi
31327 
31328     # remove trailing .exe if any
31329     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31330 
31331     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
31332     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
31333   fi
31334 
31335   else
31336     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
31337     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31338     # space.
31339     complete="$CPP"
31340     path="${complete%% *}"
31341     tmp="$complete EOL"
31342     arguments="${tmp#* }"
31343 
31344     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
31345     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
31346     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
31347       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
31348       IFS_save="$IFS"
31349       IFS=:
31350       for p in $PATH; do
31351         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
31352           new_path="$p/$path"
31353           break
31354         fi
31355       done
31356       IFS="$IFS_save"
31357     else
31358       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
31359       new_path="$path"
31360     fi
31361 
31362     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31363       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31364 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31365       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31366       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31367         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
31368 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31369       fi
31370       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31371     fi
31372   fi
31373 
31374   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
31375   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
31376     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
31377   else
31378     new_complete="$new_path"
31379   fi
31380 
31381   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
31382     CPP="$new_complete"
31383     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
31384 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
31385   fi
31386 
31387   ac_ext=cpp
31388 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31389 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31390 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31391 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31392 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to run the C++ preprocessor" >&5
31393 $as_echo_n "checking how to run the C++ preprocessor... " >&6; }
31394 if test -z "$CXXCPP"; then
31395   if ${ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP+:} false; then :
31396   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
31397 else
31398       # Double quotes because CXXCPP needs to be expanded
31399     for CXXCPP in "$CXX -E" "/lib/cpp"
31400     do
31401       ac_preproc_ok=false
31402 for ac_cxx_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31403 do
31404   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31405   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31406   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31407   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31408   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31409   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31410   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31411 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31412 #ifdef __STDC__
31413 # include <limits.h>
31414 #else
31415 # include <assert.h>
31416 #endif
31417                      Syntax error
31418 _ACEOF
31419 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31420 
31421 else
31422   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31423 continue
31424 fi
31425 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31426 
31427   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31428   # can be detected and how.
31429   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31430 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31431 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31432 _ACEOF
31433 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31434   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31435 continue
31436 else
31437   # Passes both tests.
31438 ac_preproc_ok=:
31439 break
31440 fi
31441 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31442 
31443 done
31444 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31445 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31446 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31447   break
31448 fi
31449 
31450     done
31451     ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP=$CXXCPP
31452 
31453 fi
31454   CXXCPP=$ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP
31455 else
31456   ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP=$CXXCPP
31457 fi
31458 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CXXCPP" >&5
31459 $as_echo "$CXXCPP" >&6; }
31460 ac_preproc_ok=false
31461 for ac_cxx_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31462 do
31463   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31464   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31465   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31466   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31467   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31468   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31469   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31470 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31471 #ifdef __STDC__
31472 # include <limits.h>
31473 #else
31474 # include <assert.h>
31475 #endif
31476                      Syntax error
31477 _ACEOF
31478 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31479 
31480 else
31481   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31482 continue
31483 fi
31484 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31485 
31486   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31487   # can be detected and how.
31488   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31489 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31490 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31491 _ACEOF
31492 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31493   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31494 continue
31495 else
31496   # Passes both tests.
31497 ac_preproc_ok=:
31498 break
31499 fi
31500 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31501 
31502 done
31503 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31504 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31505 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31506 
31507 else
31508   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
31509 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
31510 as_fn_error $? "C++ preprocessor \"$CXXCPP\" fails sanity check
31511 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
31512 fi
31513 
31514 ac_ext=cpp
31515 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31516 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31517 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31518 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31519 
31520 
31521   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31522 
31523   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31524   # space.
31525   complete="$CXXCPP"
31526   path="${complete%% *}"
31527   tmp="$complete EOL"
31528   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31529 
31530   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31531   # unix format.
31532   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31533 
31534   # Now try to locate executable using which
31535   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31536   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31537   # to not find them
31538   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31539       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31540       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31541     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31542   fi
31543   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31544     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31545     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31546     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31547     # argument.
31548     path="$complete"
31549     arguments="EOL"
31550     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31551     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31552     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31553     # to not find them
31554     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31555         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31556         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31557       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31558     fi
31559     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31560       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31561       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31562 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31563       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31564       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31565         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31566 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31567       fi
31568       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31569     fi
31570   fi
31571 
31572   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31573   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31574   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31575   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31576   #
31577   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31578   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31579   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31580   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31581     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31582     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31583     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31584       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31585     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31586       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31587     else
31588       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31589 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31590       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31591 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31592       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31593     fi
31594   else
31595     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31596   fi
31597 
31598   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31599   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31600   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31601 
31602   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31603   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31604   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31605   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31606   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31607   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31608   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31609     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31610     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31611     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31612     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
31613       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31614       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31615       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31616       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31617       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31618       new_path="$input_path"
31619     fi
31620   fi
31621 
31622   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31623   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31624     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31625     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31626       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31627       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31628       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31629     fi
31630   fi
31631 
31632   # remove trailing .exe if any
31633   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31634 
31635   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31636 
31637   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31638   # space.
31639   complete="$CXXCPP"
31640   path="${complete%% *}"
31641   tmp="$complete EOL"
31642   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31643 
31644   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31645   # unix format.
31646   new_path="$path"
31647 
31648   windows_path="$new_path"
31649   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31650     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31651     new_path="$unix_path"
31652   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31653     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31654     new_path="$unix_path"
31655   fi
31656 
31657 
31658   # Now try to locate executable using which
31659   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31660 
31661   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31662     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31663     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31664     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31665     # argument.
31666     path="$complete"
31667     arguments="EOL"
31668     new_path="$path"
31669 
31670   windows_path="$new_path"
31671   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31672     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31673     new_path="$unix_path"
31674   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31675     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31676     new_path="$unix_path"
31677   fi
31678 
31679 
31680     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31681     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
31682     # to not find them
31683     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31684         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31685         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31686       new_path="$path"
31687 
31688   windows_path="$new_path"
31689   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31690     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31691     new_path="$unix_path"
31692   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31693     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31694     new_path="$unix_path"
31695   fi
31696 
31697     fi
31698 
31699     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31700       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31701       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31702 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31703       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31704       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31705         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31706 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31707       fi
31708       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31709     fi
31710   fi
31711 
31712   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
31713   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
31714     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
31715     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31716     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
31717   else
31718     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
31719     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
31720 
31721   input_path="$new_path"
31722   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31723   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31724   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31725   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31726   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
31727   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31728     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31729     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31730   fi
31731 
31732     # Output is in $new_path
31733 
31734   windows_path="$new_path"
31735   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31736     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31737     new_path="$unix_path"
31738   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31739     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31740     new_path="$unix_path"
31741   fi
31742 
31743     # remove trailing .exe if any
31744     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31745 
31746     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
31747     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
31748   fi
31749 
31750   else
31751     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
31752     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31753     # space.
31754     complete="$CXXCPP"
31755     path="${complete%% *}"
31756     tmp="$complete EOL"
31757     arguments="${tmp#* }"
31758 
31759     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
31760     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
31761     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
31762       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
31763       IFS_save="$IFS"
31764       IFS=:
31765       for p in $PATH; do
31766         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
31767           new_path="$p/$path"
31768           break
31769         fi
31770       done
31771       IFS="$IFS_save"
31772     else
31773       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
31774       new_path="$path"
31775     fi
31776 
31777     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31778       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31779 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31780       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31781       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31782         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
31783 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31784       fi
31785       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31786     fi
31787   fi
31788 
31789   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
31790   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
31791     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
31792   else
31793     new_complete="$new_path"
31794   fi
31795 
31796   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
31797     CXXCPP="$new_complete"
31798     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CXXCPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
31799 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CXXCPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
31800   fi
31801 
31802 
31803   #
31804   # Setup the linker (LD)
31805   #
31806   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
31807     # In the Microsoft toolchain we have a separate LD command "link".
31808     # Make sure we reject /usr/bin/link (as determined in CYGWIN_LINK), which is
31809     # a cygwin program for something completely different.
31810     # Extract the first word of "link", so it can be a program name with args.
31811 set dummy link; ac_word=$2
31812 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
31813 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
31814 if ${ac_cv_prog_LD+:} false; then :
31815   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
31816 else
31817   if test -n "$LD"; then
31818   ac_cv_prog_LD="$LD" # Let the user override the test.
31819 else
31820   ac_prog_rejected=no
31821 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
31822 for as_dir in $PATH
31823 do
31824   IFS=$as_save_IFS
31825   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
31826     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
31827   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
31828     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "$CYGWIN_LINK"; then
31829        ac_prog_rejected=yes
31830        continue
31831      fi
31832     ac_cv_prog_LD="link"
31833     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
31834     break 2
31835   fi
31836 done
31837   done
31838 IFS=$as_save_IFS
31839 
31840 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
31841   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
31842   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_LD
31843   shift
31844   if test $# != 0; then
31845     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
31846     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
31847     # first if we set LD to just the basename; use the full file name.
31848     shift
31849     ac_cv_prog_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
31850   fi
31851 fi
31852 fi
31853 fi
31854 LD=$ac_cv_prog_LD
31855 if test -n "$LD"; then
31856   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LD" >&5
31857 $as_echo "$LD" >&6; }
31858 else
31859   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
31860 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
31861 fi
31862 
31863 
31864 
31865   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31866 
31867   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31868   # space.
31869   complete="$LD"
31870   path="${complete%% *}"
31871   tmp="$complete EOL"
31872   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31873 
31874   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31875   # unix format.
31876   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31877 
31878   # Now try to locate executable using which
31879   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31880   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31881   # to not find them
31882   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31883       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31884       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31885     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31886   fi
31887   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31888     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31889     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31890     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31891     # argument.
31892     path="$complete"
31893     arguments="EOL"
31894     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31895     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31896     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31897     # to not find them
31898     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31899         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31900         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31901       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31902     fi
31903     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31904       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31905       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31906 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31907       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31908       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31909         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31910 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31911       fi
31912       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
31913     fi
31914   fi
31915 
31916   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31917   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31918   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31919   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31920   #
31921   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31922   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31923   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31924   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31925     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31926     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31927     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31928       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31929     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31930       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31931     else
31932       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31933 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31934       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31935 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31936       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
31937     fi
31938   else
31939     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31940   fi
31941 
31942   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31943   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31944   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31945 
31946   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31947   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31948   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31949   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31950   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31951   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31952   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31953     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31954     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31955     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31956     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
31957       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31958       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31959       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31960       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31961       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31962       new_path="$input_path"
31963     fi
31964   fi
31965 
31966   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31967   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31968     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31969     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31970       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31971       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31972       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31973     fi
31974   fi
31975 
31976   # remove trailing .exe if any
31977   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31978 
31979   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31980 
31981   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31982   # space.
31983   complete="$LD"
31984   path="${complete%% *}"
31985   tmp="$complete EOL"
31986   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31987 
31988   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31989   # unix format.
31990   new_path="$path"
31991 
31992   windows_path="$new_path"
31993   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31994     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31995     new_path="$unix_path"
31996   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31997     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31998     new_path="$unix_path"
31999   fi
32000 
32001 
32002   # Now try to locate executable using which
32003   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32004 
32005   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32006     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32007     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32008     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32009     # argument.
32010     path="$complete"
32011     arguments="EOL"
32012     new_path="$path"
32013 
32014   windows_path="$new_path"
32015   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32016     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32017     new_path="$unix_path"
32018   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32019     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32020     new_path="$unix_path"
32021   fi
32022 
32023 
32024     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32025     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
32026     # to not find them
32027     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32028         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32029         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32030       new_path="$path"
32031 
32032   windows_path="$new_path"
32033   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32034     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32035     new_path="$unix_path"
32036   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32037     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32038     new_path="$unix_path"
32039   fi
32040 
32041     fi
32042 
32043     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32044       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32045       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32046 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32047       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32048       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32049         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32050 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32051       fi
32052       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
32053     fi
32054   fi
32055 
32056   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
32057   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
32058     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
32059     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32060     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
32061   else
32062     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
32063     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
32064 
32065   input_path="$new_path"
32066   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32067   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32068   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32069   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32070   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
32071   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32072     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32073     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32074   fi
32075 
32076     # Output is in $new_path
32077 
32078   windows_path="$new_path"
32079   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32080     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32081     new_path="$unix_path"
32082   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32083     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32084     new_path="$unix_path"
32085   fi
32086 
32087     # remove trailing .exe if any
32088     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32089 
32090     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
32091     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
32092   fi
32093 
32094   else
32095     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
32096     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32097     # space.
32098     complete="$LD"
32099     path="${complete%% *}"
32100     tmp="$complete EOL"
32101     arguments="${tmp#* }"
32102 
32103     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
32104     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
32105     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
32106       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
32107       IFS_save="$IFS"
32108       IFS=:
32109       for p in $PATH; do
32110         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
32111           new_path="$p/$path"
32112           break
32113         fi
32114       done
32115       IFS="$IFS_save"
32116     else
32117       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
32118       new_path="$path"
32119     fi
32120 
32121     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32122       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32123 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32124       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32125       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32126         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
32127 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32128       fi
32129       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
32130     fi
32131   fi
32132 
32133   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
32134   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
32135     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
32136   else
32137     new_complete="$new_path"
32138   fi
32139 
32140   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
32141     LD="$new_complete"
32142     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
32143 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
32144   fi
32145 
32146     # Verify that we indeed succeeded with this trick.
32147     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if the found link.exe is actually the Visual Studio linker" >&5
32148 $as_echo_n "checking if the found link.exe is actually the Visual Studio linker... " >&6; }
32149     "$LD" --version > /dev/null
32150     if test $? -eq 0 ; then
32151       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32152 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32153       as_fn_error $? "This is the Cygwin link tool. Please check your PATH and rerun configure." "$LINENO" 5
32154     else
32155       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
32156 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
32157     fi
32158     LDCXX="$LD"
32159   else
32160     # All other toolchains use the compiler to link.
32161     LD="$CC"
32162     LDCXX="$CXX"
32163   fi
32164 
32165   # FIXME: it should be CXXLD, according to standard (cf CXXCPP)
32166 
32167 
32168   #
32169   # Setup the assembler (AS)
32170   #
32171   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
32172     # FIXME: should this really be solaris, or solstudio?
32173 
32174 
32175   # Publish this variable in the help.
32176 
32177 
32178   if test "x$AS" = x; then
32179     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
32180     for ac_prog in as
32181 do
32182   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32183 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32184 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32185 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32186 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32187   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32188 else
32189   case $AS in
32190   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32191   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32192   ;;
32193   *)
32194   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32195 for as_dir in $PATH
32196 do
32197   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32198   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32199     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32200   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32201     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32202     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32203     break 2
32204   fi
32205 done
32206   done
32207 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32208 
32209   ;;
32210 esac
32211 fi
32212 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32213 if test -n "$AS"; then
32214   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32215 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32216 else
32217   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32218 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32219 fi
32220 
32221 
32222   test -n "$AS" && break
32223 done
32224 
32225   else
32226     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
32227 
32228     # Try to remove the string !AS! from our list.
32229     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!AS!/}
32230     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
32231       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
32232       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
32233       if test "xAS" != xBASH; then
32234         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of AS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
32235 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of AS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
32236       fi
32237       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
32238       for ac_prog in as
32239 do
32240   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32241 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32242 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32243 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32244 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32245   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32246 else
32247   case $AS in
32248   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32249   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32250   ;;
32251   *)
32252   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32253 for as_dir in $PATH
32254 do
32255   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32256   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32257     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32258   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32259     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32260     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32261     break 2
32262   fi
32263 done
32264   done
32265 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32266 
32267   ;;
32268 esac
32269 fi
32270 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32271 if test -n "$AS"; then
32272   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32273 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32274 else
32275   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32276 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32277 fi
32278 
32279 
32280   test -n "$AS" && break
32281 done
32282 
32283     else
32284       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
32285       # for the tool.
32286 
32287       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
32288       # for unknown variables in the end.
32289       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
32290 
32291       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
32292       tool_specified="$AS"
32293       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
32294       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
32295         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
32296         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool AS=$tool_basename" >&5
32297 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool AS=$tool_basename" >&6;}
32298         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
32299 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
32300 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32301 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32302 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32303   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32304 else
32305   case $AS in
32306   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32307   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32308   ;;
32309   *)
32310   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32311 for as_dir in $PATH
32312 do
32313   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32314   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32315     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32316   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32317     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32318     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32319     break 2
32320   fi
32321 done
32322   done
32323 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32324 
32325   ;;
32326 esac
32327 fi
32328 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32329 if test -n "$AS"; then
32330   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32331 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32332 else
32333   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32334 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32335 fi
32336 
32337 
32338         if test "x$AS" = x; then
32339           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
32340         fi
32341       else
32342         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
32343         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool AS=$tool_specified" >&5
32344 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool AS=$tool_specified" >&6;}
32345         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for AS" >&5
32346 $as_echo_n "checking for AS... " >&6; }
32347         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
32348           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
32349 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
32350           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool AS=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
32351         fi
32352         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
32353 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
32354       fi
32355     fi
32356   fi
32357 
32358 
32359 
32360   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32361 
32362   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32363   # space.
32364   complete="$AS"
32365   path="${complete%% *}"
32366   tmp="$complete EOL"
32367   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32368 
32369   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32370   # unix format.
32371   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32372 
32373   # Now try to locate executable using which
32374   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32375   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
32376   # to not find them
32377   if test "x$new_path" = x \
32378       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32379       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32380     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32381   fi
32382   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32383     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32384     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32385     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32386     # argument.
32387     path="$complete"
32388     arguments="EOL"
32389     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32390     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32391     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
32392     # to not find them
32393     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32394         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32395         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32396       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32397     fi
32398     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32399       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32400       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32401 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32402       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32403       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32404         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32405 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32406       fi
32407       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32408     fi
32409   fi
32410 
32411   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
32412   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
32413   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
32414   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
32415   #
32416   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
32417   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
32418   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32419   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
32420     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
32421     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
32422     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
32423       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
32424     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
32425       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
32426     else
32427       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
32428 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
32429       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
32430 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
32431       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32432     fi
32433   else
32434     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
32435   fi
32436 
32437   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
32438   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
32439   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
32440 
32441   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
32442   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32443   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32444   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32445   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32446   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
32447   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32448     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32449     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
32450     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
32451     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
32452       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
32453       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
32454       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32455       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
32456       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
32457       new_path="$input_path"
32458     fi
32459   fi
32460 
32461   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
32462   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
32463     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
32464     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
32465       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
32466       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
32467       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
32468     fi
32469   fi
32470 
32471   # remove trailing .exe if any
32472   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32473 
32474   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32475 
32476   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32477   # space.
32478   complete="$AS"
32479   path="${complete%% *}"
32480   tmp="$complete EOL"
32481   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32482 
32483   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32484   # unix format.
32485   new_path="$path"
32486 
32487   windows_path="$new_path"
32488   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32489     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32490     new_path="$unix_path"
32491   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32492     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32493     new_path="$unix_path"
32494   fi
32495 
32496 
32497   # Now try to locate executable using which
32498   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32499 
32500   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32501     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32502     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32503     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32504     # argument.
32505     path="$complete"
32506     arguments="EOL"
32507     new_path="$path"
32508 
32509   windows_path="$new_path"
32510   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32511     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32512     new_path="$unix_path"
32513   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32514     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32515     new_path="$unix_path"
32516   fi
32517 
32518 
32519     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32520     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
32521     # to not find them
32522     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32523         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32524         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32525       new_path="$path"
32526 
32527   windows_path="$new_path"
32528   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32529     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32530     new_path="$unix_path"
32531   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32532     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32533     new_path="$unix_path"
32534   fi
32535 
32536     fi
32537 
32538     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32539       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32540       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32541 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32542       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32543       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32544         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32545 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32546       fi
32547       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32548     fi
32549   fi
32550 
32551   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
32552   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
32553     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
32554     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32555     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
32556   else
32557     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
32558     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
32559 
32560   input_path="$new_path"
32561   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32562   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32563   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32564   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32565   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
32566   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32567     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32568     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32569   fi
32570 
32571     # Output is in $new_path
32572 
32573   windows_path="$new_path"
32574   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32575     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32576     new_path="$unix_path"
32577   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32578     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32579     new_path="$unix_path"
32580   fi
32581 
32582     # remove trailing .exe if any
32583     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32584 
32585     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
32586     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
32587   fi
32588 
32589   else
32590     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
32591     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32592     # space.
32593     complete="$AS"
32594     path="${complete%% *}"
32595     tmp="$complete EOL"
32596     arguments="${tmp#* }"
32597 
32598     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
32599     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
32600     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
32601       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
32602       IFS_save="$IFS"
32603       IFS=:
32604       for p in $PATH; do
32605         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
32606           new_path="$p/$path"
32607           break
32608         fi
32609       done
32610       IFS="$IFS_save"
32611     else
32612       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
32613       new_path="$path"
32614     fi
32615 
32616     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32617       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32618 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32619       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32620       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32621         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
32622 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32623       fi
32624       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32625     fi
32626   fi
32627 
32628   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
32629   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
32630     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
32631   else
32632     new_complete="$new_path"
32633   fi
32634 
32635   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
32636     AS="$new_complete"
32637     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting AS to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
32638 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting AS to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
32639   fi
32640 
32641   else
32642     # FIXME: is this correct for microsoft?
32643     AS="$CC -c"
32644   fi
32645 
32646 
32647   #
32648   # Setup the archiver (AR)
32649   #
32650   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
32651     # The corresponding ar tool is lib.exe (used to create static libraries)
32652     # Extract the first word of "lib", so it can be a program name with args.
32653 set dummy lib; ac_word=$2
32654 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32655 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32656 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32657   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32658 else
32659   if test -n "$AR"; then
32660   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32661 else
32662 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32663 for as_dir in $PATH
32664 do
32665   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32666   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32667     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32668   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32669     ac_cv_prog_AR="lib"
32670     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32671     break 2
32672   fi
32673 done
32674   done
32675 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32676 
32677 fi
32678 fi
32679 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32680 if test -n "$AR"; then
32681   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32682 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32683 else
32684   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32685 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32686 fi
32687 
32688 
32689   else
32690 
32691 
32692   # Publish this variable in the help.
32693 
32694 
32695   if test "x$AR" = x; then
32696     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
32697     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
32698   for ac_prog in ar
32699   do
32700     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32701 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32702 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32703 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32704 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32705   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32706 else
32707   if test -n "$AR"; then
32708   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32709 else
32710 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32711 for as_dir in $PATH
32712 do
32713   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32714   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32715     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32716   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32717     ac_cv_prog_AR="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
32718     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32719     break 2
32720   fi
32721 done
32722   done
32723 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32724 
32725 fi
32726 fi
32727 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32728 if test -n "$AR"; then
32729   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32730 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32731 else
32732   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32733 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32734 fi
32735 
32736 
32737     test -n "$AR" && break
32738   done
32739 fi
32740 if test -z "$AR"; then
32741   ac_ct_AR=$AR
32742   for ac_prog in ar
32743 do
32744   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32745 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32746 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32747 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32748 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR+:} false; then :
32749   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32750 else
32751   if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32752   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_ct_AR" # Let the user override the test.
32753 else
32754 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32755 for as_dir in $PATH
32756 do
32757   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32758   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32759     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32760   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32761     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_prog"
32762     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32763     break 2
32764   fi
32765 done
32766   done
32767 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32768 
32769 fi
32770 fi
32771 ac_ct_AR=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR
32772 if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32773   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_AR" >&5
32774 $as_echo "$ac_ct_AR" >&6; }
32775 else
32776   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32777 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32778 fi
32779 
32780 
32781   test -n "$ac_ct_AR" && break
32782 done
32783 
32784   if test "x$ac_ct_AR" = x; then
32785     AR=""
32786   else
32787     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
32788 yes:)
32789 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
32790 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
32791 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
32792 esac
32793     AR=$ac_ct_AR
32794   fi
32795 fi
32796 
32797   else
32798     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
32799 
32800     # Try to remove the string !AR! from our list.
32801     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!AR!/}
32802     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
32803       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
32804       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
32805       if test "xAR" != xBASH; then
32806         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of AR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
32807 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of AR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
32808       fi
32809       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
32810       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
32811   for ac_prog in ar
32812   do
32813     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32814 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32815 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32816 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32817 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32818   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32819 else
32820   if test -n "$AR"; then
32821   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32822 else
32823 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32824 for as_dir in $PATH
32825 do
32826   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32827   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32828     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32829   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32830     ac_cv_prog_AR="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
32831     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32832     break 2
32833   fi
32834 done
32835   done
32836 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32837 
32838 fi
32839 fi
32840 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32841 if test -n "$AR"; then
32842   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32843 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32844 else
32845   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32846 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32847 fi
32848 
32849 
32850     test -n "$AR" && break
32851   done
32852 fi
32853 if test -z "$AR"; then
32854   ac_ct_AR=$AR
32855   for ac_prog in ar
32856 do
32857   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32858 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32859 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32860 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32861 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR+:} false; then :
32862   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32863 else
32864   if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32865   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_ct_AR" # Let the user override the test.
32866 else
32867 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32868 for as_dir in $PATH
32869 do
32870   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32871   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32872     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32873   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32874     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_prog"
32875     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32876     break 2
32877   fi
32878 done
32879   done
32880 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32881 
32882 fi
32883 fi
32884 ac_ct_AR=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR
32885 if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32886   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_AR" >&5
32887 $as_echo "$ac_ct_AR" >&6; }
32888 else
32889   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32890 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32891 fi
32892 
32893 
32894   test -n "$ac_ct_AR" && break
32895 done
32896 
32897   if test "x$ac_ct_AR" = x; then
32898     AR=""
32899   else
32900     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
32901 yes:)
32902 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
32903 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
32904 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
32905 esac
32906     AR=$ac_ct_AR
32907   fi
32908 fi
32909 
32910     else
32911       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
32912       # for the tool.
32913 
32914       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
32915       # for unknown variables in the end.
32916       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
32917 
32918       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
32919       tool_specified="$AR"
32920       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
32921       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
32922         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
32923         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool AR=$tool_basename" >&5
32924 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool AR=$tool_basename" >&6;}
32925         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
32926 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
32927 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32928 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32929 if ${ac_cv_path_AR+:} false; then :
32930   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32931 else
32932   case $AR in
32933   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32934   ac_cv_path_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32935   ;;
32936   *)
32937   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32938 for as_dir in $PATH
32939 do
32940   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32941   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32942     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32943   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32944     ac_cv_path_AR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32945     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32946     break 2
32947   fi
32948 done
32949   done
32950 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32951 
32952   ;;
32953 esac
32954 fi
32955 AR=$ac_cv_path_AR
32956 if test -n "$AR"; then
32957   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32958 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32959 else
32960   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32961 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32962 fi
32963 
32964 
32965         if test "x$AR" = x; then
32966           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
32967         fi
32968       else
32969         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
32970         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool AR=$tool_specified" >&5
32971 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool AR=$tool_specified" >&6;}
32972         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for AR" >&5
32973 $as_echo_n "checking for AR... " >&6; }
32974         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
32975           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
32976 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
32977           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool AR=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
32978         fi
32979         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
32980 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
32981       fi
32982     fi
32983   fi
32984 
32985 
32986   fi
32987 
32988   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32989 
32990   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32991   # space.
32992   complete="$AR"
32993   path="${complete%% *}"
32994   tmp="$complete EOL"
32995   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32996 
32997   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32998   # unix format.
32999   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33000 
33001   # Now try to locate executable using which
33002   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33003   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33004   # to not find them
33005   if test "x$new_path" = x \
33006       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33007       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33008     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33009   fi
33010   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33011     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33012     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33013     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33014     # argument.
33015     path="$complete"
33016     arguments="EOL"
33017     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33018     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33019     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33020     # to not find them
33021     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33022         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33023         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33024       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33025     fi
33026     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33027       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33028       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33029 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33030       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33031       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33032         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33033 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33034       fi
33035       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33036     fi
33037   fi
33038 
33039   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
33040   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
33041   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
33042   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
33043   #
33044   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
33045   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
33046   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33047   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
33048     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
33049     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
33050     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
33051       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
33052     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
33053       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
33054     else
33055       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
33056 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
33057       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
33058 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
33059       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33060     fi
33061   else
33062     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
33063   fi
33064 
33065   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
33066   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
33067   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33068 
33069   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33070   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33071   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
