33072   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33073   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33074   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
33075   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33076     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33077     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
33078     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33079     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
33080       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
33081       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
33082       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33083       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
33084       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33085       new_path="$input_path"
33086     fi
33087   fi
33088 
33089   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
33090   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
33091     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
33092     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
33093       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
33094       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
33095       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
33096     fi
33097   fi
33098 
33099   # remove trailing .exe if any
33100   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33101 
33102   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33103 
33104   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33105   # space.
33106   complete="$AR"
33107   path="${complete%% *}"
33108   tmp="$complete EOL"
33109   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33110 
33111   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33112   # unix format.
33113   new_path="$path"
33114 
33115   windows_path="$new_path"
33116   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33117     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33118     new_path="$unix_path"
33119   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33120     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33121     new_path="$unix_path"
33122   fi
33123 
33124 
33125   # Now try to locate executable using which
33126   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33127 
33128   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33129     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33130     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33131     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33132     # argument.
33133     path="$complete"
33134     arguments="EOL"
33135     new_path="$path"
33136 
33137   windows_path="$new_path"
33138   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33139     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33140     new_path="$unix_path"
33141   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33142     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33143     new_path="$unix_path"
33144   fi
33145 
33146 
33147     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33148     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
33149     # to not find them
33150     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33151         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33152         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33153       new_path="$path"
33154 
33155   windows_path="$new_path"
33156   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33157     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33158     new_path="$unix_path"
33159   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33160     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33161     new_path="$unix_path"
33162   fi
33163 
33164     fi
33165 
33166     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33167       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33168       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33169 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33170       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33171       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33172         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33173 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33174       fi
33175       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33176     fi
33177   fi
33178 
33179   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
33180   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
33181     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
33182     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33183     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
33184   else
33185     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
33186     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
33187 
33188   input_path="$new_path"
33189   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33190   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33191   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33192   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33193   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
33194   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33195     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33196     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33197   fi
33198 
33199     # Output is in $new_path
33200 
33201   windows_path="$new_path"
33202   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33203     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33204     new_path="$unix_path"
33205   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33206     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33207     new_path="$unix_path"
33208   fi
33209 
33210     # remove trailing .exe if any
33211     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33212 
33213     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
33214     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
33215   fi
33216 
33217   else
33218     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
33219     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33220     # space.
33221     complete="$AR"
33222     path="${complete%% *}"
33223     tmp="$complete EOL"
33224     arguments="${tmp#* }"
33225 
33226     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
33227     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
33228     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
33229       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
33230       IFS_save="$IFS"
33231       IFS=:
33232       for p in $PATH; do
33233         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
33234           new_path="$p/$path"
33235           break
33236         fi
33237       done
33238       IFS="$IFS_save"
33239     else
33240       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
33241       new_path="$path"
33242     fi
33243 
33244     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33245       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33246 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33247       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33248       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33249         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
33250 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33251       fi
33252       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33253     fi
33254   fi
33255 
33256   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
33257   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
33258     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
33259   else
33260     new_complete="$new_path"
33261   fi
33262 
33263   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
33264     AR="$new_complete"
33265     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting AR to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
33266 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting AR to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
33267   fi
33268 
33269 
33270 
33271   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
33272     ac_ext=m
33273 ac_cpp='$OBJCPP $CPPFLAGS'
33274 ac_compile='$OBJC -c $OBJCFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
33275 ac_link='$OBJC -o conftest$ac_exeext $OBJCFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
33276 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu
33277 if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
33278   for ac_prog in gcc objcc objc cc CC
33279   do
33280     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33281 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33282 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33283 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33284 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJC+:} false; then :
33285   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33286 else
33287   if test -n "$OBJC"; then
33288   ac_cv_prog_OBJC="$OBJC" # Let the user override the test.
33289 else
33290 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33291 for as_dir in $PATH
33292 do
33293   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33294   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33295     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33296   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33297     ac_cv_prog_OBJC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
33298     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33299     break 2
33300   fi
33301 done
33302   done
33303 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33304 
33305 fi
33306 fi
33307 OBJC=$ac_cv_prog_OBJC
33308 if test -n "$OBJC"; then
33309   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJC" >&5
33310 $as_echo "$OBJC" >&6; }
33311 else
33312   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33313 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33314 fi
33315 
33316 
33317     test -n "$OBJC" && break
33318   done
33319 fi
33320 if test -z "$OBJC"; then
33321   ac_ct_OBJC=$OBJC
33322   for ac_prog in gcc objcc objc cc CC
33323 do
33324   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33325 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33326 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33327 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33328 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC+:} false; then :
33329   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33330 else
33331   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC"; then
33332   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC="$ac_ct_OBJC" # Let the user override the test.
33333 else
33334 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33335 for as_dir in $PATH
33336 do
33337   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33338   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33339     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33340   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33341     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC="$ac_prog"
33342     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33343     break 2
33344   fi
33345 done
33346   done
33347 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33348 
33349 fi
33350 fi
33351 ac_ct_OBJC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC
33352 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC"; then
33353   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJC" >&5
33354 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJC" >&6; }
33355 else
33356   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33357 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33358 fi
33359 
33360 
33361   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC" && break
33362 done
33363 
33364   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJC" = x; then
33365     OBJC="gcc"
33366   else
33367     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
33368 yes:)
33369 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
33370 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
33371 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
33372 esac
33373     OBJC=$ac_ct_OBJC
33374   fi
33375 fi
33376 
33377 # Provide some information about the compiler.
33378 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Objective C compiler version" >&5
33379 set X $ac_compile
33380 ac_compiler=$2
33381 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
33382   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
33383 case "(($ac_try" in
33384   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
33385   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
33386 esac
33387 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
33388 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
33389   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
33390   ac_status=$?
33391   if test -s conftest.err; then
33392     sed '10a\
33393 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
33394          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
33395     cat conftest.er1 >&5
33396   fi
33397   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
33398   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
33399   test $ac_status = 0; }
33400 done
33401 
33402 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU Objective C compiler" >&5
33403 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU Objective C compiler... " >&6; }
33404 if ${ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
33405   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33406 else
33407   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33408 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33409 
33410 int
33411 main ()
33412 {
33413 #ifndef __GNUC__
33414        choke me
33415 #endif
33416 
33417   ;
33418   return 0;
33419 }
33420 _ACEOF
33421 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33422   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
33423 else
33424   ac_compiler_gnu=no
33425 fi
33426 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33427 ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
33428 
33429 fi
33430 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu" >&5
33431 $as_echo "$ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
33432 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
33433   GOBJC=yes
33434 else
33435   GOBJC=
33436 fi
33437 ac_test_OBJCFLAGS=${OBJCFLAGS+set}
33438 ac_save_OBJCFLAGS=$OBJCFLAGS
33439 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $OBJC accepts -g" >&5
33440 $as_echo_n "checking whether $OBJC accepts -g... " >&6; }
33441 if ${ac_cv_prog_objc_g+:} false; then :
33442   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33443 else
33444   ac_save_objc_werror_flag=$ac_objc_werror_flag
33445    ac_objc_werror_flag=yes
33446    ac_cv_prog_objc_g=no
33447    OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33448    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33449 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33450 
33451 int
33452 main ()
33453 {
33454 
33455   ;
33456   return 0;
33457 }
33458 _ACEOF
33459 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33460   ac_cv_prog_objc_g=yes
33461 else
33462   OBJCFLAGS=""
33463       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33464 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33465 
33466 int
33467 main ()
33468 {
33469 
33470   ;
33471   return 0;
33472 }
33473 _ACEOF
33474 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33475 
33476 else
33477   ac_objc_werror_flag=$ac_save_objc_werror_flag
33478          OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33479          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33480 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33481 
33482 int
33483 main ()
33484 {
33485 
33486   ;
33487   return 0;
33488 }
33489 _ACEOF
33490 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33491   ac_cv_prog_objc_g=yes
33492 fi
33493 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33494 fi
33495 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33496 fi
33497 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33498    ac_objc_werror_flag=$ac_save_objc_werror_flag
33499 fi
33500 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_objc_g" >&5
33501 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_objc_g" >&6; }
33502 if test "$ac_test_OBJCFLAGS" = set; then
33503   OBJCFLAGS=$ac_save_OBJCFLAGS
33504 elif test $ac_cv_prog_objc_g = yes; then
33505   if test "$GOBJC" = yes; then
33506     OBJCFLAGS="-g -O2"
33507   else
33508     OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33509   fi
33510 else
33511   if test "$GOBJC" = yes; then
33512     OBJCFLAGS="-O2"
33513   else
33514     OBJCFLAGS=
33515   fi
33516 fi
33517 ac_ext=cpp
33518 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
33519 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
33520 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
33521 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
33522 
33523 
33524   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33525 
33526   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33527   # space.
33528   complete="$OBJC"
33529   path="${complete%% *}"
33530   tmp="$complete EOL"
33531   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33532 
33533   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33534   # unix format.
33535   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33536 
33537   # Now try to locate executable using which
33538   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33539   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33540   # to not find them
33541   if test "x$new_path" = x \
33542       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33543       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33544     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33545   fi
33546   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33547     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33548     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33549     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33550     # argument.
33551     path="$complete"
33552     arguments="EOL"
33553     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33554     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33555     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33556     # to not find them
33557     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33558         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33559         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33560       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33561     fi
33562     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33563       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33564       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33565 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33566       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33567       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33568         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33569 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33570       fi
33571       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33572     fi
33573   fi
33574 
33575   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
33576   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
33577   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
33578   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
33579   #
33580   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
33581   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
33582   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33583   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
33584     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
33585     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
33586     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
33587       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
33588     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
33589       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
33590     else
33591       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
33592 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
33593       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
33594 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
33595       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33596     fi
33597   else
33598     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
33599   fi
33600 
33601   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
33602   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
33603   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33604 
33605   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33606   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33607   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33608   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33609   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33610   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
33611   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33612     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33613     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
33614     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33615     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
33616       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
33617       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
33618       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33619       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
33620       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33621       new_path="$input_path"
33622     fi
33623   fi
33624 
33625   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
33626   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
33627     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
33628     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
33629       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
33630       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
33631       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
33632     fi
33633   fi
33634 
33635   # remove trailing .exe if any
33636   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33637 
33638   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33639 
33640   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33641   # space.
33642   complete="$OBJC"
33643   path="${complete%% *}"
33644   tmp="$complete EOL"
33645   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33646 
33647   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33648   # unix format.
33649   new_path="$path"
33650 
33651   windows_path="$new_path"
33652   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33653     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33654     new_path="$unix_path"
33655   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33656     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33657     new_path="$unix_path"
33658   fi
33659 
33660 
33661   # Now try to locate executable using which
33662   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33663 
33664   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33665     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33666     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33667     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33668     # argument.
33669     path="$complete"
33670     arguments="EOL"
33671     new_path="$path"
33672 
33673   windows_path="$new_path"
33674   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33675     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33676     new_path="$unix_path"
33677   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33678     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33679     new_path="$unix_path"
33680   fi
33681 
33682 
33683     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33684     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
33685     # to not find them
33686     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33687         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33688         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33689       new_path="$path"
33690 
33691   windows_path="$new_path"
33692   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33693     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33694     new_path="$unix_path"
33695   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33696     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33697     new_path="$unix_path"
33698   fi
33699 
33700     fi
33701 
33702     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33703       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33704       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33705 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33706       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33707       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33708         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33709 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33710       fi
33711       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33712     fi
33713   fi
33714 
33715   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
33716   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
33717     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
33718     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33719     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
33720   else
33721     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
33722     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
33723 
33724   input_path="$new_path"
33725   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33726   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33727   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33728   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33729   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
33730   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33731     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33732     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33733   fi
33734 
33735     # Output is in $new_path
33736 
33737   windows_path="$new_path"
33738   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33739     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33740     new_path="$unix_path"
33741   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33742     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33743     new_path="$unix_path"
33744   fi
33745 
33746     # remove trailing .exe if any
33747     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33748 
33749     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
33750     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
33751   fi
33752 
33753   else
33754     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
33755     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33756     # space.
33757     complete="$OBJC"
33758     path="${complete%% *}"
33759     tmp="$complete EOL"
33760     arguments="${tmp#* }"
33761 
33762     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
33763     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
33764     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
33765       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
33766       IFS_save="$IFS"
33767       IFS=:
33768       for p in $PATH; do
33769         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
33770           new_path="$p/$path"
33771           break
33772         fi
33773       done
33774       IFS="$IFS_save"
33775     else
33776       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
33777       new_path="$path"
33778     fi
33779 
33780     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33781       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33782 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33783       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33784       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33785         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
33786 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33787       fi
33788       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33789     fi
33790   fi
33791 
33792   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
33793   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
33794     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
33795   else
33796     new_complete="$new_path"
33797   fi
33798 
33799   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
33800     OBJC="$new_complete"
33801     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
33802 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
33803   fi
33804 
33805 
33806 
33807   # Publish this variable in the help.
33808 
33809 
33810   if test "x$LIPO" = x; then
33811     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
33812     for ac_prog in lipo
33813 do
33814   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33815 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33816 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33817 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33818 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33819   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33820 else
33821   case $LIPO in
33822   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33823   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33824   ;;
33825   *)
33826   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33827 for as_dir in $PATH
33828 do
33829   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33830   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33831     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33832   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33833     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33834     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33835     break 2
33836   fi
33837 done
33838   done
33839 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33840 
33841   ;;
33842 esac
33843 fi
33844 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33845 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33846   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33847 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33848 else
33849   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33850 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33851 fi
33852 
33853 
33854   test -n "$LIPO" && break
33855 done
33856 
33857   else
33858     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
33859 
33860     # Try to remove the string !LIPO! from our list.
33861     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!LIPO!/}
33862     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
33863       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
33864       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
33865       if test "xLIPO" != xBASH; then
33866         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of LIPO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
33867 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of LIPO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
33868       fi
33869       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
33870       for ac_prog in lipo
33871 do
33872   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33873 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33874 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33875 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33876 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33877   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33878 else
33879   case $LIPO in
33880   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33881   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33882   ;;
33883   *)
33884   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33885 for as_dir in $PATH
33886 do
33887   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33888   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33889     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33890   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33891     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33892     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33893     break 2
33894   fi
33895 done
33896   done
33897 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33898 
33899   ;;
33900 esac
33901 fi
33902 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33903 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33904   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33905 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33906 else
33907   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33908 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33909 fi
33910 
33911 
33912   test -n "$LIPO" && break
33913 done
33914 
33915     else
33916       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
33917       # for the tool.
33918 
33919       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
33920       # for unknown variables in the end.
33921       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
33922 
33923       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
33924       tool_specified="$LIPO"
33925       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
33926       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
33927         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
33928         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_basename" >&5
33929 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_basename" >&6;}
33930         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
33931 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
33932 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33933 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33934 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33935   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33936 else
33937   case $LIPO in
33938   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33939   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33940   ;;
33941   *)
33942   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33943 for as_dir in $PATH
33944 do
33945   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33946   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33947     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33948   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33949     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33950     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33951     break 2
33952   fi
33953 done
33954   done
33955 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33956 
33957   ;;
33958 esac
33959 fi
33960 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33961 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33962   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33963 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33964 else
33965   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33966 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33967 fi
33968 
33969 
33970         if test "x$LIPO" = x; then
33971           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
33972         fi
33973       else
33974         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
33975         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified" >&5
33976 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified" >&6;}
33977         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LIPO" >&5
33978 $as_echo_n "checking for LIPO... " >&6; }
33979         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
33980           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
33981 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
33982           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
33983         fi
33984         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
33985 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
33986       fi
33987     fi
33988   fi
33989 
33990 
33991 
33992   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33993 
33994   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33995   # space.
33996   complete="$LIPO"
33997   path="${complete%% *}"
33998   tmp="$complete EOL"
33999   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34000 
34001   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34002   # unix format.
34003   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34004 
34005   # Now try to locate executable using which
34006   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34007   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34008   # to not find them
34009   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34010       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34011       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34012     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34013   fi
34014   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34015     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34016     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34017     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34018     # argument.
34019     path="$complete"
34020     arguments="EOL"
34021     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34022     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34023     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34024     # to not find them
34025     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34026         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34027         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34028       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34029     fi
34030     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34031       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34032       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34033 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34034       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34035       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34036         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34037 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34038       fi
34039       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34040     fi
34041   fi
34042 
34043   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34044   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34045   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34046   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34047   #
34048   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34049   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34050   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34051   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34052     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34053     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34054     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34055       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34056     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34057       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34058     else
34059       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34060 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34061       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34062 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34063       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34064     fi
34065   else
34066     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34067   fi
34068 
34069   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34070   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34071   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34072 
34073   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34074   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34075   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34076   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34077   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34078   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34079   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34080     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34081     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34082     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34083     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34084       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34085       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34086       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34087       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34088       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34089       new_path="$input_path"
34090     fi
34091   fi
34092 
34093   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34094   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34095     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34096     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34097       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34098       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34099       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34100     fi
34101   fi
34102 
34103   # remove trailing .exe if any
34104   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34105 
34106   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34107 
34108   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34109   # space.
34110   complete="$LIPO"
34111   path="${complete%% *}"
34112   tmp="$complete EOL"
34113   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34114 
34115   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34116   # unix format.
34117   new_path="$path"
34118 
34119   windows_path="$new_path"
34120   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34121     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34122     new_path="$unix_path"
34123   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34124     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34125     new_path="$unix_path"
34126   fi
34127 
34128 
34129   # Now try to locate executable using which
34130   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34131 
34132   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34133     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34134     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34135     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34136     # argument.
34137     path="$complete"
34138     arguments="EOL"
34139     new_path="$path"
34140 
34141   windows_path="$new_path"
34142   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34143     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34144     new_path="$unix_path"
34145   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34146     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34147     new_path="$unix_path"
34148   fi
34149 
34150 
34151     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34152     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34153     # to not find them
34154     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34155         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34156         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34157       new_path="$path"
34158 
34159   windows_path="$new_path"
34160   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34161     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34162     new_path="$unix_path"
34163   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34164     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34165     new_path="$unix_path"
34166   fi
34167 
34168     fi
34169 
34170     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34171       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34172       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34173 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34174       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34175       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34176         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34177 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34178       fi
34179       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34180     fi
34181   fi
34182 
34183   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34184   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34185     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34186     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34187     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34188   else
34189     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34190     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34191 
34192   input_path="$new_path"
34193   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34194   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34195   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34196   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34197   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34198   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34199     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34200     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34201   fi
34202 
34203     # Output is in $new_path
34204 
34205   windows_path="$new_path"
34206   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34207     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34208     new_path="$unix_path"
34209   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34210     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34211     new_path="$unix_path"
34212   fi
34213 
34214     # remove trailing .exe if any
34215     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34216 
34217     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34218     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34219   fi
34220 
34221   else
34222     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34223     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34224     # space.
34225     complete="$LIPO"
34226     path="${complete%% *}"
34227     tmp="$complete EOL"
34228     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34229 
34230     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34231     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34232     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34233       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34234       IFS_save="$IFS"
34235       IFS=:
34236       for p in $PATH; do
34237         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34238           new_path="$p/$path"
34239           break
34240         fi
34241       done
34242       IFS="$IFS_save"
34243     else
34244       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34245       new_path="$path"
34246     fi
34247 
34248     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34249       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34250 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34251       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34252       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34253         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34254 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34255       fi
34256       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34257     fi
34258   fi
34259 
34260   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34261   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34262     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34263   else
34264     new_complete="$new_path"
34265   fi
34266 
34267   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34268     LIPO="$new_complete"
34269     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting LIPO to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34270 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting LIPO to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34271   fi
34272 
34273   else
34274     OBJC=
34275   fi
34276 
34277   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
34278     # Extract the first word of "mt", so it can be a program name with args.
34279 set dummy mt; ac_word=$2
34280 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34281 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34282 if ${ac_cv_prog_MT+:} false; then :
34283   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34284 else
34285   if test -n "$MT"; then
34286   ac_cv_prog_MT="$MT" # Let the user override the test.
34287 else
34288   ac_prog_rejected=no
34289 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34290 for as_dir in $PATH
34291 do
34292   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34293   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34294     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34295   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34296     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "/usr/bin/mt"; then
34297        ac_prog_rejected=yes
34298        continue
34299      fi
34300     ac_cv_prog_MT="mt"
34301     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34302     break 2
34303   fi
34304 done
34305   done
34306 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34307 
34308 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
34309   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
34310   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_MT
34311   shift
34312   if test $# != 0; then
34313     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
34314     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
34315     # first if we set MT to just the basename; use the full file name.
34316     shift
34317     ac_cv_prog_MT="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
34318   fi
34319 fi
34320 fi
34321 fi
34322 MT=$ac_cv_prog_MT
34323 if test -n "$MT"; then
34324   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MT" >&5
34325 $as_echo "$MT" >&6; }
34326 else
34327   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34328 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34329 fi
34330 
34331 
34332 
34333   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34334 
34335   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34336   # space.
34337   complete="$MT"
34338   path="${complete%% *}"
34339   tmp="$complete EOL"
34340   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34341 
34342   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34343   # unix format.
34344   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34345 
34346   # Now try to locate executable using which
34347   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34348   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34349   # to not find them
34350   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34351       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34352       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34353     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34354   fi
34355   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34356     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34357     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34358     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34359     # argument.
34360     path="$complete"
34361     arguments="EOL"
34362     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34363     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34364     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34365     # to not find them
34366     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34367         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34368         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34369       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34370     fi
34371     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34372       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34373       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34374 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34375       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34376       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34377         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34378 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34379       fi
34380       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34381     fi
34382   fi
34383 
34384   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34385   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34386   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34387   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34388   #
34389   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34390   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34391   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34392   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34393     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34394     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34395     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34396       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34397     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34398       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34399     else
34400       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34401 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34402       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34403 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34404       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34405     fi
34406   else
34407     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34408   fi
34409 
34410   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34411   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34412   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34413 
34414   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34415   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34416   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34417   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34418   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34419   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34420   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34421     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34422     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34423     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34424     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34425       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34426       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34427       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34428       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34429       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34430       new_path="$input_path"
34431     fi
34432   fi
34433 
34434   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34435   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34436     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34437     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34438       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34439       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34440       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34441     fi
34442   fi
34443 
34444   # remove trailing .exe if any
34445   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34446 
34447   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34448 
34449   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34450   # space.
34451   complete="$MT"
34452   path="${complete%% *}"
34453   tmp="$complete EOL"
34454   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34455 
34456   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34457   # unix format.
34458   new_path="$path"
34459 
34460   windows_path="$new_path"
34461   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34462     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34463     new_path="$unix_path"
34464   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34465     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34466     new_path="$unix_path"
34467   fi
34468 
34469 
34470   # Now try to locate executable using which
34471   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34472 
34473   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34474     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34475     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34476     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34477     # argument.
34478     path="$complete"
34479     arguments="EOL"
34480     new_path="$path"
34481 
34482   windows_path="$new_path"
34483   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34484     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34485     new_path="$unix_path"
34486   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34487     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34488     new_path="$unix_path"
34489   fi
34490 
34491 
34492     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34493     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34494     # to not find them
34495     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34496         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34497         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34498       new_path="$path"
34499 
34500   windows_path="$new_path"
34501   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34502     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34503     new_path="$unix_path"
34504   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34505     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34506     new_path="$unix_path"
34507   fi
34508 
34509     fi
34510 
34511     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34512       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34513       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34514 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34515       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34516       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34517         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34518 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34519       fi
34520       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34521     fi
34522   fi
34523 
34524   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34525   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34526     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34527     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34528     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34529   else
34530     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34531     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34532 
34533   input_path="$new_path"
34534   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34535   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34536   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34537   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34538   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34539   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34540     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34541     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34542   fi
34543 
34544     # Output is in $new_path
34545 
34546   windows_path="$new_path"
34547   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34548     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34549     new_path="$unix_path"
34550   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34551     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34552     new_path="$unix_path"
34553   fi
34554 
34555     # remove trailing .exe if any
34556     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34557 
34558     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34559     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34560   fi
34561 
34562   else
34563     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34564     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34565     # space.
34566     complete="$MT"
34567     path="${complete%% *}"
34568     tmp="$complete EOL"
34569     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34570 
34571     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34572     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34573     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34574       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34575       IFS_save="$IFS"
34576       IFS=:
34577       for p in $PATH; do
34578         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34579           new_path="$p/$path"
34580           break
34581         fi
34582       done
34583       IFS="$IFS_save"
34584     else
34585       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34586       new_path="$path"
34587     fi
34588 
34589     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34590       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34591 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34592       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34593       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34594         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34595 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34596       fi
34597       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34598     fi
34599   fi
34600 
34601   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34602   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34603     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34604   else
34605     new_complete="$new_path"
34606   fi
34607 
34608   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34609     MT="$new_complete"
34610     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MT to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34611 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MT to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34612   fi
34613 
34614     # Setup the resource compiler (RC)
34615     # Extract the first word of "rc", so it can be a program name with args.
34616 set dummy rc; ac_word=$2
34617 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34618 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34619 if ${ac_cv_prog_RC+:} false; then :
34620   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34621 else
34622   if test -n "$RC"; then
34623   ac_cv_prog_RC="$RC" # Let the user override the test.
34624 else
34625   ac_prog_rejected=no
34626 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34627 for as_dir in $PATH
34628 do
34629   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34630   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34631     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34632   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34633     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "/usr/bin/rc"; then
34634        ac_prog_rejected=yes
34635        continue
34636      fi
34637     ac_cv_prog_RC="rc"
34638     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34639     break 2
34640   fi
34641 done
34642   done
34643 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34644 
34645 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
34646   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
34647   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_RC
34648   shift
34649   if test $# != 0; then
34650     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
34651     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
34652     # first if we set RC to just the basename; use the full file name.
34653     shift
34654     ac_cv_prog_RC="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
34655   fi
34656 fi
34657 fi
34658 fi
34659 RC=$ac_cv_prog_RC
34660 if test -n "$RC"; then
34661   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $RC" >&5
34662 $as_echo "$RC" >&6; }
34663 else
34664   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34665 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34666 fi
34667 
34668 
34669 
34670   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34671 
34672   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34673   # space.
34674   complete="$RC"
34675   path="${complete%% *}"
34676   tmp="$complete EOL"
34677   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34678 
34679   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34680   # unix format.
34681   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34682 
34683   # Now try to locate executable using which
34684   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34685   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34686   # to not find them
34687   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34688       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34689       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34690     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34691   fi
34692   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34693     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34694     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34695     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34696     # argument.
34697     path="$complete"
34698     arguments="EOL"
34699     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34700     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34701     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34702     # to not find them
34703     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34704         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34705         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34706       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34707     fi
34708     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34709       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34710       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34711 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34712       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34713       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34714         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34715 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34716       fi
34717       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34718     fi
34719   fi
34720 
34721   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34722   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34723   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34724   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34725   #
34726   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34727   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34728   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34729   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34730     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34731     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34732     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34733       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34734     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34735       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34736     else
34737       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34738 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34739       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34740 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34741       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34742     fi
34743   else
34744     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34745   fi
34746 
34747   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34748   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34749   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34750 
34751   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34752   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34753   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34754   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34755   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34756   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34757   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34758     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34759     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34760     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34761     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34762       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34763       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34764       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34765       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34766       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34767       new_path="$input_path"
34768     fi
34769   fi
34770 
34771   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34772   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34773     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34774     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34775       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34776       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34777       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34778     fi
34779   fi
34780 
34781   # remove trailing .exe if any
34782   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34783 
34784   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34785 
34786   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34787   # space.
34788   complete="$RC"
34789   path="${complete%% *}"
34790   tmp="$complete EOL"
34791   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34792 
34793   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34794   # unix format.
34795   new_path="$path"
34796 
34797   windows_path="$new_path"
34798   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34799     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34800     new_path="$unix_path"
34801   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34802     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34803     new_path="$unix_path"
34804   fi
34805 
34806 
34807   # Now try to locate executable using which
34808   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34809 
34810   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34811     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34812     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34813     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34814     # argument.
34815     path="$complete"
34816     arguments="EOL"
34817     new_path="$path"
34818 
34819   windows_path="$new_path"
34820   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34821     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34822     new_path="$unix_path"
34823   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34824     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34825     new_path="$unix_path"
34826   fi
34827 
34828 
34829     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34830     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34831     # to not find them
34832     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34833         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34834         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34835       new_path="$path"
34836 
34837   windows_path="$new_path"
34838   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34839     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34840     new_path="$unix_path"
34841   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34842     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34843     new_path="$unix_path"
34844   fi
34845 
34846     fi
34847 
34848     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34849       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34850       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34851 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34852       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34853       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34854         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34855 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34856       fi
34857       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34858     fi
34859   fi
34860 
34861   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34862   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34863     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34864     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34865     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34866   else
34867     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34868     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34869 
34870   input_path="$new_path"
34871   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34872   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34873   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34874   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34875   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34876   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34877     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34878     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34879   fi
34880 
34881     # Output is in $new_path
34882 
34883   windows_path="$new_path"
34884   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34885     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34886     new_path="$unix_path"
34887   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34888     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34889     new_path="$unix_path"
34890   fi
34891 
34892     # remove trailing .exe if any
34893     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34894 
34895     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34896     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34897   fi
34898 
34899   else
34900     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34901     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34902     # space.
34903     complete="$RC"
34904     path="${complete%% *}"
34905     tmp="$complete EOL"
34906     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34907 
34908     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34909     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34910     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34911       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34912       IFS_save="$IFS"
34913       IFS=:
34914       for p in $PATH; do
34915         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34916           new_path="$p/$path"
34917           break
34918         fi
34919       done
34920       IFS="$IFS_save"
34921     else
34922       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34923       new_path="$path"
