34924     fi
34925 
34926     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34927       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34928 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34929       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34930       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34931         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34932 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34933       fi
34934       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34935     fi
34936   fi
34937 
34938   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34939   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34940     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34941   else
34942     new_complete="$new_path"
34943   fi
34944 
34945   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34946     RC="$new_complete"
34947     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting RC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34948 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting RC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34949   fi
34950 
34951     # Extract the first word of "dumpbin", so it can be a program name with args.
34952 set dummy dumpbin; ac_word=$2
34953 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34954 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34955 if ${ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN+:} false; then :
34956   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34957 else
34958   if test -n "$DUMPBIN"; then
34959   ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN="$DUMPBIN" # Let the user override the test.
34960 else
34961 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34962 for as_dir in $PATH
34963 do
34964   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34965   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34966     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34967   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34968     ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN="dumpbin"
34969     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34970     break 2
34971   fi
34972 done
34973   done
34974 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34975 
34976 fi
34977 fi
34978 DUMPBIN=$ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN
34979 if test -n "$DUMPBIN"; then
34980   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DUMPBIN" >&5
34981 $as_echo "$DUMPBIN" >&6; }
34982 else
34983   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34984 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34985 fi
34986 
34987 
34988 
34989   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34990 
34991   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34992   # space.
34993   complete="$DUMPBIN"
34994   path="${complete%% *}"
34995   tmp="$complete EOL"
34996   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34997 
34998   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34999   # unix format.
35000   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35001 
35002   # Now try to locate executable using which
35003   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35004   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35005   # to not find them
35006   if test "x$new_path" = x \
35007       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35008       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35009     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35010   fi
35011   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35012     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35013     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35014     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35015     # argument.
35016     path="$complete"
35017     arguments="EOL"
35018     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35019     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35020     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35021     # to not find them
35022     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35023         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35024         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35025       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35026     fi
35027     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35028       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35029       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35030 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35031       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35032       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35033         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35034 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35035       fi
35036       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35037     fi
35038   fi
35039 
35040   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
35041   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
35042   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
35043   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
35044   #
35045   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
35046   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
35047   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35048   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
35049     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
35050     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
35051     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
35052       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
35053     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
35054       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
35055     else
35056       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
35057 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
35058       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
35059 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
35060       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35061     fi
35062   else
35063     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
35064   fi
35065 
35066   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
35067   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
35068   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35069 
35070   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35071   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35072   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35073   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35074   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35075   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
35076   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35077     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35078     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
35079     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35080     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
35081       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
35082       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
35083       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35084       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
35085       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35086       new_path="$input_path"
35087     fi
35088   fi
35089 
35090   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
35091   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
35092     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
35093     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
35094       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
35095       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
35096       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
35097     fi
35098   fi
35099 
35100   # remove trailing .exe if any
35101   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35102 
35103   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35104 
35105   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35106   # space.
35107   complete="$DUMPBIN"
35108   path="${complete%% *}"
35109   tmp="$complete EOL"
35110   arguments="${tmp#* }"
35111 
35112   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
35113   # unix format.
35114   new_path="$path"
35115 
35116   windows_path="$new_path"
35117   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35118     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35119     new_path="$unix_path"
35120   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35121     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35122     new_path="$unix_path"
35123   fi
35124 
35125 
35126   # Now try to locate executable using which
35127   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35128 
35129   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35130     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35131     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35132     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35133     # argument.
35134     path="$complete"
35135     arguments="EOL"
35136     new_path="$path"
35137 
35138   windows_path="$new_path"
35139   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35140     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35141     new_path="$unix_path"
35142   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35143     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35144     new_path="$unix_path"
35145   fi
35146 
35147 
35148     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35149     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
35150     # to not find them
35151     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35152         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35153         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35154       new_path="$path"
35155 
35156   windows_path="$new_path"
35157   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35158     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35159     new_path="$unix_path"
35160   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35161     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35162     new_path="$unix_path"
35163   fi
35164 
35165     fi
35166 
35167     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35168       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35169       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35170 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35171       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35172       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35173         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35174 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35175       fi
35176       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35177     fi
35178   fi
35179 
35180   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
35181   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
35182     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
35183     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35184     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
35185   else
35186     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
35187     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
35188 
35189   input_path="$new_path"
35190   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35191   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35192   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35193   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35194   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
35195   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35196     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35197     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35198   fi
35199 
35200     # Output is in $new_path
35201 
35202   windows_path="$new_path"
35203   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35204     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35205     new_path="$unix_path"
35206   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35207     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35208     new_path="$unix_path"
35209   fi
35210 
35211     # remove trailing .exe if any
35212     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35213 
35214     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
35215     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
35216   fi
35217 
35218   else
35219     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
35220     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35221     # space.
35222     complete="$DUMPBIN"
35223     path="${complete%% *}"
35224     tmp="$complete EOL"
35225     arguments="${tmp#* }"
35226 
35227     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
35228     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
35229     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
35230       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
35231       IFS_save="$IFS"
35232       IFS=:
35233       for p in $PATH; do
35234         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
35235           new_path="$p/$path"
35236           break
35237         fi
35238       done
35239       IFS="$IFS_save"
35240     else
35241       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
35242       new_path="$path"
35243     fi
35244 
35245     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35246       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35247 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35248       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35249       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35250         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
35251 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35252       fi
35253       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35254     fi
35255   fi
35256 
35257   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
35258   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
35259     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
35260   else
35261     new_complete="$new_path"
35262   fi
35263 
35264   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
35265     DUMPBIN="$new_complete"
35266     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting DUMPBIN to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
35267 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting DUMPBIN to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
35268   fi
35269 
35270     # We need to check for 'msbuild.exe' because at the place where we expect to
35271     # find 'msbuild.exe' there's also a directory called 'msbuild' and configure
35272     # won't find the 'msbuild.exe' executable in that case (and the
35273     # 'ac_executable_extensions' is unusable due to performance reasons).
35274     # Notice that we intentionally don't fix up the path to MSBUILD because we
35275     # will call it in a DOS shell during freetype detection on Windows (see
35276     # 'LIB_SETUP_FREETYPE' in "libraries.m4"
35277     # Extract the first word of "msbuild.exe", so it can be a program name with args.
35278 set dummy msbuild.exe; ac_word=$2
35279 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35280 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35281 if ${ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD+:} false; then :
35282   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35283 else
35284   if test -n "$MSBUILD"; then
35285   ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD="$MSBUILD" # Let the user override the test.
35286 else
35287 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35288 for as_dir in $PATH
35289 do
35290   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35291   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35292     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35293   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35294     ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD="msbuild.exe"
35295     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35296     break 2
35297   fi
35298 done
35299   done
35300 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35301 
35302 fi
35303 fi
35304 MSBUILD=$ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD
35305 if test -n "$MSBUILD"; then
35306   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSBUILD" >&5
35307 $as_echo "$MSBUILD" >&6; }
35308 else
35309   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35310 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35311 fi
35312 
35313 
35314   fi
35315 
35316   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
35317 
35318 
35319   # Publish this variable in the help.
35320 
35321 
35322   if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
35323     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
35324     for ac_prog in strip
35325 do
35326   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35327 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35328 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35329 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35330 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
35331   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35332 else
35333   case $STRIP in
35334   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35335   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35336   ;;
35337   *)
35338   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35339 for as_dir in $PATH
35340 do
35341   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35342   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35343     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35344   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35345     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35346     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35347     break 2
35348   fi
35349 done
35350   done
35351 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35352 
35353   ;;
35354 esac
35355 fi
35356 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
35357 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
35358   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
35359 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
35360 else
35361   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35362 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35363 fi
35364 
35365 
35366   test -n "$STRIP" && break
35367 done
35368 
35369   else
35370     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
35371 
35372     # Try to remove the string !STRIP! from our list.
35373     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!STRIP!/}
35374     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
35375       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
35376       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
35377       if test "xSTRIP" != xBASH; then
35378         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
35379 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
35380       fi
35381       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
35382       for ac_prog in strip
35383 do
35384   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35385 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35386 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35387 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35388 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
35389   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35390 else
35391   case $STRIP in
35392   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35393   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35394   ;;
35395   *)
35396   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35397 for as_dir in $PATH
35398 do
35399   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35400   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35401     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35402   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35403     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35404     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35405     break 2
35406   fi
35407 done
35408   done
35409 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35410 
35411   ;;
35412 esac
35413 fi
35414 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
35415 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
35416   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
35417 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
35418 else
35419   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35420 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35421 fi
35422 
35423 
35424   test -n "$STRIP" && break
35425 done
35426 
35427     else
35428       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
35429       # for the tool.
35430 
35431       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
35432       # for unknown variables in the end.
35433       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
35434 
35435       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
35436       tool_specified="$STRIP"
35437       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
35438       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
35439         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
35440         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&5
35441 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
35442         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
35443 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
35444 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35445 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35446 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
35447   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35448 else
35449   case $STRIP in
35450   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35451   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35452   ;;
35453   *)
35454   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35455 for as_dir in $PATH
35456 do
35457   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35458   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35459     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35460   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35461     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35462     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35463     break 2
35464   fi
35465 done
35466   done
35467 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35468 
35469   ;;
35470 esac
35471 fi
35472 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
35473 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
35474   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
35475 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
35476 else
35477   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35478 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35479 fi
35480 
35481 
35482         if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
35483           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
35484         fi
35485       else
35486         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
35487         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&5
35488 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
35489         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for STRIP" >&5
35490 $as_echo_n "checking for STRIP... " >&6; }
35491         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
35492           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
35493 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
35494           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
35495         fi
35496         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
35497 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
35498       fi
35499     fi
35500   fi
35501 
35502 
35503 
35504   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35505 
35506   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35507   # space.
35508   complete="$STRIP"
35509   path="${complete%% *}"
35510   tmp="$complete EOL"
35511   arguments="${tmp#* }"
35512 
35513   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
35514   # unix format.
35515   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35516 
35517   # Now try to locate executable using which
35518   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35519   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35520   # to not find them
35521   if test "x$new_path" = x \
35522       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35523       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35524     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35525   fi
35526   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35527     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35528     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35529     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35530     # argument.
35531     path="$complete"
35532     arguments="EOL"
35533     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35534     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35535     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35536     # to not find them
35537     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35538         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35539         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35540       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35541     fi
35542     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35543       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35544       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35545 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35546       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35547       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35548         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35549 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35550       fi
35551       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
35552     fi
35553   fi
35554 
35555   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
35556   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
35557   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
35558   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
35559   #
35560   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
35561   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
35562   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35563   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
35564     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
35565     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
35566     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
35567       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
35568     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
35569       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
35570     else
35571       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
35572 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
35573       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
35574 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
35575       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
35576     fi
35577   else
35578     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
35579   fi
35580 
35581   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
35582   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
35583   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35584 
35585   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35586   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35587   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35588   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35589   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35590   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
35591   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35592     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35593     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
35594     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35595     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
35596       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
35597       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
35598       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35599       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
35600       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35601       new_path="$input_path"
35602     fi
35603   fi
35604 
35605   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
35606   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
35607     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
35608     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
35609       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
35610       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
35611       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
35612     fi
35613   fi
35614 
35615   # remove trailing .exe if any
35616   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35617 
35618   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35619 
35620   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35621   # space.
35622   complete="$STRIP"
35623   path="${complete%% *}"
35624   tmp="$complete EOL"
35625   arguments="${tmp#* }"
35626 
35627   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
35628   # unix format.
35629   new_path="$path"
35630 
35631   windows_path="$new_path"
35632   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35633     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35634     new_path="$unix_path"
35635   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35636     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35637     new_path="$unix_path"
35638   fi
35639 
35640 
35641   # Now try to locate executable using which
35642   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35643 
35644   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35645     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35646     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35647     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35648     # argument.
35649     path="$complete"
35650     arguments="EOL"
35651     new_path="$path"
35652 
35653   windows_path="$new_path"
35654   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35655     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35656     new_path="$unix_path"
35657   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35658     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35659     new_path="$unix_path"
35660   fi
35661 
35662 
35663     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35664     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
35665     # to not find them
35666     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35667         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35668         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35669       new_path="$path"
35670 
35671   windows_path="$new_path"
35672   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35673     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35674     new_path="$unix_path"
35675   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35676     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35677     new_path="$unix_path"
35678   fi
35679 
35680     fi
35681 
35682     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35683       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35684       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35685 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35686       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35687       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35688         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35689 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35690       fi
35691       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
35692     fi
35693   fi
35694 
35695   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
35696   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
35697     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
35698     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35699     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
35700   else
35701     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
35702     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
35703 
35704   input_path="$new_path"
35705   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35706   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35707   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35708   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35709   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
35710   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35711     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35712     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35713   fi
35714 
35715     # Output is in $new_path
35716 
35717   windows_path="$new_path"
35718   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35719     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35720     new_path="$unix_path"
35721   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35722     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35723     new_path="$unix_path"
35724   fi
35725 
35726     # remove trailing .exe if any
35727     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35728 
35729     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
35730     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
35731   fi
35732 
35733   else
35734     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
35735     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35736     # space.
35737     complete="$STRIP"
35738     path="${complete%% *}"
35739     tmp="$complete EOL"
35740     arguments="${tmp#* }"
35741 
35742     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
35743     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
35744     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
35745       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
35746       IFS_save="$IFS"
35747       IFS=:
35748       for p in $PATH; do
35749         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
35750           new_path="$p/$path"
35751           break
35752         fi
35753       done
35754       IFS="$IFS_save"
35755     else
35756       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
35757       new_path="$path"
35758     fi
35759 
35760     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35761       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35762 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35763       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35764       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35765         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
35766 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35767       fi
35768       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
35769     fi
35770   fi
35771 
35772   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
35773   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
35774     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
35775   else
35776     new_complete="$new_path"
35777   fi
35778 
35779   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
35780     STRIP="$new_complete"
35781     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
35782 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
35783   fi
35784 
35785 
35786 
35787   # Publish this variable in the help.
35788 
35789 
35790   if test "x$NM" = x; then
35791     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
35792     for ac_prog in nm
35793 do
35794   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35795 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35796 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35797 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35798 if ${ac_cv_path_NM+:} false; then :
35799   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35800 else
35801   case $NM in
35802   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35803   ac_cv_path_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35804   ;;
35805   *)
35806   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35807 for as_dir in $PATH
35808 do
35809   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35810   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35811     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35812   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35813     ac_cv_path_NM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35814     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35815     break 2
35816   fi
35817 done
35818   done
35819 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35820 
35821   ;;
35822 esac
35823 fi
35824 NM=$ac_cv_path_NM
35825 if test -n "$NM"; then
35826   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
35827 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
35828 else
35829   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35830 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35831 fi
35832 
35833 
35834   test -n "$NM" && break
35835 done
35836 
35837   else
35838     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
35839 
35840     # Try to remove the string !NM! from our list.
35841     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!NM!/}
35842     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
35843       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
35844       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
35845       if test "xNM" != xBASH; then
35846         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
35847 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
35848       fi
35849       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
35850       for ac_prog in nm
35851 do
35852   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35853 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35854 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35855 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35856 if ${ac_cv_path_NM+:} false; then :
35857   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35858 else
35859   case $NM in
35860   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35861   ac_cv_path_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35862   ;;
35863   *)
35864   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35865 for as_dir in $PATH
35866 do
35867   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35868   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35869     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35870   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35871     ac_cv_path_NM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35872     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35873     break 2
35874   fi
35875 done
35876   done
35877 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35878 
35879   ;;
35880 esac
35881 fi
35882 NM=$ac_cv_path_NM
35883 if test -n "$NM"; then
35884   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
35885 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
35886 else
35887   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35888 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35889 fi
35890 
35891 
35892   test -n "$NM" && break
35893 done
35894 
35895     else
35896       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
35897       # for the tool.
35898 
35899       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
35900       # for unknown variables in the end.
35901       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
35902 
35903       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
35904       tool_specified="$NM"
35905       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
35906       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
35907         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
35908         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&5
35909 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
35910         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
35911 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
35912 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35913 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35914 if ${ac_cv_path_NM+:} false; then :
35915   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35916 else
35917   case $NM in
35918   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35919   ac_cv_path_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35920   ;;
35921   *)
35922   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35923 for as_dir in $PATH
35924 do
35925   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35926   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35927     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35928   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35929     ac_cv_path_NM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35930     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35931     break 2
35932   fi
35933 done
35934   done
35935 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35936 
35937   ;;
35938 esac
35939 fi
35940 NM=$ac_cv_path_NM
35941 if test -n "$NM"; then
35942   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
35943 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
35944 else
35945   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35946 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35947 fi
35948 
35949 
35950         if test "x$NM" = x; then
35951           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
35952         fi
35953       else
35954         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
35955         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&5
35956 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
35957         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for NM" >&5
35958 $as_echo_n "checking for NM... " >&6; }
35959         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
35960           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
35961 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
35962           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool NM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
35963         fi
35964         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
35965 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
35966       fi
35967     fi
35968   fi
35969 
35970 
35971 
35972   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35973 
35974   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35975   # space.
35976   complete="$NM"
35977   path="${complete%% *}"
35978   tmp="$complete EOL"
35979   arguments="${tmp#* }"
35980 
35981   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
35982   # unix format.
35983   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35984 
35985   # Now try to locate executable using which
35986   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35987   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35988   # to not find them
35989   if test "x$new_path" = x \
35990       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35991       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35992     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35993   fi
35994   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35995     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35996     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35997     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35998     # argument.
35999     path="$complete"
36000     arguments="EOL"
36001     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36002     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36003     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
36004     # to not find them
36005     if test "x$new_path" = x \
36006         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36007         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36008       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36009     fi
36010     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36011       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
36012       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36013 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36014       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36015       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36016         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
36017 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36018       fi
36019       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
36020     fi
36021   fi
36022 
36023   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
36024   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
36025   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
36026   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
36027   #
36028   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
36029   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
36030   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36031   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
36032     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
36033     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
36034     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
36035       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
36036     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
36037       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
36038     else
36039       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
36040 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
36041       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
36042 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
36043       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
36044     fi
36045   else
36046     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
36047   fi
36048 
36049   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
36050   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
36051   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36052 
36053   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36054   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
36055   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
36056   # take no chances and rewrite it.
36057   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
36058   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
36059   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
36060     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
36061     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
36062     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
36063     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
36064       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
36065       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
36066       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
36067       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
36068       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
36069       new_path="$input_path"
36070     fi
36071   fi
36072 
36073   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
36074   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
36075     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
36076     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
36077       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
36078       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
36079       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
36080     fi
36081   fi
36082 
36083   # remove trailing .exe if any
36084   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36085 
36086   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36087 
36088   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36089   # space.
36090   complete="$NM"
36091   path="${complete%% *}"
36092   tmp="$complete EOL"
36093   arguments="${tmp#* }"
36094 
36095   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
36096   # unix format.
36097   new_path="$path"
36098 
36099   windows_path="$new_path"
36100   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36101     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36102     new_path="$unix_path"
36103   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36104     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36105     new_path="$unix_path"
36106   fi
36107 
36108 
36109   # Now try to locate executable using which
36110   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36111 
36112   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36113     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
36114     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
36115     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
36116     # argument.
36117     path="$complete"
36118     arguments="EOL"
36119     new_path="$path"
36120 
36121   windows_path="$new_path"
36122   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36123     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36124     new_path="$unix_path"
36125   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36126     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36127     new_path="$unix_path"
36128   fi
36129 
36130 
36131     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36132     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
36133     # to not find them
36134     if test "x$new_path" = x \
36135         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36136         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36137       new_path="$path"
36138 
36139   windows_path="$new_path"
36140   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36141     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36142     new_path="$unix_path"
36143   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36144     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36145     new_path="$unix_path"
36146   fi
36147 
36148     fi
36149 
36150     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36151       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
36152       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36153 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36154       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36155       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36156         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
36157 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36158       fi
36159       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
36160     fi
36161   fi
36162 
36163   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
36164   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
36165     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
36166     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36167     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
36168   else
36169     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
36170     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
36171 
36172   input_path="$new_path"
36173   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
36174   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
36175   # take no chances and rewrite it.
36176   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
36177   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
36178   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
36179     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
36180     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
36181   fi
36182 
36183     # Output is in $new_path
36184 
36185   windows_path="$new_path"
36186   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36187     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36188     new_path="$unix_path"
36189   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36190     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36191     new_path="$unix_path"
36192   fi
36193 
36194     # remove trailing .exe if any
36195     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36196 
36197     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
36198     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
36199   fi
36200 
36201   else
36202     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
36203     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36204     # space.
36205     complete="$NM"
36206     path="${complete%% *}"
36207     tmp="$complete EOL"
36208     arguments="${tmp#* }"
36209 
36210     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
36211     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
36212     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
36213       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
36214       IFS_save="$IFS"
36215       IFS=:
36216       for p in $PATH; do
36217         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
36218           new_path="$p/$path"
36219           break
36220         fi
36221       done
36222       IFS="$IFS_save"
36223     else
36224       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
36225       new_path="$path"
36226     fi
36227 
36228     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36229       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36230 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36231       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36232       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36233         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
36234 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36235       fi
36236       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
36237     fi
36238   fi
36239 
36240   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
36241   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
36242     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
36243   else
36244     new_complete="$new_path"
36245   fi
36246 
36247   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
36248     NM="$new_complete"
36249     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
36250 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
36251   fi
36252 
36253 
36254 
36255   # Publish this variable in the help.
36256 
36257 
36258   if test "x$GNM" = x; then
36259     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
36260     for ac_prog in gnm
36261 do
36262   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
36263 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
36264 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36265 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36266 if ${ac_cv_path_GNM+:} false; then :
36267   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36268 else
36269   case $GNM in
36270   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36271   ac_cv_path_GNM="$GNM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36272   ;;
36273   *)
36274   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36275 for as_dir in $PATH
36276 do
36277   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36278   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36279     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36280   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36281     ac_cv_path_GNM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
36282     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36283     break 2
36284   fi
36285 done
36286   done
36287 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36288 
36289   ;;
36290 esac
36291 fi
36292 GNM=$ac_cv_path_GNM
36293 if test -n "$GNM"; then
36294   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $GNM" >&5
36295 $as_echo "$GNM" >&6; }
36296 else
36297   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36298 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36299 fi
36300 
36301 
36302   test -n "$GNM" && break
36303 done
36304 
36305   else
36306     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
36307 
36308     # Try to remove the string !GNM! from our list.
36309     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!GNM!/}
36310     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
36311       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
36312       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
36313       if test "xGNM" != xBASH; then
36314         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of GNM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
36315 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of GNM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
36316       fi
36317       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
36318       for ac_prog in gnm
36319 do
36320   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
36321 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
36322 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36323 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36324 if ${ac_cv_path_GNM+:} false; then :
36325   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36326 else
36327   case $GNM in
36328   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36329   ac_cv_path_GNM="$GNM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36330   ;;
36331   *)
36332   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36333 for as_dir in $PATH
36334 do
36335   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36336   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36337     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36338   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36339     ac_cv_path_GNM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
36340     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36341     break 2
36342   fi
36343 done
36344   done
36345 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36346 
36347   ;;
36348 esac
36349 fi
36350 GNM=$ac_cv_path_GNM
36351 if test -n "$GNM"; then
36352   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $GNM" >&5
36353 $as_echo "$GNM" >&6; }
36354 else
36355   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36356 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36357 fi
36358 
36359 
36360   test -n "$GNM" && break
36361 done
36362 
36363     else
36364       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
36365       # for the tool.
36366 
36367       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
36368       # for unknown variables in the end.
36369       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
36370 
36371       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
36372       tool_specified="$GNM"
36373       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
36374       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
36375         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
36376         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool GNM=$tool_basename" >&5
36377 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool GNM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
36378         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
36379 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
36380 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36381 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36382 if ${ac_cv_path_GNM+:} false; then :
36383   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36384 else
36385   case $GNM in
36386   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36387   ac_cv_path_GNM="$GNM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36388   ;;
36389   *)
36390   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36391 for as_dir in $PATH
36392 do
36393   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36394   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36395     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36396   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36397     ac_cv_path_GNM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
36398     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36399     break 2
36400   fi
36401 done
36402   done
36403 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36404 
36405   ;;
36406 esac
36407 fi
36408 GNM=$ac_cv_path_GNM
36409 if test -n "$GNM"; then
36410   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $GNM" >&5
36411 $as_echo "$GNM" >&6; }
36412 else
36413   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36414 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36415 fi
36416 
36417 
36418         if test "x$GNM" = x; then
36419           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
36420         fi
36421       else
36422         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
36423         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool GNM=$tool_specified" >&5
36424 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool GNM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
36425         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for GNM" >&5
36426 $as_echo_n "checking for GNM... " >&6; }
36427         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
36428           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
36429 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
36430           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool GNM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
36431         fi
36432         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
36433 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
36434       fi
36435     fi
36436   fi
36437 
36438 
36439 
36440   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36441 
36442   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36443   # space.
36444   complete="$GNM"
36445   path="${complete%% *}"
36446   tmp="$complete EOL"
36447   arguments="${tmp#* }"
36448 
36449   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
36450   # unix format.
36451   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36452 
36453   # Now try to locate executable using which
36454   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36455   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
36456   # to not find them
36457   if test "x$new_path" = x \
36458       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36459       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36460     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36461   fi
36462   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36463     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
36464     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
36465     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
36466     # argument.
36467     path="$complete"
36468     arguments="EOL"
36469     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36470     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36471     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
36472     # to not find them
36473     if test "x$new_path" = x \
36474         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36475         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36476       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36477     fi
36478     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36479       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
36480       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36481 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36482       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36483       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36484         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
36485 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36486       fi
36487       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of GNM" "$LINENO" 5
36488     fi
36489   fi
36490 
36491   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
36492   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
36493   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
36494   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
36495   #
36496   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
36497   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
36498   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36499   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
36500     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
36501     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
36502     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
36503       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
36504     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
36505       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
36506     else
36507       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
36508 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
36509       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
36510 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
36511       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of GNM" "$LINENO" 5
36512     fi
36513   else
36514     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
36515   fi
36516 
36517   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
36518   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
36519   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36520 
36521   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36522   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
36523   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
36524   # take no chances and rewrite it.
36525   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
36526   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
36527   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
36528     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
36529     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
36530     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
36531     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
36532       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
36533       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
36534       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
36535       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
36536       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
36537       new_path="$input_path"
36538     fi
36539   fi
36540 
36541   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
36542   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
36543     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
36544     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
36545       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
36546       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
36547       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
36548     fi
36549   fi
36550 
36551   # remove trailing .exe if any
36552   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36553 
36554   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36555 
36556   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36557   # space.
36558   complete="$GNM"
36559   path="${complete%% *}"
36560   tmp="$complete EOL"
36561   arguments="${tmp#* }"
36562 
36563   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
36564   # unix format.
36565   new_path="$path"
36566 
36567   windows_path="$new_path"
36568   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36569     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36570     new_path="$unix_path"
36571   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36572     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36573     new_path="$unix_path"
36574   fi
36575 
36576 
36577   # Now try to locate executable using which
36578   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36579 
36580   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36581     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
36582     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
36583     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
36584     # argument.
36585     path="$complete"
36586     arguments="EOL"
36587     new_path="$path"
36588 
36589   windows_path="$new_path"
36590   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36591     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36592     new_path="$unix_path"
36593   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36594     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36595     new_path="$unix_path"
36596   fi
36597 
36598 
36599     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36600     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
36601     # to not find them
36602     if test "x$new_path" = x \
36603         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36604         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36605       new_path="$path"
36606 
36607   windows_path="$new_path"
36608   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36609     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36610     new_path="$unix_path"
36611   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36612     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36613     new_path="$unix_path"
36614   fi
36615 
36616     fi
36617 
36618     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36619       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
36620       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36621 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36622       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36623       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36624         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
36625 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36626       fi
36627       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of GNM" "$LINENO" 5
36628     fi
36629   fi
36630 
36631   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
36632   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
36633     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
36634     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36635     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
36636   else
36637     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
36638     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
36639 
36640   input_path="$new_path"
36641   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
36642   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
36643   # take no chances and rewrite it.
36644   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
36645   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
36646   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
36647     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
36648     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
36649   fi
36650 
36651     # Output is in $new_path
36652 
36653   windows_path="$new_path"
36654   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36655     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
36656     new_path="$unix_path"
36657   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
36658     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
36659     new_path="$unix_path"
36660   fi
36661 
36662     # remove trailing .exe if any
36663     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
36664 
36665     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
36666     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
36667   fi
36668 
36669   else
36670     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
36671     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36672     # space.
36673     complete="$GNM"
36674     path="${complete%% *}"
36675     tmp="$complete EOL"
36676     arguments="${tmp#* }"
36677 
36678     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
36679     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
36680     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
36681       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
36682       IFS_save="$IFS"
36683       IFS=:
36684       for p in $PATH; do
36685         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
36686           new_path="$p/$path"
36687           break
36688         fi
36689       done
36690       IFS="$IFS_save"
36691     else
36692       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
36693       new_path="$path"
36694     fi
36695 
36696     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36697       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36698 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of GNM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36699       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36700       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36701         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
36702 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36703       fi
36704       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of GNM" "$LINENO" 5
36705     fi
36706   fi
36707 
36708   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
36709   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
36710     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
36711   else
36712     new_complete="$new_path"
36713   fi
36714 
36715   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
36716     GNM="$new_complete"
36717     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting GNM to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
36718 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting GNM to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
36719   fi
36720 
36721 
36722 
36723 
36724   # Publish this variable in the help.
36725 
36726 
36727   if test "x$MCS" = x; then
36728     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
36729     for ac_prog in mcs
36730 do
36731   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
36732 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
36733 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36734 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36735 if ${ac_cv_path_MCS+:} false; then :
36736   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36737 else
36738   case $MCS in
36739   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36740   ac_cv_path_MCS="$MCS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36741   ;;
36742   *)
36743   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36744 for as_dir in $PATH
36745 do
36746   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36747   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36748     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36749   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36750     ac_cv_path_MCS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
