36751     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36752     break 2
36753   fi
36754 done
36755   done
36756 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36757 
36758   ;;
36759 esac
36760 fi
36761 MCS=$ac_cv_path_MCS
36762 if test -n "$MCS"; then
36763   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MCS" >&5
36764 $as_echo "$MCS" >&6; }
36765 else
36766   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36767 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36768 fi
36769 
36770 
36771   test -n "$MCS" && break
36772 done
36773 
36774   else
36775     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
36776 
36777     # Try to remove the string !MCS! from our list.
36778     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!MCS!/}
36779     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
36780       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
36781       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
36782       if test "xMCS" != xBASH; then
36783         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of MCS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
36784 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of MCS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
36785       fi
36786       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
36787       for ac_prog in mcs
36788 do
36789   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
36790 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
36791 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36792 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36793 if ${ac_cv_path_MCS+:} false; then :
36794   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36795 else
36796   case $MCS in
36797   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36798   ac_cv_path_MCS="$MCS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36799   ;;
36800   *)
36801   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36802 for as_dir in $PATH
36803 do
36804   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36805   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36806     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36807   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36808     ac_cv_path_MCS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
36809     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36810     break 2
36811   fi
36812 done
36813   done
36814 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36815 
36816   ;;
36817 esac
36818 fi
36819 MCS=$ac_cv_path_MCS
36820 if test -n "$MCS"; then
36821   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MCS" >&5
36822 $as_echo "$MCS" >&6; }
36823 else
36824   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36825 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36826 fi
36827 
36828 
36829   test -n "$MCS" && break
36830 done
36831 
36832     else
36833       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
36834       # for the tool.
36835 
36836       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
36837       # for unknown variables in the end.
36838       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
36839 
36840       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
36841       tool_specified="$MCS"
36842       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
36843       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
36844         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
36845         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool MCS=$tool_basename" >&5
36846 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool MCS=$tool_basename" >&6;}
36847         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
36848 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
36849 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
36850 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
36851 if ${ac_cv_path_MCS+:} false; then :
36852   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
36853 else
36854   case $MCS in
36855   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
36856   ac_cv_path_MCS="$MCS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
36857   ;;
36858   *)
36859   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
36860 for as_dir in $PATH
36861 do
36862   IFS=$as_save_IFS
36863   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
36864     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
36865   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
36866     ac_cv_path_MCS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
36867     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
36868     break 2
36869   fi
36870 done
36871   done
36872 IFS=$as_save_IFS
36873 
36874   ;;
36875 esac
36876 fi
36877 MCS=$ac_cv_path_MCS
36878 if test -n "$MCS"; then
36879   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MCS" >&5
36880 $as_echo "$MCS" >&6; }
36881 else
36882   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
36883 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
36884 fi
36885 
36886 
36887         if test "x$MCS" = x; then
36888           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
36889         fi
36890       else
36891         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
36892         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool MCS=$tool_specified" >&5
36893 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool MCS=$tool_specified" >&6;}
36894         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for MCS" >&5
36895 $as_echo_n "checking for MCS... " >&6; }
36896         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
36897           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
36898 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
36899           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool MCS=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
36900         fi
36901         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
36902 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
36903       fi
36904     fi
36905   fi
36906 
36907 
36908 
36909   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
36910 
36911   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
36912   # space.
36913   complete="$MCS"
36914   path="${complete%% *}"
36915   tmp="$complete EOL"
36916   arguments="${tmp#* }"
36917 
36918   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
36919   # unix format.
36920   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36921 
36922   # Now try to locate executable using which
36923   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36924   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
36925   # to not find them
36926   if test "x$new_path" = x \
36927       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36928       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36929     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36930   fi
36931   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36932     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
36933     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
36934     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
36935     # argument.
36936     path="$complete"
36937     arguments="EOL"
36938     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36939     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36940     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
36941     # to not find them
36942     if test "x$new_path" = x \
36943         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
36944         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
36945       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
36946     fi
36947     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
36948       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
36949       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
36950 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
36951       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
36952       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
36953         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
36954 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
36955       fi
36956       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MCS" "$LINENO" 5
36957     fi
36958   fi
36959 
36960   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
36961   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
36962   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
36963   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
36964   #
36965   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
36966   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
36967   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
36968   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
36969     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
36970     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
36971     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
36972       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
36973     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
36974       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
36975     else
36976       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
36977 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
36978       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
36979 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
36980       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MCS" "$LINENO" 5
36981     fi
36982   else
36983     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
36984   fi
36985 
36986   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
36987   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
36988   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36989 
36990   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
36991   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
36992   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
36993   # take no chances and rewrite it.
36994   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
36995   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
36996   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
36997     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
36998     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
36999     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37000     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
37001       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
37002       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
37003       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37004       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
37005       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37006       new_path="$input_path"
37007     fi
37008   fi
37009 
37010   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
37011   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
37012     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
37013     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
37014       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
37015       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
37016       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
37017     fi
37018   fi
37019 
37020   # remove trailing .exe if any
37021   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37022 
37023   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37024 
37025   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37026   # space.
37027   complete="$MCS"
37028   path="${complete%% *}"
37029   tmp="$complete EOL"
37030   arguments="${tmp#* }"
37031 
37032   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
37033   # unix format.
37034   new_path="$path"
37035 
37036   windows_path="$new_path"
37037   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37038     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37039     new_path="$unix_path"
37040   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37041     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37042     new_path="$unix_path"
37043   fi
37044 
37045 
37046   # Now try to locate executable using which
37047   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37048 
37049   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37050     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
37051     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
37052     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
37053     # argument.
37054     path="$complete"
37055     arguments="EOL"
37056     new_path="$path"
37057 
37058   windows_path="$new_path"
37059   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37060     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37061     new_path="$unix_path"
37062   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37063     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37064     new_path="$unix_path"
37065   fi
37066 
37067 
37068     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37069     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
37070     # to not find them
37071     if test "x$new_path" = x \
37072         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37073         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37074       new_path="$path"
37075 
37076   windows_path="$new_path"
37077   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37078     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37079     new_path="$unix_path"
37080   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37081     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37082     new_path="$unix_path"
37083   fi
37084 
37085     fi
37086 
37087     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37088       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
37089       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37090 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37091       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37092       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37093         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
37094 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37095       fi
37096       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MCS" "$LINENO" 5
37097     fi
37098   fi
37099 
37100   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
37101   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
37102     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
37103     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37104     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
37105   else
37106     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
37107     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
37108 
37109   input_path="$new_path"
37110   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
37111   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
37112   # take no chances and rewrite it.
37113   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
37114   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
37115   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
37116     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
37117     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37118   fi
37119 
37120     # Output is in $new_path
37121 
37122   windows_path="$new_path"
37123   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37124     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37125     new_path="$unix_path"
37126   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37127     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37128     new_path="$unix_path"
37129   fi
37130 
37131     # remove trailing .exe if any
37132     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37133 
37134     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
37135     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
37136   fi
37137 
37138   else
37139     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
37140     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37141     # space.
37142     complete="$MCS"
37143     path="${complete%% *}"
37144     tmp="$complete EOL"
37145     arguments="${tmp#* }"
37146 
37147     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
37148     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
37149     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
37150       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
37151       IFS_save="$IFS"
37152       IFS=:
37153       for p in $PATH; do
37154         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
37155           new_path="$p/$path"
37156           break
37157         fi
37158       done
37159       IFS="$IFS_save"
37160     else
37161       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
37162       new_path="$path"
37163     fi
37164 
37165     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37166       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37167 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MCS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37168       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37169       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37170         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
37171 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37172       fi
37173       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MCS" "$LINENO" 5
37174     fi
37175   fi
37176 
37177   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
37178   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
37179     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
37180   else
37181     new_complete="$new_path"
37182   fi
37183 
37184   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
37185     MCS="$new_complete"
37186     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MCS to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
37187 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MCS to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
37188   fi
37189 
37190   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xwindows; then
37191     # FIXME: we should unify this with the solaris case above.
37192 
37193 
37194   # Publish this variable in the help.
37195 
37196 
37197   if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
37198     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
37199     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37200   for ac_prog in strip
37201   do
37202     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37203 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37204 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37205 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37206 if ${ac_cv_prog_STRIP+:} false; then :
37207   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37208 else
37209   if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37210   ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37211 else
37212 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37213 for as_dir in $PATH
37214 do
37215   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37216   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37217     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37218   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37219     ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37220     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37221     break 2
37222   fi
37223 done
37224   done
37225 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37226 
37227 fi
37228 fi
37229 STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_STRIP
37230 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37231   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
37232 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
37233 else
37234   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37235 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37236 fi
37237 
37238 
37239     test -n "$STRIP" && break
37240   done
37241 fi
37242 if test -z "$STRIP"; then
37243   ac_ct_STRIP=$STRIP
37244   for ac_prog in strip
37245 do
37246   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37247 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37248 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37249 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37250 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP+:} false; then :
37251   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37252 else
37253   if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37254   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_ct_STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37255 else
37256 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37257 for as_dir in $PATH
37258 do
37259   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37260   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37261     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37262   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37263     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_prog"
37264     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37265     break 2
37266   fi
37267 done
37268   done
37269 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37270 
37271 fi
37272 fi
37273 ac_ct_STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP
37274 if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37275   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_STRIP" >&5
37276 $as_echo "$ac_ct_STRIP" >&6; }
37277 else
37278   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37279 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37280 fi
37281 
37282 
37283   test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP" && break
37284 done
37285 
37286   if test "x$ac_ct_STRIP" = x; then
37287     STRIP=""
37288   else
37289     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37290 yes:)
37291 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37292 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37293 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37294 esac
37295     STRIP=$ac_ct_STRIP
37296   fi
37297 fi
37298 
37299   else
37300     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
37301 
37302     # Try to remove the string !STRIP! from our list.
37303     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!STRIP!/}
37304     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
37305       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
37306       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
37307       if test "xSTRIP" != xBASH; then
37308         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
37309 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
37310       fi
37311       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
37312       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37313   for ac_prog in strip
37314   do
37315     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37316 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37317 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37318 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37319 if ${ac_cv_prog_STRIP+:} false; then :
37320   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37321 else
37322   if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37323   ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37324 else
37325 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37326 for as_dir in $PATH
37327 do
37328   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37329   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37330     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37331   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37332     ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37333     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37334     break 2
37335   fi
37336 done
37337   done
37338 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37339 
37340 fi
37341 fi
37342 STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_STRIP
37343 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37344   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
37345 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
37346 else
37347   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37348 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37349 fi
37350 
37351 
37352     test -n "$STRIP" && break
37353   done
37354 fi
37355 if test -z "$STRIP"; then
37356   ac_ct_STRIP=$STRIP
37357   for ac_prog in strip
37358 do
37359   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37360 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37361 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37362 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37363 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP+:} false; then :
37364   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37365 else
37366   if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37367   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_ct_STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37368 else
37369 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37370 for as_dir in $PATH
37371 do
37372   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37373   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37374     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37375   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37376     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_prog"
37377     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37378     break 2
37379   fi
37380 done
37381   done
37382 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37383 
37384 fi
37385 fi
37386 ac_ct_STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP
37387 if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37388   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_STRIP" >&5
37389 $as_echo "$ac_ct_STRIP" >&6; }
37390 else
37391   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37392 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37393 fi
37394 
37395 
37396   test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP" && break
37397 done
37398 
37399   if test "x$ac_ct_STRIP" = x; then
37400     STRIP=""
37401   else
37402     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37403 yes:)
37404 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37405 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37406 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37407 esac
37408     STRIP=$ac_ct_STRIP
37409   fi
37410 fi
37411 
37412     else
37413       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
37414       # for the tool.
37415 
37416       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
37417       # for unknown variables in the end.
37418       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
37419 
37420       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
37421       tool_specified="$STRIP"
37422       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
37423       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
37424         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
37425         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&5
37426 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
37427         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
37428 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
37429 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37430 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37431 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
37432   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37433 else
37434   case $STRIP in
37435   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
37436   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
37437   ;;
37438   *)
37439   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37440 for as_dir in $PATH
37441 do
37442   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37443   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37444     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37445   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37446     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
37447     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37448     break 2
37449   fi
37450 done
37451   done
37452 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37453 
37454   ;;
37455 esac
37456 fi
37457 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
37458 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37459   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
37460 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
37461 else
37462   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37463 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37464 fi
37465 
37466 
37467         if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
37468           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
37469         fi
37470       else
37471         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
37472         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&5
37473 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
37474         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for STRIP" >&5
37475 $as_echo_n "checking for STRIP... " >&6; }
37476         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
37477           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
37478 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
37479           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
37480         fi
37481         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
37482 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
37483       fi
37484     fi
37485   fi
37486 
37487 
37488 
37489   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37490 
37491   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37492   # space.
37493   complete="$STRIP"
37494   path="${complete%% *}"
37495   tmp="$complete EOL"
37496   arguments="${tmp#* }"
37497 
37498   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
37499   # unix format.
37500   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37501 
37502   # Now try to locate executable using which
37503   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37504   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
37505   # to not find them
37506   if test "x$new_path" = x \
37507       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37508       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37509     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37510   fi
37511   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37512     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
37513     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
37514     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
37515     # argument.
37516     path="$complete"
37517     arguments="EOL"
37518     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37519     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37520     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
37521     # to not find them
37522     if test "x$new_path" = x \
37523         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37524         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37525       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37526     fi
37527     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37528       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
37529       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37530 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37531       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37532       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37533         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
37534 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37535       fi
37536       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37537     fi
37538   fi
37539 
37540   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
37541   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
37542   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
37543   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
37544   #
37545   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
37546   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
37547   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37548   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
37549     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
37550     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
37551     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
37552       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
37553     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
37554       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
37555     else
37556       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
37557 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
37558       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
37559 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
37560       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37561     fi
37562   else
37563     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
37564   fi
37565 
37566   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
37567   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
37568   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
37569 
37570   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
37571   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
37572   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
37573   # take no chances and rewrite it.
37574   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
37575   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
37576   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
37577     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
37578     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
37579     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37580     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
37581       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
37582       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
37583       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37584       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
37585       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37586       new_path="$input_path"
37587     fi
37588   fi
37589 
37590   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
37591   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
37592     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
37593     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
37594       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
37595       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
37596       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
37597     fi
37598   fi
37599 
37600   # remove trailing .exe if any
37601   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37602 
37603   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37604 
37605   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37606   # space.
37607   complete="$STRIP"
37608   path="${complete%% *}"
37609   tmp="$complete EOL"
37610   arguments="${tmp#* }"
37611 
37612   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
37613   # unix format.
37614   new_path="$path"
37615 
37616   windows_path="$new_path"
37617   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37618     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37619     new_path="$unix_path"
37620   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37621     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37622     new_path="$unix_path"
37623   fi
37624 
37625 
37626   # Now try to locate executable using which
37627   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37628 
37629   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37630     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
37631     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
37632     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
37633     # argument.
37634     path="$complete"
37635     arguments="EOL"
37636     new_path="$path"
37637 
37638   windows_path="$new_path"
37639   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37640     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37641     new_path="$unix_path"
37642   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37643     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37644     new_path="$unix_path"
37645   fi
37646 
37647 
37648     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37649     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
37650     # to not find them
37651     if test "x$new_path" = x \
37652         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37653         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37654       new_path="$path"
37655 
37656   windows_path="$new_path"
37657   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37658     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37659     new_path="$unix_path"
37660   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37661     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37662     new_path="$unix_path"
37663   fi
37664 
37665     fi
37666 
37667     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37668       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
37669       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37670 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37671       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37672       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37673         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
37674 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37675       fi
37676       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37677     fi
37678   fi
37679 
37680   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
37681   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
37682     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
37683     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37684     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
37685   else
37686     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
37687     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
37688 
37689   input_path="$new_path"
37690   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
37691   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
37692   # take no chances and rewrite it.
37693   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
37694   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
37695   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
37696     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
37697     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37698   fi
37699 
37700     # Output is in $new_path
37701 
37702   windows_path="$new_path"
37703   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37704     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37705     new_path="$unix_path"
37706   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37707     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37708     new_path="$unix_path"
37709   fi
37710 
37711     # remove trailing .exe if any
37712     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37713 
37714     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
37715     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
37716   fi
37717 
37718   else
37719     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
37720     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37721     # space.
37722     complete="$STRIP"
37723     path="${complete%% *}"
37724     tmp="$complete EOL"
37725     arguments="${tmp#* }"
37726 
37727     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
37728     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
37729     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
37730       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
37731       IFS_save="$IFS"
37732       IFS=:
37733       for p in $PATH; do
37734         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
37735           new_path="$p/$path"
37736           break
37737         fi
37738       done
37739       IFS="$IFS_save"
37740     else
37741       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
37742       new_path="$path"
37743     fi
37744 
37745     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37746       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37747 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37748       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37749       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37750         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
37751 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37752       fi
37753       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37754     fi
37755   fi
37756 
37757   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
37758   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
37759     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
37760   else
37761     new_complete="$new_path"
37762   fi
37763 
37764   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
37765     STRIP="$new_complete"
37766     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
37767 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
37768   fi
37769 
37770 
37771 
37772   # Publish this variable in the help.
37773 
37774 
37775   if test "x$NM" = x; then
37776     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
37777     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37778   for ac_prog in nm
37779   do
37780     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37781 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37782 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37783 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37784 if ${ac_cv_prog_NM+:} false; then :
37785   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37786 else
37787   if test -n "$NM"; then
37788   ac_cv_prog_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test.
37789 else
37790 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37791 for as_dir in $PATH
37792 do
37793   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37794   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37795     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37796   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37797     ac_cv_prog_NM="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37798     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37799     break 2
37800   fi
37801 done
37802   done
37803 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37804 
37805 fi
37806 fi
37807 NM=$ac_cv_prog_NM
37808 if test -n "$NM"; then
37809   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
37810 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
37811 else
37812   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37813 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37814 fi
37815 
37816 
37817     test -n "$NM" && break
37818   done
37819 fi
37820 if test -z "$NM"; then
37821   ac_ct_NM=$NM
37822   for ac_prog in nm
37823 do
37824   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37825 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37826 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37827 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37828 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM+:} false; then :
37829   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37830 else
37831   if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37832   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_ct_NM" # Let the user override the test.
37833 else
37834 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37835 for as_dir in $PATH
37836 do
37837   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37838   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37839     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37840   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37841     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_prog"
37842     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37843     break 2
37844   fi
37845 done
37846   done
37847 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37848 
37849 fi
37850 fi
37851 ac_ct_NM=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM
37852 if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37853   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_NM" >&5
37854 $as_echo "$ac_ct_NM" >&6; }
37855 else
37856   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37857 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37858 fi
37859 
37860 
37861   test -n "$ac_ct_NM" && break
37862 done
37863 
37864   if test "x$ac_ct_NM" = x; then
37865     NM=""
37866   else
37867     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37868 yes:)
37869 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37870 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37871 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37872 esac
37873     NM=$ac_ct_NM
37874   fi
37875 fi
37876 
37877   else
37878     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
37879 
37880     # Try to remove the string !NM! from our list.
37881     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!NM!/}
37882     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
37883       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
37884       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
37885       if test "xNM" != xBASH; then
37886         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
37887 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
37888       fi
37889       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
37890       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37891   for ac_prog in nm
37892   do
37893     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37894 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37895 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37896 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37897 if ${ac_cv_prog_NM+:} false; then :
37898   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37899 else
37900   if test -n "$NM"; then
37901   ac_cv_prog_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test.
37902 else
37903 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37904 for as_dir in $PATH
37905 do
37906   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37907   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37908     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37909   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37910     ac_cv_prog_NM="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37911     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37912     break 2
37913   fi
37914 done
37915   done
37916 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37917 
37918 fi
37919 fi
37920 NM=$ac_cv_prog_NM
37921 if test -n "$NM"; then
37922   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
37923 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
37924 else
37925   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37926 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37927 fi
37928 
37929 
37930     test -n "$NM" && break
37931   done
37932 fi
37933 if test -z "$NM"; then
37934   ac_ct_NM=$NM
37935   for ac_prog in nm
37936 do
37937   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37938 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37939 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37940 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37941 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM+:} false; then :
37942   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37943 else
37944   if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37945   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_ct_NM" # Let the user override the test.
37946 else
37947 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37948 for as_dir in $PATH
37949 do
37950   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37951   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37952     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37953   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37954     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_prog"
37955     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37956     break 2
37957   fi
37958 done
37959   done
37960 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37961 
37962 fi
37963 fi
37964 ac_ct_NM=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM
37965 if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37966   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_NM" >&5
37967 $as_echo "$ac_ct_NM" >&6; }
37968 else
37969   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37970 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37971 fi
37972 
37973 
37974   test -n "$ac_ct_NM" && break
37975 done
37976 
37977   if test "x$ac_ct_NM" = x; then
37978     NM=""
37979   else
37980     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37981 yes:)
37982 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37983 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37984 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37985 esac
37986     NM=$ac_ct_NM
37987   fi
37988 fi
37989 
37990     else
37991       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
37992       # for the tool.
37993 
37994       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
37995       # for unknown variables in the end.
37996       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
37997 
37998       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
37999       tool_specified="$NM"
38000       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
38001       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
38002         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
38003         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&5
38004 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
38005         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
38006 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
38007 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38008 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38009 if ${ac_cv_path_NM+:} false; then :
38010   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38011 else
38012   case $NM in
38013   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
38014   ac_cv_path_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
38015   ;;
38016   *)
38017   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38018 for as_dir in $PATH
38019 do
38020   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38021   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38022     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38023   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38024     ac_cv_path_NM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
38025     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38026     break 2
38027   fi
38028 done
38029   done
38030 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38031 
38032   ;;
38033 esac
38034 fi
38035 NM=$ac_cv_path_NM
38036 if test -n "$NM"; then
38037   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
38038 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
38039 else
38040   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38041 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38042 fi
38043 
38044 
38045         if test "x$NM" = x; then
38046           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
38047         fi
38048       else
38049         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
38050         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&5
38051 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
38052         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for NM" >&5
38053 $as_echo_n "checking for NM... " >&6; }
38054         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
38055           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
38056 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
38057           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool NM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
38058         fi
38059         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
38060 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
38061       fi
38062     fi
38063   fi
38064 
38065 
38066 
38067   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38068 
38069   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38070   # space.
38071   complete="$NM"
38072   path="${complete%% *}"
38073   tmp="$complete EOL"
38074   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38075 
38076   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38077   # unix format.
38078   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38079 
38080   # Now try to locate executable using which
38081   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38082   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38083   # to not find them
38084   if test "x$new_path" = x \
38085       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38086       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38087     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38088   fi
38089   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38090     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38091     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38092     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38093     # argument.
38094     path="$complete"
38095     arguments="EOL"
38096     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38097     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38098     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38099     # to not find them
38100     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38101         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38102         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38103       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38104     fi
38105     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38106       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38107       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38108 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38109       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38110       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38111         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38112 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38113       fi
38114       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38115     fi
38116   fi
38117 
38118   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
38119   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
38120   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
38121   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
38122   #
38123   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
38124   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
38125   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38126   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
38127     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
38128     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
38129     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
38130       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
38131     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
38132       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
38133     else
38134       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
38135 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
38136       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
38137 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
38138       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38139     fi
38140   else
38141     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
38142   fi
38143 
38144   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
38145   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
38146   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38147 
38148   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38149   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38150   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38151   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38152   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38153   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
38154   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38155     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38156     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
38157     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38158     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
38159       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
38160       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
38161       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38162       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
38163       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38164       new_path="$input_path"
38165     fi
38166   fi
38167 
38168   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
38169   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
38170     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
38171     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
38172       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
38173       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
38174       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
38175     fi
38176   fi
38177 
38178   # remove trailing .exe if any
38179   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38180 
38181   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38182 
38183   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38184   # space.
38185   complete="$NM"
38186   path="${complete%% *}"
38187   tmp="$complete EOL"
38188   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38189 
38190   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38191   # unix format.
38192   new_path="$path"
38193 
38194   windows_path="$new_path"
38195   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38196     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38197     new_path="$unix_path"
38198   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38199     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38200     new_path="$unix_path"
38201   fi
38202 
38203 
38204   # Now try to locate executable using which
38205   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38206 
38207   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38208     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38209     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38210     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38211     # argument.
38212     path="$complete"
38213     arguments="EOL"
38214     new_path="$path"
38215 
38216   windows_path="$new_path"
38217   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38218     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38219     new_path="$unix_path"
38220   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38221     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38222     new_path="$unix_path"
38223   fi
38224 
38225 
38226     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38227     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
38228     # to not find them
38229     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38230         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38231         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38232       new_path="$path"
38233 
38234   windows_path="$new_path"
38235   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38236     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38237     new_path="$unix_path"
38238   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38239     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38240     new_path="$unix_path"
38241   fi
38242 
38243     fi
38244 
38245     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38246       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38247       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38248 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38249       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38250       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38251         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38252 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38253       fi
38254       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38255     fi
38256   fi
38257 
38258   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
38259   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
38260     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
38261     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38262     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
38263   else
38264     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
38265     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
38266 
38267   input_path="$new_path"
38268   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38269   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38270   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38271   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38272   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
38273   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38274     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38275     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38276   fi
38277 
38278     # Output is in $new_path
38279 
38280   windows_path="$new_path"
38281   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38282     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38283     new_path="$unix_path"
38284   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38285     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38286     new_path="$unix_path"
38287   fi
38288 
38289     # remove trailing .exe if any
38290     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38291 
38292     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
38293     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
38294   fi
38295 
38296   else
38297     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
38298     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38299     # space.
38300     complete="$NM"
38301     path="${complete%% *}"
38302     tmp="$complete EOL"
38303     arguments="${tmp#* }"
38304 
38305     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
38306     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
38307     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
38308       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
38309       IFS_save="$IFS"
38310       IFS=:
38311       for p in $PATH; do
38312         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
38313           new_path="$p/$path"
38314           break
38315         fi
38316       done
38317       IFS="$IFS_save"
38318     else
38319       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
38320       new_path="$path"
38321     fi
38322 
38323     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38324       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38325 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38326       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38327       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38328         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
38329 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38330       fi
38331       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38332     fi
38333   fi
38334 
38335   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
38336   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
38337     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
38338   else
38339     new_complete="$new_path"
38340   fi
38341 
38342   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
38343     NM="$new_complete"
38344     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
38345 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
38346   fi
38347 
38348     GNM="$NM"
38349 
38350   fi
38351 
38352   # objcopy is used for moving debug symbols to separate files when
38353   # full debug symbols are enabled.
38354   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
38355 
38356 
38357   # Publish this variable in the help.
38358 
38359 
38360   if test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
38361     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
38362     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38363   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38364   do
38365     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38366 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38367 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38368 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38369 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38370   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38371 else
38372   if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38373   ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38374 else
38375 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38376 for as_dir in $PATH
38377 do
38378   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38379   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38380     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38381   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38382     ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38383     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38384     break 2
38385   fi
38386 done
38387   done
38388 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38389 
38390 fi
38391 fi
38392 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY
38393 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38394   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38395 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38396 else
38397   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38398 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38399 fi
38400 
38401 
38402     test -n "$OBJCOPY" && break
38403   done
38404 fi
38405 if test -z "$OBJCOPY"; then
38406   ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$OBJCOPY
38407   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38408 do
38409   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38410 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38411 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38412 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38413 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38414   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38415 else
38416   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38417   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38418 else
38419 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38420 for as_dir in $PATH
38421 do
38422   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38423   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38424     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38425   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38426     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_prog"
38427     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38428     break 2
38429   fi
38430 done
38431   done
38432 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38433 
38434 fi
38435 fi
38436 ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38437 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38438   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&5
38439 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38440 else
38441   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38442 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38443 fi
38444 
38445 
38446   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" && break
38447 done
38448 
38449   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" = x; then
38450     OBJCOPY=""
38451   else
38452     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
38453 yes:)
38454 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
38455 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
38456 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
38457 esac
38458     OBJCOPY=$ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38459   fi
38460 fi
38461 
38462   else
38463     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
38464 
38465     # Try to remove the string !OBJCOPY! from our list.
38466     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!OBJCOPY!/}
38467     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
38468       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
38469       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
38470       if test "xOBJCOPY" != xBASH; then
38471         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJCOPY from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
38472 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJCOPY from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
38473       fi
38474       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
38475       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38476   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38477   do
38478     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38479 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38480 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38481 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38482 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38483   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38484 else
38485   if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38486   ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38487 else
38488 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38489 for as_dir in $PATH
38490 do
38491   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38492   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38493     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38494   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38495     ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38496     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38497     break 2
38498   fi
38499 done
38500   done
38501 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38502 
38503 fi
38504 fi
38505 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY
38506 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38507   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38508 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38509 else
38510   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38511 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38512 fi
38513 
38514 
38515     test -n "$OBJCOPY" && break
38516   done
38517 fi
38518 if test -z "$OBJCOPY"; then
38519   ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$OBJCOPY
38520   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38521 do
38522   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38523 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38524 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38525 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38526 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38527   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38528 else
38529   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38530   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38531 else
38532 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38533 for as_dir in $PATH
38534 do
38535   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38536   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38537     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38538   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38539     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_prog"
38540     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38541     break 2
38542   fi
38543 done
38544   done
38545 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38546 
38547 fi
38548 fi
38549 ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38550 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38551   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&5
38552 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38553 else
38554   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38555 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38556 fi
38557 
38558 
38559   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" && break
38560 done
38561 
38562   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" = x; then
38563     OBJCOPY=""
38564   else
38565     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
38566 yes:)
38567 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
38568 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
38569 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
38570 esac
38571     OBJCOPY=$ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38572   fi
38573 fi
38574 
38575     else
38576       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
38577       # for the tool.
38578 
38579       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
38580       # for unknown variables in the end.
38581       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
38582 
38583       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
38584       tool_specified="$OBJCOPY"
38585       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
38586       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
38587         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
38588         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_basename" >&5
38589 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_basename" >&6;}
38590         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
38591 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
38592 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38593 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38594 if ${ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38595   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38596 else
38597   case $OBJCOPY in
38598   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
38599   ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test with a path.
38600   ;;
38601   *)
38602   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38603 for as_dir in $PATH
38604 do
38605   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38606   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38607     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38608   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38609     ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
38610     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38611     break 2
38612   fi
38613 done
38614   done
38615 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38616 
38617   ;;
38618 esac
38619 fi
38620 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY
38621 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38622   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38623 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38624 else
38625   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38626 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38627 fi
38628 
38629 
38630         if test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
38631           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
38632         fi
38633       else
38634         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
38635         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified" >&5
38636 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified" >&6;}
38637         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for OBJCOPY" >&5
38638 $as_echo_n "checking for OBJCOPY... " >&6; }
38639         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
38640           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
38641 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
38642           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
38643         fi
38644         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
38645 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
38646       fi
38647     fi
38648   fi
38649 
38650 
38651     # Only call fixup if objcopy was found.
38652     if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38653 
38654   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38655 
38656   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38657   # space.
38658   complete="$OBJCOPY"
38659   path="${complete%% *}"
38660   tmp="$complete EOL"
38661   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38662 
38663   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38664   # unix format.
38665   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38666 
38667   # Now try to locate executable using which
38668   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38669   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38670   # to not find them
38671   if test "x$new_path" = x \
