38672       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38673       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38674     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38675   fi
38676   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38677     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38678     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38679     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38680     # argument.
38681     path="$complete"
38682     arguments="EOL"
38683     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38684     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38685     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38686     # to not find them
38687     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38688         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38689         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38690       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38691     fi
38692     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38693       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38694       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38695 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38696       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38697       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38698         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38699 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38700       fi
38701       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38702     fi
38703   fi
38704 
38705   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
38706   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
38707   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
38708   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
38709   #
38710   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
38711   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
38712   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38713   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
38714     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
38715     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
38716     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
38717       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
38718     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
38719       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
38720     else
38721       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
38722 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
38723       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
38724 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
38725       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38726     fi
38727   else
38728     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
38729   fi
38730 
38731   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
38732   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
38733   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38734 
38735   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38736   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38737   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38738   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38739   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38740   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
38741   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38742     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38743     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
38744     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38745     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
38746       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
38747       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
38748       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38749       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
38750       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38751       new_path="$input_path"
38752     fi
38753   fi
38754 
38755   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
38756   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
38757     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
38758     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
38759       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
38760       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
38761       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
38762     fi
38763   fi
38764 
38765   # remove trailing .exe if any
38766   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38767 
38768   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38769 
38770   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38771   # space.
38772   complete="$OBJCOPY"
38773   path="${complete%% *}"
38774   tmp="$complete EOL"
38775   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38776 
38777   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38778   # unix format.
38779   new_path="$path"
38780 
38781   windows_path="$new_path"
38782   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38783     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38784     new_path="$unix_path"
38785   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38786     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38787     new_path="$unix_path"
38788   fi
38789 
38790 
38791   # Now try to locate executable using which
38792   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38793 
38794   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38795     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38796     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38797     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38798     # argument.
38799     path="$complete"
38800     arguments="EOL"
38801     new_path="$path"
38802 
38803   windows_path="$new_path"
38804   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38805     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38806     new_path="$unix_path"
38807   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38808     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38809     new_path="$unix_path"
38810   fi
38811 
38812 
38813     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38814     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
38815     # to not find them
38816     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38817         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38818         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38819       new_path="$path"
38820 
38821   windows_path="$new_path"
38822   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38823     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38824     new_path="$unix_path"
38825   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38826     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38827     new_path="$unix_path"
38828   fi
38829 
38830     fi
38831 
38832     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38833       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38834       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38835 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38836       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38837       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38838         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38839 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38840       fi
38841       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38842     fi
38843   fi
38844 
38845   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
38846   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
38847     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
38848     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38849     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
38850   else
38851     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
38852     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
38853 
38854   input_path="$new_path"
38855   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38856   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38857   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38858   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38859   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
38860   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38861     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38862     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38863   fi
38864 
38865     # Output is in $new_path
38866 
38867   windows_path="$new_path"
38868   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38869     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38870     new_path="$unix_path"
38871   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38872     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38873     new_path="$unix_path"
38874   fi
38875 
38876     # remove trailing .exe if any
38877     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38878 
38879     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
38880     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
38881   fi
38882 
38883   else
38884     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
38885     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38886     # space.
38887     complete="$OBJCOPY"
38888     path="${complete%% *}"
38889     tmp="$complete EOL"
38890     arguments="${tmp#* }"
38891 
38892     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
38893     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
38894     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
38895       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
38896       IFS_save="$IFS"
38897       IFS=:
38898       for p in $PATH; do
38899         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
38900           new_path="$p/$path"
38901           break
38902         fi
38903       done
38904       IFS="$IFS_save"
38905     else
38906       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
38907       new_path="$path"
38908     fi
38909 
38910     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38911       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38912 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38913       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38914       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38915         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
38916 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38917       fi
38918       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38919     fi
38920   fi
38921 
38922   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
38923   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
38924     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
38925   else
38926     new_complete="$new_path"
38927   fi
38928 
38929   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
38930     OBJCOPY="$new_complete"
38931     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJCOPY to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
38932 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJCOPY to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
38933   fi
38934 
38935     fi
38936   fi
38937 
38938 
38939 
38940   # Publish this variable in the help.
38941 
38942 
38943   if test "x$OBJDUMP" = x; then
38944     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
38945     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38946   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
38947   do
38948     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38949 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38950 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38951 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38952 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
38953   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38954 else
38955   if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
38956   ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
38957 else
38958 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38959 for as_dir in $PATH
38960 do
38961   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38962   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38963     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38964   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38965     ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38966     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38967     break 2
38968   fi
38969 done
38970   done
38971 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38972 
38973 fi
38974 fi
38975 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP
38976 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
38977   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
38978 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
38979 else
38980   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38981 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38982 fi
38983 
38984 
38985     test -n "$OBJDUMP" && break
38986   done
38987 fi
38988 if test -z "$OBJDUMP"; then
38989   ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$OBJDUMP
38990   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
38991 do
38992   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38993 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38994 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38995 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38996 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
38997   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38998 else
38999   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39000   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
39001 else
39002 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39003 for as_dir in $PATH
39004 do
39005   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39006   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39007     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39008   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39009     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_prog"
39010     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39011     break 2
39012   fi
39013 done
39014   done
39015 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39016 
39017 fi
39018 fi
39019 ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39020 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39021   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&5
39022 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39023 else
39024   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39025 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39026 fi
39027 
39028 
39029   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" && break
39030 done
39031 
39032   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" = x; then
39033     OBJDUMP=""
39034   else
39035     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
39036 yes:)
39037 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
39038 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
39039 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
39040 esac
39041     OBJDUMP=$ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39042   fi
39043 fi
39044 
39045   else
39046     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
39047 
39048     # Try to remove the string !OBJDUMP! from our list.
39049     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!OBJDUMP!/}
39050     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
39051       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
39052       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
39053       if test "xOBJDUMP" != xBASH; then
39054         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJDUMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
39055 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJDUMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
39056       fi
39057       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
39058       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
39059   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
39060   do
39061     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39062 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39063 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39064 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39065 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39066   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39067 else
39068   if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39069   ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
39070 else
39071 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39072 for as_dir in $PATH
39073 do
39074   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39075   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39076     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39077   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39078     ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
39079     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39080     break 2
39081   fi
39082 done
39083   done
39084 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39085 
39086 fi
39087 fi
39088 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP
39089 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39090   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
39091 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39092 else
39093   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39094 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39095 fi
39096 
39097 
39098     test -n "$OBJDUMP" && break
39099   done
39100 fi
39101 if test -z "$OBJDUMP"; then
39102   ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$OBJDUMP
39103   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
39104 do
39105   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39106 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39107 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39108 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39109 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39110   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39111 else
39112   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39113   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
39114 else
39115 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39116 for as_dir in $PATH
39117 do
39118   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39119   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39120     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39121   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39122     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_prog"
39123     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39124     break 2
39125   fi
39126 done
39127   done
39128 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39129 
39130 fi
39131 fi
39132 ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39133 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39134   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&5
39135 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39136 else
39137   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39138 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39139 fi
39140 
39141 
39142   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" && break
39143 done
39144 
39145   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" = x; then
39146     OBJDUMP=""
39147   else
39148     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
39149 yes:)
39150 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
39151 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
39152 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
39153 esac
39154     OBJDUMP=$ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39155   fi
39156 fi
39157 
39158     else
39159       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
39160       # for the tool.
39161 
39162       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
39163       # for unknown variables in the end.
39164       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
39165 
39166       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
39167       tool_specified="$OBJDUMP"
39168       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
39169       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
39170         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
39171         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_basename" >&5
39172 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
39173         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
39174 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
39175 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39176 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39177 if ${ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39178   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39179 else
39180   case $OBJDUMP in
39181   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39182   ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39183   ;;
39184   *)
39185   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39186 for as_dir in $PATH
39187 do
39188   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39189   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39190     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39191   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39192     ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39193     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39194     break 2
39195   fi
39196 done
39197   done
39198 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39199 
39200   ;;
39201 esac
39202 fi
39203 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP
39204 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39205   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
39206 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39207 else
39208   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39209 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39210 fi
39211 
39212 
39213         if test "x$OBJDUMP" = x; then
39214           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
39215         fi
39216       else
39217         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
39218         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified" >&5
39219 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
39220         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for OBJDUMP" >&5
39221 $as_echo_n "checking for OBJDUMP... " >&6; }
39222         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
39223           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
39224 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
39225           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
39226         fi
39227         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
39228 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
39229       fi
39230     fi
39231   fi
39232 
39233 
39234   if test "x$OBJDUMP" != x; then
39235     # Only used for compare.sh; we can live without it. BASIC_FIXUP_EXECUTABLE
39236     # bails if argument is missing.
39237 
39238   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39239 
39240   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39241   # space.
39242   complete="$OBJDUMP"
39243   path="${complete%% *}"
39244   tmp="$complete EOL"
39245   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39246 
39247   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39248   # unix format.
39249   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39250 
39251   # Now try to locate executable using which
39252   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39253   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39254   # to not find them
39255   if test "x$new_path" = x \
39256       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39257       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39258     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39259   fi
39260   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39261     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39262     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39263     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39264     # argument.
39265     path="$complete"
39266     arguments="EOL"
39267     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39268     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39269     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39270     # to not find them
39271     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39272         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39273         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39274       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39275     fi
39276     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39277       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39278       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39279 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39280       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39281       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39282         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39283 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39284       fi
39285       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39286     fi
39287   fi
39288 
39289   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
39290   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
39291   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
39292   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
39293   #
39294   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
39295   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
39296   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39297   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
39298     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
39299     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
39300     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
39301       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
39302     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
39303       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
39304     else
39305       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
39306 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
39307       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
39308 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
39309       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39310     fi
39311   else
39312     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
39313   fi
39314 
39315   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
39316   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
39317   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39318 
39319   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39320   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39321   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39322   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39323   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39324   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
39325   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39326     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39327     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
39328     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39329     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
39330       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
39331       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
39332       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39333       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
39334       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39335       new_path="$input_path"
39336     fi
39337   fi
39338 
39339   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
39340   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
39341     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
39342     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
39343       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
39344       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
39345       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
39346     fi
39347   fi
39348 
39349   # remove trailing .exe if any
39350   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39351 
39352   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39353 
39354   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39355   # space.
39356   complete="$OBJDUMP"
39357   path="${complete%% *}"
39358   tmp="$complete EOL"
39359   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39360 
39361   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39362   # unix format.
39363   new_path="$path"
39364 
39365   windows_path="$new_path"
39366   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39367     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39368     new_path="$unix_path"
39369   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39370     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39371     new_path="$unix_path"
39372   fi
39373 
39374 
39375   # Now try to locate executable using which
39376   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39377 
39378   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39379     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39380     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39381     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39382     # argument.
39383     path="$complete"
39384     arguments="EOL"
39385     new_path="$path"
39386 
39387   windows_path="$new_path"
39388   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39389     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39390     new_path="$unix_path"
39391   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39392     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39393     new_path="$unix_path"
39394   fi
39395 
39396 
39397     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39398     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
39399     # to not find them
39400     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39401         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39402         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39403       new_path="$path"
39404 
39405   windows_path="$new_path"
39406   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39407     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39408     new_path="$unix_path"
39409   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39410     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39411     new_path="$unix_path"
39412   fi
39413 
39414     fi
39415 
39416     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39417       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39418       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39419 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39420       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39421       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39422         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39423 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39424       fi
39425       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39426     fi
39427   fi
39428 
39429   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
39430   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
39431     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
39432     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39433     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
39434   else
39435     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
39436     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
39437 
39438   input_path="$new_path"
39439   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39440   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39441   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39442   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39443   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
39444   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39445     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39446     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39447   fi
39448 
39449     # Output is in $new_path
39450 
39451   windows_path="$new_path"
39452   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39453     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39454     new_path="$unix_path"
39455   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39456     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39457     new_path="$unix_path"
39458   fi
39459 
39460     # remove trailing .exe if any
39461     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39462 
39463     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
39464     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
39465   fi
39466 
39467   else
39468     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
39469     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39470     # space.
39471     complete="$OBJDUMP"
39472     path="${complete%% *}"
39473     tmp="$complete EOL"
39474     arguments="${tmp#* }"
39475 
39476     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
39477     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
39478     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
39479       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
39480       IFS_save="$IFS"
39481       IFS=:
39482       for p in $PATH; do
39483         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
39484           new_path="$p/$path"
39485           break
39486         fi
39487       done
39488       IFS="$IFS_save"
39489     else
39490       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
39491       new_path="$path"
39492     fi
39493 
39494     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39495       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39496 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39497       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39498       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39499         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
39500 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39501       fi
39502       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39503     fi
39504   fi
39505 
39506   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
39507   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
39508     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
39509   else
39510     new_complete="$new_path"
39511   fi
39512 
39513   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
39514     OBJDUMP="$new_complete"
39515     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJDUMP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
39516 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJDUMP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
39517   fi
39518 
39519   fi
39520 
39521 
39522   # Restore old path.
39523   PATH="$OLD_PATH"
39524 
39525   # Restore the flags to the user specified values.
39526   # This is necessary since AC_PROG_CC defaults CFLAGS to "-g -O2"
39527   CFLAGS="$ORG_CFLAGS"
39528   CXXFLAGS="$ORG_CXXFLAGS"
39529   OBJCFLAGS="$ORG_OBJCFLAGS"
39530 
39531 
39532 # Finally do some processing after the detection phase
39533 
39534   if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = "xcross"; then
39535     # Now we need to find a C/C++ compiler that can build executables for the
39536     # build platform. We can't use the AC_PROG_CC macro, since it can only be
39537     # used once. Also, we need to do this without adding a tools dir to the
39538     # path, otherwise we might pick up cross-compilers which don't use standard
39539     # naming.
39540 
39541     # FIXME: we should list the discovered compilers as an exclude pattern!
39542     # If we do that, we can do this detection before POST_DETECTION, and still
39543     # find the build compilers in the tools dir, if needed.
39544 
39545 
39546   # Publish this variable in the help.
39547 
39548 
39549   if test "x$BUILD_CC" = x; then
39550     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
39551     for ac_prog in cl cc gcc
39552 do
39553   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39554 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39555 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39556 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39557 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39558   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39559 else
39560   case $BUILD_CC in
39561   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39562   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39563   ;;
39564   *)
39565   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39566 for as_dir in $PATH
39567 do
39568   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39569   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39570     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39571   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39572     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39573     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39574     break 2
39575   fi
39576 done
39577   done
39578 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39579 
39580   ;;
39581 esac
39582 fi
39583 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39584 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39585   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39586 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39587 else
39588   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39589 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39590 fi
39591 
39592 
39593   test -n "$BUILD_CC" && break
39594 done
39595 
39596   else
39597     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
39598 
39599     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_CC! from our list.
39600     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_CC!/}
39601     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
39602       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
39603       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
39604       if test "xBUILD_CC" != xBASH; then
39605         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
39606 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
39607       fi
39608       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
39609       for ac_prog in cl cc gcc
39610 do
39611   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39612 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39613 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39614 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39615 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39616   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39617 else
39618   case $BUILD_CC in
39619   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39620   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39621   ;;
39622   *)
39623   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39624 for as_dir in $PATH
39625 do
39626   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39627   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39628     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39629   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39630     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39631     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39632     break 2
39633   fi
39634 done
39635   done
39636 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39637 
39638   ;;
39639 esac
39640 fi
39641 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39642 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39643   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39644 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39645 else
39646   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39647 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39648 fi
39649 
39650 
39651   test -n "$BUILD_CC" && break
39652 done
39653 
39654     else
39655       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
39656       # for the tool.
39657 
39658       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
39659       # for unknown variables in the end.
39660       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
39661 
39662       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
39663       tool_specified="$BUILD_CC"
39664       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
39665       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
39666         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
39667         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_basename" >&5
39668 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_basename" >&6;}
39669         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
39670 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
39671 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39672 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39673 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39674   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39675 else
39676   case $BUILD_CC in
39677   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39678   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39679   ;;
39680   *)
39681   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39682 for as_dir in $PATH
39683 do
39684   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39685   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39686     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39687   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39688     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39689     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39690     break 2
39691   fi
39692 done
39693   done
39694 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39695 
39696   ;;
39697 esac
39698 fi
39699 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39700 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39701   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39702 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39703 else
39704   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39705 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39706 fi
39707 
39708 
39709         if test "x$BUILD_CC" = x; then
39710           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
39711         fi
39712       else
39713         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
39714         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified" >&5
39715 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified" >&6;}
39716         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_CC" >&5
39717 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_CC... " >&6; }
39718         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
39719           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
39720 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
39721           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
39722         fi
39723         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
39724 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
39725       fi
39726     fi
39727   fi
39728 
39729 
39730 
39731   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39732 
39733   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39734   # space.
39735   complete="$BUILD_CC"
39736   path="${complete%% *}"
39737   tmp="$complete EOL"
39738   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39739 
39740   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39741   # unix format.
39742   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39743 
39744   # Now try to locate executable using which
39745   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39746   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39747   # to not find them
39748   if test "x$new_path" = x \
39749       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39750       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39751     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39752   fi
39753   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39754     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39755     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39756     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39757     # argument.
39758     path="$complete"
39759     arguments="EOL"
39760     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39761     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39762     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39763     # to not find them
39764     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39765         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39766         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39767       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39768     fi
39769     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39770       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39771       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39772 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39773       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39774       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39775         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39776 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39777       fi
39778       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39779     fi
39780   fi
39781 
39782   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
39783   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
39784   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
39785   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
39786   #
39787   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
39788   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
39789   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39790   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
39791     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
39792     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
39793     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
39794       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
39795     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
39796       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
39797     else
39798       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
39799 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
39800       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
39801 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
39802       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39803     fi
39804   else
39805     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
39806   fi
39807 
39808   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
39809   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
39810   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39811 
39812   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39813   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39814   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39815   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39816   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39817   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
39818   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39819     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39820     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
39821     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39822     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
39823       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
39824       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
39825       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39826       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
39827       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39828       new_path="$input_path"
39829     fi
39830   fi
39831 
39832   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
39833   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
39834     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
39835     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
39836       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
39837       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
39838       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
39839     fi
39840   fi
39841 
39842   # remove trailing .exe if any
39843   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39844 
39845   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39846 
39847   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39848   # space.
39849   complete="$BUILD_CC"
39850   path="${complete%% *}"
39851   tmp="$complete EOL"
39852   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39853 
39854   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39855   # unix format.
39856   new_path="$path"
39857 
39858   windows_path="$new_path"
39859   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39860     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39861     new_path="$unix_path"
39862   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39863     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39864     new_path="$unix_path"
39865   fi
39866 
39867 
39868   # Now try to locate executable using which
39869   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39870 
39871   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39872     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39873     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39874     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39875     # argument.
39876     path="$complete"
39877     arguments="EOL"
39878     new_path="$path"
39879 
39880   windows_path="$new_path"
39881   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39882     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39883     new_path="$unix_path"
39884   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39885     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39886     new_path="$unix_path"
39887   fi
39888 
39889 
39890     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39891     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
39892     # to not find them
39893     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39894         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39895         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39896       new_path="$path"
39897 
39898   windows_path="$new_path"
39899   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39900     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39901     new_path="$unix_path"
39902   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39903     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39904     new_path="$unix_path"
39905   fi
39906 
39907     fi
39908 
39909     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39910       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39911       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39912 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39913       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39914       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39915         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39916 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39917       fi
39918       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39919     fi
39920   fi
39921 
39922   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
39923   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
39924     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
39925     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39926     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
39927   else
39928     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
39929     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
39930 
39931   input_path="$new_path"
39932   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39933   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39934   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39935   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39936   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
39937   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39938     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39939     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39940   fi
39941 
39942     # Output is in $new_path
39943 
39944   windows_path="$new_path"
39945   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39946     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39947     new_path="$unix_path"
39948   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39949     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39950     new_path="$unix_path"
39951   fi
39952 
39953     # remove trailing .exe if any
39954     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39955 
39956     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
39957     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
39958   fi
39959 
39960   else
39961     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
39962     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39963     # space.
39964     complete="$BUILD_CC"
39965     path="${complete%% *}"
39966     tmp="$complete EOL"
39967     arguments="${tmp#* }"
39968 
39969     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
39970     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
39971     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
39972       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
39973       IFS_save="$IFS"
39974       IFS=:
39975       for p in $PATH; do
39976         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
39977           new_path="$p/$path"
39978           break
39979         fi
39980       done
39981       IFS="$IFS_save"
39982     else
39983       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
39984       new_path="$path"
39985     fi
39986 
39987     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39988       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39989 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39990       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39991       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39992         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
39993 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39994       fi
39995       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39996     fi
39997   fi
39998 
39999   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
40000   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
40001     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
40002   else
40003     new_complete="$new_path"
40004   fi
40005 
40006   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40007     BUILD_CC="$new_complete"
40008     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40009 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40010   fi
40011 
40012 
40013 
40014   # Publish this variable in the help.
40015 
40016 
40017   if test "x$BUILD_CXX" = x; then
40018     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
40019     for ac_prog in cl CC g++
40020 do
40021   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40022 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40023 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40024 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40025 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40026   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40027 else
40028   case $BUILD_CXX in
40029   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40030   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40031   ;;
40032   *)
40033   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40034 for as_dir in $PATH
40035 do
40036   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40037   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40038     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40039   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40040     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40041     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40042     break 2
40043   fi
40044 done
40045   done
40046 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40047 
40048   ;;
40049 esac
40050 fi
40051 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40052 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40053   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40054 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40055 else
40056   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40057 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40058 fi
40059 
40060 
40061   test -n "$BUILD_CXX" && break
40062 done
40063 
40064   else
40065     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
40066 
40067     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_CXX! from our list.
40068     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_CXX!/}
40069     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
40070       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
40071       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
40072       if test "xBUILD_CXX" != xBASH; then
40073         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CXX from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
40074 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CXX from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
40075       fi
40076       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
40077       for ac_prog in cl CC g++
40078 do
40079   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40080 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40081 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40082 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40083 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40084   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40085 else
40086   case $BUILD_CXX in
40087   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40088   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40089   ;;
40090   *)
40091   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40092 for as_dir in $PATH
40093 do
40094   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40095   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40096     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40097   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40098     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40099     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40100     break 2
40101   fi
40102 done
40103   done
40104 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40105 
40106   ;;
40107 esac
40108 fi
40109 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40110 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40111   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40112 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40113 else
40114   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40115 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40116 fi
40117 
40118 
40119   test -n "$BUILD_CXX" && break
40120 done
40121 
40122     else
40123       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
40124       # for the tool.
40125 
40126       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
40127       # for unknown variables in the end.
40128       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
40129 
40130       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
40131       tool_specified="$BUILD_CXX"
40132       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
40133       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
40134         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
40135         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_basename" >&5
40136 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_basename" >&6;}
40137         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
40138 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
40139 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40140 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40141 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40142   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40143 else
40144   case $BUILD_CXX in
40145   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40146   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40147   ;;
40148   *)
40149   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40150 for as_dir in $PATH
40151 do
40152   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40153   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40154     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40155   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40156     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40157     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40158     break 2
40159   fi
40160 done
40161   done
40162 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40163 
40164   ;;
40165 esac
40166 fi
40167 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40168 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40169   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40170 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40171 else
40172   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40173 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40174 fi
40175 
40176 
40177         if test "x$BUILD_CXX" = x; then
40178           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
40179         fi
40180       else
40181         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
40182         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified" >&5
40183 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified" >&6;}
40184         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_CXX" >&5
40185 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_CXX... " >&6; }
40186         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
40187           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
40188 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
40189           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
40190         fi
40191         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
40192 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
40193       fi
40194     fi
40195   fi
40196 
40197 
40198 
40199   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40200 
40201   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40202   # space.
40203   complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40204   path="${complete%% *}"
40205   tmp="$complete EOL"
40206   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40207 
40208   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40209   # unix format.
40210   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40211 
40212   # Now try to locate executable using which
40213   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40214   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40215   # to not find them
40216   if test "x$new_path" = x \
40217       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40218       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40219     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40220   fi
40221   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40222     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40223     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40224     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40225     # argument.
40226     path="$complete"
40227     arguments="EOL"
40228     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40229     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40230     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40231     # to not find them
40232     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40233         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40234         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40235       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40236     fi
40237     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40238       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40239       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40240 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40241       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40242       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40243         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40244 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40245       fi
40246       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40247     fi
40248   fi
40249 
40250   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
40251   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
40252   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
40253   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
40254   #
40255   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
40256   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
40257   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40258   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
40259     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
40260     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
40261     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
40262       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
40263     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
40264       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
40265     else
40266       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
40267 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
40268       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
40269 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
40270       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40271     fi
40272   else
40273     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
40274   fi
40275 
40276   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
40277   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
40278   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40279 
40280   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40281   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40282   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40283   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40284   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40285   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
40286   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40287     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40288     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
40289     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40290     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
40291       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
40292       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
40293       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40294       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
40295       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40296       new_path="$input_path"
40297     fi
40298   fi
40299 
40300   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
40301   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
40302     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
40303     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
40304       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
40305       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
40306       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
40307     fi
40308   fi
40309 
40310   # remove trailing .exe if any
40311   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40312 
40313   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40314 
40315   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40316   # space.
40317   complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40318   path="${complete%% *}"
40319   tmp="$complete EOL"
40320   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40321 
40322   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40323   # unix format.
40324   new_path="$path"
40325 
40326   windows_path="$new_path"
40327   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40328     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40329     new_path="$unix_path"
40330   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40331     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40332     new_path="$unix_path"
40333   fi
40334 
40335 
40336   # Now try to locate executable using which
40337   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40338 
40339   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40340     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40341     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40342     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40343     # argument.
40344     path="$complete"
40345     arguments="EOL"
40346     new_path="$path"
40347 
40348   windows_path="$new_path"
40349   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40350     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40351     new_path="$unix_path"
40352   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40353     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40354     new_path="$unix_path"
40355   fi
40356 
40357 
40358     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40359     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
40360     # to not find them
40361     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40362         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40363         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40364       new_path="$path"
40365 
40366   windows_path="$new_path"
40367   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40368     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40369     new_path="$unix_path"
40370   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40371     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40372     new_path="$unix_path"
40373   fi
40374 
40375     fi
40376 
40377     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40378       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40379       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40380 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40381       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40382       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40383         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40384 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40385       fi
40386       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40387     fi
40388   fi
40389 
40390   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
40391   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
40392     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
40393     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40394     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
40395   else
40396     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
40397     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
40398 
40399   input_path="$new_path"
40400   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40401   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40402   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40403   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40404   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
40405   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40406     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40407     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40408   fi
40409 
40410     # Output is in $new_path
40411 
40412   windows_path="$new_path"
40413   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40414     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40415     new_path="$unix_path"
40416   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40417     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40418     new_path="$unix_path"
40419   fi
40420 
40421     # remove trailing .exe if any
40422     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40423 
40424     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
40425     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
40426   fi
40427 
40428   else
40429     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
40430     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40431     # space.
40432     complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40433     path="${complete%% *}"
40434     tmp="$complete EOL"
40435     arguments="${tmp#* }"
40436 
40437     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
40438     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
40439     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
40440       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
40441       IFS_save="$IFS"
40442       IFS=:
40443       for p in $PATH; do
40444         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
40445           new_path="$p/$path"
40446           break
40447         fi
40448       done
40449       IFS="$IFS_save"
40450     else
40451       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
40452       new_path="$path"
40453     fi
40454 
40455     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40456       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40457 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40458       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40459       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40460         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
40461 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40462       fi
40463       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40464     fi
40465   fi
40466 
40467   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
40468   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
40469     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
40470   else
40471     new_complete="$new_path"
40472   fi
40473 
40474   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40475     BUILD_CXX="$new_complete"
40476     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40477 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40478   fi
40479 
40480 
40481
