40482   # Publish this variable in the help.
40483 
40484 
40485   if test "x$BUILD_LD" = x; then
40486     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
40487     for ac_prog in ld
40488 do
40489   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40490 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40491 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40492 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40493 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40494   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40495 else
40496   case $BUILD_LD in
40497   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40498   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40499   ;;
40500   *)
40501   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40502 for as_dir in $PATH
40503 do
40504   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40505   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40506     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40507   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40508     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40509     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40510     break 2
40511   fi
40512 done
40513   done
40514 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40515 
40516   ;;
40517 esac
40518 fi
40519 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40520 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40521   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40522 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40523 else
40524   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40525 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40526 fi
40527 
40528 
40529   test -n "$BUILD_LD" && break
40530 done
40531 
40532   else
40533     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
40534 
40535     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_LD! from our list.
40536     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_LD!/}
40537     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
40538       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
40539       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
40540       if test "xBUILD_LD" != xBASH; then
40541         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_LD from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
40542 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_LD from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
40543       fi
40544       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
40545       for ac_prog in ld
40546 do
40547   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40548 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40549 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40550 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40551 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40552   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40553 else
40554   case $BUILD_LD in
40555   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40556   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40557   ;;
40558   *)
40559   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40560 for as_dir in $PATH
40561 do
40562   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40563   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40564     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40565   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40566     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40567     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40568     break 2
40569   fi
40570 done
40571   done
40572 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40573 
40574   ;;
40575 esac
40576 fi
40577 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40578 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40579   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40580 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40581 else
40582   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40583 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40584 fi
40585 
40586 
40587   test -n "$BUILD_LD" && break
40588 done
40589 
40590     else
40591       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
40592       # for the tool.
40593 
40594       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
40595       # for unknown variables in the end.
40596       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
40597 
40598       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
40599       tool_specified="$BUILD_LD"
40600       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
40601       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
40602         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
40603         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_basename" >&5
40604 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_basename" >&6;}
40605         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
40606 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
40607 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40608 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40609 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40610   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40611 else
40612   case $BUILD_LD in
40613   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40614   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40615   ;;
40616   *)
40617   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40618 for as_dir in $PATH
40619 do
40620   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40621   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40622     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40623   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40624     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40625     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40626     break 2
40627   fi
40628 done
40629   done
40630 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40631 
40632   ;;
40633 esac
40634 fi
40635 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40636 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40637   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40638 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40639 else
40640   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40641 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40642 fi
40643 
40644 
40645         if test "x$BUILD_LD" = x; then
40646           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
40647         fi
40648       else
40649         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
40650         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified" >&5
40651 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified" >&6;}
40652         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_LD" >&5
40653 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_LD... " >&6; }
40654         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
40655           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
40656 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
40657           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
40658         fi
40659         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
40660 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
40661       fi
40662     fi
40663   fi
40664 
40665 
40666 
40667   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40668 
40669   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40670   # space.
40671   complete="$BUILD_LD"
40672   path="${complete%% *}"
40673   tmp="$complete EOL"
40674   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40675 
40676   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40677   # unix format.
40678   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40679 
40680   # Now try to locate executable using which
40681   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40682   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40683   # to not find them
40684   if test "x$new_path" = x \
40685       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40686       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40687     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40688   fi
40689   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40690     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40691     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40692     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40693     # argument.
40694     path="$complete"
40695     arguments="EOL"
40696     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40697     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40698     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40699     # to not find them
40700     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40701         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40702         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40703       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40704     fi
40705     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40706       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40707       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40708 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40709       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40710       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40711         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40712 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40713       fi
40714       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40715     fi
40716   fi
40717 
40718   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
40719   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
40720   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
40721   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
40722   #
40723   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
40724   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
40725   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40726   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
40727     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
40728     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
40729     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
40730       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
40731     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
40732       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
40733     else
40734       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
40735 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
40736       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
40737 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
40738       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40739     fi
40740   else
40741     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
40742   fi
40743 
40744   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
40745   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
40746   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40747 
40748   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40749   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40750   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40751   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40752   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40753   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
40754   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40755     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40756     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
40757     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40758     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
40759       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
40760       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
40761       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40762       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
40763       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40764       new_path="$input_path"
40765     fi
40766   fi
40767 
40768   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
40769   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
40770     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
40771     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
40772       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
40773       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
40774       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
40775     fi
40776   fi
40777 
40778   # remove trailing .exe if any
40779   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40780 
40781   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40782 
40783   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40784   # space.
40785   complete="$BUILD_LD"
40786   path="${complete%% *}"
40787   tmp="$complete EOL"
40788   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40789 
40790   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40791   # unix format.
40792   new_path="$path"
40793 
40794   windows_path="$new_path"
40795   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40796     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40797     new_path="$unix_path"
40798   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40799     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40800     new_path="$unix_path"
40801   fi
40802 
40803 
40804   # Now try to locate executable using which
40805   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40806 
40807   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40808     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40809     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40810     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40811     # argument.
40812     path="$complete"
40813     arguments="EOL"
40814     new_path="$path"
40815 
40816   windows_path="$new_path"
40817   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40818     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40819     new_path="$unix_path"
40820   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40821     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40822     new_path="$unix_path"
40823   fi
40824 
40825 
40826     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40827     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
40828     # to not find them
40829     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40830         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40831         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40832       new_path="$path"
40833 
40834   windows_path="$new_path"
40835   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40836     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40837     new_path="$unix_path"
40838   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40839     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40840     new_path="$unix_path"
40841   fi
40842 
40843     fi
40844 
40845     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40846       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40847       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40848 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40849       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40850       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40851         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40852 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40853       fi
40854       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40855     fi
40856   fi
40857 
40858   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
40859   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
40860     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
40861     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40862     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
40863   else
40864     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
40865     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
40866 
40867   input_path="$new_path"
40868   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40869   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40870   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40871   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40872   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
40873   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40874     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40875     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40876   fi
40877 
40878     # Output is in $new_path
40879 
40880   windows_path="$new_path"
40881   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40882     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40883     new_path="$unix_path"
40884   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40885     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40886     new_path="$unix_path"
40887   fi
40888 
40889     # remove trailing .exe if any
40890     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40891 
40892     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
40893     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
40894   fi
40895 
40896   else
40897     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
40898     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40899     # space.
40900     complete="$BUILD_LD"
40901     path="${complete%% *}"
40902     tmp="$complete EOL"
40903     arguments="${tmp#* }"
40904 
40905     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
40906     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
40907     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
40908       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
40909       IFS_save="$IFS"
40910       IFS=:
40911       for p in $PATH; do
40912         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
40913           new_path="$p/$path"
40914           break
40915         fi
40916       done
40917       IFS="$IFS_save"
40918     else
40919       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
40920       new_path="$path"
40921     fi
40922 
40923     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40924       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40925 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40926       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40927       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40928         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
40929 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40930       fi
40931       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40932     fi
40933   fi
40934 
40935   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
40936   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
40937     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
40938   else
40939     new_complete="$new_path"
40940   fi
40941 
40942   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40943     BUILD_LD="$new_complete"
40944     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40945 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40946   fi
40947 
40948   else
40949     # If we are not cross compiling, use the normal target compilers for
40950     # building the build platform executables.
40951     BUILD_CC="$CC"
40952     BUILD_CXX="$CXX"
40953     BUILD_LD="$LD"
40954   fi
40955 
40956 
40957 
40958 
40959 
40960 
40961   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
40962     # For hotspot, we need these in Windows mixed path,
40963     # so rewrite them all. Need added .exe suffix.
40964     HOTSPOT_CXX="$CXX.exe"
40965     HOTSPOT_LD="$LD.exe"
40966     HOTSPOT_MT="$MT.exe"
40967     HOTSPOT_RC="$RC.exe"
40968 
40969   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_CXX"
40970   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40971     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40972     HOTSPOT_CXX="$windows_path"
40973   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40974     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40975     HOTSPOT_CXX="$windows_path"
40976   fi
40977 
40978 
40979   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_LD"
40980   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40981     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40982     HOTSPOT_LD="$windows_path"
40983   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40984     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40985     HOTSPOT_LD="$windows_path"
40986   fi
40987 
40988 
40989   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_MT"
40990   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40991     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40992     HOTSPOT_MT="$windows_path"
40993   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40994     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40995     HOTSPOT_MT="$windows_path"
40996   fi
40997 
40998 
40999   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_RC"
41000   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
41001     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
41002     HOTSPOT_RC="$windows_path"
41003   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
41004     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
41005     HOTSPOT_RC="$windows_path"
41006   fi
41007 
41008 
41009 
41010   else
41011     HOTSPOT_CXX="$CXX"
41012     HOTSPOT_LD="$LD"
41013   fi
41014 
41015 
41016 
41017   if test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
41018     USE_CLANG=true
41019   fi
41020 
41021 
41022   # LDEXE is the linker to use, when creating executables. Not really used.
41023   # FIXME: These should just be removed!
41024   LDEXE="$LD"
41025   LDEXECXX="$LDCXX"
41026 
41027 
41028 
41029 
41030 
41031 
41032   # The package path is used only on macosx?
41033   # FIXME: clean this up, and/or move it elsewhere.
41034   PACKAGE_PATH=/opt/local
41035 
41036 
41037   # Check for extra potential brokenness.
41038   if test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41039     # On Windows, double-check that we got the right compiler.
41040     CC_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$CC 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
41041     COMPILER_CPU_TEST=`$ECHO $CC_VERSION_OUTPUT | $SED -n "s/^.* \(.*\)$/\1/p"`
41042     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = "xx86"; then
41043       if test "x$COMPILER_CPU_TEST" != "x80x86"; then
41044         as_fn_error $? "Target CPU mismatch. We are building for $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU but CL is for \"$COMPILER_CPU_TEST\"; expected \"80x86\"." "$LINENO" 5
41045       fi
41046     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = "xx86_64"; then
41047       if test "x$COMPILER_CPU_TEST" != "xx64"; then
41048         as_fn_error $? "Target CPU mismatch. We are building for $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU but CL is for \"$COMPILER_CPU_TEST\"; expected \"x64\"." "$LINENO" 5
41049       fi
41050     fi
41051   fi
41052 
41053   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41054     # If this is a --hash-style=gnu system, use --hash-style=both, why?
41055     HAS_GNU_HASH=`$CC -dumpspecs 2>/dev/null | $GREP 'hash-style=gnu'`
41056     # This is later checked when setting flags.
41057 
41058     # "-Og" suppported for GCC 4.8 and later
41059     CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG="-Og"
41060 
41061   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"$CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG\"" >&5
41062 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"$CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41063   supports=yes
41064 
41065   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
41066   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG"
41067   ac_ext=c
41068 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41069 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41070 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41071 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41072 
41073   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41074 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41075 int i;
41076 _ACEOF
41077 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41078 
41079 else
41080   supports=no
41081 fi
41082 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41083   ac_ext=cpp
41084 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41085 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41086 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41087 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41088 
41089   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
41090 
41091   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
41092   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG $CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG"
41093   ac_ext=cpp
41094 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41095 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41096 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41097 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41098 
41099   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41100 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41101 int i;
41102 _ACEOF
41103 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41104 
41105 else
41106   supports=no
41107 fi
41108 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41109   ac_ext=cpp
41110 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41111 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41112 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41113 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41114 
41115   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
41116 
41117   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41118 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41119   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41120     HAS_CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG=true
41121   else
41122     HAS_CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG=false
41123   fi
41124 
41125 
41126     # "-z relro" supported in GNU binutils 2.17 and later
41127     LINKER_RELRO_FLAG="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker relro"
41128 
41129   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_RELRO_FLAG\"" >&5
41130 $as_echo_n "checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_RELRO_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41131   supports=yes
41132 
41133   saved_ldflags="$LDFLAGS"
41134   LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
41135   ac_ext=c
41136 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41137 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41138 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41139 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41140 
41141   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41142 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41143 
41144 int
41145 main ()
41146 {
41147 
41148   ;
41149   return 0;
41150 }
41151 _ACEOF
41152 if ac_fn_c_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
41153 
41154 else
41155   supports=no
41156 fi
41157 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
41158     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
41159   ac_ext=cpp
41160 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41161 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41162 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41163 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41164 
41165   LDFLAGS="$saved_ldflags"
41166 
41167   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41168 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41169   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41170     HAS_LINKER_RELRO=true
41171   else
41172     HAS_LINKER_RELRO=false
41173   fi
41174 
41175 
41176     # "-z now" supported in GNU binutils 2.11 and later
41177     LINKER_NOW_FLAG="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker now"
41178 
41179   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_NOW_FLAG\"" >&5
41180 $as_echo_n "checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_NOW_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41181   supports=yes
41182 
41183   saved_ldflags="$LDFLAGS"
41184   LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
41185   ac_ext=c
41186 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41187 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41188 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41189 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41190 
41191   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41192 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41193 
41194 int
41195 main ()
41196 {
41197 
41198   ;
41199   return 0;
41200 }
41201 _ACEOF
41202 if ac_fn_c_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
41203 
41204 else
41205   supports=no
41206 fi
41207 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
41208     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
41209   ac_ext=cpp
41210 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41211 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41212 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41213 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41214 
41215   LDFLAGS="$saved_ldflags"
41216 
41217   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41218 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41219   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41220     HAS_LINKER_NOW=true
41221   else
41222     HAS_LINKER_NOW=false
41223   fi
41224 
41225   fi
41226 
41227   # Check for broken SuSE 'ld' for which 'Only anonymous version tag is allowed
41228   # in executable.'
41229   USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=no
41230   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux && test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41231     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for broken SuSE 'ld' which only understands anonymous version tags in executables" >&5
41232 $as_echo_n "checking for broken SuSE 'ld' which only understands anonymous version tags in executables... " >&6; }
41233     $ECHO "SUNWprivate_1.1 { local: *; };" > version-script.map
41234     $ECHO "int main() { }" > main.c
41235     if $CXX -Xlinker -version-script=version-script.map main.c 2>&5 >&5; then
41236       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41237 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41238       USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=no
41239     else
41240       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
41241 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
41242       USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=yes
41243     fi
41244     rm -rf version-script.map main.c a.out
41245   fi
41246 
41247 
41248 
41249 # Setup the JTReg Regression Test Harness.
41250 
41251 
41252 # Check whether --with-jtreg was given.
41253 if test "${with_jtreg+set}" = set; then :
41254   withval=$with_jtreg;
41255 else
41256   with_jtreg=no
41257 fi
41258 
41259 
41260   if test "x$with_jtreg" = xno; then
41261     # jtreg disabled
41262     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jtreg" >&5
41263 $as_echo_n "checking for jtreg... " >&6; }
41264     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41265 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41266   else
41267     if test "x$with_jtreg" != xyes; then
41268       # with path specified.
41269       JT_HOME="$with_jtreg"
41270     fi
41271 
41272     if test "x$JT_HOME" != x; then
41273       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jtreg" >&5
41274 $as_echo_n "checking for jtreg... " >&6; }
41275 
41276       # use JT_HOME enviroment var.
41277 
41278   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
41279 
41280   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
41281   # unix format.
41282   path="$JT_HOME"
41283   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
41284 
41285   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
41286   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
41287   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
41288   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
41289   #
41290   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
41291   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
41292   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
41293   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
41294     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
41295 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
41296     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of JT_HOME" "$LINENO" 5
41297   fi
41298 
41299   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
41300   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
41301 
41302   input_path="$new_path"
41303   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
41304   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
41305   # take no chances and rewrite it.
41306   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
41307   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
41308   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
41309     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
41310     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
41311     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
41312     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
41313       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
41314       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
41315       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
41316       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
41317       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
41318       new_path="$input_path"
41319     fi
41320   fi
41321 
41322   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
41323   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
41324     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
41325     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
41326       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
41327       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
41328       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
41329     fi
41330   fi
41331 
41332 
41333   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
41334     JT_HOME="$new_path"
41335     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&5
41336 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
41337   fi
41338 
41339   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
41340 
41341   path="$JT_HOME"
41342   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
41343   new_path="$path"
41344   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
41345     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
41346     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
41347   fi
41348 
41349 
41350   input_path="$new_path"
41351   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
41352   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
41353   # take no chances and rewrite it.
41354   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
41355   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
41356   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
41357     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
41358     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
41359   fi
41360 
41361 
41362   windows_path="$new_path"
41363   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
41364     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
41365     new_path="$unix_path"
41366   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
41367     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
41368     new_path="$unix_path"
41369   fi
41370 
41371   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
41372     JT_HOME="$new_path"
41373     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&5
41374 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
41375   fi
41376 
41377   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
41378   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
41379 
41380   else
41381     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
41382     path="$JT_HOME"
41383     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
41384     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
41385       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
41386 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
41387       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
41388     fi
41389 
41390     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
41391     eval path="$path"
41392     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
41393       as_fn_error $? "The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
41394     fi
41395 
41396     JT_HOME="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
41397   fi
41398 
41399 
41400       # jtreg win32 script works for everybody
41401       JTREGEXE="$JT_HOME/win32/bin/jtreg"
41402 
41403       if test ! -f "$JTREGEXE"; then
41404         as_fn_error $? "JTReg executable does not exist: $JTREGEXE" "$LINENO" 5
41405       fi
41406 
41407       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41408 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41409     else
41410       # try to find jtreg on path
41411 
41412 
41413 
41414   # Publish this variable in the help.
41415 
41416 
41417   if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41418     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
41419     for ac_prog in jtreg
41420 do
41421   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
41422 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
41423 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41424 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41425 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41426   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41427 else
41428   case $JTREGEXE in
41429   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41430   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41431   ;;
41432   *)
41433   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41434 for as_dir in $PATH
41435 do
41436   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41437   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41438     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41439   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41440     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41441     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41442     break 2
41443   fi
41444 done
41445   done
41446 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41447 
41448   ;;
41449 esac
41450 fi
41451 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41452 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41453   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41454 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41455 else
41456   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41457 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41458 fi
41459 
41460 
41461   test -n "$JTREGEXE" && break
41462 done
41463 
41464   else
41465     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
41466 
41467     # Try to remove the string !JTREGEXE! from our list.
41468     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!JTREGEXE!/}
41469     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
41470       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
41471       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
41472       if test "xJTREGEXE" != xBASH; then
41473         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of JTREGEXE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
41474 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of JTREGEXE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
41475       fi
41476       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
41477       for ac_prog in jtreg
41478 do
41479   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
41480 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
41481 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41482 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41483 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41484   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41485 else
41486   case $JTREGEXE in
41487   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41488   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41489   ;;
41490   *)
41491   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41492 for as_dir in $PATH
41493 do
41494   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41495   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41496     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41497   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41498     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41499     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41500     break 2
41501   fi
41502 done
41503   done
41504 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41505 
41506   ;;
41507 esac
41508 fi
41509 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41510 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41511   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41512 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41513 else
41514   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41515 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41516 fi
41517 
41518 
41519   test -n "$JTREGEXE" && break
41520 done
41521 
41522     else
41523       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
41524       # for the tool.
41525 
41526       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
41527       # for unknown variables in the end.
41528       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
41529 
41530       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
41531       tool_specified="$JTREGEXE"
41532       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
41533       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
41534         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
41535         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_basename" >&5
41536 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_basename" >&6;}
41537         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
41538 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
41539 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41540 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41541 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41542   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41543 else
41544   case $JTREGEXE in
41545   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41546   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41547   ;;
41548   *)
41549   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41550 for as_dir in $PATH
41551 do
41552   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41553   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41554     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41555   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41556     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41557     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41558     break 2
41559   fi
41560 done
41561   done
41562 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41563 
41564   ;;
41565 esac
41566 fi
41567 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41568 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41569   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41570 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41571 else
41572   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41573 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41574 fi
41575 
41576 
41577         if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41578           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
41579         fi
41580       else
41581         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
41582         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified" >&5
41583 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified" >&6;}
41584         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for JTREGEXE" >&5
41585 $as_echo_n "checking for JTREGEXE... " >&6; }
41586         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
41587           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
41588 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
41589           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
41590         fi
41591         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
41592 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
41593       fi
41594     fi
41595   fi
41596 
41597 
41598 
41599   if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41600     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for JTREGEXE" "$LINENO" 5
41601   fi
41602 
41603 
41604       JT_HOME="`$DIRNAME $JTREGEXE`"
41605     fi
41606   fi
41607 
41608 
41609 
41610 
41611 
41612 
41613   # Option used to tell the compiler whether to create 32- or 64-bit executables
41614   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
41615     COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG="-q"
41616   else
41617     COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG="-m"
41618   fi
41619 
41620 
41621   # FIXME: figure out if we should select AR flags depending on OS or toolchain.
41622   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41623     ARFLAGS="-r"
41624   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41625     ARFLAGS="-X64"
41626   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
41627     # lib.exe is used as AR to create static libraries.
41628     ARFLAGS="-nologo -NODEFAULTLIB:MSVCRT"
41629   else
41630     ARFLAGS=""
41631   fi
41632 
41633 
41634   ## Setup strip.
41635   # FIXME: should this really be per platform, or should it be per toolchain type?
41636   # strip is not provided by clang or solstudio; so guessing platform makes most sense.
41637   # FIXME: we should really only export STRIPFLAGS from here, not POST_STRIP_CMD.
41638   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
41639     STRIPFLAGS="-g"
41640   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41641     STRIPFLAGS="-x"
41642   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41643     STRIPFLAGS="-S"
41644   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41645     STRIPFLAGS="-X32_64"
41646   fi
41647 
41648   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xwindows; then
41649     POST_STRIP_CMD="$STRIP $STRIPFLAGS"
41650   fi
41651 
41652 
41653   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41654     # FIXME: break out into MCSFLAGS
41655     POST_MCS_CMD="$MCS -d -a \"JDK $FULL_VERSION\""
41656   fi
41657 
41658 
41659   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41660     CC_OUT_OPTION=-Fo
41661     EXE_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41662     LD_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41663     AR_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41664   else
41665     # The option used to specify the target .o,.a or .so file.
41666     # When compiling, how to specify the to be created object file.
41667     CC_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41668     # When linking, how to specify the to be created executable.
41669     EXE_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41670     # When linking, how to specify the to be created dynamically linkable library.
41671     LD_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41672     # When archiving, how to specify the to be create static archive for object files.
41673     AR_OUT_OPTION='rcs$(SPACE)'
41674   fi
41675 
41676 
41677 
41678 
41679 
41680   # On Windows, we need to set RC flags.
41681   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41682     RC_FLAGS="-nologo -l0x409"
41683     if test "x$VARIANT" = xOPT; then
41684       RC_FLAGS="$RC_FLAGS -DNDEBUG"
41685     fi
41686 
41687     # The version variables used to create RC_FLAGS may be overridden
41688     # in a custom configure script, or possibly the command line.
41689     # Let those variables be expanded at make time in spec.gmk.
41690     # The \$ are escaped to the shell, and the $(...) variables
41691     # are evaluated by make.
41692     RC_FLAGS="$RC_FLAGS \
41693         -D\"JDK_BUILD_ID=\$(FULL_VERSION)\" \
41694         -D\"JDK_COMPANY=\$(COMPANY_NAME)\" \
41695         -D\"JDK_COMPONENT=\$(PRODUCT_NAME) \$(JDK_RC_PLATFORM_NAME) binary\" \
41696         -D\"JDK_VER=\$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION).\$(JDK_MICRO_VERSION).\$(if \$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),\$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),0).\$(COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER)\" \
41697         -D\"JDK_COPYRIGHT=Copyright \xA9 $COPYRIGHT_YEAR\" \
41698         -D\"JDK_NAME=\$(PRODUCT_NAME) \$(JDK_RC_PLATFORM_NAME) \$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION) \$(JDK_UPDATE_META_TAG)\" \
41699         -D\"JDK_FVER=\$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION),\$(JDK_MICRO_VERSION),\$(if \$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),\$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),0),\$(COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER)\""
41700   fi
41701 
41702 
41703   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41704     # silence copyright notice and other headers.
41705     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS -nologo"
41706   fi
41707 
41708   if test "x$SYSROOT" != "x"; then
41709     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
41710       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41711         # Solaris Studio does not have a concept of sysroot. Instead we must
41712         # make sure the default include and lib dirs are appended to each
41713         # compile and link command line.
41714         SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/usr/include"
41715         SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="-L$SYSROOT/usr/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
41716             -L$SYSROOT/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
41717             -L$SYSROOT/usr/ccs/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
41718       fi
41719     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41720       # Apple only wants -isysroot <path>, but we also need -iframework<path>/System/Library/Frameworks
41721       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\" -iframework\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks\""
41722       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS=$SYSROOT_CFLAGS
41723     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41724       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="--sysroot=$SYSROOT"
41725       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="--sysroot=$SYSROOT"
41726     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
41727       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\""
41728       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\""
41729     fi
41730     # Propagate the sysroot args to hotspot
41731     LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS"
41732     LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS"
41733     LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS $SYSROOT_LDFLAGS"
41734   fi
41735 
41736   # These always need to be set, or we can't find the frameworks embedded in JavaVM.framework
41737   # set this here so it doesn't have to be peppered throughout the forest
41738   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41739     SYSROOT_CFLAGS="$SYSROOT_CFLAGS -F\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Frameworks\""
41740     SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="$SYSROOT_LDFLAGS -F\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Frameworks\""
41741   fi
41742 
41743 
41744 
41745 
41746 
41747 # FIXME: Currently we must test this after toolchain but before flags. Fix!
41748 
41749 # Now we can test some aspects on the target using configure macros.
41750 
41751 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
41752 $as_echo_n "checking for ANSI C header files... " >&6; }
41753 if ${ac_cv_header_stdc+:} false; then :
41754   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41755 else
41756   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41757 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41758 #include <stdlib.h>
41759 #include <stdarg.h>
41760 #include <string.h>
41761 #include <float.h>
41762 
41763 int
41764 main ()
41765 {
41766 
41767   ;
41768   return 0;
41769 }
41770 _ACEOF
41771 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41772   ac_cv_header_stdc=yes
41773 else
41774   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41775 fi
41776 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41777 
41778 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41779   # SunOS 4.x string.h does not declare mem*, contrary to ANSI.
41780   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41781 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41782 #include <string.h>
41783 
41784 _ACEOF
41785 if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
41786   $EGREP "memchr" >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
41787 
41788 else
41789   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41790 fi
41791 rm -f conftest*
41792 
41793 fi
41794 
41795 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41796   # ISC 2.0.2 stdlib.h does not declare free, contrary to ANSI.
41797   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41798 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41799 #include <stdlib.h>
41800 
41801 _ACEOF
41802 if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
41803   $EGREP "free" >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
41804 
41805 else
41806   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41807 fi
41808 rm -f conftest*
41809 
41810 fi
41811 
41812 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41813   # /bin/cc in Irix-4.0.5 gets non-ANSI ctype macros unless using -ansi.
41814   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then :
41815   :
41816 else
41817   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41818 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41819 #include <ctype.h>
41820 #include <stdlib.h>
41821 #if ((' ' & 0x0FF) == 0x020)
41822 # define ISLOWER(c) ('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z')
41823 # define TOUPPER(c) (ISLOWER(c) ? 'A' + ((c) - 'a') : (c))
41824 #else
41825 # define ISLOWER(c) \
41826                    (('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'i') \
41827                      || ('j' <= (c) && (c) <= 'r') \
41828                      || ('s' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z'))
41829 # define TOUPPER(c) (ISLOWER(c) ? ((c) | 0x40) : (c))
41830 #endif
41831 
41832 #define XOR(e, f) (((e) && !(f)) || (!(e) && (f)))
41833 int
41834 main ()
41835 {
41836   int i;
41837   for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
41838     if (XOR (islower (i), ISLOWER (i))
41839         || toupper (i) != TOUPPER (i))
41840       return 2;
41841   return 0;
41842 }
41843 _ACEOF
41844 if ac_fn_cxx_try_run "$LINENO"; then :
41845 
41846 else
41847   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41848 fi
41849 rm -f core *.core core.conftest.* gmon.out bb.out conftest$ac_exeext \
41850   conftest.$ac_objext conftest.beam conftest.$ac_ext
41851 fi
41852 
41853 fi
41854 fi
41855 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_header_stdc" >&5
41856 $as_echo "$ac_cv_header_stdc" >&6; }
41857 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41858 
41859 $as_echo "#define STDC_HEADERS 1" >>confdefs.h
41860 
41861 fi
41862 
41863 # On IRIX 5.3, sys/types and inttypes.h are conflicting.
41864 for ac_header in sys/types.h sys/stat.h stdlib.h string.h memory.h strings.h \
41865                   inttypes.h stdint.h unistd.h
41866 do :
41867   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
41868 ac_fn_cxx_check_header_compile "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "$ac_includes_default
41869 "
41870 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
41871   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41872 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
41873 _ACEOF
41874 
41875 fi
41876 
41877 done
41878 
41879 
41880 
41881   ###############################################################################
41882   #
41883   # Now we check if libjvm.so will use 32 or 64 bit pointers for the C/C++ code.
41884   # (The JVM can use 32 or 64 bit Java pointers but that decision
41885   # is made at runtime.)
41886   #
41887 
41888   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41889     # Always specify -m flag on Solaris
41890     # And -q on AIX because otherwise the compiler produces 32-bit objects by default
41891 
41892   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
41893   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
41894   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
41895   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
41896   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41897   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41898   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41899 
41900   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41901   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41902   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41903 
41904   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41905   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41906   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41907 
41908   elif test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xreduced; then
41909     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE" = xunix; then
41910       # Specify -m if running reduced on unix platforms
41911 
41912   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
41913   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
41914   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
41915   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
41916   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41917   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41918   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41919 
41920   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41921   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41922   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41923 
41924   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41925   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41926   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41927 
41928     fi
41929   fi
41930 
41931   # Make compilation sanity check
41932   for ac_header in stdio.h
41933 do :
41934   ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "stdio.h" "ac_cv_header_stdio_h" "$ac_includes_default"
41935 if test "x$ac_cv_header_stdio_h" = xyes; then :
41936   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41937 #define HAVE_STDIO_H 1
41938 _ACEOF
41939 
41940 else
41941 
41942     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Failed to compile stdio.h. This likely implies missing compile dependencies." >&5
41943 $as_echo "$as_me: Failed to compile stdio.h. This likely implies missing compile dependencies." >&6;}
41944     if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xreduced; then
41945       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You are doing a reduced build. Check that you have 32-bit libraries installed." >&5
41946 $as_echo "$as_me: You are doing a reduced build. Check that you have 32-bit libraries installed." >&6;}
41947     elif test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xcross; then
41948       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You are doing a cross-compilation. Check that you have all target platform libraries installed." >&5
41949 $as_echo "$as_me: You are doing a cross-compilation. Check that you have all target platform libraries installed." >&6;}
41950     fi
41951     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue." "$LINENO" 5
41952 
41953 fi
41954 
41955 done
41956 
41957 
41958   # The cast to long int works around a bug in the HP C Compiler
41959 # version HP92453-01 B.11.11.23709.GP, which incorrectly rejects
41960 # declarations like `int a3[[(sizeof (unsigned char)) >= 0]];'.
41961 # This bug is HP SR number 8606223364.
41962 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking size of int *" >&5
41963 $as_echo_n "checking size of int *... " >&6; }
41964 if ${ac_cv_sizeof_int_p+:} false; then :
41965   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41966 else
41967   if ac_fn_cxx_compute_int "$LINENO" "(long int) (sizeof (int *))" "ac_cv_sizeof_int_p"        "$ac_includes_default"; then :
41968 
41969 else
41970   if test "$ac_cv_type_int_p" = yes; then
41971      { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
41972 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
41973 as_fn_error 77 "cannot compute sizeof (int *)
41974 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
41975    else
41976      ac_cv_sizeof_int_p=0
41977    fi
41978 fi
41979 
41980 fi
41981 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&5
41982 $as_echo "$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&6; }
41983 
41984 
41985 
41986 cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41987 #define SIZEOF_INT_P $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
41988 _ACEOF
41989 
41990 
41991 
41992   # AC_CHECK_SIZEOF defines 'ac_cv_sizeof_int_p' to hold the number of bytes used by an 'int*'
41993   if test "x$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" = x; then
41994     # The test failed, lets stick to the assumed value.
41995     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: The number of bits in the target could not be determined, using $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS." >&5
41996 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: The number of bits in the target could not be determined, using $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS." >&2;}
41997   else
41998     TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS=`expr 8 \* $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p`
41999 
42000     if test "x$TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS"; then
42001       # This situation may happen on 64-bit platforms where the compiler by default only generates 32-bit objects
42002       # Let's try to implicitely set the compilers target architecture and retry the test
42003       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)." >&5
42004 $as_echo "$as_me: The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)." >&6;}
42005       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: I'll retry after setting the platforms compiler target bits flag to ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}" >&5
42006 $as_echo "$as_me: I'll retry after setting the platforms compiler target bits flag to ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}" >&6;}
42007 
42008   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
42009   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
42010   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
42011   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
42012   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42013   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42014   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42015 
42016   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
42017   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
42018   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
42019 
42020   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
42021   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
42022   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
42023 
42024 
42025       # We have to unset 'ac_cv_sizeof_int_p' first, otherwise AC_CHECK_SIZEOF will use the previously cached value!
42026       unset ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
42027       # And we have to undef the definition of SIZEOF_INT_P in confdefs.h by the previous invocation of AC_CHECK_SIZEOF
42028       cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
42029 #undef SIZEOF_INT_P
42030 _ACEOF
42031 
42032       # The cast to long int works around a bug in the HP C Compiler
42033 # version HP92453-01 B.11.11.23709.GP, which incorrectly rejects
42034 # declarations like `int a3[[(sizeof (unsigned char)) >= 0]];'.
42035 # This bug is HP SR number 8606223364.
42036 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking size of int *" >&5
42037 $as_echo_n "checking size of int *... " >&6; }
42038 if ${ac_cv_sizeof_int_p+:} false; then :
42039   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
42040 else
42041   if ac_fn_cxx_compute_int "$LINENO" "(long int) (sizeof (int *))" "ac_cv_sizeof_int_p"        "$ac_includes_default"; then :
42042 
42043 else
42044   if test "$ac_cv_type_int_p" = yes; then
42045      { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
42046 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
42047 as_fn_error 77 "cannot compute sizeof (int *)
42048 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
42049    else
42050      ac_cv_sizeof_int_p=0
42051    fi
42052 fi
42053 
42054 fi
42055 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&5
42056 $as_echo "$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&6; }
42057 
42058 
42059 
42060 cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
42061 #define SIZEOF_INT_P $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
42062 _ACEOF
42063 
42064 
42065 
42066       TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS=`expr 8 \* $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p`
42067 
42068       if test "x$TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS"; then
42069         as_fn_error $? "The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)" "$LINENO" 5
42070       fi
42071     fi
42072   fi
42073 
42074   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for target address size" >&5
42075 $as_echo_n "checking for target address size... " >&6; }
42076   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS bits" >&5
42077 $as_echo "$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS bits" >&6; }
42078 
42079 
42080   ###############################################################################
42081   #
42082   # Is the target little of big endian?
42083   #
42084    { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether byte ordering is bigendian" >&5
42085 $as_echo_n "checking whether byte ordering is bigendian... " >&6; }
42086 if ${ac_cv_c_bigendian+:} false; then :
42087   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
42088 else
42089   ac_cv_c_bigendian=unknown
42090     # See if we're dealing with a universal compiler.
42091     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42092 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42093 #ifndef __APPLE_CC__
42094                not a universal capable compiler
42095              #endif
42096              typedef int dummy;
42097 
42098 _ACEOF
42099 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42100 
42101         # Check for potential -arch flags.  It is not universal unless
42102         # there are at least two -arch flags with different values.
42103         ac_arch=
42104         ac_prev=
42105         for ac_word in $CC $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS; do
42106          if test -n "$ac_prev"; then
42107            case $ac_word in
42108              i?86 | x86_64 | ppc | ppc64)
42109                if test -z "$ac_arch" || test "$ac_arch" = "$ac_word"; then
42110                  ac_arch=$ac_word
42111                else
42112                  ac_cv_c_bigendian=universal
42113                  break
42114                fi
42115                ;;
42116            esac
42117            ac_prev=
42118          elif test "x$ac_word" = "x-arch"; then
42119            ac_prev=arch
42120          fi
42121        done
42122 fi
42123 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42124     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42125       # See if sys/param.h defines the BYTE_ORDER macro.
42126       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42127 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42128 #include <sys/types.h>
42129              #include <sys/param.h>
42130 
42131 int
42132 main ()
42133 {
42134 #if ! (defined BYTE_ORDER && defined BIG_ENDIAN \
42135                      && defined LITTLE_ENDIAN && BYTE_ORDER && BIG_ENDIAN \
42136                      && LITTLE_ENDIAN)
42137               bogus endian macros
42138              #endif
42139 
42140   ;
42141   return 0;
42142 }
42143 _ACEOF
42144 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42145   # It does; now see whether it defined to BIG_ENDIAN or not.
42146          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42147 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42148 #include <sys/types.h>
42149                 #include <sys/param.h>
42150 
42151 int
42152 main ()
42153 {
42154 #if BYTE_ORDER != BIG_ENDIAN
42155                  not big endian
42156                 #endif
42157 
42158   ;
42159   return 0;
42160 }
42161 _ACEOF
42162 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42163   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42164 else
42165   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42166 fi
42167 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42168 fi
42169 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42170     fi
42171     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42172       # See if <limits.h> defines _LITTLE_ENDIAN or _BIG_ENDIAN (e.g., Solaris).
42173       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42174 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42175 #include <limits.h>
42176 
42177 int
42178 main ()
42179 {
42180 #if ! (defined _LITTLE_ENDIAN || defined _BIG_ENDIAN)
42181               bogus endian macros
42182              #endif
42183 
42184   ;
42185   return 0;
42186 }
42187 _ACEOF
42188 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42189   # It does; now see whether it defined to _BIG_ENDIAN or not.
42190          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42191 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42192 #include <limits.h>
42193 
42194 int
42195 main ()
42196 {
42197 #ifndef _BIG_ENDIAN
42198                  not big endian
42199                 #endif
42200 
42201   ;
42202   return 0;
42203 }
42204 _ACEOF
42205 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42206   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42207 else
42208   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42209 fi
42210 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42211 fi
42212 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42213     fi
42214     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42215       # Compile a test program.
42216       if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then :
42217   # Try to guess by grepping values from an object file.
42218          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42219 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42220 short int ascii_mm[] =
42221                   { 0x4249, 0x4765, 0x6E44, 0x6961, 0x6E53, 0x7953, 0 };
42222                 short int ascii_ii[] =
42223                   { 0x694C, 0x5454, 0x656C, 0x6E45, 0x6944, 0x6E61, 0 };
42224                 int use_ascii (int i) {
42225                   return ascii_mm[i] + ascii_ii[i];
42226                 }
42227                 short int ebcdic_ii[] =
42228                   { 0x89D3, 0xE3E3, 0x8593, 0x95C5, 0x89C4, 0x9581, 0 };
42229                 short int ebcdic_mm[] =
42230                   { 0xC2C9, 0xC785, 0x95C4, 0x8981, 0x95E2, 0xA8E2, 0 };
42231                 int use_ebcdic (int i) {
42232                   return ebcdic_mm[i] + ebcdic_ii[i];
42233                 }
42234                 extern int foo;
42235 
42236 int
42237 main ()
42238 {
42239 return use_ascii (foo) == use_ebcdic (foo);
42240   ;
42241   return 0;
42242 }
42243 _ACEOF
42244 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42245   if grep BIGenDianSyS conftest.$ac_objext >/dev/null; then
42246               ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42247             fi
42248             if grep LiTTleEnDian conftest.$ac_objext >/dev/null ; then
42249               if test "$ac_cv_c_bigendian" = unknown; then
42250                 ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42251               else
42252                 # finding both strings is unlikely to happen, but who knows?
42253                 ac_cv_c_bigendian=unknown
42254               fi
42255             fi
42256 fi
42257 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42258 else
42259   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42260 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42261 $ac_includes_default
42262 int
42263 main ()
42264 {
42265 
42266              /* Are we little or big endian?  From Harbison&Steele.  */
42267              union
42268              {
42269                long int l;
42270                char c[sizeof (long int)];
42271              } u;
42272              u.l = 1;
42273              return u.c[sizeof (long int) - 1] == 1;
42274 
42275   ;
42276   return 0;
42277 }
42278 _ACEOF
42279 if ac_fn_cxx_try_run "$LINENO"; then :
42280   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42281 else
42282   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42283 fi
42284 rm -f core *.core core.conftest.* gmon.out bb.out conftest$ac_exeext \
42285   conftest.$ac_objext conftest.beam conftest.$ac_ext
42286 fi
42287 
42288     fi
42289 fi
42290 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_c_bigendian" >&5
42291 $as_echo "$ac_cv_c_bigendian" >&6; }
42292  case $ac_cv_c_bigendian in #(
42293    yes)
42294      ENDIAN="big";; #(
42295    no)
42296      ENDIAN="little" ;; #(
42297    universal)
42298      ENDIAN="universal_endianness"
42299      ;; #(
42300    *)
42301      ENDIAN="unknown" ;;
42302  esac
42303 
42304 
42305   if test "x$ENDIAN" = xuniversal_endianness; then
42306     as_fn_error $? "Building with both big and little endianness is not supported" "$LINENO" 5
42307   fi
42308   if test "x$ENDIAN" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN"; then
42309     as_fn_error $? "The tested endian in the target ($ENDIAN) differs from the endian expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN)" "$LINENO" 5
42310   fi
42311 
42312 
42313 # Configure flags for the tools
42314 
42315   ###############################################################################
42316   #
42317   # How to compile shared libraries.
42318   #
42319 
42320   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42321     PICFLAG="-fPIC"
42322     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42323     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42324 
42325     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42326       # Linking is different on MacOSX
42327       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-dynamiclib -compatibility_version 1.0.0 -current_version 1.0.0 $PICFLAG"
42328       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker @loader_path/.'
42329       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42330       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -install_name -Xlinker @rpath/$1'
42331       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42332     else
42333       # Default works for linux, might work on other platforms as well.
42334       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS='-shared'
42335       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker \$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42336       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker origin $SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42337       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -soname=$1'
42338       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-Xlinker -version-script=$1'
42339     fi
42340   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42341     PICFLAG=''
42342     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42343     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42344 
42345     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42346       # Linking is different on MacOSX
42347       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-dynamiclib -compatibility_version 1.0.0 -current_version 1.0.0 $PICFLAG"
42348       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker @loader_path/.'
42349       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42350       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -install_name -Xlinker @rpath/$1'
42351       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42352     else
42353       # Default works for linux, might work on other platforms as well.
42354       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS='-shared'
42355       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker \$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42356       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker origin $SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42357       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -soname=$1'
42358       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-Xlinker -version-script=$1'
42359     fi
42360   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42361     PICFLAG="-KPIC"
42362     C_FLAG_REORDER='-xF'
42363     CXX_FLAG_REORDER='-xF'
42364     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-G"
42365     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-R\$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42366     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42367     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42368     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-M$1'
42369   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42370     PICFLAG="-qpic=large"
42371     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42372     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42373     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-qmkshrobj"
42374     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN=""
42375     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN=''
42376     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42377     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42378   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42379     PICFLAG=""
42380     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42381     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42382     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-LD"
42383     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN=''
42384     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN=''
42385     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42386     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42387   fi
42388 
42389 
42390 
42391 
42392 
42393 
42394 
42395 
42396 
42397   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42398     CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -D__solaris__"
42399     CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} -D__solaris__"
42400     CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA='-xstrconst'
42401   fi
42402   # The (cross) compiler is now configured, we can now test capabilities
42403   # of the target platform.
42404 
42405 
42406 
42407   ###############################################################################
42408   #
42409   # Setup the opt flags for different compilers
42410   # and different operating systems.
42411   #
42412 
42413   # FIXME: this was indirectly the old default, but just inherited.
42414   # if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42415   #   C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42416   # fi
42417 
42418   # Generate make dependency files
42419   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42420     C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42421   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42422     C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42423   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42424     C_FLAG_DEPS="-xMMD -xMF"
42425   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42426     C_FLAG_DEPS="-qmakedep=gcc -MF"
42427   fi
42428   CXX_FLAG_DEPS="$C_FLAG_DEPS"
42429 
42430 
42431 
42432   # Debug symbols
42433   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42434     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x64" && test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" = "xfastdebug"; then
42435       # reduce from default "-g2" option to save space
42436       CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g1"
42437       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g1"
42438     else
42439       CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42440       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42441     fi
42442   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42443     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42444     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42445   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42446     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g -xs"
42447     # FIXME: likely a bug, this disables debug symbols rather than enables them
42448     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g0 -xs"
42449   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42450     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42451     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42452   fi
42453 
42454 
42455 
42456   # bounds, memory and behavior checking options
42457   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42458     case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42459     release )
42460       # no adjustment
42461       ;;
42462     fastdebug )
42463       # no adjustment
42464       ;;
42465     slowdebug )
42466       # Add runtime stack smashing and undefined behavior checks
42467       CFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS="-fstack-protector-all --param ssp-buffer-size=1"
42468       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS="-fstack-protector-all --param ssp-buffer-size=1"
42469       ;;
42470     esac
42471   fi
42472 
42473 
42474 
42475   # Optimization levels
42476   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42477     CC_HIGHEST="$CC_HIGHEST -fns -fsimple -fsingle -xbuiltin=%all -xdepend -xrestrict -xlibmil"
42478 
42479     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xx86"; then
