42480       # FIXME: seems we always set -xregs=no%frameptr; put it elsewhere more global?
42481       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Wu,-O4~yz $CC_HIGHEST -xalias_level=basic -xregs=no%frameptr"
42482       C_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Wu,-O4~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42483       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Wu,-O2~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42484       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42485       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42486       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Qoption ube -O4~yz $CC_HIGHEST -xregs=no%frameptr"
42487       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Qoption ube -O4~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42488       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Qoption ube -O2~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42489       CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42490       CXX_O_FLAG_NONE="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42491       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x32"; then
42492         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST -xchip=pentium"
42493         CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST -xchip=pentium"
42494       fi
42495     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xsparc"; then
42496       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0 $CC_HIGHEST -xalias_level=basic -xprefetch=auto,explicit -xchip=ultra"
42497       C_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0"
42498       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0"
42499       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG=""
42500       C_O_FLAG_NONE=""
42501       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0 $CC_HIGHEST -xprefetch=auto,explicit -xchip=ultra"
42502       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0"
42503       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0"
42504       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG=""
42505       CXX_O_FLAG_NONE=""
42506     fi
42507   else
42508     # The remaining toolchains share opt flags between CC and CXX;
42509     # setup for C and duplicate afterwards.
42510     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42511       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42512         # On MacOSX we optimize for size, something
42513         # we should do for all platforms?
42514         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-Os"
42515         C_O_FLAG_HI="-Os"
42516         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-Os"
42517       else
42518         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42519         C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3"
42520         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42521       fi
42522       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-O0"
42523       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-O0"
42524     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42525       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42526         # On MacOSX we optimize for size, something
42527         # we should do for all platforms?
42528         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-Os"
42529         C_O_FLAG_HI="-Os"
42530         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-Os"
42531       else
42532         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42533         C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3"
42534         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42535       fi
42536       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-O0"
42537       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-O0"
42538     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42539       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42540       C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3 -qstrict"
42541       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42542       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-qnoopt"
42543       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-qnoop"
42544     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42545       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O2"
42546       C_O_FLAG_HI="-O1"
42547       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O1"
42548       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-Od"
42549       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-Od"
42550     fi
42551     CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST"
42552     CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_HI"
42553     CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="$C_O_FLAG_NORM"
42554     CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42555     CXX_O_FLAG_NONE="$C_O_FLAG_NONE"
42556   fi
42557 
42558   # Adjust optimization flags according to debug level.
42559   case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42560     release )
42561       # no adjustment
42562       ;;
42563     fastdebug )
42564       # Not quite so much optimization
42565       C_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_NORM"
42566       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$CXX_O_FLAG_NORM"
42567       ;;
42568     slowdebug )
42569       # Disable optimization
42570       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42571       C_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42572       C_O_FLAG_NORM="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42573       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42574       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42575       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42576       ;;
42577   esac
42578 
42579 
42580 
42581 
42582 
42583 
42584 
42585 
42586 
42587 
42588 
42589 
42590 
42591   # Special extras...
42592   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42593     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xsparc"; then
42594       CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA="${CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA} -xregs=no%appl"
42595       CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA="${CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA} -xregs=no%appl"
42596     fi
42597   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42598     LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -q64 -brtl -bnolibpath -liconv -bexpall"
42599     CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -qchars=signed -q64 -qfullpath -qsaveopt"
42600     CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} -qchars=signed -q64 -qfullpath -qsaveopt"
42601   fi
42602 
42603   if test "x$CFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_CFLAGS}"; then
42604     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring CFLAGS($CFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cflags" >&5
42605 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring CFLAGS($CFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cflags" >&2;}
42606   fi
42607 
42608   if test "x$CXXFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"; then
42609     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring CXXFLAGS($CXXFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cxxflags" >&5
42610 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring CXXFLAGS($CXXFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cxxflags" >&2;}
42611   fi
42612 
42613   if test "x$LDFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"; then
42614     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring LDFLAGS($LDFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-ldflags" >&5
42615 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring LDFLAGS($LDFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-ldflags" >&2;}
42616   fi
42617 
42618 
42619 # Check whether --with-extra-cflags was given.
42620 if test "${with_extra_cflags+set}" = set; then :
42621   withval=$with_extra_cflags;
42622 fi
42623 
42624 
42625 
42626 # Check whether --with-extra-cxxflags was given.
42627 if test "${with_extra_cxxflags+set}" = set; then :
42628   withval=$with_extra_cxxflags;
42629 fi
42630 
42631 
42632 
42633 # Check whether --with-extra-ldflags was given.
42634 if test "${with_extra_ldflags+set}" = set; then :
42635   withval=$with_extra_ldflags;
42636 fi
42637 
42638 
42639   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_cflags"
42640   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_cxxflags"
42641   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_ldflags"
42642 
42643   # Hotspot needs these set in their legacy form
42644   LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS $with_extra_cflags"
42645   LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS $with_extra_cxxflags"
42646   LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS $with_extra_ldflags"
42647 
42648 
42649 
42650 
42651 
42652   ###############################################################################
42653   #
42654   # Now setup the CFLAGS and LDFLAGS for the JDK build.
42655   # Later we will also have CFLAGS and LDFLAGS for the hotspot subrepo build.
42656   #
42657 
42658   # Setup compiler/platform specific flags into
42659   #    CFLAGS_JDK    - C Compiler flags
42660   #    CXXFLAGS_JDK  - C++ Compiler flags
42661   #    COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK - common to C and C++
42662   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42663     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -Wall -Wno-parentheses -Wextra -Wno-unused -Wno-unused-parameter -Wformat=2 \
42664         -pipe -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE"
42665     case $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH in
42666       arm )
42667         # on arm we don't prevent gcc to omit frame pointer but do prevent strict aliasing
42668         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42669         ;;
42670       ppc )
42671         # on ppc we don't prevent gcc to omit frame pointer but do prevent strict aliasing
42672         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42673         ;;
42674       * )
42675         COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -fno-omit-frame-pointer"
42676         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42677         ;;
42678     esac
42679   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42680     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DTRACING -DMACRO_MEMSYS_OPS -DBREAKPTS"
42681     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = xx86; then
42682       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DcpuIntel -Di586 -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB"
42683       CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -erroff=E_BAD_PRAGMA_PACK_VALUE"
42684     fi
42685 
42686     CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -xc99=%none -xCC -errshort=tags -Xa -v -mt -W0,-noglobal"
42687     CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK -errtags=yes +w -mt -features=no%except -DCC_NOEX -norunpath -xnolib"
42688   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42689     CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -DSTDC"
42690     CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -DSTDC"
42691   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42692     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -Zi -MD -Zc:wchar_t- -W3 -wd4800 \
42693     -D_STATIC_CPPLIB -D_DISABLE_DEPRECATE_STATIC_CPPLIB -DWIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN \
42694     -D_CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE -D_CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE \
42695     -DWIN32 -DIAL"
42696     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
42697       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_AMD64_ -Damd64"
42698     else
42699       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_X86_ -Dx86"
42700     fi
42701   fi
42702 
42703   ###############################################################################
42704 
42705   # Adjust flags according to debug level.
42706   case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42707     fastdebug | slowdebug )
42708       CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS $CFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS"
42709       CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS $CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS"
42710       JAVAC_FLAGS="$JAVAC_FLAGS -g"
42711       ;;
42712     release )
42713       ;;
42714     * )
42715       as_fn_error $? "Unrecognized \$DEBUG_LEVEL: $DEBUG_LEVEL" "$LINENO" 5
42716       ;;
42717   esac
42718 
42719   # Setup LP64
42720   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $ADD_LP64"
42721 
42722   # Set some common defines. These works for all compilers, but assume
42723   # -D is universally accepted.
42724 
42725   # Setup endianness
42726   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN" = xlittle; then
42727     # The macro _LITTLE_ENDIAN needs to be defined the same to avoid the
42728     #   Sun C compiler warning message: warning: macro redefined: _LITTLE_ENDIAN
42729     #   (The Solaris X86 system defines this in file /usr/include/sys/isa_defs.h).
42730     #   Note: -Dmacro         is the same as    #define macro 1
42731     #         -Dmacro=        is the same as    #define macro
42732     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42733       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_LITTLE_ENDIAN="
42734     else
42735       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_LITTLE_ENDIAN"
42736     fi
42737   else
42738     # Same goes for _BIG_ENDIAN. Do we really need to set *ENDIAN on Solaris if they
42739     # are defined in the system?
42740     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42741       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_BIG_ENDIAN="
42742     else
42743       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_BIG_ENDIAN"
42744     fi
42745   fi
42746 
42747   # Setup target OS define. Use OS target name but in upper case.
42748   OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_UPPERCASE=`$ECHO $OPENJDK_TARGET_OS | $TR 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
42749   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_UPPERCASE"
42750 
42751   # Setup target CPU
42752   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DARCH='\"$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY\"' -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY"
42753 
42754   # Setup debug/release defines
42755   if test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" = xrelease; then
42756     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DNDEBUG"
42757     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42758       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DTRIMMED"
42759     fi
42760   else
42761     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DDEBUG"
42762   fi
42763 
42764   # Setup release name
42765   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DRELEASE='\"\$(RELEASE)\"'"
42766 
42767 
42768   # Set some additional per-OS defines.
42769   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42770     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_ALLBSD_SOURCE -D_DARWIN_UNLIMITED_SELECT"
42771   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
42772     # FIXME: PPC64 should not be here.
42773     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DPPC64"
42774   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xbsd; then
42775     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_ALLBSD_SOURCE"
42776   fi
42777 
42778   # Additional macosx handling
42779   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42780     # Setting these parameters makes it an error to link to macosx APIs that are
42781     # newer than the given OS version and makes the linked binaries compatible
42782     # even if built on a newer version of the OS.
42783     # The expected format is X.Y.Z
42784     MACOSX_VERSION_MIN=10.7.0
42785 
42786 
42787     # The macro takes the version with no dots, ex: 1070
42788     # Let the flags variables get resolved in make for easier override on make
42789     # command line.
42790     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DMAC_OS_X_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED=\$(subst .,,\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)) -mmacosx-version-min=\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)"
42791     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -mmacosx-version-min=\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)"
42792   fi
42793 
42794   # Setup some hard coded includes
42795   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK \
42796       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/share/native/include \
42797       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS/native/include \
42798       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE/native/include"
42799 
42800   # The shared libraries are compiled using the picflag.
42801   CFLAGS_JDKLIB="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_JDK $PICFLAG $CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA"
42802   CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_JDK $PICFLAG $CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA "
42803 
42804   # Executable flags
42805   CFLAGS_JDKEXE="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_JDK"
42806   CXXFLAGS_JDKEXE="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_JDK"
42807 
42808 
42809 
42810 
42811 
42812 
42813   # Setup LDFLAGS et al.
42814   #
42815 
42816   # Now this is odd. The JDK native libraries have to link against libjvm.so
42817   # On 32-bit machines there is normally two distinct libjvm.so:s, client and server.
42818   # Which should we link to? Are we lucky enough that the binary api to the libjvm.so library
42819   # is identical for client and server? Yes. Which is picked at runtime (client or server)?
42820   # Neither, since the chosen libjvm.so has already been loaded by the launcher, all the following
42821   # libraries will link to whatever is in memory. Yuck.
42822   #
42823   # Thus we offer the compiler to find libjvm.so first in server then in client. It works. Ugh.
42824   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42825     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -nologo -opt:ref -incremental:no"
42826     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x32"; then
42827       LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -safeseh"
42828     fi
42829     # TODO: make -debug optional "--disable-full-debug-symbols"
42830     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -debug"
42831   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42832     # If this is a --hash-style=gnu system, use --hash-style=both, why?
42833     # We have previously set HAS_GNU_HASH if this is the case
42834     if test -n "$HAS_GNU_HASH"; then
42835       LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker --hash-style=both"
42836     fi
42837     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
42838       # And since we now know that the linker is gnu, then add -z defs, to forbid
42839       # undefined symbols in object files.
42840       LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker -z -Xlinker defs"
42841       case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42842         release )
42843           # tell linker to optimize libraries.
42844           # Should this be supplied to the OSS linker as well?
42845           LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker -O1"
42846           ;;
42847         slowdebug )
42848           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_NOW" = "xtrue"; then
42849             # do relocations at load
42850             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
42851             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
42852           fi
42853           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_RELRO" = "xtrue"; then
42854             # mark relocations read only
42855             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42856             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42857           fi
42858           ;;
42859         fastdebug )
42860           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_RELRO" = "xtrue"; then
42861             # mark relocations read only
42862             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42863             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42864           fi
42865           ;;
42866         * )
42867           as_fn_error $? "Unrecognized \$DEBUG_LEVEL: $DEBUG_LEVEL" "$LINENO" 5
42868           ;;
42869         esac
42870     fi
42871   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42872     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -z defs -xildoff -ztext"
42873     LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK -norunpath -xnolib"
42874   fi
42875 
42876   # Customize LDFLAGS for executables
42877 
42878   LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="${LDFLAGS_JDK}"
42879 
42880   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42881     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x64"; then
42882       LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE=1048576
42883     else
42884       LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE=327680
42885     fi
42886     LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="${LDFLAGS_JDKEXE} /STACK:$LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE"
42887   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
42888     LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="$LDFLAGS_JDKEXE -Xlinker --allow-shlib-undefined"
42889   fi
42890 
42891   # Customize LDFLAGS for libs
42892   LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDK}"
42893 
42894   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42895     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -dll -libpath:${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base"
42896     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX=""
42897   else
42898     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB}  ${SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS} \
42899         -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}"
42900 
42901     # On some platforms (mac) the linker warns about non existing -L dirs.
42902     # Add server first if available. Linking aginst client does not always produce the same results.
42903     # Only add client dir if client is being built. Add minimal (note not minimal1) if only building minimal1.
42904     # Default to server for other variants.
42905     if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_SERVER" = xtrue; then
42906       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/server"
42907     elif test "x$JVM_VARIANT_CLIENT" = xtrue; then
42908       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/client"
42909     elif test "x$JVM_VARIANT_MINIMAL1" = xtrue; then
42910       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/minimal"
42911     else
42912       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/server"
42913     fi
42914 
42915     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX="-ljava -ljvm"
42916     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42917       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX="$LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX -lc"
42918     fi
42919   fi
42920 
42921 
42922 
42923 
42924 
42925 
42926 
42927 
42928   # Some Zero and Shark settings.
42929   # ZERO_ARCHFLAG tells the compiler which mode to build for
42930   case "${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU}" in
42931     s390)
42932       ZERO_ARCHFLAG="${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}31"
42933       ;;
42934     *)
42935       ZERO_ARCHFLAG="${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42936   esac
42937 
42938   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"$ZERO_ARCHFLAG\"" >&5
42939 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"$ZERO_ARCHFLAG\"... " >&6; }
42940   supports=yes
42941 
42942   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
42943   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $ZERO_ARCHFLAG"
42944   ac_ext=c
42945 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
42946 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42947 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42948 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
42949 
42950   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42951 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42952 int i;
42953 _ACEOF
42954 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42955 
42956 else
42957   supports=no
42958 fi
42959 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42960   ac_ext=cpp
42961 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42962 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42963 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42964 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42965 
42966   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
42967 
42968   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
42969   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG $ZERO_ARCHFLAG"
42970   ac_ext=cpp
42971 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42972 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42973 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42974 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42975 
42976   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42977 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42978 int i;
42979 _ACEOF
42980 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42981 
42982 else
42983   supports=no
42984 fi
42985 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42986   ac_ext=cpp
42987 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42988 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42989 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42990 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42991 
42992   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
42993 
42994   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
42995 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
42996   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
42997     :
42998   else
42999     ZERO_ARCHFLAG=""
43000   fi
43001 
43002 
43003 
43004   # Check that the compiler supports -mX (or -qX on AIX) flags
43005   # Set COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG to 'true' if it does
43006 
43007   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}\"" >&5
43008 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}\"... " >&6; }
43009   supports=yes
43010 
43011   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
43012   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
43013   ac_ext=c
43014 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
43015 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43016 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43017 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
43018 
43019   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43020 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43021 int i;
43022 _ACEOF
43023 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
43024 
43025 else
43026   supports=no
43027 fi
43028 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
43029   ac_ext=cpp
43030 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43031 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43032 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43033 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43034 
43035   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
43036 
43037   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
43038   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
43039   ac_ext=cpp
43040 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43041 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43042 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43043 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43044 
43045   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43046 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43047 int i;
43048 _ACEOF
43049 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
43050 
43051 else
43052   supports=no
43053 fi
43054 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
43055   ac_ext=cpp
43056 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43057 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43058 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43059 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43060 
43061   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
43062 
43063   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
43064 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
43065   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
43066     COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG=true
43067   else
43068     COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG=false
43069   fi
43070 
43071 
43072 
43073   case "${TOOLCHAIN_TYPE}" in
43074     microsoft)
43075       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-WX"
43076       ;;
43077     solstudio)
43078       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-errtags -errwarn=%all"
43079       ;;
43080     gcc)
43081       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-Werror"
43082       ;;
43083     clang)
43084       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-Werror"
43085       ;;
43086   esac
43087 
43088 
43089 
43090 # Setup debug symbols (need objcopy from the toolchain for that)
43091 
43092   #
43093   # ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS
43094   # This must be done after the toolchain is setup, since we're looking at objcopy.
43095   #
43096   # Check whether --enable-debug-symbols was given.
43097 if test "${enable_debug_symbols+set}" = set; then :
43098   enableval=$enable_debug_symbols;
43099 fi
43100 
43101 
43102   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should generate debug symbols" >&5
43103 $as_echo_n "checking if we should generate debug symbols... " >&6; }
43104 
43105   if test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xyes" && test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
43106     # explicit enabling of enable-debug-symbols and can't find objcopy
43107     #   this is an error
43108     as_fn_error $? "Unable to find objcopy, cannot enable debug-symbols" "$LINENO" 5
43109   fi
43110 
43111   if test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xyes"; then
43112     ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43113   elif test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xno"; then
43114     ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=false
43115   else
43116     # Default is on if objcopy is found
43117     if test "x$OBJCOPY" != x; then
43118       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43119     # MacOS X and Windows don't use objcopy but default is on for those OSes
43120     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
43121       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43122     else
43123       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=false
43124     fi
43125   fi
43126 
43127   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS" >&5
43128 $as_echo "$ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS" >&6; }
43129 
43130   #
43131   # ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES
43132   #
43133   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should zip debug-info files" >&5
43134 $as_echo_n "checking if we should zip debug-info files... " >&6; }
43135   # Check whether --enable-zip-debug-info was given.
43136 if test "${enable_zip_debug_info+set}" = set; then :
43137   enableval=$enable_zip_debug_info; enable_zip_debug_info="${enableval}"
43138 else
43139   enable_zip_debug_info="yes"
43140 fi
43141 
43142   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${enable_zip_debug_info}" >&5
43143 $as_echo "${enable_zip_debug_info}" >&6; }
43144 
43145   if test "x${enable_zip_debug_info}" = "xno"; then
43146     ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES=false
43147   else
43148     ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES=true
43149   fi
43150 
43151 
43152 
43153 
43154 
43155 ###############################################################################
43156 #
43157 # Check dependencies for external and internal libraries.
43158 #
43159 ###############################################################################
43160 
43161 # After we have toolchain, we can compile fixpath. It's needed by the lib checks.
43162 
43163   # When using cygwin or msys, we need a wrapper binary that renames
43164   # /cygdrive/c/ arguments into c:/ arguments and peeks into
43165   # @files and rewrites these too! This wrapper binary is
43166   # called fixpath.
43167   FIXPATH=
43168   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xwindows; then
43169     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if fixpath can be created" >&5
43170 $as_echo_n "checking if fixpath can be created... " >&6; }
43171     FIXPATH_SRC="$SRC_ROOT/common/src/fixpath.c"
43172     FIXPATH_BIN="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe"
43173     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = xwindows.cygwin; then
43174       FIXPATH_SRC=`$CYGPATH -m $FIXPATH_SRC`
43175       FIXPATH_BIN=`$CYGPATH -m $FIXPATH_BIN`
43176       # Important to keep the .exe suffix on Cygwin for Hotspot makefiles
43177       FIXPATH="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe -c"
43178     elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = xwindows.msys; then
43179       FIXPATH_SRC=`cmd //c echo $FIXPATH_SRC`
43180       FIXPATH_BIN=`cmd //c echo $FIXPATH_BIN`
43181 
43182       # Take all collected prefixes and turn them into a -m/c/foo@/c/bar@... command line
43183       # @ was chosen as separator to minimize risk of other tools messing around with it
43184       all_unique_prefixes=`echo "${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" | tr ' ' '\n' | grep '^/./' | sort | uniq`
43185       fixpath_argument_list=`echo $all_unique_prefixes  | tr ' ' '@'`
43186 
43187       FIXPATH="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath -m$fixpath_argument_list"
43188     fi
43189     rm -f $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath*
43190     cd $OUTPUT_ROOT
43191     $CC $FIXPATH_SRC -Fe$FIXPATH_BIN > $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath1.log 2>&1
43192     cd $CURDIR
43193 
43194     if test ! -x $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe; then
43195       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43196 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43197       cat $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath1.log
43198       as_fn_error $? "Could not create $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe" "$LINENO" 5
43199     fi
43200     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43201 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43202     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if fixpath.exe works" >&5
43203 $as_echo_n "checking if fixpath.exe works... " >&6; }
43204     cd $OUTPUT_ROOT
43205     $FIXPATH $CC $SRC_ROOT/common/src/fixpath.c -Fe$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.exe > $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.log 2>&1
43206     cd $CURDIR
43207     if test ! -x $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.exe; then
43208       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43209 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43210       cat $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.log
43211       as_fn_error $? "fixpath did not work!" "$LINENO" 5
43212     fi
43213     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43214 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43215     rm -f $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath?.??? $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.obj
43216   fi
43217 
43218 
43219 
43220 
43221 
43222 
43223   ###############################################################################
43224   #
43225   # OS specific settings that we never will need to probe.
43226   #
43227   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
43228     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Linux?" >&5
43229 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Linux?... " >&6; }
43230     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43231     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: pulse" >&5
43232 $as_echo "pulse" >&6; }
43233   fi
43234 
43235   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
43236     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Solaris?" >&5
43237 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Solaris?... " >&6; }
43238     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43239     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43240     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse" >&5
43241 $as_echo "alsa pulse" >&6; }
43242   fi
43243 
43244   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
43245     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on AIX?" >&5
43246 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on AIX?... " >&6; }
43247     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43248     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43249     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse" >&5
43250 $as_echo "alsa pulse" >&6; }
43251   fi
43252 
43253 
43254   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
43255     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Windows?" >&5
43256 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Windows?... " >&6; }
43257     CUPS_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43258     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43259     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43260     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43261     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa cups pulse x11" >&5
43262 $as_echo "alsa cups pulse x11" >&6; }
43263   fi
43264 
43265   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
43266     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on MacOSX?" >&5
43267 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on MacOSX?... " >&6; }
43268     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43269     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43270     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43271     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse x11" >&5
43272 $as_echo "alsa pulse x11" >&6; }
43273   fi
43274 
43275   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xbsd; then
43276     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on bsd?" >&5
43277 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on bsd?... " >&6; }
43278     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43279     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa" >&5
43280 $as_echo "alsa" >&6; }
43281   fi
43282 
43283   if test "x$OPENJDK" = "xfalse"; then
43284     FREETYPE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43285   fi
43286 
43287   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xno; then
43288     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43289   fi
43290 
43291 
43292 
43293   ###############################################################################
43294   #
43295   # Check for X Windows
43296   #
43297 
43298   if test "x$X11_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
43299     if test "x${with_x}" != x; then
43300       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: X11 is not used, so --with-x is ignored" >&5
43301 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: X11 is not used, so --with-x is ignored" >&2;}
43302     fi
43303     X_CFLAGS=
43304     X_LIBS=
43305   else
43306     # Check if the user has specified sysroot, but not --x-includes or --x-libraries.
43307     # Make a simple check for the libraries at the sysroot, and setup --x-includes and
43308     # --x-libraries for the sysroot, if that seems to be correct.
43309     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xlinux"; then
43310       if test "x$SYSROOT" != "x"; then
43311         if test "x$x_includes" = xNONE; then
43312           if test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/include/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43313             x_includes="$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/include"
43314           elif test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/include/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43315             x_includes="$SYSROOT/usr/include"
43316           fi
43317         fi
43318         if test "x$x_libraries" = xNONE; then
43319           if test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/lib/libX11.so"; then
43320             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/lib"
43321           elif test "$SYSROOT/usr/lib64/libX11.so" && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
43322             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/lib64"
43323           elif test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/lib/libX11.so"; then
43324             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/lib"
43325           fi
43326         fi
43327       fi
43328     fi
43329 
43330     # Now let autoconf do it's magic
43331     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for X" >&5
43332 $as_echo_n "checking for X... " >&6; }
43333 
43334 
43335 # Check whether --with-x was given.
43336 if test "${with_x+set}" = set; then :
43337   withval=$with_x;
43338 fi
43339 
43340 # $have_x is `yes', `no', `disabled', or empty when we do not yet know.
43341 if test "x$with_x" = xno; then
43342   # The user explicitly disabled X.
43343   have_x=disabled
43344 else
43345   case $x_includes,$x_libraries in #(
43346     *\'*) as_fn_error $? "cannot use X directory names containing '" "$LINENO" 5;; #(
43347     *,NONE | NONE,*) if ${ac_cv_have_x+:} false; then :
43348   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43349 else
43350   # One or both of the vars are not set, and there is no cached value.
43351 ac_x_includes=no ac_x_libraries=no
43352 rm -f -r conftest.dir
43353 if mkdir conftest.dir; then
43354   cd conftest.dir
43355   cat >Imakefile <<'_ACEOF'
43356 incroot:
43357         @echo incroot='${INCROOT}'
43358 usrlibdir:
43359         @echo usrlibdir='${USRLIBDIR}'
43360 libdir:
43361         @echo libdir='${LIBDIR}'
43362 _ACEOF
43363   if (export CC; ${XMKMF-xmkmf}) >/dev/null 2>/dev/null && test -f Makefile; then
43364     # GNU make sometimes prints "make[1]: Entering ...", which would confuse us.
43365     for ac_var in incroot usrlibdir libdir; do
43366       eval "ac_im_$ac_var=\`\${MAKE-make} $ac_var 2>/dev/null | sed -n 's/^$ac_var=//p'\`"
43367     done
43368     # Open Windows xmkmf reportedly sets LIBDIR instead of USRLIBDIR.
43369     for ac_extension in a so sl dylib la dll; do
43370       if test ! -f "$ac_im_usrlibdir/libX11.$ac_extension" &&
43371          test -f "$ac_im_libdir/libX11.$ac_extension"; then
43372         ac_im_usrlibdir=$ac_im_libdir; break
43373       fi
43374     done
43375     # Screen out bogus values from the imake configuration.  They are
43376     # bogus both because they are the default anyway, and because
43377     # using them would break gcc on systems where it needs fixed includes.
43378     case $ac_im_incroot in
43379         /usr/include) ac_x_includes= ;;
43380         *) test -f "$ac_im_incroot/X11/Xos.h" && ac_x_includes=$ac_im_incroot;;
43381     esac
43382     case $ac_im_usrlibdir in
43383         /usr/lib | /usr/lib64 | /lib | /lib64) ;;
43384         *) test -d "$ac_im_usrlibdir" && ac_x_libraries=$ac_im_usrlibdir ;;
43385     esac
43386   fi
43387   cd ..
43388   rm -f -r conftest.dir
43389 fi
43390 
43391 # Standard set of common directories for X headers.
43392 # Check X11 before X11Rn because it is often a symlink to the current release.
43393 ac_x_header_dirs='
43394 /usr/X11/include
43395 /usr/X11R7/include
43396 /usr/X11R6/include
43397 /usr/X11R5/include
43398 /usr/X11R4/include
43399 
43400 /usr/include/X11
43401 /usr/include/X11R7
43402 /usr/include/X11R6
43403 /usr/include/X11R5
43404 /usr/include/X11R4
43405 
43406 /usr/local/X11/include
43407 /usr/local/X11R7/include
43408 /usr/local/X11R6/include
43409 /usr/local/X11R5/include
43410 /usr/local/X11R4/include
43411 
43412 /usr/local/include/X11
43413 /usr/local/include/X11R7
43414 /usr/local/include/X11R6
43415 /usr/local/include/X11R5
43416 /usr/local/include/X11R4
43417 
43418 /usr/X386/include
43419 /usr/x386/include
43420 /usr/XFree86/include/X11
43421 
43422 /usr/include
43423 /usr/local/include
43424 /usr/unsupported/include
43425 /usr/athena/include
43426 /usr/local/x11r5/include
43427 /usr/lpp/Xamples/include
43428 
43429 /usr/openwin/include
43430 /usr/openwin/share/include'
43431 
43432 if test "$ac_x_includes" = no; then
43433   # Guess where to find include files, by looking for Xlib.h.
43434   # First, try using that file with no special directory specified.
43435   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43436 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43437 #include <X11/Xlib.h>
43438 _ACEOF
43439 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
43440   # We can compile using X headers with no special include directory.
43441 ac_x_includes=
43442 else
43443   for ac_dir in $ac_x_header_dirs; do
43444   if test -r "$ac_dir/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43445     ac_x_includes=$ac_dir
43446     break
43447   fi
43448 done
43449 fi
43450 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
43451 fi # $ac_x_includes = no
43452 
43453 if test "$ac_x_libraries" = no; then
43454   # Check for the libraries.
43455   # See if we find them without any special options.
43456   # Don't add to $LIBS permanently.
43457   ac_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43458   LIBS="-lX11 $LIBS"
43459   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43460 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43461 #include <X11/Xlib.h>
43462 int
43463 main ()
43464 {
43465 XrmInitialize ()
43466   ;
43467   return 0;
43468 }
43469 _ACEOF
43470 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43471   LIBS=$ac_save_LIBS
43472 # We can link X programs with no special library path.
43473 ac_x_libraries=
43474 else
43475   LIBS=$ac_save_LIBS
43476 for ac_dir in `$as_echo "$ac_x_includes $ac_x_header_dirs" | sed s/include/lib/g`
43477 do
43478   # Don't even attempt the hair of trying to link an X program!
43479   for ac_extension in a so sl dylib la dll; do
43480     if test -r "$ac_dir/libX11.$ac_extension"; then
43481       ac_x_libraries=$ac_dir
43482       break 2
43483     fi
43484   done
43485 done
43486 fi
43487 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43488     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43489 fi # $ac_x_libraries = no
43490 
43491 case $ac_x_includes,$ac_x_libraries in #(
43492   no,* | *,no | *\'*)
43493     # Didn't find X, or a directory has "'" in its name.
43494     ac_cv_have_x="have_x=no";; #(
43495   *)
43496     # Record where we found X for the cache.
43497     ac_cv_have_x="have_x=yes\
43498         ac_x_includes='$ac_x_includes'\
43499         ac_x_libraries='$ac_x_libraries'"
43500 esac
43501 fi
43502 ;; #(
43503     *) have_x=yes;;
43504   esac
43505   eval "$ac_cv_have_x"
43506 fi # $with_x != no
43507 
43508 if test "$have_x" != yes; then
43509   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $have_x" >&5
43510 $as_echo "$have_x" >&6; }
43511   no_x=yes
43512 else
43513   # If each of the values was on the command line, it overrides each guess.
43514   test "x$x_includes" = xNONE && x_includes=$ac_x_includes
43515   test "x$x_libraries" = xNONE && x_libraries=$ac_x_libraries
43516   # Update the cache value to reflect the command line values.
43517   ac_cv_have_x="have_x=yes\
43518         ac_x_includes='$x_includes'\
43519         ac_x_libraries='$x_libraries'"
43520   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: libraries $x_libraries, headers $x_includes" >&5
43521 $as_echo "libraries $x_libraries, headers $x_includes" >&6; }
43522 fi
43523 
43524     if test "$no_x" = yes; then
43525   # Not all programs may use this symbol, but it does not hurt to define it.
43526 
43527 $as_echo "#define X_DISPLAY_MISSING 1" >>confdefs.h
43528 
43529   X_CFLAGS= X_PRE_LIBS= X_LIBS= X_EXTRA_LIBS=
43530 else
43531   if test -n "$x_includes"; then
43532     X_CFLAGS="$X_CFLAGS -I$x_includes"
43533   fi
43534 
43535   # It would also be nice to do this for all -L options, not just this one.
43536   if test -n "$x_libraries"; then
43537     X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -L$x_libraries"
43538     # For Solaris; some versions of Sun CC require a space after -R and
43539     # others require no space.  Words are not sufficient . . . .
43540     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether -R must be followed by a space" >&5
43541 $as_echo_n "checking whether -R must be followed by a space... " >&6; }
43542     ac_xsave_LIBS=$LIBS; LIBS="$LIBS -R$x_libraries"
43543     ac_xsave_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_cxx_werror_flag
43544     ac_cxx_werror_flag=yes
43545     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43546 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43547 
43548 int
43549 main ()
43550 {
43551 
43552   ;
43553   return 0;
43554 }
43555 _ACEOF
43556 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43557   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43558 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43559        X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -R$x_libraries"
43560 else
43561   LIBS="$ac_xsave_LIBS -R $x_libraries"
43562        cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43563 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43564 
43565 int
43566 main ()
43567 {
43568 
43569   ;
43570   return 0;
43571 }
43572 _ACEOF
43573 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43574   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43575 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43576           X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -R $x_libraries"
43577 else
43578   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: neither works" >&5
43579 $as_echo "neither works" >&6; }
43580 fi
43581 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43582     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43583 fi
43584 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43585     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43586     ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_xsave_cxx_werror_flag
43587     LIBS=$ac_xsave_LIBS
43588   fi
43589 
43590   # Check for system-dependent libraries X programs must link with.
43591   # Do this before checking for the system-independent R6 libraries
43592   # (-lICE), since we may need -lsocket or whatever for X linking.
43593 
43594   if test "$ISC" = yes; then
43595     X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -lnsl_s -linet"
43596   else
43597     # Martyn Johnson says this is needed for Ultrix, if the X
43598     # libraries were built with DECnet support.  And Karl Berry says
43599     # the Alpha needs dnet_stub (dnet does not exist).
43600     ac_xsave_LIBS="$LIBS"; LIBS="$LIBS $X_LIBS -lX11"
43601     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43602 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43603 
43604 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43605    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43606    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43607 #ifdef __cplusplus
43608 extern "C"
43609 #endif
43610 char XOpenDisplay ();
43611 int
43612 main ()
43613 {
43614 return XOpenDisplay ();
43615   ;
43616   return 0;
43617 }
43618 _ACEOF
43619 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43620 
43621 else
43622   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet" >&5
43623 $as_echo_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet... " >&6; }
43624 if ${ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa+:} false; then :
43625   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43626 else
43627   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43628 LIBS="-ldnet  $LIBS"
43629 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43630 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43631 
43632 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43633    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43634    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43635 #ifdef __cplusplus
43636 extern "C"
43637 #endif
43638 char dnet_ntoa ();
43639 int
43640 main ()
43641 {
43642 return dnet_ntoa ();
43643   ;
43644   return 0;
43645 }
43646 _ACEOF
43647 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43648   ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa=yes
43649 else
43650   ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa=no
43651 fi
43652 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43653     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43654 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43655 fi
43656 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" >&5
43657 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" >&6; }
43658 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" = xyes; then :
43659   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -ldnet"
43660 fi
43661 
43662     if test $ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa = no; then
43663       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub" >&5
43664 $as_echo_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub... " >&6; }
43665 if ${ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa+:} false; then :
43666   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43667 else
43668   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43669 LIBS="-ldnet_stub  $LIBS"
43670 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43671 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43672 
43673 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43674    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43675    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43676 #ifdef __cplusplus
43677 extern "C"
43678 #endif
43679 char dnet_ntoa ();
43680 int
43681 main ()
43682 {
43683 return dnet_ntoa ();
43684   ;
43685   return 0;
43686 }
43687 _ACEOF
43688 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43689   ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa=yes
43690 else
43691   ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa=no
43692 fi
43693 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43694     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43695 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43696 fi
43697 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" >&5
43698 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" >&6; }
43699 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" = xyes; then :
43700   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -ldnet_stub"
43701 fi
43702 
43703     fi
43704 fi
43705 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43706     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43707     LIBS="$ac_xsave_LIBS"
43708 
43709     # msh@cis.ufl.edu says -lnsl (and -lsocket) are needed for his 386/AT,
43710     # to get the SysV transport functions.
43711     # Chad R. Larson says the Pyramis MIS-ES running DC/OSx (SVR4)
43712     # needs -lnsl.
43713     # The nsl library prevents programs from opening the X display
43714     # on Irix 5.2, according to T.E. Dickey.
43715     # The functions gethostbyname, getservbyname, and inet_addr are
43716     # in -lbsd on LynxOS 3.0.1/i386, according to Lars Hecking.
43717     ac_fn_cxx_check_func "$LINENO" "gethostbyname" "ac_cv_func_gethostbyname"
43718 if test "x$ac_cv_func_gethostbyname" = xyes; then :
43719 
43720 fi
43721 
43722     if test $ac_cv_func_gethostbyname = no; then
43723       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for gethostbyname in -lnsl" >&5
43724 $as_echo_n "checking for gethostbyname in -lnsl... " >&6; }
43725 if ${ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname+:} false; then :
43726   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43727 else
43728   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43729 LIBS="-lnsl  $LIBS"
43730 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43731 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43732 
43733 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43734    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43735    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43736 #ifdef __cplusplus
43737 extern "C"
43738 #endif
43739 char gethostbyname ();
43740 int
43741 main ()
43742 {
43743 return gethostbyname ();
43744   ;
43745   return 0;
43746 }
43747 _ACEOF
43748 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43749   ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname=yes
43750 else
43751   ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname=no
43752 fi
43753 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43754     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43755 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43756 fi
43757 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" >&5
43758 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" >&6; }
43759 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" = xyes; then :
43760   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -lnsl"
43761 fi
43762 
43763       if test $ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname = no; then
43764         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for gethostbyname in -lbsd" >&5
43765 $as_echo_n "checking for gethostbyname in -lbsd... " >&6; }
43766 if ${ac_cv_lib_bsd_gethostbyname+:} false; then :
43767   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43768 else
43769   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43770 LIBS="-lbsd  $LIBS"
43771 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43772 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43773 
43774 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43775    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43776    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43777 #ifdef __cplusplus
43778 extern "C"
43779 #endif
43780 char gethostbyname ();
43781 int
43782 main ()
43783 {
43784 return gethostbyname ();
43785   ;
43786   return 0;
43787 }
43788 _ACEOF

43800 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_bsd_gethostbyname" = xyes; then :
43801   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -lbsd"
43802 fi
43803 
43804       fi
43805     fi
43806 
43807     # lieder@skyler.mavd.honeywell.com says without -lsocket,
43808     # socket/setsockopt and other routines are undefined under SCO ODT
43809     # 2.0.  But -lsocket is broken on IRIX 5.2 (and is not necessary
43810     # on later versions), says Simon Leinen: it contains gethostby*
43811     # variants that don't use the name server (or something).  -lsocket
43812     # must be given before -lnsl if both are needed.  We assume that
43813     # if connect needs -lnsl, so does gethostbyname.
43814     ac_fn_cxx_check_func "$LINENO" "connect" "ac_cv_func_connect"
43815 if test "x$ac_cv_func_connect" = xyes; then :
43816 
43817 fi
43818 
43819     if test $ac_cv_func_connect = no; then
43820       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for connect in -lsocket" >&5
43821 $as_echo_n "checking for connect in -lsocket... " >&6; }
43822 if ${ac_cv_lib_socket_connect+:} false; then :
43823   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43824 else
43825   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43826 LIBS="-lsocket $X_EXTRA_LIBS $LIBS"
43827 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43828 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43829 
43830 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43831    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43832    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43833 #ifdef __cplusplus
43834 extern "C"
43835 #endif
43836 char connect ();
43837 int
43838 main ()
43839 {
43840 return connect ();
43841   ;
43842   return 0;
43843 }
43844 _ACEOF
43845 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43846   ac_cv_lib_socket_connect=yes
43847 else
43848   ac_cv_lib_socket_connect=no
43849 fi
43850 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43851     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext

43853 fi

43961   # Check for libraries that X11R6 Xt/Xaw programs need.
43962   ac_save_LDFLAGS=$LDFLAGS
43963   test -n "$x_libraries" && LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS -L$x_libraries"
43964   # SM needs ICE to (dynamically) link under SunOS 4.x (so we have to
43965   # check for ICE first), but we must link in the order -lSM -lICE or
43966   # we get undefined symbols.  So assume we have SM if we have ICE.
43967   # These have to be linked with before -lX11, unlike the other
43968   # libraries we check for below, so use a different variable.
43969   # John Interrante, Karl Berry
43970   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for IceConnectionNumber in -lICE" >&5
43971 $as_echo_n "checking for IceConnectionNumber in -lICE... " >&6; }
43972 if ${ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber+:} false; then :
43973   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43974 else
43975   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43976 LIBS="-lICE $X_EXTRA_LIBS $LIBS"
43977 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43978 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43979 
43980 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43981    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43982    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43983 #ifdef __cplusplus
43984 extern "C"
43985 #endif
43986 char IceConnectionNumber ();
43987 int
43988 main ()
43989 {
43990 return IceConnectionNumber ();
43991   ;
43992   return 0;
43993 }
43994 _ACEOF
43995 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43996   ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber=yes
43997 else
43998   ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber=no
43999 fi
44000 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
44001     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
44002 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
44003 fi
44004 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" >&5
44005 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" >&6; }
44006 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" = xyes; then :
44007   X_PRE_LIBS="$X_PRE_LIBS -lSM -lICE"
44008 fi
44009 
44010   LDFLAGS=$ac_save_LDFLAGS
44011 
44012 fi
44013 
44014 
44015     # AC_PATH_XTRA creates X_LIBS and sometimes adds -R flags. When cross compiling
44016     # this doesn't make sense so we remove it.
44017     if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xcross; then
44018       X_LIBS=`$ECHO $X_LIBS | $SED 's/-R \{0,1\}[^ ]*//g'`
44019     fi
44020 
44021     if test "x$no_x" = xyes; then
44022 
44023   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44024   # x11 is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44025   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=x11
44026 
44027   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44028     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44029   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44030     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44031   else
44032     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44033 
44034     case $PKGHANDLER in
44035       apt-get)
44036         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44037       yum)
44038         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44039       port)
44040         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44041       pkgutil)
44042         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44043       pkgadd)
44044         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44045     esac
44046 
44047     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44048       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44049     fi
44050   fi
44051 
44052       as_fn_error $? "Could not find X11 libraries. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
44053     fi
44054 
44055     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
44056       OPENWIN_HOME="/usr/openwin"
44057       X_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/include -I$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/include/X11/extensions"
44058       X_LIBS="-L$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/sfw/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44059           -L$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44060           -R$OPENWIN_HOME/sfw/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44061           -R$OPENWIN_HOME/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
44062     fi
44063 
44064     ac_ext=c
44065 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
44066 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
44067 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
44068 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
44069 
44070     OLD_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
44071     CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS $X_CFLAGS"
44072 
44073     # Need to include Xlib.h and Xutil.h to avoid "present but cannot be compiled" warnings on Solaris 10
44074     for ac_header in X11/extensions/shape.h X11/extensions/Xrender.h X11/extensions/XTest.h X11/Intrinsic.h
44075 do :
44076   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
44077 ac_fn_c_check_header_compile "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "
44078           # include <X11/Xlib.h>
44079           # include <X11/Xutil.h>
44080 
44081 
44082 "
44083 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
44084   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
44085 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
44086 _ACEOF
44087  X11_HEADERS_OK=yes
44088 else
44089   X11_HEADERS_OK=no; break
44090 fi
44091 
44092 done
44093 
44094 
44095     if test "x$X11_HEADERS_OK" = xno; then
44096 
44097   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44098   # x11 is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44099   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=x11
44100 
44101   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44102     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44103   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44104     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44105   else
44106     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44107 
44108     case $PKGHANDLER in
44109       apt-get)
44110         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44111       yum)
44112         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44113       port)
44114         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44115       pkgutil)
44116         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44117       pkgadd)
44118         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44119     esac
44120 
44121     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44122       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44123     fi
44124   fi
44125 
44126       as_fn_error $? "Could not find all X11 headers (shape.h Xrender.h XTest.h Intrinsic.h). $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
44127     fi
44128 
44129     # If XLinearGradient isn't available in Xrender.h, signal that it needs to be
44130     # defined in libawt_xawt.
44131     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if XlinearGradient is defined in Xrender.h" >&5
44132 $as_echo_n "checking if XlinearGradient is defined in Xrender.h... " >&6; }
44133     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
44134 /* end confdefs.h.  */
44135 #include <X11/extensions/Xrender.h>
44136 int
44137 main ()
44138 {
44139 XLinearGradient x;
44140   ;
44141   return 0;
44142 }
44143 _ACEOF
44144 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
44145   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
44146 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
44147 else
44148   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
44149 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
44150          X_CFLAGS="$X_CFLAGS -DSOLARIS10_NO_XRENDER_STRUCTS"
44151 fi
44152 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
44153 
44154     CFLAGS="$OLD_CFLAGS"
44155     ac_ext=cpp
44156 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
44157 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
44158 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
44159 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
44160 
44161   fi # X11_NOT_NEEDED
44162 
44163 
44164 
44165 
44166 
44167 
44168   ###############################################################################
44169   #
44170   # The common unix printing system cups is used to print from java.
44171   #
44172 
44173 # Check whether --with-cups was given.
44174 if test "${with_cups+set}" = set; then :
44175   withval=$with_cups;
44176 fi
44177 
44178 
44179 # Check whether --with-cups-include was given.
44180 if test "${with_cups_include+set}" = set; then :
44181   withval=$with_cups_include;
44182 fi
44183 
44184 
44185   if test "x$CUPS_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
44186     if test "x${with_cups}" != x || test "x${with_cups_include}" != x; then
44187       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: cups not used, so --with-cups is ignored" >&5
44188 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: cups not used, so --with-cups is ignored" >&2;}
44189     fi
44190     CUPS_CFLAGS=
44191   else
44192     CUPS_FOUND=no
44193 
44194     if test "x${with_cups}" = xno || test "x${with_cups_include}" = xno; then
44195       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to disable the use of cups. Remove the --without-cups option." "$LINENO" 5
44196     fi
44197 
44198     if test "x${with_cups}" != x; then
44199       CUPS_CFLAGS="-I${with_cups}/include"
44200       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44201     fi
44202     if test "x${with_cups_include}" != x; then
44203       CUPS_CFLAGS="-I${with_cups_include}"
44204       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44205     fi
44206     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44207 
44208 
44209   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
44210     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
44211     . $builddepsfile
44212     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
44213     eval resource=\${builddep_cups_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
44214     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44215       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
44216       eval resource=\${builddep_cups_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
44217     fi
44218     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44219       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
44220       eval resource=\${builddep_cups_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
44221     fi
44222     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44223       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
44224       # (The cups comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
44225       resource=${builddep_cups}
44226     fi
44227     if test "x$resource" != x; then
44228       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for cups" >&5
44229 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for cups" >&6;}
44230       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
44231       # for example /java/linux/cups
44232       if test -d ${resource}; then
44233         depdir=${resource}
44234       else
44235 
44236   # cups is for example mymodule
44237   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
44238   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
44239   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
44240   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
44241   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
44242   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
44243   filename=`basename $resource`
44244   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
44245   filebase=${filename%%.*}
44246   extension=${filename#*.}
44247   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
44248   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
44249     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency cups from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
44250 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency cups from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
44251     if test ! -d $installdir; then
44252       mkdir -p $installdir
44253     fi
44254     if test ! -d $installdir; then
44255       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
44256     fi
44257     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/cups.XXXXXXXXX`
44258     touch $tmpfile
44259     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
44260       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
44261     fi
44262 
44263   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
44264   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
44265   VALID_TOOL=no
44266   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
44267     VALID_TOOL=yes
44268     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
44269   fi
44270   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
44271     VALID_TOOL=yes
44272     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
44273   fi
44274   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
44275     VALID_TOOL=yes
44276     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
44277     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
44278     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
44279     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
44280       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
44281       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
44282       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
44283     else
44284       FTPUSER=ftp
44285       FTPPWD=ftp
44286     fi
44287     # the "pass" command does not work on some
44288     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
44289     # passive mode is better!
44290     ( \
44291         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
44292         echo "pass"                         ; \
44293         echo "bin"                          ; \
44294         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
44295     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
44296   fi
44297   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
44298     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
44299   fi
44300 
44301     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
44302     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
44303       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
44304     fi
44305     case "$extension" in
44306       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
44307         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44308         ;;
44309       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
44310         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44311         ;;
44312       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
44313         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44314         ;;
44315       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
44316         ;;
44317     esac
44318   fi
44319   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
44320     depdir=$installdir
44321   fi
44322 
44323       fi
44324       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
44325       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
44326       . $builddepsfile
44327       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
44328       theroot=${builddep_cups_ROOT}
44329       thecflags=${builddep_cups_CFLAGS}
44330       thelibs=${builddep_cups_LIBS}
44331       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
44332         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency cups" "$LINENO" 5
44333       fi
44334       CUPS=$depdir
44335       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
44336         CUPS="$theroot"
44337       fi
44338       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
44339         CUPS_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
44340       fi
44341       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
44342         CUPS_LIBS="$thelibs"
44343       fi
44344       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44345 
44346     fi
44347 
44348   fi
44349 
44350     fi
44351     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44352       # Are the cups headers installed in the default /usr/include location?
44353       for ac_header in cups/cups.h cups/ppd.h
44354 do :
44355   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
44356 ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "$ac_includes_default"
44357 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
44358   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
44359 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
44360 _ACEOF
44361 
44362             CUPS_FOUND=yes
44363             CUPS_CFLAGS=
44364             DEFAULT_CUPS=yes
44365 
44366 
44367 fi
44368 
44369 done
44370 
44371     fi
44372     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44373       # Getting nervous now? Lets poke around for standard Solaris third-party
44374       # package installation locations.
44375       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for cups headers" >&5
44376 $as_echo_n "checking for cups headers... " >&6; }
44377       if test -s $SYSROOT/opt/sfw/cups/include/cups/cups.h; then
44378         # An SFW package seems to be installed!
44379         CUPS_FOUND=yes
44380         CUPS_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/opt/sfw/cups/include"
44381       elif test -s $SYSROOT/opt/csw/include/cups/cups.h; then
44382         # A CSW package seems to be installed!
44383         CUPS_FOUND=yes
44384         CUPS_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/opt/csw/include"
44385       fi
44386       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CUPS_FOUND" >&5
44387 $as_echo "$CUPS_FOUND" >&6; }
44388     fi
44389     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44390 
44391   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44392   # cups is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44393   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=cups
44394 
44395   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44396     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44397   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44398     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44399   else
44400     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44401 
44402     case $PKGHANDLER in
44403       apt-get)
44404         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44405       yum)
44406         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44407       port)
44408         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44409       pkgutil)
44410         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44411       pkgadd)
44412         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44413     esac
44414 
44415     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44416       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44417     fi
44418   fi
44419 
44420       as_fn_error $? "Could not find cups! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
44421     fi
44422   fi
44423 
44424 
44425 
44426 
44427 
44428 
44429   ###############################################################################
44430   #
44431   # The ubiquitous freetype library is used to render fonts.
44432   #
44433 
44434 # Check whether --with-freetype was given.
44435 if test "${with_freetype+set}" = set; then :
44436   withval=$with_freetype;
44437 fi
44438 
44439 
44440 # Check whether --with-freetype-include was given.
44441 if test "${with_freetype_include+set}" = set; then :
44442   withval=$with_freetype_include;
44443 fi
44444 
44445 
44446 # Check whether --with-freetype-lib was given.
44447 if test "${with_freetype_lib+set}" = set; then :
44448   withval=$with_freetype_lib;
44449 fi
44450 
44451 
44452 # Check whether --with-freetype-src was given.
44453 if test "${with_freetype_src+set}" = set; then :
44454   withval=$with_freetype_src;
44455 fi
44456 
44457   # Check whether --enable-freetype-bundling was given.
44458 if test "${enable_freetype_bundling+set}" = set; then :
44459   enableval=$enable_freetype_bundling;
44460 fi
44461 
44462 
44463   # Need to specify explicitly since it needs to be overridden on some versions of macosx
44464   FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44465   FREETYPE_CFLAGS=
44466   FREETYPE_LIBS=
44467   FREETYPE_BUNDLE_LIB_PATH=
44468 
44469   if test "x$FREETYPE_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
44470     if test "x$with_freetype" != x || test "x$with_freetype_include" != x || test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x || test "x$with_freetype_src" != x; then
44471       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: freetype not used, so --with-freetype is ignored" >&5
44472 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: freetype not used, so --with-freetype is ignored" >&2;}
44473     fi
44474     if test "x$enable_freetype_bundling" != x; then
44475       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: freetype not used, so --enable-freetype-bundling is ignored" >&5
44476 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: freetype not used, so --enable-freetype-bundling is ignored" >&2;}
44477     fi
44478   else
44479     # freetype is needed to build; go get it!
44480 
44481     BUNDLE_FREETYPE="$enable_freetype_bundling"
44482 
44483     if  test "x$with_freetype_src" != x; then
44484       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
44485         # Try to build freetype if --with-freetype-src was given on Windows
44486 
44487   FREETYPE_SRC_PATH="$with_freetype_src"
44488   BUILD_FREETYPE=yes
44489 
44490   # Check if the freetype sources are acessible..
44491   if ! test -d $FREETYPE_SRC_PATH; then
44492     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-freetype-src specified, but can't find path \"$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH\" - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44493 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-freetype-src specified, but can't find path \"$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH\" - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44494     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44495   fi
44496   # ..and contain a vc2010 project file
44497   vcxproj_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/builds/windows/vc2010/freetype.vcxproj"
44498   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes && ! test -s $vcxproj_path; then
44499     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Can't find project file $vcxproj_path (you may try a newer freetype version) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44500 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Can't find project file $vcxproj_path (you may try a newer freetype version) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44501     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44502   fi
44503   # Now check if configure found a version of 'msbuild.exe'
44504   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes && test "x$MSBUILD" == x ; then
44505     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Can not find an msbuild.exe executable (you may try to install .NET 4.0) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44506 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Can not find an msbuild.exe executable (you may try to install .NET 4.0) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44507     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44508   fi
44509 
44510   # Ready to go..
44511   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44512 
44513     # msbuild requires trailing slashes for output directories
44514     freetype_lib_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS/"
44515     freetype_lib_path_unix="$freetype_lib_path"
44516     freetype_obj_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/obj$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS/"
44517 
44518   unix_path="$vcxproj_path"
44519   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44520     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44521     vcxproj_path="$windows_path"
44522   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44523     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44524     vcxproj_path="$windows_path"
44525   fi
44526 
44527 
44528   unix_path="$freetype_lib_path"
44529   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44530     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44531     freetype_lib_path="$windows_path"
44532   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44533     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44534     freetype_lib_path="$windows_path"
44535   fi
44536 
44537 
44538   unix_path="$freetype_obj_path"
44539   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44540     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44541     freetype_obj_path="$windows_path"
44542   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44543     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44544     freetype_obj_path="$windows_path"
44545   fi
44546 
44547     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
44548       freetype_platform=x64
44549     else
44550       freetype_platform=win32
44551     fi
44552 
44553     # The original freetype project file is for VS 2010 (i.e. 'v100'),
44554     # so we have to adapt the toolset if building with any other toolsed (i.e. SDK).
44555     # Currently 'PLATFORM_TOOLSET' is set in 'TOOLCHAIN_CHECK_POSSIBLE_VISUAL_STUDIO_ROOT'/
44556     # 'TOOLCHAIN_CHECK_POSSIBLE_WIN_SDK_ROOT' in toolchain_windows.m4
44557     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Trying to compile freetype sources with PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET to $freetype_lib_path_unix ..." >&5
44558 $as_echo "$as_me: Trying to compile freetype sources with PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET to $freetype_lib_path_unix ..." >&6;}
44559 
44560     # First we try to build the freetype.dll
44561     $ECHO -e "@echo off\n"\
44562              "$MSBUILD $vcxproj_path "\
44563                        "/p:PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET "\
44564                        "/p:Configuration=\"Release Multithreaded\" "\
44565                        "/p:Platform=$freetype_platform "\
44566                        "/p:ConfigurationType=DynamicLibrary "\
44567                        "/p:TargetName=freetype "\
44568                        "/p:OutDir=\"$freetype_lib_path\" "\
44569                        "/p:IntDir=\"$freetype_obj_path\" > freetype.log" > freetype.bat
44570     cmd /c freetype.bat
44571 
44572     if test -s "$freetype_lib_path_unix/freetype.dll"; then
44573       # If that succeeds we also build freetype.lib
44574       $ECHO -e "@echo off\n"\
44575                "$MSBUILD $vcxproj_path "\
44576                          "/p:PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET "\
44577                          "/p:Configuration=\"Release Multithreaded\" "\
44578                          "/p:Platform=$freetype_platform "\
44579                          "/p:ConfigurationType=StaticLibrary "\
44580                          "/p:TargetName=freetype "\
44581                          "/p:OutDir=\"$freetype_lib_path\" "\
