44582                          "/p:IntDir=\"$freetype_obj_path\" >> freetype.log" > freetype.bat
44583       cmd /c freetype.bat
44584 
44585       if test -s "$freetype_lib_path_unix/freetype.lib"; then
44586         # Once we build both, lib and dll, set freetype lib and include path appropriately
44587         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/include"
44588         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$freetype_lib_path_unix"
44589         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compiling freetype sources succeeded! (see freetype.log for build results)" >&5
44590 $as_echo "$as_me: Compiling freetype sources succeeded! (see freetype.log for build results)" >&6;}
44591       else
44592         BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44593       fi
44594     else
44595       BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44596     fi
44597   fi
44598 
44599         if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44600           # Okay, we built it. Check that it works.
44601 
44602   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44603   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44604   METHOD="--with-freetype-src"
44605 
44606   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
44607   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
44608 
44609   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
44610   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44611     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
44612     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
44613     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44614       # Fail.
44615       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44616     fi
44617   fi
44618 
44619   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44620     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
44621     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
44622 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
44623 
44624     # Reset to default value
44625     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44626     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44627     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44628       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
44629           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
44630         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
44631         # for the .6 version explicitly.
44632         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
44633         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44634         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
44635 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
44636       else
44637         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
44638 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
44639         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44640       fi
44641     else
44642       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
44643         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
44644         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
44645           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
44646 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
44647           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44648         fi
44649       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
44650           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44651         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
44652         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
44653         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
44654 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
44655       fi
44656     fi
44657   fi
44658 
44659   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44660 
44661   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44662 
44663   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
44664   # unix format.
44665   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44666   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
44667 
44668   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
44669   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
44670   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
44671   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
44672   #
44673   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
44674   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
44675   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
44676   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
44677     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44678 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44679     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
44680   fi
44681 
44682   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
44683   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
44684 
44685   input_path="$new_path"
44686   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44687   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44688   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44689   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44690   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
44691   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44692     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44693     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
44694     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44695     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
44696       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
44697       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
44698       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44699       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
44700       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44701       new_path="$input_path"
44702     fi
44703   fi
44704 
44705   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
44706   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
44707     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
44708     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
44709       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
44710       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
44711       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
44712     fi
44713   fi
44714 
44715 
44716   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44717     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
44718     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44719 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44720   fi
44721 
44722   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44723 
44724   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44725   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
44726   new_path="$path"
44727   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
44728     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
44729     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
44730   fi
44731 
44732 
44733   input_path="$new_path"
44734   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44735   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44736   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44737   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44738   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
44739   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44740     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44741     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44742   fi
44743 
44744 
44745   windows_path="$new_path"
44746   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44747     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
44748     new_path="$unix_path"
44749   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44750     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
44751     new_path="$unix_path"
44752   fi
44753 
44754   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44755     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
44756     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44757 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44758   fi
44759 
44760   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
44761   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
44762 
44763   else
44764     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
44765     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44766     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
44767     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
44768       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44769 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44770       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
44771     fi
44772 
44773     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
44774     eval path="$path"
44775     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
44776       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
44777     fi
44778 
44779     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
44780   fi
44781 
44782 
44783   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44784 
44785   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
44786   # unix format.
44787   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44788   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
44789 
44790   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
44791   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
44792   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
44793   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
44794   #
44795   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
44796   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
44797   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
44798   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
44799     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44800 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44801     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
44802   fi
44803 
44804   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
44805   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
44806 
44807   input_path="$new_path"
44808   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44809   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44810   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44811   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44812   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
44813   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44814     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44815     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
44816     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44817     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
44818       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
44819       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
44820       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44821       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
44822       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44823       new_path="$input_path"
44824     fi
44825   fi
44826 
44827   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
44828   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
44829     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
44830     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
44831       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
44832       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
44833       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
44834     fi
44835   fi
44836 
44837 
44838   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44839     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
44840     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44841 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44842   fi
44843 
44844   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44845 
44846   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44847   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
44848   new_path="$path"
44849   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
44850     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
44851     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
44852   fi
44853 
44854 
44855   input_path="$new_path"
44856   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44857   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44858   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44859   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44860   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
44861   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44862     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44863     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44864   fi
44865 
44866 
44867   windows_path="$new_path"
44868   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44869     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
44870     new_path="$unix_path"
44871   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44872     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
44873     new_path="$unix_path"
44874   fi
44875 
44876   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44877     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
44878     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44879 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44880   fi
44881 
44882   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
44883   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
44884 
44885   else
44886     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
44887     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44888     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
44889     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
44890       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44891 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44892       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
44893     fi
44894 
44895     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
44896     eval path="$path"
44897     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
44898       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
44899     fi
44900 
44901     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
44902   fi
44903 
44904 
44905     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44906     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
44907 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
44908     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
44909 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
44910     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44911     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
44912 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
44913     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
44914 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
44915   fi
44916 
44917           if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
44918             as_fn_error $? "Can not use the built freetype at location given by --with-freetype-src" "$LINENO" 5
44919           fi
44920         else
44921           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: User specified --with-freetype-src but building freetype failed. (see freetype.log for build results)" >&5
44922 $as_echo "$as_me: User specified --with-freetype-src but building freetype failed. (see freetype.log for build results)" >&6;}
44923           as_fn_error $? "Consider building freetype manually and using --with-freetype instead." "$LINENO" 5
44924         fi
44925       else
44926         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-freetype-src is currently only supported on Windows - ignoring" >&5
44927 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-freetype-src is currently only supported on Windows - ignoring" >&2;}
44928       fi
44929     fi
44930 
44931     if test "x$with_freetype" != x || test "x$with_freetype_include" != x || test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x; then
44932       # User has specified settings
44933 
44934       if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = x; then
44935         # If not specified, default is to bundle freetype
44936         BUNDLE_FREETYPE=yes
44937       fi
44938 
44939       if test "x$with_freetype" != x; then
44940         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$with_freetype/include"
44941         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$with_freetype/lib"
44942       fi
44943 
44944       # Allow --with-freetype-lib and --with-freetype-include to override
44945       if test "x$with_freetype_include" != x; then
44946         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$with_freetype_include"
44947       fi
44948       if test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x; then
44949         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$with_freetype_lib"
44950       fi
44951 
44952       if test "x$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" != x && test "x$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" != x; then
44953         # Okay, we got it. Check that it works.
44954 
44955   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44956   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44957   METHOD="--with-freetype"
44958 
44959   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
44960   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
44961 
44962   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
44963   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44964     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
44965     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
44966     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44967       # Fail.
44968       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44969     fi
44970   fi
44971 
44972   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44973     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
44974     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
44975 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
44976 
44977     # Reset to default value
44978     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44979     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44980     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44981       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
44982           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
44983         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
44984         # for the .6 version explicitly.
44985         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
44986         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44987         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
44988 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
44989       else
44990         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
44991 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
44992         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44993       fi
44994     else
44995       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
44996         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
44997         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
44998           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
44999 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
45000           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45001         fi
45002       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
45003           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
45004         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
45005         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
45006         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
45007 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
45008       fi
45009     fi
45010   fi
45011 
45012   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45013 
45014   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45015 
45016   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
45017   # unix format.
45018   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45019   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
45020 
45021   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
45022   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
45023   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
45024   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
45025   #
45026   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
45027   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
45028   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
45029   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
45030     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45031 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45032     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
45033   fi
45034 
45035   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
45036   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
45037 
45038   input_path="$new_path"
45039   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45040   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45041   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45042   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45043   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
45044   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45045     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45046     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
45047     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45048     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
45049       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
45050       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
45051       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45052       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
45053       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45054       new_path="$input_path"
45055     fi
45056   fi
45057 
45058   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
45059   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
45060     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
45061     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
45062       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
45063       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
45064       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
45065     fi
45066   fi
45067 
45068 
45069   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45070     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
45071     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45072 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45073   fi
45074 
45075   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45076 
45077   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45078   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
45079   new_path="$path"
45080   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
45081     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
45082     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
45083   fi
45084 
45085 
45086   input_path="$new_path"
45087   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45088   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45089   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45090   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45091   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
45092   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45093     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45094     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45095   fi
45096 
45097 
45098   windows_path="$new_path"
45099   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45100     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45101     new_path="$unix_path"
45102   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45103     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45104     new_path="$unix_path"
45105   fi
45106 
45107   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45108     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
45109     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45110 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45111   fi
45112 
45113   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
45114   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
45115 
45116   else
45117     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
45118     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45119     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
45120     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
45121       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45122 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45123       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
45124     fi
45125 
45126     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
45127     eval path="$path"
45128     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
45129       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
45130     fi
45131 
45132     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
45133   fi
45134 
45135 
45136   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45137 
45138   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
45139   # unix format.
45140   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45141   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
45142 
45143   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
45144   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
45145   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
45146   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
45147   #
45148   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
45149   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
45150   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
45151   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
45152     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45153 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45154     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
45155   fi
45156 
45157   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
45158   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
45159 
45160   input_path="$new_path"
45161   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45162   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45163   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45164   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45165   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
45166   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45167     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45168     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
45169     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45170     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
45171       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
45172       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
45173       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45174       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
45175       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45176       new_path="$input_path"
45177     fi
45178   fi
45179 
45180   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
45181   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
45182     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
45183     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
45184       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
45185       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
45186       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
45187     fi
45188   fi
45189 
45190 
45191   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45192     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
45193     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45194 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45195   fi
45196 
45197   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45198 
45199   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45200   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
45201   new_path="$path"
45202   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
45203     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
45204     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
45205   fi
45206 
45207 
45208   input_path="$new_path"
45209   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45210   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45211   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45212   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45213   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
45214   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45215     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45216     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45217   fi
45218 
45219 
45220   windows_path="$new_path"
45221   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45222     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45223     new_path="$unix_path"
45224   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45225     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45226     new_path="$unix_path"
45227   fi
45228 
45229   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45230     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
45231     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45232 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45233   fi
45234 
45235   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
45236   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
45237 
45238   else
45239     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
45240     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45241     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
45242     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
45243       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45244 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45245       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
45246     fi
45247 
45248     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
45249     eval path="$path"
45250     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
45251       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
45252     fi
45253 
45254     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
45255   fi
45256 
45257 
45258     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45259     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
45260 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
45261     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
45262 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
45263     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45264     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
45265 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
45266     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
45267 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
45268   fi
45269 
45270         if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
45271           as_fn_error $? "Can not find or use freetype at location given by --with-freetype" "$LINENO" 5
45272         fi
45273       else
45274         # User specified only one of lib or include. This is an error.
45275         if test "x$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" = x ; then
45276           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: User specified --with-freetype-lib but not --with-freetype-include" >&5
45277 $as_echo "$as_me: User specified --with-freetype-lib but not --with-freetype-include" >&6;}
45278           as_fn_error $? "Need both freetype lib and include paths. Consider using --with-freetype instead." "$LINENO" 5
45279         else
45280           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: User specified --with-freetype-include but not --with-freetype-lib" >&5
45281 $as_echo "$as_me: User specified --with-freetype-include but not --with-freetype-lib" >&6;}
45282           as_fn_error $? "Need both freetype lib and include paths. Consider using --with-freetype instead." "$LINENO" 5
45283         fi
45284       fi
45285     else
45286       # User did not specify settings, but we need freetype. Try to locate it.
45287 
45288       if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = x; then
45289         # If not specified, default is to bundle freetype only on windows
45290         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
45291           BUNDLE_FREETYPE=yes
45292         else
45293           BUNDLE_FREETYPE=no
45294         fi
45295       fi
45296 
45297       if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
45298         # Check builddeps
45299 
45300 
45301   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
45302     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
45303     . $builddepsfile
45304     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
45305     eval resource=\${builddep_freetype2_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
45306     if test "x$resource" = x; then
45307       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
45308       eval resource=\${builddep_freetype2_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
45309     fi
45310     if test "x$resource" = x; then
45311       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
45312       eval resource=\${builddep_freetype2_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
45313     fi
45314     if test "x$resource" = x; then
45315       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
45316       # (The freetype2 comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
45317       resource=${builddep_freetype2}
45318     fi
45319     if test "x$resource" != x; then
45320       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for freetype2" >&5
45321 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for freetype2" >&6;}
45322       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
45323       # for example /java/linux/cups
45324       if test -d ${resource}; then
45325         depdir=${resource}
45326       else
45327 
45328   # freetype2 is for example mymodule
45329   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
45330   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
45331   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
45332   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
45333   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
45334   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
45335   filename=`basename $resource`
45336   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
45337   filebase=${filename%%.*}
45338   extension=${filename#*.}
45339   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
45340   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
45341     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency freetype2 from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
45342 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency freetype2 from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
45343     if test ! -d $installdir; then
45344       mkdir -p $installdir
45345     fi
45346     if test ! -d $installdir; then
45347       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
45348     fi
45349     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/freetype2.XXXXXXXXX`
45350     touch $tmpfile
45351     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
45352       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
45353     fi
45354 
45355   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
45356   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
45357   VALID_TOOL=no
45358   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
45359     VALID_TOOL=yes
45360     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
45361   fi
45362   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
45363     VALID_TOOL=yes
45364     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
45365   fi
45366   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
45367     VALID_TOOL=yes
45368     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
45369     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
45370     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
45371     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
45372       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
45373       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
45374       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
45375     else
45376       FTPUSER=ftp
45377       FTPPWD=ftp
45378     fi
45379     # the "pass" command does not work on some
45380     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
45381     # passive mode is better!
45382     ( \
45383         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
45384         echo "pass"                         ; \
45385         echo "bin"                          ; \
45386         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
45387     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
45388   fi
45389   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
45390     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
45391   fi
45392 
45393     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
45394     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
45395       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
45396     fi
45397     case "$extension" in
45398       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
45399         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
45400         ;;
45401       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
45402         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
45403         ;;
45404       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
45405         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
45406         ;;
45407       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
45408         ;;
45409     esac
45410   fi
45411   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
45412     depdir=$installdir
45413   fi
45414 
45415       fi
45416       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
45417       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
45418       . $builddepsfile
45419       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
45420       theroot=${builddep_freetype2_ROOT}
45421       thecflags=${builddep_freetype2_CFLAGS}
45422       thelibs=${builddep_freetype2_LIBS}
45423       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
45424         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency freetype2" "$LINENO" 5
45425       fi
45426       FREETYPE=$depdir
45427       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
45428         FREETYPE="$theroot"
45429       fi
45430       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
45431         FREETYPE_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
45432       fi
45433       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
45434         FREETYPE_LIBS="$thelibs"
45435       fi
45436       FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
45437       else FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45438 
45439     fi
45440     else FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45441 
45442   fi
45443 
45444         # BDEPS_CHECK_MODULE will set FREETYPE_CFLAGS and _LIBS, but we don't get a lib path for bundling.
45445         if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45446           if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45447             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype using builddeps, but ignoring since we can not bundle that" >&5
45448 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype using builddeps, but ignoring since we can not bundle that" >&6;}
45449             FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45450           else
45451             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype" >&5
45452 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype... " >&6; }
45453             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes (using builddeps)" >&5
45454 $as_echo "yes (using builddeps)" >&6; }
45455           fi
45456         fi
45457       fi
45458 
45459       # If we have a sysroot, assume that's where we are supposed to look and skip pkg-config.
45460       if test "x$SYSROOT" = x; then
45461         if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
45462           # Check modules using pkg-config, but only if we have it (ugly output results otherwise)
45463           if test "x$PKG_CONFIG" != x; then
45464 
45465 pkg_failed=no
45466 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for FREETYPE" >&5
45467 $as_echo_n "checking for FREETYPE... " >&6; }
45468 
45469 if test -n "$FREETYPE_CFLAGS"; then
45470     pkg_cv_FREETYPE_CFLAGS="$FREETYPE_CFLAGS"
45471  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
45472     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
45473     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"freetype2\""; } >&5
45474   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "freetype2") 2>&5
45475   ac_status=$?
45476   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
45477   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
45478   pkg_cv_FREETYPE_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "freetype2" 2>/dev/null`
45479 else
45480   pkg_failed=yes
45481 fi
45482  else
45483     pkg_failed=untried
45484 fi
45485 if test -n "$FREETYPE_LIBS"; then
45486     pkg_cv_FREETYPE_LIBS="$FREETYPE_LIBS"
45487  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
45488     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
45489     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"freetype2\""; } >&5
45490   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "freetype2") 2>&5
45491   ac_status=$?
45492   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
45493   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
45494   pkg_cv_FREETYPE_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "freetype2" 2>/dev/null`
45495 else
45496   pkg_failed=yes
45497 fi
45498  else
45499     pkg_failed=untried
45500 fi
45501 
45502 
45503 
45504 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
45505 
45506 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
45507         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
45508 else
45509         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
45510 fi
45511         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
45512                 FREETYPE_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "freetype2" 2>&1`
45513         else
45514                 FREETYPE_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "freetype2" 2>&1`
45515         fi
45516         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
45517         echo "$FREETYPE_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
45518 
45519         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
45520 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
45521                 FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45522 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
45523         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45524 else
45525         FREETYPE_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_FREETYPE_CFLAGS
45526         FREETYPE_LIBS=$pkg_cv_FREETYPE_LIBS
45527         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
45528 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
45529         FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
45530 fi
45531             if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45532               # On solaris, pkg_check adds -lz to freetype libs, which isn't necessary for us.
45533               FREETYPE_LIBS=`$ECHO $FREETYPE_LIBS | $SED 's/-lz//g'`
45534               # 64-bit libs for Solaris x86 are installed in the amd64 subdirectory, change lib to lib/amd64
45535               if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
45536                 FREETYPE_LIBS=`$ECHO $FREETYPE_LIBS | $SED 's?/lib?/lib/amd64?g'`
45537               fi
45538               # BDEPS_CHECK_MODULE will set FREETYPE_CFLAGS and _LIBS, but we don't get a lib path for bundling.
45539               if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45540                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype using pkg-config, but ignoring since we can not bundle that" >&5
45541 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype using pkg-config, but ignoring since we can not bundle that" >&6;}
45542                 FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45543               else
45544                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype" >&5
45545 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype... " >&6; }
45546                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes (using pkg-config)" >&5
45547 $as_echo "yes (using pkg-config)" >&6; }
45548               fi
45549             fi
45550           fi
45551         fi
45552       fi
45553 
45554       if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
45555         # Check in well-known locations
45556         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
45557           FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$PROGRAMFILES/GnuWin32"
45558 
45559   windows_path="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR"
45560   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45561     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45562     FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$unix_path"
45563   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45564     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45565     FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$unix_path"
45566   fi
45567 
45568 
45569   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/include"
45570   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/lib"
45571   METHOD="well-known location"
45572 
45573   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
45574   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
45575 
45576   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
45577   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
45578     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
45579     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
45580     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
45581       # Fail.
45582       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45583     fi
45584   fi
45585 
45586   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45587     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
45588     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
45589 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
45590 
45591     # Reset to default value
45592     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
45593     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
45594     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
45595       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
45596           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
45597         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
45598         # for the .6 version explicitly.
45599         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
45600         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
45601         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
45602 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
45603       else
45604         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
45605 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
45606         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45607       fi
45608     else
45609       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
45610         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
45611         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
45612           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
45613 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
45614           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45615         fi
45616       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
45617           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
45618         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
45619         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
45620         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
45621 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
45622       fi
45623     fi
45624   fi
45625 
45626   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45627 
45628   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45629 
45630   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
45631   # unix format.
45632   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45633   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
45634 
45635   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
45636   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
45637   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
45638   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
45639   #
45640   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
45641   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
45642   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
45643   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
45644     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45645 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45646     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
45647   fi
45648 
45649   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
45650   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
45651 
45652   input_path="$new_path"
45653   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45654   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45655   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45656   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45657   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
45658   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45659     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45660     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
45661     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45662     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
45663       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
45664       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
45665       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45666       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
45667       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45668       new_path="$input_path"
45669     fi
45670   fi
45671 
45672   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
45673   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
45674     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
45675     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
45676       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
45677       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
45678       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
45679     fi
45680   fi
45681 
45682 
45683   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45684     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
45685     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45686 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45687   fi
45688 
45689   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45690 
45691   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45692   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
45693   new_path="$path"
45694   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
45695     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
45696     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
45697   fi
45698 
45699 
45700   input_path="$new_path"
45701   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45702   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45703   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45704   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45705   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
45706   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45707     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45708     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45709   fi
45710 
45711 
45712   windows_path="$new_path"
45713   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45714     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45715     new_path="$unix_path"
45716   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45717     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45718     new_path="$unix_path"
45719   fi
45720 
45721   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45722     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
45723     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45724 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45725   fi
45726 
45727   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
45728   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
45729 
45730   else
45731     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
45732     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45733     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
45734     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
45735       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45736 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45737       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
45738     fi
45739 
45740     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
45741     eval path="$path"
45742     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
45743       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
45744     fi
45745 
45746     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
45747   fi
45748 
45749 
45750   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45751 
45752   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
45753   # unix format.
45754   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45755   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
45756 
45757   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
45758   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
45759   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
45760   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
45761   #
45762   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
45763   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
45764   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
45765   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
45766     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45767 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45768     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
45769   fi
45770 
45771   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
45772   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
45773 
45774   input_path="$new_path"
45775   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45776   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45777   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45778   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45779   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
45780   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45781     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45782     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
45783     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45784     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
45785       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
45786       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
45787       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45788       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
45789       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45790       new_path="$input_path"
45791     fi
45792   fi
45793 
45794   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
45795   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
45796     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
45797     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
45798       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
45799       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
45800       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
45801     fi
45802   fi
45803 
45804 
45805   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45806     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
45807     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45808 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45809   fi
45810 
45811   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45812 
45813   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45814   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
45815   new_path="$path"
45816   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
45817     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
45818     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
45819   fi
45820 
45821 
45822   input_path="$new_path"
45823   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45824   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45825   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45826   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45827   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
45828   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45829     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45830     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45831   fi
45832 
45833 
45834   windows_path="$new_path"
45835   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45836     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45837     new_path="$unix_path"
45838   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45839     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45840     new_path="$unix_path"
45841   fi
45842 
45843   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
45844     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
45845     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
45846 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
45847   fi
45848 
45849   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
45850   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
45851 
45852   else
45853     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
45854     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45855     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
45856     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
45857       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45858 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45859       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
45860     fi
45861 
45862     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
45863     eval path="$path"
45864     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
45865       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
45866     fi
45867 
45868     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
45869   fi
45870 
45871 
45872     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45873     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
45874 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
45875     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
45876 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
45877     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
45878     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
45879 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
45880     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
45881 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
45882   fi
45883 
45884           if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
45885             FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$ProgramW6432/GnuWin32"
45886 
45887   windows_path="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR"
45888   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45889     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
45890     FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$unix_path"
45891   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
45892     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
45893     FREETYPE_BASE_DIR="$unix_path"
45894   fi
45895 
45896 
45897   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/include"
45898   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/lib"
45899   METHOD="well-known location"
45900 
45901   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
45902   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
45903 
45904   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
45905   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
45906     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
45907     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
45908     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
45909       # Fail.
45910       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45911     fi
45912   fi
45913 
45914   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45915     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
45916     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
45917 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
45918 
45919     # Reset to default value
45920     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
45921     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
45922     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
45923       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
45924           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
45925         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
45926         # for the .6 version explicitly.
45927         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
45928         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
45929         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
45930 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
45931       else
45932         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
45933 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
45934         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45935       fi
45936     else
45937       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
45938         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
45939         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
45940           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
45941 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
45942           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
45943         fi
45944       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
45945           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
45946         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
45947         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
45948         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
45949 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
45950       fi
45951     fi
45952   fi
45953 
45954   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
45955 
45956   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
45957 
45958   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
45959   # unix format.
45960   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
45961   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
45962 
45963   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
45964   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
45965   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
45966   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
45967   #
45968   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
45969   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
45970   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
45971   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
45972     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
45973 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
45974     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
45975   fi
45976 
45977   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
45978   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
45979 
45980   input_path="$new_path"
45981   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
45982   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
45983   # take no chances and rewrite it.
45984   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
45985   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
45986   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
45987     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
45988     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
45989     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45990     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
45991       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
45992       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
45993       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
45994       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
45995       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
45996       new_path="$input_path"
45997     fi
45998   fi
45999 
46000   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
46001   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
46002     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
46003     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
46004       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
46005       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
46006       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
46007     fi
46008   fi
46009 
46010 
46011   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
46012     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
46013     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
46014 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
46015   fi
46016 
46017   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
46018 
46019   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
46020   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
46021   new_path="$path"
46022   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
46023     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
46024     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
46025   fi
46026 
46027 
46028   input_path="$new_path"
46029   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
46030   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
46031   # take no chances and rewrite it.
46032   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
46033   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
46034   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
46035     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
46036     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
46037   fi
46038 
46039 
46040   windows_path="$new_path"
46041   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
46042     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
46043     new_path="$unix_path"
46044   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
46045     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
46046     new_path="$unix_path"
46047   fi
46048 
46049   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
46050     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
46051     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
46052 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
46053   fi
46054 
46055   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
46056   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
46057 
46058   else
46059     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
46060     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
46061     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
46062     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
46063       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
46064 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
46065       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
46066     fi
46067 
46068     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
46069     eval path="$path"
46070     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
46071       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
46072     fi
46073 
46074     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
46075   fi
46076 
46077 
46078   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
46079 
46080   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
46081   # unix format.
46082   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
46083   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
46084 
46085   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
46086   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
46087   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
46088   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
46089   #
46090   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
46091   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
46092   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
46093   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
46094     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
46095 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
46096     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
46097   fi
46098 
46099   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
46100   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
46101 
46102   input_path="$new_path"
