47592       new_path="$input_path"
47593     fi
47594   fi
47595 
47596   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
47597   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
47598     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
47599     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
47600       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
47601       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
47602       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
47603     fi
47604   fi
47605 
47606 
47607   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47608     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
47609     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47610 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47611   fi
47612 
47613   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47614 
47615   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47616   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
47617   new_path="$path"
47618   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
47619     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
47620     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
47621   fi
47622 
47623 
47624   input_path="$new_path"
47625   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
47626   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
47627   # take no chances and rewrite it.
47628   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
47629   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
47630   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
47631     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
47632     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
47633   fi
47634 
47635 
47636   windows_path="$new_path"
47637   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47638     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
47639     new_path="$unix_path"
47640   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47641     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
47642     new_path="$unix_path"
47643   fi
47644 
47645   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47646     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
47647     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47648 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47649   fi
47650 
47651   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
47652   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
47653 
47654   else
47655     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
47656     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47657     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
47658     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
47659       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
47660 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
47661       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
47662     fi
47663 
47664     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
47665     eval path="$path"
47666     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
47667       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
47668     fi
47669 
47670     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
47671   fi
47672 
47673 
47674   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47675 
47676   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
47677   # unix format.
47678   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
47679   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
47680 
47681   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
47682   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
47683   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
47684   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
47685   #
47686   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
47687   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
47688   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
47689   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
47690     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
47691 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
47692     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
47693   fi
47694 
47695   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
47696   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
47697 
47698   input_path="$new_path"
47699   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
47700   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
47701   # take no chances and rewrite it.
47702   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
47703   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
47704   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
47705     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
47706     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
47707     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
47708     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
47709       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
47710       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
47711       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
47712       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
47713       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
47714       new_path="$input_path"
47715     fi
47716   fi
47717 
47718   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
47719   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
47720     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
47721     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
47722       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
47723       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
47724       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
47725     fi
47726   fi
47727 
47728 
47729   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47730     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
47731     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47732 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47733   fi
47734 
47735   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47736 
47737   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
47738   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
47739   new_path="$path"
47740   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
47741     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
47742     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
47743   fi
47744 
47745 
47746   input_path="$new_path"
47747   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
47748   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
47749   # take no chances and rewrite it.
47750   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
47751   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
47752   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
47753     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
47754     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
47755   fi
47756 
47757 
47758   windows_path="$new_path"
47759   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47760     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
47761     new_path="$unix_path"
47762   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47763     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
47764     new_path="$unix_path"
47765   fi
47766 
47767   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47768     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
47769     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47770 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47771   fi
47772 
47773   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
47774   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
47775 
47776   else
47777     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
47778     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
47779     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
47780     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
47781       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
47782 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
47783       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
47784     fi
47785 
47786     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
47787     eval path="$path"
47788     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
47789       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
47790     fi
47791 
47792     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
47793   fi
47794 
47795 
47796     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47797     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
47798 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
47799     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
47800 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
47801     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
47802     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
47803 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
47804     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
47805 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
47806   fi
47807 
47808               if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
47809 
47810   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/include"
47811   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$FREETYPE_BASE_DIR/lib32"
47812   METHOD="well-known location"
47813 
47814   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
47815   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
47816 
47817   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
47818   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
47819     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
47820     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
47821     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
47822       # Fail.
47823       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
47824     fi
47825   fi
47826 
47827   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
47828     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
47829     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
47830 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
47831 
47832     # Reset to default value
47833     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
47834     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
47835     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
47836       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
47837           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
47838         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
47839         # for the .6 version explicitly.
47840         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
47841         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
47842         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
47843 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
47844       else
47845         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
47846 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
47847         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
47848       fi
47849     else
47850       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
47851         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
47852         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
47853           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
47854 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
47855           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
47856         fi
47857       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
47858           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
47859         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
47860         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
47861         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
47862 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
47863       fi
47864     fi
47865   fi
47866 
47867   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
47868 
47869   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47870 
47871   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
47872   # unix format.
47873   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47874   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
47875 
47876   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
47877   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
47878   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
47879   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
47880   #
47881   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
47882   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
47883   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
47884   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
47885     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
47886 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
47887     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
47888   fi
47889 
47890   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
47891   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
47892 
47893   input_path="$new_path"
47894   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
47895   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
47896   # take no chances and rewrite it.
47897   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
47898   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
47899   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
47900     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
47901     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
47902     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
47903     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
47904       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
47905       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
47906       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
47907       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
47908       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
47909       new_path="$input_path"
47910     fi
47911   fi
47912 
47913   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
47914   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
47915     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
47916     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
47917       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
47918       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
47919       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
47920     fi
47921   fi
47922 
47923 
47924   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47925     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
47926     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47927 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47928   fi
47929 
47930   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47931 
47932   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47933   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
47934   new_path="$path"
47935   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
47936     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
47937     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
47938   fi
47939 
47940 
47941   input_path="$new_path"
47942   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
47943   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
47944   # take no chances and rewrite it.
47945   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
47946   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
47947   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
47948     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
47949     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
47950   fi
47951 
47952 
47953   windows_path="$new_path"
47954   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47955     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
47956     new_path="$unix_path"
47957   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
47958     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
47959     new_path="$unix_path"
47960   fi
47961 
47962   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
47963     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
47964     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
47965 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
47966   fi
47967 
47968   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
47969   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
47970 
47971   else
47972     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
47973     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
47974     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
47975     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
47976       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
47977 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
47978       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
47979     fi
47980 
47981     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
47982     eval path="$path"
47983     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
47984       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
47985     fi
47986 
47987     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
47988   fi
47989 
47990 
47991   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
47992 
47993   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
47994   # unix format.
47995   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
47996   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
47997 
47998   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
47999   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
48000   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
48001   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
48002   #
48003   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
48004   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
48005   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48006   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48007     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48008 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48009     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48010   fi
48011 
48012   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48013   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48014 
48015   input_path="$new_path"
48016   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48017   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48018   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48019   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48020   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48021   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48022     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48023     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48024     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48025     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48026       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48027       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48028       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48029       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48030       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48031       new_path="$input_path"
48032     fi
48033   fi
48034 
48035   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48036   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48037     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48038     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48039       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48040       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48041       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48042     fi
48043   fi
48044 
48045 
48046   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48047     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48048     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48049 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48050   fi
48051 
48052   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48053 
48054   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48055   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48056   new_path="$path"
48057   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48058     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48059     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48060   fi
48061 
48062 
48063   input_path="$new_path"
48064   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48065   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48066   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48067   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48068   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48069   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48070     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48071     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48072   fi
48073 
48074 
48075   windows_path="$new_path"
48076   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48077     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48078     new_path="$unix_path"
48079   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48080     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48081     new_path="$unix_path"
48082   fi
48083 
48084   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48085     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48086     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48087 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48088   fi
48089 
48090   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48091   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48092 
48093   else
48094     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48095     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48096     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48097     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48098       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48099 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48100       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48101     fi
48102 
48103     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48104     eval path="$path"
48105     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48106       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48107     fi
48108 
48109     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48110   fi
48111 
48112 
48113     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48114     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
48115 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
48116     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
48117 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
48118     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48119     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
48120 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
48121     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
48122 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
48123   fi
48124 
48125               fi
48126             fi
48127           fi
48128         fi
48129       fi # end check in well-known locations
48130 
48131       if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
48132 
48133   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48134   # freetype is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48135   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=freetype
48136 
48137   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48138     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48139   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48140     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48141   else
48142     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48143 
48144     case $PKGHANDLER in
48145       apt-get)
48146         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48147       yum)
48148         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48149       port)
48150         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48151       pkgutil)
48152         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48153       pkgadd)
48154         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48155     esac
48156 
48157     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48158       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48159     fi
48160   fi
48161 
48162         as_fn_error $? "Could not find freetype! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
48163       fi
48164     fi # end user specified settings
48165 
48166     # Set FREETYPE_CFLAGS, _LIBS and _LIB_PATH from include and lib dir.
48167     if test "x$FREETYPE_CFLAGS" = x; then
48168 
48169   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48170 
48171   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
48172   # unix format.
48173   path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48174   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
48175 
48176   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
48177   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
48178   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
48179   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
48180   #
48181   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
48182   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
48183   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48184   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48185     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48186 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48187     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48188   fi
48189 
48190   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48191   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48192 
48193   input_path="$new_path"
48194   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48195   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48196   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48197   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48198   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48199   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48200     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48201     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48202     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48203     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48204       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48205       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48206       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48207       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48208       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48209       new_path="$input_path"
48210     fi
48211   fi
48212 
48213   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48214   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48215     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48216     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48217       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48218       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48219       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48220     fi
48221   fi
48222 
48223 
48224   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48225     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
48226     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48227 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48228   fi
48229 
48230   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48231 
48232   path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48233   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48234   new_path="$path"
48235   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48236     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48237     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48238   fi
48239 
48240 
48241   input_path="$new_path"
48242   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48243   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48244   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48245   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48246   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48247   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48248     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48249     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48250   fi
48251 
48252 
48253   windows_path="$new_path"
48254   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48255     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48256     new_path="$unix_path"
48257   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48258     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48259     new_path="$unix_path"
48260   fi
48261 
48262   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48263     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
48264     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48265 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48266   fi
48267 
48268   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48269   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48270 
48271   else
48272     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48273     path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48274     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48275     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48276       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48277 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48278       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48279     fi
48280 
48281     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48282     eval path="$path"
48283     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48284       as_fn_error $? "The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48285     fi
48286 
48287     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48288   fi
48289 
48290       if test -d $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2/freetype; then
48291         FREETYPE_CFLAGS="-I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2 -I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48292       else
48293         FREETYPE_CFLAGS="-I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48294       fi
48295     fi
48296 
48297     if test "x$FREETYPE_LIBS" = x; then
48298 
48299   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48300 
48301   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
48302   # unix format.
48303   path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48304   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
48305 
48306   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
48307   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
48308   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
48309   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
48310   #
48311   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
48312   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
48313   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48314   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48315     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48316 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48317     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48318   fi
48319 
48320   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48321   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48322 
48323   input_path="$new_path"
48324   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48325   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48326   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48327   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48328   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48329   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48330     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48331     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48332     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48333     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48334       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48335       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48336       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48337       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48338       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48339       new_path="$input_path"
48340     fi
48341   fi
48342 
48343   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48344   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48345     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48346     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48347       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48348       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48349       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48350     fi
48351   fi
48352 
48353 
48354   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48355     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48356     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48357 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48358   fi
48359 
48360   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48361 
48362   path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48363   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48364   new_path="$path"
48365   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48366     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48367     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48368   fi
48369 
48370 
48371   input_path="$new_path"
48372   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48373   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48374   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48375   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48376   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48377   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48378     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48379     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48380   fi
48381 
48382 
48383   windows_path="$new_path"
48384   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48385     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48386     new_path="$unix_path"
48387   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48388     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48389     new_path="$unix_path"
48390   fi
48391 
48392   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48393     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48394     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48395 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48396   fi
48397 
48398   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48399   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48400 
48401   else
48402     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48403     path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48404     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48405     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48406       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48407 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48408       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48409     fi
48410 
48411     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48412     eval path="$path"
48413     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48414       as_fn_error $? "The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48415     fi
48416 
48417     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48418   fi
48419 
48420       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
48421         FREETYPE_LIBS="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_BASE_NAME.lib"
48422       else
48423         FREETYPE_LIBS="-L$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH -l$FREETYPE_BASE_NAME"
48424       fi
48425     fi
48426 
48427     # Try to compile it
48428     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we can compile and link with freetype" >&5
48429 $as_echo_n "checking if we can compile and link with freetype... " >&6; }
48430     ac_ext=cpp
48431 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
48432 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
48433 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
48434 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
48435 
48436     PREV_CXXCFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
48437     PREV_LIBS="$LIBS"
48438     PREV_CXX="$CXX"
48439     CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS $FREETYPE_CFLAGS"
48440     LIBS="$LIBS $FREETYPE_LIBS"
48441     CXX="$FIXPATH $CXX"
48442     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
48443 /* end confdefs.h.  */
48444 
48445           #include<ft2build.h>
48446           #include FT_FREETYPE_H
48447           int main () {
48448             FT_Init_FreeType(NULL);
48449             return 0;
48450           }
48451 
48452 _ACEOF
48453 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
48454 
48455           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
48456 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
48457 
48458 else
48459 
48460           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
48461 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
48462           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not compile and link with freetype. This might be a 32/64-bit mismatch." >&5
48463 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not compile and link with freetype. This might be a 32/64-bit mismatch." >&6;}
48464           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using FREETYPE_CFLAGS=$FREETYPE_CFLAGS and FREETYPE_LIBS=$FREETYPE_LIBS" >&5
48465 $as_echo "$as_me: Using FREETYPE_CFLAGS=$FREETYPE_CFLAGS and FREETYPE_LIBS=$FREETYPE_LIBS" >&6;}
48466 
48467 
48468   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48469   # freetype is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48470   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=freetype
48471 
48472   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48473     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48474   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48475     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48476   else
48477     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48478 
48479     case $PKGHANDLER in
48480       apt-get)
48481         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48482       yum)
48483         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48484       port)
48485         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48486       pkgutil)
48487         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48488       pkgadd)
48489         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48490     esac
48491 
48492     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48493       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48494     fi
48495   fi
48496 
48497 
48498           as_fn_error $? "Can not continue without freetype. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
48499 
48500 
48501 fi
48502 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
48503     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
48504     CXXCFLAGS="$PREV_CXXFLAGS"
48505     LIBS="$PREV_LIBS"
48506     CXX="$PREV_CXX"
48507     ac_ext=cpp
48508 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
48509 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
48510 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
48511 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
48512 
48513 
48514     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should bundle freetype" >&5
48515 $as_echo_n "checking if we should bundle freetype... " >&6; }
48516     if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
48517       FREETYPE_BUNDLE_LIB_PATH="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48518     fi
48519     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUNDLE_FREETYPE" >&5
48520 $as_echo "$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" >&6; }
48521 
48522   fi # end freetype needed
48523 
48524 
48525 
48526 
48527 
48528 
48529 
48530   ###############################################################################
48531   #
48532   # Check for alsa headers and libraries. Used on Linux/GNU systems.
48533   #
48534 
48535 # Check whether --with-alsa was given.
48536 if test "${with_alsa+set}" = set; then :
48537   withval=$with_alsa;
48538 fi
48539 
48540 
48541 # Check whether --with-alsa-include was given.
48542 if test "${with_alsa_include+set}" = set; then :
48543   withval=$with_alsa_include;
48544 fi
48545 
48546 
48547 # Check whether --with-alsa-lib was given.
48548 if test "${with_alsa_lib+set}" = set; then :
48549   withval=$with_alsa_lib;
48550 fi
48551 
48552 
48553   if test "x$ALSA_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
48554     if test "x${with_alsa}" != x || test "x${with_alsa_include}" != x || test "x${with_alsa_lib}" != x; then
48555       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: alsa not used, so --with-alsa is ignored" >&5
48556 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: alsa not used, so --with-alsa is ignored" >&2;}
48557     fi
48558     ALSA_CFLAGS=
48559     ALSA_LIBS=
48560   else
48561     ALSA_FOUND=no
48562 
48563     if test "x${with_alsa}" = xno || test "x${with_alsa_include}" = xno || test "x${with_alsa_lib}" = xno; then
48564       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to disable the use of alsa. Remove the --without-alsa option." "$LINENO" 5
48565     fi
48566 
48567     if test "x${with_alsa}" != x; then
48568       ALSA_LIBS="-L${with_alsa}/lib -lasound"
48569       ALSA_CFLAGS="-I${with_alsa}/include"
48570       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48571     fi
48572     if test "x${with_alsa_include}" != x; then
48573       ALSA_CFLAGS="-I${with_alsa_include}"
48574       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48575     fi
48576     if test "x${with_alsa_lib}" != x; then
48577       ALSA_LIBS="-L${with_alsa_lib} -lasound"
48578       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48579     fi
48580     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48581 
48582 
48583   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
48584     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
48585     . $builddepsfile
48586     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
48587     eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
48588     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48589       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
48590       eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
48591     fi
48592     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48593       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
48594       eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
48595     fi
48596     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48597       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
48598       # (The alsa comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
48599       resource=${builddep_alsa}
48600     fi
48601     if test "x$resource" != x; then
48602       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for alsa" >&5
48603 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for alsa" >&6;}
48604       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
48605       # for example /java/linux/cups
48606       if test -d ${resource}; then
48607         depdir=${resource}
48608       else
48609 
48610   # alsa is for example mymodule
48611   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
48612   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
48613   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
48614   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
48615   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
48616   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
48617   filename=`basename $resource`
48618   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
48619   filebase=${filename%%.*}
48620   extension=${filename#*.}
48621   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
48622   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
48623     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency alsa from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
48624 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency alsa from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
48625     if test ! -d $installdir; then
48626       mkdir -p $installdir
48627     fi
48628     if test ! -d $installdir; then
48629       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
48630     fi
48631     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/alsa.XXXXXXXXX`
48632     touch $tmpfile
48633     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
48634       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
48635     fi
48636 
48637   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
48638   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
48639   VALID_TOOL=no
48640   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
48641     VALID_TOOL=yes
48642     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
48643   fi
48644   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
48645     VALID_TOOL=yes
48646     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
48647   fi
48648   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
48649     VALID_TOOL=yes
48650     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
48651     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
48652     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
48653     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
48654       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
48655       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
48656       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
48657     else
48658       FTPUSER=ftp
48659       FTPPWD=ftp
48660     fi
48661     # the "pass" command does not work on some
48662     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
48663     # passive mode is better!
48664     ( \
48665         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
48666         echo "pass"                         ; \
48667         echo "bin"                          ; \
48668         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
48669     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
48670   fi
48671   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
48672     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
48673   fi
48674 
48675     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
48676     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
48677       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
48678     fi
48679     case "$extension" in
48680       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
48681         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48682         ;;
48683       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
48684         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48685         ;;
48686       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
48687         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48688         ;;
48689       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
48690         ;;
48691     esac
48692   fi
48693   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
48694     depdir=$installdir
48695   fi
48696 
48697       fi
48698       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
48699       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
48700       . $builddepsfile
48701       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
48702       theroot=${builddep_alsa_ROOT}
48703       thecflags=${builddep_alsa_CFLAGS}
48704       thelibs=${builddep_alsa_LIBS}
48705       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
48706         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency alsa" "$LINENO" 5
48707       fi
48708       ALSA=$depdir
48709       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
48710         ALSA="$theroot"
48711       fi
48712       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
48713         ALSA_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
48714       fi
48715       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
48716         ALSA_LIBS="$thelibs"
48717       fi
48718       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48719       else ALSA_FOUND=no
48720 
48721     fi
48722     else ALSA_FOUND=no
48723 
48724   fi
48725 
48726     fi
48727     # Do not try pkg-config if we have a sysroot set.
48728     if test "x$SYSROOT" = x; then
48729       if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48730 
48731 pkg_failed=no
48732 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for ALSA" >&5
48733 $as_echo_n "checking for ALSA... " >&6; }
48734 
48735 if test -n "$ALSA_CFLAGS"; then
48736     pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS="$ALSA_CFLAGS"
48737  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
48738     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
48739     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"alsa\""; } >&5
48740   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "alsa") 2>&5
48741   ac_status=$?
48742   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
48743   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
48744   pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "alsa" 2>/dev/null`
48745 else
48746   pkg_failed=yes
48747 fi
48748  else
48749     pkg_failed=untried
48750 fi
48751 if test -n "$ALSA_LIBS"; then
48752     pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS="$ALSA_LIBS"
48753  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
48754     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
48755     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"alsa\""; } >&5
48756   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "alsa") 2>&5
48757   ac_status=$?
48758   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
48759   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
48760   pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "alsa" 2>/dev/null`
48761 else
48762   pkg_failed=yes
48763 fi
48764  else
48765     pkg_failed=untried
48766 fi
48767 
48768 
48769 
48770 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
48771 
48772 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
48773         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
48774 else
48775         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
48776 fi
48777         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
48778                 ALSA_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "alsa" 2>&1`
48779         else
48780                 ALSA_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "alsa" 2>&1`
48781         fi
48782         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
48783         echo "$ALSA_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
48784 
48785         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
48786 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
48787                 ALSA_FOUND=no
48788 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
48789         ALSA_FOUND=no
48790 else
48791         ALSA_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS
48792         ALSA_LIBS=$pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS
48793         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
48794 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
48795         ALSA_FOUND=yes
48796 fi
48797       fi
48798     fi
48799     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48800       for ac_header in alsa/asoundlib.h
48801 do :
48802   ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "alsa/asoundlib.h" "ac_cv_header_alsa_asoundlib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48803 if test "x$ac_cv_header_alsa_asoundlib_h" = xyes; then :
48804   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
48805 #define HAVE_ALSA_ASOUNDLIB_H 1
48806 _ACEOF
48807 
48808             ALSA_FOUND=yes
48809             ALSA_CFLAGS=-Iignoreme
48810             ALSA_LIBS=-lasound
48811             DEFAULT_ALSA=yes
48812 
48813 else
48814   ALSA_FOUND=no
48815 fi
48816 
48817 done
48818 
48819     fi
48820     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48821 
48822   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48823   # alsa is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48824   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=alsa
48825 
48826   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48827     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48828   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48829     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48830   else
48831     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48832 
48833     case $PKGHANDLER in
48834       apt-get)
48835         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48836       yum)
48837         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48838       port)
48839         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48840       pkgutil)
48841         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48842       pkgadd)
48843         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48844     esac
48845 
48846     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48847       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48848     fi
48849   fi
48850 
48851       as_fn_error $? "Could not find alsa! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
48852     fi
48853   fi
48854 
48855 
48856 
48857 
48858 
48859 
48860   ###############################################################################
48861   #
48862   # Check for the jpeg library
48863   #
48864 
48865 
48866 # Check whether --with-libjpeg was given.
48867 if test "${with_libjpeg+set}" = set; then :
48868   withval=$with_libjpeg;
48869 fi
48870 
48871 
48872   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which libjpeg to use" >&5
48873 $as_echo_n "checking for which libjpeg to use... " >&6; }
48874 
48875   # default is bundled
48876   DEFAULT_LIBJPEG=bundled
48877 
48878   #
48879   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LIBJPEG
48880   #
48881   if test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "x"; then
48882     with_libjpeg=${DEFAULT_LIBJPEG}
48883   fi
48884 
48885   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${with_libjpeg}" >&5
48886 $as_echo "${with_libjpeg}" >&6; }
48887 
48888   if test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "xbundled"; then
48889     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBJPEG=false
48890   elif test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "xsystem"; then
48891     ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "jpeglib.h" "ac_cv_header_jpeglib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48892 if test "x$ac_cv_header_jpeglib_h" = xyes; then :
48893 
48894 else
48895    as_fn_error $? "--with-libjpeg=system specified, but jpeglib.h not found!" "$LINENO" 5
48896 fi
48897 
48898 
48899     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jpeg_CreateDecompress in -ljpeg" >&5
48900 $as_echo_n "checking for jpeg_CreateDecompress in -ljpeg... " >&6; }
48901 if ${ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress+:} false; then :
48902   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
48903 else
48904   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
48905 LIBS="-ljpeg  $LIBS"
48906 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
48907 /* end confdefs.h.  */
48908 
48909 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
48910    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
48911    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
48912 #ifdef __cplusplus
48913 extern "C"
48914 #endif
48915 char jpeg_CreateDecompress ();
48916 int
48917 main ()
48918 {
48919 return jpeg_CreateDecompress ();
48920   ;
48921   return 0;
48922 }
48923 _ACEOF
48924 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
48925   ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress=yes
48926 else
48927   ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress=no
48928 fi
48929 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
48930     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
48931 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
48932 fi
48933 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" >&5
48934 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" >&6; }
48935 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" = xyes; then :
48936   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
48937 #define HAVE_LIBJPEG 1
48938 _ACEOF
48939 
48940   LIBS="-ljpeg $LIBS"
48941 
48942 else
48943    as_fn_error $? "--with-libjpeg=system specified, but no libjpeg found" "$LINENO" 5
48944 fi
48945 
48946 
48947     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBJPEG=true
48948   else
48949     as_fn_error $? "Invalid use of --with-libjpeg: ${with_libjpeg}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
48950   fi
48951 
48952 
48953 
48954   ###############################################################################
48955   #
48956   # Check for the gif library
48957   #
48958 
48959 
48960 # Check whether --with-giflib was given.
48961 if test "${with_giflib+set}" = set; then :
48962   withval=$with_giflib;
48963 fi
48964 
48965 
48966 
48967   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which giflib to use" >&5
48968 $as_echo_n "checking for which giflib to use... " >&6; }
48969 
48970   # default is bundled
48971   DEFAULT_GIFLIB=bundled
48972 
48973   #
48974   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_GIFLIB
48975   #
48976   if test "x${with_giflib}" = "x"; then
48977     with_giflib=${DEFAULT_GIFLIB}
48978   fi
48979 
48980   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${with_giflib}" >&5
48981 $as_echo "${with_giflib}" >&6; }
48982 
48983   if test "x${with_giflib}" = "xbundled"; then
48984     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBGIF=false
48985   elif test "x${with_giflib}" = "xsystem"; then
48986     ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "gif_lib.h" "ac_cv_header_gif_lib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48987 if test "x$ac_cv_header_gif_lib_h" = xyes; then :
48988 
48989 else
48990    as_fn_error $? "--with-giflib=system specified, but gif_lib.h not found!" "$LINENO" 5
48991 fi
48992 
48993 
48994     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for DGifGetCode in -lgif" >&5
48995 $as_echo_n "checking for DGifGetCode in -lgif... " >&6; }
48996 if ${ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode+:} false; then :
48997   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
48998 else
48999   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49000 LIBS="-lgif  $LIBS"
49001 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49002 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49003 
49004 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49005    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49006    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49007 #ifdef __cplusplus
49008 extern "C"
49009 #endif
49010 char DGifGetCode ();
49011 int
49012 main ()
49013 {
49014 return DGifGetCode ();
49015   ;
49016   return 0;
49017 }
49018 _ACEOF
49019 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49020   ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode=yes
49021 else
49022   ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode=no
49023 fi
49024 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49025     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49026 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49027 fi
49028 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" >&5
49029 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" >&6; }
49030 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" = xyes; then :
49031   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49032 #define HAVE_LIBGIF 1
49033 _ACEOF
49034 
49035   LIBS="-lgif $LIBS"
49036 
49037 else
49038    as_fn_error $? "--with-giflib=system specified, but no giflib found!" "$LINENO" 5
49039 fi
49040 
49041 
49042     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBGIF=true
49043   else
49044     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value of --with-giflib: ${with_giflib}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49045   fi
49046 
49047 
49048   ###############################################################################
49049   #
49050   # Check for the lcms2 library
49051   #
49052 
49053 
49054 # Check whether --with-lcms was given.
49055 if test "${with_lcms+set}" = set; then :
49056   withval=$with_lcms;
49057 fi
49058 
49059 
49060   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which lcms to use" >&5
49061 $as_echo_n "checking for which lcms to use... " >&6; }
49062 
49063   DEFAULT_LCMS=bundled
49064 
49065   #
49066   # If user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LCMS
49067   #
49068   if test "x${with_lcms}" = "x"; then
49069       with_lcms=${DEFAULT_LCMS}
49070   fi
49071 
49072   if test "x${with_lcms}" = "xbundled"; then
49073     USE_EXTERNAL_LCMS=false
49074     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49075 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49076   elif test "x${with_lcms}" = "xsystem"; then
49077     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49078 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49079 
49080 pkg_failed=no
49081 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LCMS" >&5
49082 $as_echo_n "checking for LCMS... " >&6; }
49083 
49084 if test -n "$LCMS_CFLAGS"; then
49085     pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS="$LCMS_CFLAGS"
49086  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49087     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49088     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"lcms2\""; } >&5
49089   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "lcms2") 2>&5
49090   ac_status=$?
49091   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49092   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49093   pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "lcms2" 2>/dev/null`
49094 else
49095   pkg_failed=yes
49096 fi
49097  else
49098     pkg_failed=untried
49099 fi
49100 if test -n "$LCMS_LIBS"; then
49101     pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS="$LCMS_LIBS"
49102  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49103     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49104     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"lcms2\""; } >&5
49105   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "lcms2") 2>&5
49106   ac_status=$?
49107   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49108   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49109   pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "lcms2" 2>/dev/null`
49110 else
49111   pkg_failed=yes
49112 fi
49113  else
49114     pkg_failed=untried
49115 fi
49116 
49117 
49118 
49119 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49120 
49121 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49122         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49123 else
49124         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49125 fi
49126         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49127                 LCMS_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "lcms2" 2>&1`
49128         else
49129                 LCMS_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "lcms2" 2>&1`
49130         fi
49131         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49132         echo "$LCMS_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49133 
49134         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49135 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49136                 LCMS_FOUND=no
49137 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49138         LCMS_FOUND=no
49139 else
49140         LCMS_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS
49141         LCMS_LIBS=$pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS
49142         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49143 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49144         LCMS_FOUND=yes
49145 fi
49146     if test "x${LCMS_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49147       USE_EXTERNAL_LCMS=true
49148     else
49149       as_fn_error $? "--with-lcms=system specified, but no lcms found!" "$LINENO" 5
49150     fi
49151   else
49152     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value for --with-lcms: ${with_lcms}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49153   fi
49154 
49155 
49156 
49157   ###############################################################################
49158   #
49159   # Check for the png library
49160   #
49161 
49162 
49163 # Check whether --with-libpng was given.
49164 if test "${with_libpng+set}" = set; then :
49165   withval=$with_libpng;
49166 fi
49167 
49168 
49169 
49170   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which libpng to use" >&5
49171 $as_echo_n "checking for which libpng to use... " >&6; }
49172 
49173   # default is bundled
49174   DEFAULT_LIBPNG=bundled
49175 
49176   #
49177   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LIBPNG
49178   #
49179   if test "x${with_libpng}" = "x"; then
49180       with_libpng=${DEFAULT_LIBPNG}
49181   fi
49182 
49183   if test "x${with_libpng}" = "xbundled"; then
49184       USE_EXTERNAL_LIBPNG=false
49185       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49186 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49187   elif test "x${with_libpng}" = "xsystem"; then
49188 
49189 pkg_failed=no
49190 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for PNG" >&5
49191 $as_echo_n "checking for PNG... " >&6; }
49192 
49193 if test -n "$PNG_CFLAGS"; then
49194     pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS="$PNG_CFLAGS"
49195  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49196     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49197     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libpng\""; } >&5
49198   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libpng") 2>&5
49199   ac_status=$?
49200   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49201   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49202   pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "libpng" 2>/dev/null`
49203 else
49204   pkg_failed=yes
49205 fi
49206  else
49207     pkg_failed=untried
49208 fi
49209 if test -n "$PNG_LIBS"; then
49210     pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS="$PNG_LIBS"
49211  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49212     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49213     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libpng\""; } >&5
49214   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libpng") 2>&5
49215   ac_status=$?
49216   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49217   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49218   pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "libpng" 2>/dev/null`
49219 else
49220   pkg_failed=yes
49221 fi
49222  else
49223     pkg_failed=untried
49224 fi
49225 
49226 
49227 
49228 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49229 
49230 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49231         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49232 else
49233         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49234 fi
49235         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49236                 PNG_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "libpng" 2>&1`
49237         else
49238                 PNG_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "libpng" 2>&1`
49239         fi
49240         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49241         echo "$PNG_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49242 
49243         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49244 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49245                  LIBPNG_FOUND=no
49246 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49247          LIBPNG_FOUND=no
49248 else
49249         PNG_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS
49250         PNG_LIBS=$pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS
49251         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49252 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49253          LIBPNG_FOUND=yes
49254 fi
49255       if test "x${LIBPNG_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49256           USE_EXTERNAL_LIBPNG=true
49257           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49258 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49259       else
49260           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system not found" >&5
49261 $as_echo "system not found" >&6; }
49262           as_fn_error $? "--with-libpng=system specified, but no libpng found!" "$LINENO" 5
49263       fi
49264   else
49265       as_fn_error $? "Invalid value of --with-libpng: ${with_libpng}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49266   fi
49267 
49268 
49269   ###############################################################################
49270   #
49271   # Check for the zlib library
49272   #
49273 
49274 
49275 # Check whether --with-zlib was given.
49276 if test "${with_zlib+set}" = set; then :
49277   withval=$with_zlib;
49278 fi
49279 
49280 
49281   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for compress in -lz" >&5
49282 $as_echo_n "checking for compress in -lz... " >&6; }
49283 if ${ac_cv_lib_z_compress+:} false; then :
49284   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49285 else
49286   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49287 LIBS="-lz  $LIBS"
49288 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49289 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49290 
49291 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49292    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49293    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49294 #ifdef __cplusplus
49295 extern "C"
49296 #endif
49297 char compress ();
49298 int
49299 main ()
49300 {
49301 return compress ();
49302   ;
49303   return 0;
49304 }
49305 _ACEOF
49306 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49307   ac_cv_lib_z_compress=yes
49308 else
49309   ac_cv_lib_z_compress=no
49310 fi
49311 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49312     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49313 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49314 fi
49315 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_z_compress" >&5
49316 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_z_compress" >&6; }
49317 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_z_compress" = xyes; then :
49318    ZLIB_FOUND=yes
49319 else
49320    ZLIB_FOUND=no
49321 fi
49322 
49323 
49324   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which zlib to use" >&5
49325 $as_echo_n "checking for which zlib to use... " >&6; }
49326 
49327   DEFAULT_ZLIB=bundled
49328   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
49329     #
49330     # On macosx default is system...on others default is
49331     #
49332     DEFAULT_ZLIB=system
49333   fi
49334 
49335   if test "x${ZLIB_FOUND}" != "xyes"; then
49336     #
49337     # If we don't find any system...set default to bundled
49338     #
49339     DEFAULT_ZLIB=bundled
49340   fi
49341 
49342   #
49343   # If user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_ZLIB
49344   #
49345   if test "x${with_zlib}" = "x"; then
49346     with_zlib=${DEFAULT_ZLIB}
49347   fi
49348 
49349   if test "x${with_zlib}" = "xbundled"; then
49350     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBZ=false
49351     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49352 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49353   elif test "x${with_zlib}" = "xsystem"; then
49354     if test "x${ZLIB_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49355       USE_EXTERNAL_LIBZ=true
49356       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49357 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49358     else
49359       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system not found" >&5
49360 $as_echo "system not found" >&6; }
49361       as_fn_error $? "--with-zlib=system specified, but no zlib found!" "$LINENO" 5
49362     fi
49363   else
49364     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value for --with-zlib: ${with_zlib}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49365   fi
49366 
49367 
49368 
49369   ###############################################################################
49370   LIBZIP_CAN_USE_MMAP=true
49371 
49372 
49373 
49374   ###############################################################################
49375   #
49376   # Check if altzone exists in time.h
49377   #
49378 
49379   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49380 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49381 #include <time.h>
49382 int
49383 main ()
49384 {
49385 return (int)altzone;
49386   ;
49387   return 0;
49388 }
49389 _ACEOF
49390 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49391   has_altzone=yes
49392 else
49393   has_altzone=no
49394 fi
49395 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49396     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49397   if test "x$has_altzone" = xyes; then
49398 
49399 $as_echo "#define HAVE_ALTZONE 1" >>confdefs.h
49400 
49401   fi
49402 
49403   ###############################################################################
49404   #
49405   # Check the maths library
49406   #
49407 
49408   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for cos in -lm" >&5
49409 $as_echo_n "checking for cos in -lm... " >&6; }
49410 if ${ac_cv_lib_m_cos+:} false; then :
49411   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49412 else
49413   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49414 LIBS="-lm  $LIBS"
49415 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49416 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49417 
49418 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49419    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49420    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49421 #ifdef __cplusplus
49422 extern "C"
49423 #endif
49424 char cos ();
49425 int
49426 main ()
49427 {
49428 return cos ();
49429   ;
49430   return 0;
49431 }
49432 _ACEOF
49433 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49434   ac_cv_lib_m_cos=yes
49435 else
49436   ac_cv_lib_m_cos=no
49437 fi
49438 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49439     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49440 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49441 fi
49442 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_m_cos" >&5
49443 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_m_cos" >&6; }
49444 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_m_cos" = xyes; then :
49445   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49446 #define HAVE_LIBM 1
49447 _ACEOF
49448 
49449   LIBS="-lm $LIBS"
49450 
49451 else
49452 
49453         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Maths library was not found" >&5
49454 $as_echo "$as_me: Maths library was not found" >&6;}
49455 
49456 
49457 fi
49458 
49459 
49460 
49461   ###############################################################################
49462   #
49463   # Check for libdl.so
49464 
49465   save_LIBS="$LIBS"
49466   LIBS=""
49467   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dlopen in -ldl" >&5
49468 $as_echo_n "checking for dlopen in -ldl... " >&6; }
49469 if ${ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen+:} false; then :
49470   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49471 else
49472   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49473 LIBS="-ldl  $LIBS"
49474 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49475 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49476 
49477 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49478    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49479    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49480 #ifdef __cplusplus
49481 extern "C"
49482 #endif
49483 char dlopen ();
49484 int
49485 main ()
49486 {
49487 return dlopen ();
49488   ;
49489   return 0;
49490 }
49491 _ACEOF
49492 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49493   ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen=yes
49494 else
49495   ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen=no
49496 fi
49497 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49498     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49499 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49500 fi
