49501 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" >&5
49502 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" >&6; }
49503 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" = xyes; then :
49504   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49505 #define HAVE_LIBDL 1
49506 _ACEOF
49507 
49508   LIBS="-ldl $LIBS"
49509 
49510 fi
49511 
49512   LIBDL="$LIBS"
49513 
49514   LIBS="$save_LIBS"
49515 
49516 
49517   ###############################################################################
49518   #
49519   # statically link libstdc++ before C++ ABI is stablized on Linux unless
49520   # dynamic build is configured on command line.
49521   #
49522 
49523 # Check whether --with-stdc++lib was given.
49524 if test "${with_stdc__lib+set}" = set; then :
49525   withval=$with_stdc__lib;
49526         if test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xdynamic && test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xstatic \
49527                 && test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xdefault; then
49528           as_fn_error $? "Bad parameter value --with-stdc++lib=$with_stdc__lib!" "$LINENO" 5
49529         fi
49530 
49531 else
49532   with_stdc__lib=default
49533 
49534 fi
49535 
49536 
49537   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
49538     # Test if -lstdc++ works.
49539     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if dynamic link of stdc++ is possible" >&5
49540 $as_echo_n "checking if dynamic link of stdc++ is possible... " >&6; }
49541     ac_ext=cpp
49542 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49543 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49544 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49545 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49546 
49547     OLD_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
49548     CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS -lstdc++"
49549     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49550 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49551 
49552 int
49553 main ()
49554 {
49555 return 0;
49556   ;
49557   return 0;
49558 }
49559 _ACEOF
49560 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49561   has_dynamic_libstdcxx=yes
49562 else
49563   has_dynamic_libstdcxx=no
49564 fi
49565 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49566     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49567     CXXFLAGS="$OLD_CXXFLAGS"
49568     ac_ext=cpp
49569 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49570 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49571 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49572 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49573 
49574     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $has_dynamic_libstdcxx" >&5
49575 $as_echo "$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" >&6; }
49576 
49577     # Test if stdc++ can be linked statically.
49578     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if static link of stdc++ is possible" >&5
49579 $as_echo_n "checking if static link of stdc++ is possible... " >&6; }
49580     STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS="-Wl,-Bstatic -lstdc++ -lgcc -Wl,-Bdynamic"
49581     ac_ext=cpp
49582 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49583 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49584 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49585 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49586 
49587     OLD_LIBS="$LIBS"
49588     OLD_CXX="$CXX"
49589     LIBS="$STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS"
49590     CXX="$CC"
49591     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49592 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49593 
49594 int
49595 main ()
49596 {
49597 return 0;
49598   ;
49599   return 0;
49600 }
49601 _ACEOF
49602 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49603   has_static_libstdcxx=yes
49604 else
49605   has_static_libstdcxx=no
49606 fi
49607 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49608     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49609     LIBS="$OLD_LIBS"
49610     CXX="$OLD_CXX"
49611     ac_ext=cpp
49612 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49613 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49614 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49615 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49616 
49617     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $has_static_libstdcxx" >&5
49618 $as_echo "$has_static_libstdcxx" >&6; }
49619 
49620     if test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno && test "x$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49621       as_fn_error $? "Cannot link to stdc++, neither dynamically nor statically!" "$LINENO" 5
49622     fi
49623 
49624     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xstatic && test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49625       as_fn_error $? "Static linking of libstdc++ was not possible!" "$LINENO" 5
49626     fi
49627 
49628     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xdynamic && test "x$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49629       as_fn_error $? "Dynamic linking of libstdc++ was not possible!" "$LINENO" 5
49630     fi
49631 
49632     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to link with libstdc++" >&5
49633 $as_echo_n "checking how to link with libstdc++... " >&6; }
49634     # If dynamic was requested, it's available since it would fail above otherwise.
49635     # If dynamic wasn't requested, go with static unless it isn't available.
49636     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xdynamic || test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno || test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49637       LIBCXX="$LIBCXX -lstdc++"
49638       LDCXX="$CXX"
49639       STATIC_CXX_SETTING="STATIC_CXX=false"
49640       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: dynamic" >&5
49641 $as_echo "dynamic" >&6; }
49642     else
49643       LIBCXX="$LIBCXX $STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS"
49644       LDCXX="$CC"
49645       STATIC_CXX_SETTING="STATIC_CXX=true"
49646       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: static" >&5
49647 $as_echo "static" >&6; }
49648     fi
49649   fi
49650 
49651 
49652   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZERO" = xtrue || test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49653     # Figure out LIBFFI_CFLAGS and LIBFFI_LIBS
49654 
49655 pkg_failed=no
49656 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LIBFFI" >&5
49657 $as_echo_n "checking for LIBFFI... " >&6; }
49658 
49659 if test -n "$LIBFFI_CFLAGS"; then
49660     pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS="$LIBFFI_CFLAGS"
49661  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49662     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49663     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libffi\""; } >&5
49664   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libffi") 2>&5
49665   ac_status=$?
49666   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49667   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49668   pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "libffi" 2>/dev/null`
49669 else
49670   pkg_failed=yes
49671 fi
49672  else
49673     pkg_failed=untried
49674 fi
49675 if test -n "$LIBFFI_LIBS"; then
49676     pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS="$LIBFFI_LIBS"
49677  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49678     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49679     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libffi\""; } >&5
49680   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libffi") 2>&5
49681   ac_status=$?
49682   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49683   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49684   pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "libffi" 2>/dev/null`
49685 else
49686   pkg_failed=yes
49687 fi
49688  else
49689     pkg_failed=untried
49690 fi
49691 
49692 
49693 
49694 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49695 
49696 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49697         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49698 else
49699         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49700 fi
49701         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49702                 LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "libffi" 2>&1`
49703         else
49704                 LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "libffi" 2>&1`
49705         fi
49706         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49707         echo "$LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49708 
49709         as_fn_error $? "Package requirements (libffi) were not met:
49710 
49711 $LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS
49712 
49713 Consider adjusting the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable if you
49714 installed software in a non-standard prefix.
49715 
49716 Alternatively, you may set the environment variables LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49717 and LIBFFI_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
49718 See the pkg-config man page for more details.
49719 " "$LINENO" 5
49720 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49721         { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
49722 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
49723 as_fn_error $? "The pkg-config script could not be found or is too old.  Make sure it
49724 is in your PATH or set the PKG_CONFIG environment variable to the full
49725 path to pkg-config.
49726 
49727 Alternatively, you may set the environment variables LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49728 and LIBFFI_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
49729 See the pkg-config man page for more details.
49730 
49731 To get pkg-config, see <http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org/>.
49732 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
49733 else
49734         LIBFFI_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49735         LIBFFI_LIBS=$pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS
49736         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49737 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49738         :
49739 fi
49740 
49741   fi
49742 
49743   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49744     # Extract the first word of "llvm-config", so it can be a program name with args.
49745 set dummy llvm-config; ac_word=$2
49746 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
49747 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
49748 if ${ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG+:} false; then :
49749   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49750 else
49751   if test -n "$LLVM_CONFIG"; then
49752   ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG="$LLVM_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test.
49753 else
49754 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
49755 for as_dir in $PATH
49756 do
49757   IFS=$as_save_IFS
49758   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
49759     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
49760   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
49761     ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG="llvm-config"
49762     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
49763     break 2
49764   fi
49765 done
49766   done
49767 IFS=$as_save_IFS
49768 
49769 fi
49770 fi
49771 LLVM_CONFIG=$ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG
49772 if test -n "$LLVM_CONFIG"; then
49773   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LLVM_CONFIG" >&5
49774 $as_echo "$LLVM_CONFIG" >&6; }
49775 else
49776   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49777 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49778 fi
49779 
49780 
49781 
49782     if test "x$LLVM_CONFIG" != xllvm-config; then
49783       as_fn_error $? "llvm-config not found in $PATH." "$LINENO" 5
49784     fi
49785 
49786     llvm_components="jit mcjit engine nativecodegen native"
49787     unset LLVM_CFLAGS
49788     for flag in $("$LLVM_CONFIG" --cxxflags); do
49789       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-[ID]'; then
49790         if test "${flag}" != "-D_DEBUG" ; then
49791           if test "${LLVM_CFLAGS}" != "" ; then
49792             LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS} "
49793           fi
49794           LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS}${flag}"
49795         fi
49796       fi
49797     done
49798     llvm_version=$("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --version | sed 's/\.//; s/svn.*//')
49799     LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS} -DSHARK_LLVM_VERSION=${llvm_version}"
49800 
49801     unset LLVM_LDFLAGS
49802     for flag in $("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --ldflags); do
49803       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-L'; then
49804         if test "${LLVM_LDFLAGS}" != ""; then
49805           LLVM_LDFLAGS="${LLVM_LDFLAGS} "
49806         fi
49807         LLVM_LDFLAGS="${LLVM_LDFLAGS}${flag}"
49808       fi
49809     done
49810 
49811     unset LLVM_LIBS
49812     for flag in $("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --libs ${llvm_components}); do
49813       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-l'; then
49814         if test "${LLVM_LIBS}" != ""; then
49815           LLVM_LIBS="${LLVM_LIBS} "
49816         fi
49817         LLVM_LIBS="${LLVM_LIBS}${flag}"
49818       fi
49819     done
49820 
49821 
49822 
49823 
49824   fi
49825 
49826   # libCrun is the c++ runtime-library with SunStudio (roughly the equivalent of gcc's libstdc++.so)
49827   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio && test "x$LIBCXX" = x; then
49828     LIBCXX="${SYSROOT}/usr/lib${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR}/libCrun.so.1"
49829   fi
49830 
49831   # TODO better (platform agnostic) test
49832   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx && test "x$LIBCXX" = x && test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
49833     LIBCXX="-lstdc++"
49834   fi
49835 
49836 
49837 
49838 
49839   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
49840 
49841 
49842 # Check whether --with-msvcr-dll was given.
49843 if test "${with_msvcr_dll+set}" = set; then :
49844   withval=$with_msvcr_dll;
49845 fi
49846 
49847 
49848   if test "x$with_msvcr_dll" != x; then
49849     # If given explicitely by user, do not probe. If not present, fail directly.
49850 
49851   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$with_msvcr_dll"
49852   METHOD="--with-msvcr-dll"
49853   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
49854     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
49855 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
49856 
49857     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
49858     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
49859 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
49860     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
49861     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49862       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49863       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
49864       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49865         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
49866       else
49867         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
49868       fi
49869     else
49870       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49871         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
49872       else
49873         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49874       fi
49875     fi
49876     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
49877       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
49878 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
49879       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49880       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49881 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49882       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49883 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49884     else
49885       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
49886 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
49887       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
49888 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
49889     fi
49890   fi
49891 
49892     if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
49893       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a proper msvcr100.dll as specified by --with-msvcr-dll" "$LINENO" 5
49894     fi
49895   fi
49896 
49897   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
49898     # Probe: Using well-known location from Visual Studio 10.0
49899     if test "x$VCINSTALLDIR" != x; then
49900       CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$VCINSTALLDIR"
49901 
49902   windows_path="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR"
49903   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
49904     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
49905     CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$unix_path"
49906   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49907     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
49908     CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$unix_path"
49909   fi
49910 
49911       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
49912         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR/redist/x64/Microsoft.VC100.CRT/msvcr100.dll"
49913       else
49914         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC100.CRT/msvcr100.dll"
49915       fi
49916 
49917   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49918   METHOD="well-known location in VCINSTALLDIR"
49919   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
49920     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
49921 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
49922 
49923     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
49924     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
49925 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
49926     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
49927     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49928       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49929       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
49930       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49931         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
49932       else
49933         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
49934       fi
49935     else
49936       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49937         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
49938       else
49939         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49940       fi
49941     fi
49942     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
49943       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
49944 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
49945       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49946       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49947 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49948       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49949 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49950     else
49951       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
49952 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
49953       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
49954 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
49955     fi
49956   fi
49957 
49958     fi
49959   fi
49960 
49961   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
49962     # Probe: Check in the Boot JDK directory.
49963     POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$BOOT_JDK/bin/msvcr100.dll"
49964 
49965   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49966   METHOD="well-known location in Boot JDK"
49967   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
49968     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
49969 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
49970 
49971     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
49972     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
49973 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
49974     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
49975     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49976       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49977       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
49978       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49979         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
49980       else
49981         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
49982       fi
49983     else
49984       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49985         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
49986       else
49987         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49988       fi
49989     fi
49990     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
49991       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
49992 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
49993       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49994       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49995 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49996       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49997 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49998     else
49999       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50000 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50001       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50002 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50003     fi
50004   fi
50005 
50006   fi
50007 
50008   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50009     # Probe: Look in the Windows system32 directory
50010     CYGWIN_SYSTEMROOT="$SYSTEMROOT"
50011

50013   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50014     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
50015     CYGWIN_SYSTEMROOT="$unix_path"
50016   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50017     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
50018     CYGWIN_SYSTEMROOT="$unix_path"
50019   fi
50020

50022 
50023   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50024   METHOD="well-known location in SYSTEMROOT"
50025   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
50026     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
50027 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}

50032     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
50033     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50034       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
50035       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
50036       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50037         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
50038       else
50039         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
50040       fi
50041     else
50042       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50043         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
50044       else

50046       fi
50047     fi

50053 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50054       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
50055 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
50056     else
50057       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50058 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50059       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50060 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50061     fi
50062   fi
50063 
50064   fi
50065 
50066   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50067     # Probe: If Visual Studio Express is installed, there is usually one with the debugger
50068     if test "x$VS100COMNTOOLS" != x; then
50069       CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR="$VS100COMNTOOLS/.."
50070 
50071   windows_path="$CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR"
50072   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50073     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
50074     CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR="$unix_path"
50075   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50076     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
50077     CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR="$unix_path"
50078   fi
50079 
50080       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
50081         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP -i /x64/ | $HEAD --lines 1`
50082       else
50083         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP -i /x86/ | $HEAD --lines 1`
50084       fi
50085 
50086   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50087   METHOD="search of VS100COMNTOOLS"
50088   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
50089     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
50090 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
50091 
50092     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
50093     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
50094 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
50095     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
50096     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50097       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
50098       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
50099       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50100         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
50101       else
50102         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
50103       fi
50104     else
50105       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50106         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
50107       else
50108         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
50109       fi
50110     fi
50111     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
50112       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
50113 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
50114       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50115       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50116 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50117       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
50118 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
50119     else
50120       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50121 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50122       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50123 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50124     fi
50125   fi
50126 
50127     fi
50128   fi
50129 
50130   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50131     # Probe: Search wildly in the VCINSTALLDIR. We've probably lost by now.
50132     # (This was the original behaviour; kept since it might turn up something)
50133     if test "x$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" != x; then
50134       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
50135         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP x64 | $HEAD --lines 1`
50136       else
50137         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP x86 | $GREP -v ia64 | $GREP -v x64 | $HEAD --lines 1`
50138         if test "x$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50139           # We're grasping at straws now...
50140           POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $HEAD --lines 1`
50141         fi
50142       fi
50143 
50144 
50145   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50146   METHOD="search of VCINSTALLDIR"
50147   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
50148     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
50149 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
50150 
50151     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
50152     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
50153 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
50154     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
50155     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50156       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
50157       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
50158       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50159         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
50160       else
50161         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
50162       fi
50163     else
50164       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50165         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
50166       else
50167         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
50168       fi
50169     fi
50170     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
50171       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
50172 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
50173       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50174       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50175 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50176       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
50177 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
50178     else
50179       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50180 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50181       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50182 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50183     fi
50184   fi
50185 
50186     fi
50187   fi
50188 
50189   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50190     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50191 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50192     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50193 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50194     as_fn_error $? "Could not find msvcr100.dll. Please specify using --with-msvcr-dll." "$LINENO" 5
50195   fi
50196 
50197 
50198   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50199 
50200   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
50201   # unix format.
50202   path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50203   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
50204 
50205   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
50206   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
50207   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
50208   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
50209   #
50210   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
50211   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
50212   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
50213   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
50214     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
50215 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
50216     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MSVCR_DLL" "$LINENO" 5
50217   fi
50218 
50219   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
50220   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
50221 
50222   input_path="$new_path"
50223   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
50224   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
50225   # take no chances and rewrite it.
50226   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
50227   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
50228   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
50229     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
50230     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
50231     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
50232     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
50233       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
50234       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
50235       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
50236       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
50237       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
50238       new_path="$input_path"
50239     fi
50240   fi
50241 
50242   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
50243   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
50244     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
50245     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
50246       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
50247       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
50248       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
50249     fi
50250   fi
50251 
50252 
50253   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
50254     MSVCR_DLL="$new_path"
50255     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&5
50256 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
50257   fi
50258 
50259   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50260 
50261   path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50262   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
50263   new_path="$path"
50264   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
50265     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
50266     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
50267   fi
50268 
50269 
50270   input_path="$new_path"
50271   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
50272   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
50273   # take no chances and rewrite it.
50274   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
50275   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
50276   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
50277     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
50278     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
50279   fi
50280 
50281 
50282   windows_path="$new_path"
50283   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50284     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
50285     new_path="$unix_path"
50286   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50287     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
50288     new_path="$unix_path"
50289   fi
50290 
50291   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
50292     MSVCR_DLL="$new_path"
50293     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&5
50294 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
50295   fi
50296 
50297   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
50298   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
50299 
50300   else
50301     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
50302     path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50303     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
50304     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
50305       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
50306 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
50307       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
50308     fi
50309 
50310     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
50311     eval path="$path"
50312     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
50313       as_fn_error $? "The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
50314     fi
50315 
50316     MSVCR_DLL="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
50317   fi
50318 
50319 
50320 
50321 
50322 # Check whether --with-dxsdk was given.
50323 if test "${with_dxsdk+set}" = set; then :
50324   withval=$with_dxsdk; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50325 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50326 fi
50327 
50328 
50329 
50330 
50331 # Check whether --with-dxsdk-lib was given.
50332 if test "${with_dxsdk_lib+set}" = set; then :
50333   withval=$with_dxsdk_lib; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-lib is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50334 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-lib is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50335 fi
50336 
50337 
50338 
50339 
50340 # Check whether --with-dxsdk-include was given.
50341 if test "${with_dxsdk_include+set}" = set; then :
50342   withval=$with_dxsdk_include; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-include is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50343 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-include is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50344 fi
50345 
50346 
50347   fi
50348 
50349 
50350 
50351 ###############################################################################
50352 #
50353 # We need to do some final tweaking, when everything else is done.
50354 #
50355 ###############################################################################
50356 
50357 
50358   HOTSPOT_MAKE_ARGS="$HOTSPOT_TARGET"
50359 
50360 
50361   # The name of the Service Agent jar.
50362   SALIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}saproc${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
50363   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
50364     SALIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}sawindbg${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
50365   fi
50366 
50367 
50368 
50369     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if elliptic curve crypto implementation is present" >&5
50370 $as_echo_n "checking if elliptic curve crypto implementation is present... " >&6; }
50371 
50372     if test -d "${SRC_ROOT}/jdk/src/jdk.crypto.ec/share/native/libsunec/impl"; then
50373       ENABLE_INTREE_EC=yes
50374       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50375 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50376     else
50377       ENABLE_INTREE_EC=no
50378       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50379 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50380     fi
50381 
50382 
50383 
50384 
50385 ###############################################################################
50386 #
50387 # Configure parts of the build that only affect the build performance,
50388 # not the result.
50389 #
50390 ###############################################################################
50391 
50392 
50393   # How many cores do we have on this build system?
50394 
50395 # Check whether --with-num-cores was given.
50396 if test "${with_num_cores+set}" = set; then :
50397   withval=$with_num_cores;
50398 fi
50399 
50400   if test "x$with_num_cores" = x; then
50401     # The number of cores were not specified, try to probe them.
50402 
50403   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for number of cores" >&5
50404 $as_echo_n "checking for number of cores... " >&6; }
50405   NUM_CORES=1
50406   FOUND_CORES=no
50407 
50408   if test -f /proc/cpuinfo; then
50409     # Looks like a Linux (or cygwin) system
50410     NUM_CORES=`cat /proc/cpuinfo  | grep -c processor`
50411     FOUND_CORES=yes
50412   elif test -x /usr/sbin/psrinfo; then
50413     # Looks like a Solaris system
50414     NUM_CORES=`LC_MESSAGES=C /usr/sbin/psrinfo -v | grep -c on-line`
50415     FOUND_CORES=yes
50416   elif test -x /usr/sbin/system_profiler; then
50417     # Looks like a MacOSX system
50418     NUM_CORES=`/usr/sbin/system_profiler -detailLevel full SPHardwareDataType | grep 'Cores' | awk  '{print $5}'`
50419     FOUND_CORES=yes
50420   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xaix ; then
50421     NUM_CORES=`/usr/sbin/prtconf | grep "^Number Of Processors" | awk '{ print $4 }'`
50422     FOUND_CORES=yes
50423   elif test -n "$NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS"; then
50424     # On windows, look in the env
50425     NUM_CORES=$NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS
50426     FOUND_CORES=yes
50427   fi
50428 
50429   if test "x$FOUND_CORES" = xyes; then
50430     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NUM_CORES" >&5
50431 $as_echo "$NUM_CORES" >&6; }
50432   else
50433     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: could not detect number of cores, defaulting to 1" >&5
50434 $as_echo "could not detect number of cores, defaulting to 1" >&6; }
50435     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: This will disable all parallelism from build!" >&5
50436 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: This will disable all parallelism from build!" >&2;}
50437   fi
50438 
50439   else
50440     NUM_CORES=$with_num_cores
50441   fi
50442 
50443 
50444 
50445   # How much memory do we have on this build system?
50446 
50447 # Check whether --with-memory-size was given.
50448 if test "${with_memory_size+set}" = set; then :
50449   withval=$with_memory_size;
50450 fi
50451 
50452   if test "x$with_memory_size" = x; then
50453     # The memory size was not specified, try to probe it.
50454 
50455   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for memory size" >&5
50456 $as_echo_n "checking for memory size... " >&6; }
50457   # Default to 1024 MB
50458   MEMORY_SIZE=1024
50459   FOUND_MEM=no
50460 
50461   if test -f /proc/meminfo; then
50462     # Looks like a Linux (or cygwin) system
50463     MEMORY_SIZE=`cat /proc/meminfo | grep MemTotal | awk '{print $2}'`
50464     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024`
50465     FOUND_MEM=yes
50466   elif test -x /usr/sbin/prtconf; then
50467     # Looks like a Solaris or AIX system
50468     MEMORY_SIZE=`/usr/sbin/prtconf | grep "^Memory [Ss]ize" | awk '{ print $3 }'`
50469     FOUND_MEM=yes
50470   elif test -x /usr/sbin/system_profiler; then
50471     # Looks like a MacOSX system
50472     MEMORY_SIZE=`/usr/sbin/system_profiler -detailLevel full SPHardwareDataType | grep 'Memory' | awk  '{print $2}'`
50473     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE \* 1024`
50474     FOUND_MEM=yes
50475   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xwindows; then
50476     # Windows, but without cygwin
50477     MEMORY_SIZE=`wmic computersystem get totalphysicalmemory -value | grep = | cut -d "=" -f 2-`
50478     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024 / 1024`
50479     FOUND_MEM=yes
50480   fi
50481 
50482   if test "x$FOUND_MEM" = xyes; then
50483     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&5
50484 $as_echo "$MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&6; }
50485   else
50486     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: could not detect memory size, defaulting to $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&5
50487 $as_echo "could not detect memory size, defaulting to $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&6; }
50488     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: This might seriously impact build performance!" >&5
50489 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: This might seriously impact build performance!" >&2;}
50490   fi
50491 
50492   else
50493     MEMORY_SIZE=$with_memory_size
50494   fi
50495 
50496 
50497 
50498   # Provide a decent default number of parallel jobs for make depending on
50499   # number of cores, amount of memory and machine architecture.
50500 
50501 # Check whether --with-jobs was given.
50502 if test "${with_jobs+set}" = set; then :
50503   withval=$with_jobs;
50504 fi
50505 
50506   if test "x$with_jobs" = x; then
50507     # Number of jobs was not specified, calculate.
50508     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for appropriate number of jobs to run in parallel" >&5
50509 $as_echo_n "checking for appropriate number of jobs to run in parallel... " >&6; }
50510     # Approximate memory in GB.
50511     memory_gb=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024`
50512     # Pick the lowest of memory in gb and number of cores.
50513     if test "$memory_gb" -lt "$NUM_CORES"; then
50514       JOBS="$memory_gb"
50515     else
50516       JOBS="$NUM_CORES"
50517       # On bigger machines, leave some room for other processes to run
50518       if test "$JOBS" -gt "4"; then
50519         JOBS=`expr $JOBS '*' 90 / 100`
50520       fi
50521     fi
50522     # Cap number of jobs to 16
50523     if test "$JOBS" -gt "16"; then
50524       JOBS=16
50525     fi
50526     if test "$JOBS" -eq "0"; then
50527       JOBS=1
50528     fi
50529     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JOBS" >&5
50530 $as_echo "$JOBS" >&6; }
50531   else
50532     JOBS=$with_jobs
50533   fi
50534 
50535 
50536 
50537 # Setup arguments for the boot jdk (after cores and memory have been setup)
50538 
50539   ##############################################################################
50540   #
50541   # Specify jvm options for anything that is run with the Boot JDK.
50542   # Not all JVM:s accept the same arguments on the command line.
50543   #
50544 
50545 # Check whether --with-boot-jdk-jvmargs was given.
50546 if test "${with_boot_jdk_jvmargs+set}" = set; then :
50547   withval=$with_boot_jdk_jvmargs;
50548 fi
50549 
50550 
50551   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command " >&5
50552 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command ... " >&6; }
50553 
50554   # Disable special log output when a debug build is used as Boot JDK...
50555 
50556   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput" >&5
50557   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput -version" >&5
50558   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput -version 2>&1`
50559   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50560   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50561   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50562     boot_jdk_jvmargs="$boot_jdk_jvmargs -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput"
50563     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50564   else
50565     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50566     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50567     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50568   fi
50569 
50570 
50571   # Apply user provided options.
50572 
50573   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&5
50574   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs -version" >&5
50575   OUTPUT=`$JAVA $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs -version 2>&1`
50576   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50577   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50578   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50579     boot_jdk_jvmargs="$boot_jdk_jvmargs $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs"
50580     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50581   else
50582     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50583     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50584     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50585   fi
50586 
50587 
50588   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&5
50589 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&6; }
50590 
50591   # For now, general JAVA_FLAGS are the same as the boot jdk jvmargs
50592   JAVA_FLAGS=$boot_jdk_jvmargs
50593 
50594 
50595 
50596   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command for big workloads" >&5
50597 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command for big workloads... " >&6; }
50598 
50599   # Starting amount of heap memory.
50600 
50601   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms64M" >&5
50602   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xms64M -version" >&5
50603   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xms64M -version 2>&1`
50604   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50605   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50606   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50607     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -Xms64M"
50608     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50609   else
50610     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50611     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50612     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50613   fi
50614 
50615 
50616   # Maximum amount of heap memory.
50617   # Maximum stack size.
50618   JVM_MAX_HEAP=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 2`
50619   if test "x$BUILD_NUM_BITS" = x32; then
50620     if test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -gt "1100"; then
50621       JVM_MAX_HEAP=1100
50622     elif test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -lt "512"; then
50623       JVM_MAX_HEAP=512
50624     fi
50625     STACK_SIZE=768
50626   else
50627     # Running Javac on a JVM on a 64-bit machine, takes more space since 64-bit
50628     # pointers are used. Apparently, we need to increase the heap and stack
50629     # space for the jvm. More specifically, when running javac to build huge
50630     # jdk batch
50631     if test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -gt "1600"; then
50632       JVM_MAX_HEAP=1600
50633     elif test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -lt "512"; then
50634       JVM_MAX_HEAP=512
50635     fi
50636     STACK_SIZE=1536
50637   fi
50638 
50639   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M" >&5
50640   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M -version" >&5
50641   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M -version 2>&1`
50642   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50643   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50644   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50645     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M"
50646     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50647   else
50648     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50649     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50650     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50651   fi
50652 
50653 
50654   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE" >&5
50655   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE -version" >&5
50656   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE -version 2>&1`
50657   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50658   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50659   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50660     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE"
50661     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50662   else
50663     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50664     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50665     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50666   fi
50667 
50668 
50669   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs_big" >&5
50670 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big" >&6; }
50671 
50672   JAVA_FLAGS_BIG=$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big
50673 
50674 
50675 
50676   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command for small workloads" >&5
50677 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command for small workloads... " >&6; }
50678 
50679   # Use serial gc for small short lived tools if possible
50680 
50681   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:+UseSerialGC" >&5
50682   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:+UseSerialGC -version" >&5
50683   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:+UseSerialGC -version 2>&1`
50684   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50685   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50686   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50687     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -XX:+UseSerialGC"
50688     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50689   else
50690     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50691     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50692     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50693   fi
50694 
50695 
50696   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms32M" >&5
50697   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xms32M -version" >&5
50698   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xms32M -version 2>&1`
50699   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50700   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50701   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50702     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -Xms32M"
50703     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50704   else
50705     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50706     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50707     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50708   fi
50709 
50710 
50711   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xmx512M" >&5
50712   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xmx512M -version" >&5
50713   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xmx512M -version 2>&1`
50714   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50715   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50716   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50717     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -Xmx512M"
50718     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50719   else
50720     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50721     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50722     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50723   fi
50724 
50725 
50726   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs_small" >&5
50727 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small" >&6; }
50728 
50729   JAVA_FLAGS_SMALL=$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small
50730 
50731 
50732   JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL=""
50733   for f in $JAVA_FLAGS_SMALL; do
50734     JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL="$JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL -J$f"
50735   done
50736 
50737 
50738 
50739 # Setup smart javac (after cores and memory have been setup)
50740 
50741 
50742 # Check whether --with-sjavac-server-java was given.
50743 if test "${with_sjavac_server_java+set}" = set; then :
50744   withval=$with_sjavac_server_java;
50745 fi
50746 
50747 
50748   if test "x$with_sjavac_server_java" != x; then
50749     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA="$with_sjavac_server_java"
50750     FOUND_VERSION=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -version 2>&1 | grep " version \""`
50751     if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" = x; then
50752       as_fn_error $? "Could not execute server java: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA" "$LINENO" 5
50753     fi
50754   else
50755     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA="$JAVA"
50756   fi
50757 
50758 
50759   if test "$MEMORY_SIZE" -gt "3000"; then
50760 
50761   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -d64" >&5
50762   $ECHO "Command: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -d64 -version" >&5
50763   OUTPUT=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -d64 -version 2>&1`
50764   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50765   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50766   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50767     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS="$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS -d64"
50768     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50769   else
50770     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50771     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50772     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50773   fi
50774 
50775     if test "$JVM_ARG_OK" = true; then
50776       JVM_64BIT=true
50777       JVM_ARG_OK=false
50778     fi
50779   fi
50780 
50781   MX_VALUE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 2`
50782   if test "$JVM_64BIT" = true; then
50783     # Set ms lower than mx since more than one instance of the server might
50784     # get launched at the same time before they figure out which instance won.
50785     MS_VALUE=512
50786     if test "$MX_VALUE" -gt "2048"; then
50787       MX_VALUE=2048
50788     fi
50789   else
50790     MS_VALUE=256
50791     if test "$MX_VALUE" -gt "1500"; then
50792       MX_VALUE=1500
50793     fi
50794   fi
50795   if test "$MX_VALUE" -lt "512"; then
50796     MX_VALUE=512
50797   fi
50798 
50799   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M" >&5
50800   $ECHO "Command: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M -version" >&5
50801   OUTPUT=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M -version 2>&1`
50802   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50803   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50804   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50805     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS="$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M"
50806     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50807   else
50808     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50809     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50810     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50811   fi
50812 
50813 
50814 
50815   # Check whether --enable-sjavac was given.
50816 if test "${enable_sjavac+set}" = set; then :
50817   enableval=$enable_sjavac; ENABLE_SJAVAC="${enableval}"
50818 else
50819   ENABLE_SJAVAC='no'
50820 fi
50821 
50822   if test "x$JVM_ARG_OK" = "xfalse"; then
50823     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Could not set -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M, disabling sjavac" >&5
50824 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Could not set -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M, disabling sjavac" >&2;}
50825     ENABLE_SJAVAC=no;
50826   fi
50827   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether to use sjavac" >&5
50828 $as_echo_n "checking whether to use sjavac... " >&6; }
50829   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ENABLE_SJAVAC" >&5
50830 $as_echo "$ENABLE_SJAVAC" >&6; }
50831 
50832 
50833   if test "x$ENABLE_SJAVAC" = xyes; then
50834     SJAVAC_SERVER_DIR="$OUTPUT_ROOT/javacservers"
50835   else
50836     SJAVAC_SERVER_DIR=
50837   fi
50838 
50839 
50840 
50841 # Can the C/C++ compiler use precompiled headers?
50842 
50843 
50844   ###############################################################################
50845   #
50846   # Can the C/C++ compiler use precompiled headers?
50847   #
50848   # Check whether --enable-precompiled-headers was given.
50849 if test "${enable_precompiled_headers+set}" = set; then :
50850   enableval=$enable_precompiled_headers; ENABLE_PRECOMPH=${enable_precompiled_headers}
50851 else
50852   ENABLE_PRECOMPH=yes
50853 fi
50854 
50855 
50856   USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=1
50857   if test "x$ENABLE_PRECOMPH" = xno; then
50858     USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=0
50859   fi
50860 
50861   if test "x$ENABLE_PRECOMPH" = xyes; then
50862     # Check that the compiler actually supports precomp headers.
50863     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
50864       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking that precompiled headers work" >&5
50865 $as_echo_n "checking that precompiled headers work... " >&6; }
50866       echo "int alfa();" > conftest.h
50867       $CXX -x c++-header conftest.h -o conftest.hpp.gch 2>&5 >&5
50868       if test ! -f conftest.hpp.gch; then
50869         USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=0
50870         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50871 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50872       else
50873         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50874 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50875       fi
50876       rm -f conftest.h conftest.hpp.gch
50877     fi
50878   fi
50879 
50880 
50881 
50882 
50883 # Setup use of ccache, if available
50884 
50885   # Check whether --enable-ccache was given.
50886 if test "${enable_ccache+set}" = set; then :
50887   enableval=$enable_ccache;
50888 fi
50889 
50890 
50891   CCACHE=
50892   CCACHE_STATUS=
50893   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking is ccache enabled" >&5
50894 $as_echo_n "checking is ccache enabled... " >&6; }
50895   if test "x$enable_ccache" = xyes; then
50896     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "xgcc" -o "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "xclang"; then
50897       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50898 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50899       OLD_PATH="$PATH"
50900       if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
50901         PATH=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$PATH
50902       fi
50903 
50904 
50905 
50906   # Publish this variable in the help.
50907 
50908 
50909   if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
50910     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
50911     for ac_prog in ccache
50912 do
50913   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
50914 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
50915 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
50916 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
50917 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
50918   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
50919 else
50920   case $CCACHE in
50921   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
50922   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
50923   ;;
50924   *)
50925   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
50926 for as_dir in $PATH
50927 do
50928   IFS=$as_save_IFS
50929   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
50930     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
50931   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
50932     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
50933     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
50934     break 2
50935   fi
50936 done
50937   done
50938 IFS=$as_save_IFS
50939 
50940   ;;
50941 esac
50942 fi
50943 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
50944 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
50945   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
50946 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
50947 else
50948   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50949 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50950 fi
50951 
50952 
50953   test -n "$CCACHE" && break
50954 done
50955 
50956   else
50957     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
50958 
50959     # Try to remove the string !CCACHE! from our list.
50960     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!CCACHE!/}
50961     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
50962       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
50963       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
50964       if test "xCCACHE" != xBASH; then
50965         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of CCACHE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
50966 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of CCACHE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
50967       fi
50968       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
50969       for ac_prog in ccache
50970 do
50971   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
50972 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
50973 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
50974 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
50975 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
50976   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
50977 else
50978   case $CCACHE in
50979   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
50980   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
50981   ;;
50982   *)
50983   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
50984 for as_dir in $PATH
50985 do
50986   IFS=$as_save_IFS
50987   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
50988     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
50989   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
50990     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
50991     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
50992     break 2
50993   fi
50994 done
50995   done
50996 IFS=$as_save_IFS
50997 
50998   ;;
50999 esac
51000 fi
51001 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
51002 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
51003   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
51004 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
51005 else
51006   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51007 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51008 fi
51009 
51010 
51011   test -n "$CCACHE" && break
51012 done
51013 
51014     else
51015       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
51016       # for the tool.
51017 
51018       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
51019       # for unknown variables in the end.
51020       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
51021 
51022       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
51023       tool_specified="$CCACHE"
51024       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
51025       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
51026         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
51027         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_basename" >&5
51028 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_basename" >&6;}
51029         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
51030 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
51031 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
51032 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
51033 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
51034   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
51035 else
51036   case $CCACHE in
51037   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
51038   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
51039   ;;
51040   *)
51041   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
51042 for as_dir in $PATH
51043 do
51044   IFS=$as_save_IFS
51045   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
51046     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
51047   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
51048     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
51049     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
51050     break 2
51051   fi
51052 done
51053   done
51054 IFS=$as_save_IFS
51055 
51056   ;;
51057 esac
51058 fi
51059 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
51060 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
51061   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
51062 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
51063 else
51064   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51065 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51066 fi
51067 
51068 
51069         if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51070           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
51071         fi
51072       else
51073         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
51074         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified" >&5
51075 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified" >&6;}
51076         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CCACHE" >&5
51077 $as_echo_n "checking for CCACHE... " >&6; }
51078         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
51079           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
51080 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
51081           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
51082         fi
51083         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
51084 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
51085       fi
51086     fi
51087   fi
51088 
51089 
51090 
51091   if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51092     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for CCACHE" "$LINENO" 5
51093   fi
51094 
51095 
51096       PATH="$OLD_PATH"
51097       CCACHE_VERSION=`$CCACHE --version | head -n1 | $SED 's/[A-Za-z ]*//'`
51098       CCACHE_STATUS="Active ($CCACHE_VERSION)"
51099     else
51100       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51101 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51102       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: ccache is not supported with toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" >&5
51103 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: ccache is not supported with toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" >&2;}
51104     fi
51105   elif test "x$enable_ccache" = xno; then
51106     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, explicitly disabled" >&5
51107 $as_echo "no, explicitly disabled" >&6; }
51108     CCACHE_STATUS="Disabled"
51109   elif test "x$enable_ccache" = x; then
51110     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51111 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51112   else
51113     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unknown" >&5
51114 $as_echo "unknown" >&6; }
51115     as_fn_error $? "--enable-ccache does not accept any parameters" "$LINENO" 5
51116   fi
51117 
51118 
51119 
51120 # Check whether --with-ccache-dir was given.
51121 if test "${with_ccache_dir+set}" = set; then :
51122   withval=$with_ccache_dir;
51123 fi
51124 
51125 
51126   if test "x$with_ccache_dir" != x; then
51127     # When using a non home ccache directory, assume the use is to share ccache files
51128     # with other users. Thus change the umask.
51129     SET_CCACHE_DIR="CCACHE_DIR=$with_ccache_dir CCACHE_UMASK=002"
51130     if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51131       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-ccache-dir has no meaning when ccache is not enabled" >&5
51132 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-ccache-dir has no meaning when ccache is not enabled" >&2;}
51133     fi
51134   fi
51135 
51136   if test "x$CCACHE" != x; then
51137 
51138   if test "x$CCACHE" != x; then
51139     if test "x$USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER" = "x1"; then
51140       HAS_BAD_CCACHE=`$ECHO $CCACHE_VERSION | \
51141           $GREP -e '^1.*' -e '^2.*' -e '^3\.0.*' -e '^3\.1\.[0123]'`
51142       if test "x$HAS_BAD_CCACHE" != "x"; then
51143         as_fn_error $? "Precompiled headers requires ccache 3.1.4 or later, found $CCACHE_VERSION" "$LINENO" 5
51144       fi
51145       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if C-compiler supports ccache precompiled headers" >&5
51146 $as_echo_n "checking if C-compiler supports ccache precompiled headers... " >&6; }
51147       CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG="-fpch-preprocess"
51148       PUSHED_FLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
51149       CXXFLAGS="$CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG $CXXFLAGS"
51150       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
51151 /* end confdefs.h.  */
51152 
51153 int
51154 main ()
51155 {
51156 
51157   ;
51158   return 0;
51159 }
51160 _ACEOF
51161 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
51162   CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK=yes
51163 else
51164   CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK=no
51165 fi
51166 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
51167       CXXFLAGS="$PUSHED_FLAGS"
51168       if test "x$CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK" = xyes; then
51169         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
51170 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
51171         CFLAGS_CCACHE="$CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG"
51172 
51173         CCACHE_SLOPPINESS=pch_defines,time_macros
51174       else
51175         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51176 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51177         as_fn_error $? "Cannot use ccache with precompiled headers without compiler support for $CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG" "$LINENO" 5
51178       fi
51179     fi
51180 
51181     CCACHE="CCACHE_COMPRESS=1 $SET_CCACHE_DIR \
51182         CCACHE_SLOPPINESS=$CCACHE_SLOPPINESS CCACHE_BASEDIR=$TOPDIR $CCACHE"
51183 
51184     if test "x$SET_CCACHE_DIR" != x; then
51185       mkdir -p $CCACHE_DIR > /dev/null 2>&1
51186       chmod a+rwxs $CCACHE_DIR > /dev/null 2>&1
51187     fi
51188   fi
51189 
51190   fi
51191 
51192 
51193 ###############################################################################
51194 #
51195 # And now the finish...
51196 #
51197 ###############################################################################
51198 
51199 # Check for some common pitfalls
51200 
51201   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
51202     file_to_test="$SRC_ROOT/LICENSE"
51203     if test `$STAT -c '%a' "$file_to_test"` -lt 400; then
51204       as_fn_error $? "Bad file permissions on src files. This is usually caused by cloning the repositories with a non cygwin hg in a directory not created in cygwin." "$LINENO" 5
51205     fi
51206   fi
51207 
51208 
51209   # Did user specify any unknown variables?
51210 
51211   if test "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES" != x; then
51212     # Replace the separating ! with spaces before presenting for end user.
51213     unknown_variables=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!/ }
51214     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: The following variables might be unknown to configure: $unknown_variables" >&5
51215 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: The following variables might be unknown to configure: $unknown_variables" >&2;}
51216   fi
51217 
51218 
51219   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if build directory is on local disk" >&5
51220 $as_echo_n "checking if build directory is on local disk... " >&6; }
51221 
51222   # df -l lists only local disks; if the given directory is not found then
51223   # a non-zero exit code is given
51224   if test "x$DF" = x; then
51225     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
51226       # msys does not have df; use Windows "net use" instead.
51227       IS_NETWORK_DISK=`net use | grep \`pwd -W | cut -d ":" -f 1 | tr a-z A-Z\`:`
51228       if test "x$IS_NETWORK_DISK" = x; then
51229         OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51230       else
51231         OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="no"
51232       fi
51233     else
51234       # No df here, say it's local
51235       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51236     fi
51237   else
51238     if $DF -l $OUTPUT_ROOT > /dev/null 2>&1; then
51239       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51240     else
51241       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="no"
51242     fi
51243   fi
51244 
51245   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" >&5
51246 $as_echo "$OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" >&6; }
51247 
51248 
51249 
51250   # Check if the user has any old-style ALT_ variables set.
51251   FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES=`env | grep ^ALT_`
51252 
51253   # Before generating output files, test if they exist. If they do, this is a reconfigure.
51254   # Since we can't properly handle the dependencies for this, warn the user about the situation
51255   if test -e $OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk; then
51256     IS_RECONFIGURE=yes
51257   else
51258     IS_RECONFIGURE=no
51259   fi
51260 
51261 
51262 # At the end, call the custom hook. (Dummy macro if no custom sources available)
51263 
51264 
51265 # We're messing a bit with internal autoconf variables to put the config.status
51266 # in the output directory instead of the current directory.
51267 CONFIG_STATUS="$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.status"
51268 
51269 # Create the actual output files. Now the main work of configure is done.
51270 cat >confcache <<\_ACEOF
51271 # This file is a shell script that caches the results of configure
51272 # tests run on this system so they can be shared between configure
51273 # scripts and configure runs, see configure's option --config-cache.
51274 # It is not useful on other systems.  If it contains results you don't
51275 # want to keep, you may remove or edit it.
51276 #
51277 # config.status only pays attention to the cache file if you give it
51278 # the --recheck option to rerun configure.
51279 #
51280 # `ac_cv_env_foo' variables (set or unset) will be overridden when
51281 # loading this file, other *unset* `ac_cv_foo' will be assigned the
51282 # following values.
51283 
51284 _ACEOF
51285 
51286 # The following way of writing the cache mishandles newlines in values,
51287 # but we know of no workaround that is simple, portable, and efficient.
51288 # So, we kill variables containing newlines.
51289 # Ultrix sh set writes to stderr and can't be redirected directly,
51290 # and sets the high bit in the cache file unless we assign to the vars.
51291 (
51292   for ac_var in `(set) 2>&1 | sed -n 's/^\([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\)=.*/\1/p'`; do
51293     eval ac_val=\$$ac_var
51294     case $ac_val in #(
51295     *${as_nl}*)
51296       case $ac_var in #(
51297       *_cv_*) { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: cache variable $ac_var contains a newline" >&5
51298 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: cache variable $ac_var contains a newline" >&2;} ;;
51299       esac
51300       case $ac_var in #(
51301       _ | IFS | as_nl) ;; #(
51302       BASH_ARGV | BASH_SOURCE) eval $ac_var= ;; #(
51303       *) { eval $ac_var=; unset $ac_var;} ;;
51304       esac ;;
51305     esac
51306   done
51307 
51308   (set) 2>&1 |
51309     case $as_nl`(ac_space=' '; set) 2>&1` in #(
51310     *${as_nl}ac_space=\ *)
51311       # `set' does not quote correctly, so add quotes: double-quote
51312       # substitution turns \\\\ into \\, and sed turns \\ into \.
51313       sed -n \
51314         "s/'/'\\\\''/g;
51315           s/^\\([_$as_cr_alnum]*_cv_[_$as_cr_alnum]*\\)=\\(.*\\)/\\1='\\2'/p"
51316       ;; #(
51317     *)
51318       # `set' quotes correctly as required by POSIX, so do not add quotes.
51319       sed -n "/^[_$as_cr_alnum]*_cv_[_$as_cr_alnum]*=/p"
51320       ;;
51321     esac |
51322     sort
51323 ) |
51324   sed '
51325      /^ac_cv_env_/b end
51326      t clear
51327      :clear
51328      s/^\([^=]*\)=\(.*[{}].*\)$/test "${\1+set}" = set || &/
51329      t end
51330      s/^\([^=]*\)=\(.*\)$/\1=${\1=\2}/
51331      :end' >>confcache
51332 if diff "$cache_file" confcache >/dev/null 2>&1; then :; else
51333   if test -w "$cache_file"; then
51334     if test "x$cache_file" != "x/dev/null"; then
51335       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: updating cache $cache_file" >&5
51336 $as_echo "$as_me: updating cache $cache_file" >&6;}
51337       if test ! -f "$cache_file" || test -h "$cache_file"; then
51338         cat confcache >"$cache_file"
51339       else
51340         case $cache_file in #(
51341         */* | ?:*)
51342           mv -f confcache "$cache_file"$$ &&
51343           mv -f "$cache_file"$$ "$cache_file" ;; #(
51344         *)
51345           mv -f confcache "$cache_file" ;;
51346         esac
51347       fi
51348     fi
51349   else
51350     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: not updating unwritable cache $cache_file" >&5
51351 $as_echo "$as_me: not updating unwritable cache $cache_file" >&6;}
51352   fi
51353 fi
51354 rm -f confcache
51355 
51356 test "x$prefix" = xNONE && prefix=$ac_default_prefix
51357 # Let make expand exec_prefix.
51358 test "x$exec_prefix" = xNONE && exec_prefix='${prefix}'
51359 
51360 # Transform confdefs.h into DEFS.
51361 # Protect against shell expansion while executing Makefile rules.
51362 # Protect against Makefile macro expansion.
51363 #
51364 # If the first sed substitution is executed (which looks for macros that
51365 # take arguments), then branch to the quote section.  Otherwise,
51366 # look for a macro that doesn't take arguments.
51367 ac_script='
51368 :mline
51369 /\\$/{
51370  N
51371  s,\\\n,,
51372  b mline
51373 }
51374 t clear
51375 :clear
51376 s/^[     ]*#[    ]*define[       ][      ]*\([^  (][^    (]*([^)]*)\)[   ]*\(.*\)/-D\1=\2/g
51377 t quote
51378 s/^[     ]*#[    ]*define[       ][      ]*\([^  ][^     ]*\)[   ]*\(.*\)/-D\1=\2/g
51379 t quote
51380 b any
51381 :quote
51382 s/[      `~#$^&*(){}\\|;'\''"<>?]/\\&/g
51383 s/\[/\\&/g
51384 s/\]/\\&/g
51385 s/\$/$$/g
51386 H
51387 :any
51388 ${
51389         g
51390         s/^\n//
51391         s/\n/ /g
51392         p
51393 }
51394 '
51395 DEFS=`sed -n "$ac_script" confdefs.h`
51396 
51397 
51398 ac_libobjs=
51399 ac_ltlibobjs=
51400 U=
51401 for ac_i in : $LIBOBJS; do test "x$ac_i" = x: && continue
51402   # 1. Remove the extension, and $U if already installed.
51403   ac_script='s/\$U\././;s/\.o$//;s/\.obj$//'
51404   ac_i=`$as_echo "$ac_i" | sed "$ac_script"`
51405   # 2. Prepend LIBOBJDIR.  When used with automake>=1.10 LIBOBJDIR
51406   #    will be set to the directory where LIBOBJS objects are built.
51407   as_fn_append ac_libobjs " \${LIBOBJDIR}$ac_i\$U.$ac_objext"
51408   as_fn_append ac_ltlibobjs " \${LIBOBJDIR}$ac_i"'$U.lo'
51409 done
51410 LIBOBJS=$ac_libobjs
51411 
51412 LTLIBOBJS=$ac_ltlibobjs
51413 
51414 
51415 
51416 : "${CONFIG_STATUS=./config.status}"
51417 ac_write_fail=0
51418 ac_clean_files_save=$ac_clean_files
51419 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files $CONFIG_STATUS"
51420 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: creating $CONFIG_STATUS" >&5
51421 $as_echo "$as_me: creating $CONFIG_STATUS" >&6;}
51422 as_write_fail=0
51423 cat >$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ASEOF || as_write_fail=1
51424 #! $SHELL
51425 # Generated by $as_me.
51426 # Run this file to recreate the current configuration.
51427 # Compiler output produced by configure, useful for debugging
51428 # configure, is in config.log if it exists.
51429 
51430 debug=false
51431 ac_cs_recheck=false
51432 ac_cs_silent=false
51433 
51434 SHELL=\${CONFIG_SHELL-$SHELL}
51435 export SHELL
51436 _ASEOF
51437 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ASEOF || as_write_fail=1
51438 ## -------------------- ##
51439 ## M4sh Initialization. ##
51440 ## -------------------- ##
51441 
51442 # Be more Bourne compatible
51443 DUALCASE=1; export DUALCASE # for MKS sh
51444 if test -n "${ZSH_VERSION+set}" && (emulate sh) >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
51445   emulate sh
51446   NULLCMD=:
51447   # Pre-4.2 versions of Zsh do word splitting on ${1+"$@"}, which
51448   # is contrary to our usage.  Disable this feature.
51449   alias -g '${1+"$@"}'='"$@"'
51450   setopt NO_GLOB_SUBST
51451 else
51452   case `(set -o) 2>/dev/null` in #(
51453   *posix*) :
51454     set -o posix ;; #(
51455   *) :
51456      ;;
51457 esac
51458 fi
51459 
51460 
51461 as_nl='
51462 '
51463 export as_nl
51464 # Printing a long string crashes Solaris 7 /usr/bin/printf.
51465 as_echo='\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'
