51466 as_echo=$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo
51467 as_echo=$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo
51468 # Prefer a ksh shell builtin over an external printf program on Solaris,
51469 # but without wasting forks for bash or zsh.
51470 if test -z "$BASH_VERSION$ZSH_VERSION" \
51471     && (test "X`print -r -- $as_echo`" = "X$as_echo") 2>/dev/null; then
51472   as_echo='print -r --'
51473   as_echo_n='print -rn --'
51474 elif (test "X`printf %s $as_echo`" = "X$as_echo") 2>/dev/null; then
51475   as_echo='printf %s\n'
51476   as_echo_n='printf %s'
51477 else
51478   if test "X`(/usr/ucb/echo -n -n $as_echo) 2>/dev/null`" = "X-n $as_echo"; then
51479     as_echo_body='eval /usr/ucb/echo -n "$1$as_nl"'
51480     as_echo_n='/usr/ucb/echo -n'
51481   else
51482     as_echo_body='eval expr "X$1" : "X\\(.*\\)"'
51483     as_echo_n_body='eval
51484       arg=$1;
51485       case $arg in #(
51486       *"$as_nl"*)
51487         expr "X$arg" : "X\\(.*\\)$as_nl";
51488         arg=`expr "X$arg" : ".*$as_nl\\(.*\\)"`;;
51489       esac;
51490       expr "X$arg" : "X\\(.*\\)" | tr -d "$as_nl"
51491     '
51492     export as_echo_n_body
51493     as_echo_n='sh -c $as_echo_n_body as_echo'
51494   fi
51495   export as_echo_body
51496   as_echo='sh -c $as_echo_body as_echo'
51497 fi
51498 
51499 # The user is always right.
51500 if test "${PATH_SEPARATOR+set}" != set; then
51501   PATH_SEPARATOR=:
51502   (PATH='/bin;/bin'; FPATH=$PATH; sh -c :) >/dev/null 2>&1 && {
51503     (PATH='/bin:/bin'; FPATH=$PATH; sh -c :) >/dev/null 2>&1 ||
51504       PATH_SEPARATOR=';'
51505   }
51506 fi
51507 
51508 
51509 # IFS
51510 # We need space, tab and new line, in precisely that order.  Quoting is
51511 # there to prevent editors from complaining about space-tab.
51512 # (If _AS_PATH_WALK were called with IFS unset, it would disable word
51513 # splitting by setting IFS to empty value.)
51514 IFS=" ""        $as_nl"
51515 
51516 # Find who we are.  Look in the path if we contain no directory separator.
51517 as_myself=
51518 case $0 in #((
51519   *[\\/]* ) as_myself=$0 ;;
51520   *) as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
51521 for as_dir in $PATH
51522 do
51523   IFS=$as_save_IFS
51524   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
51525     test -r "$as_dir/$0" && as_myself=$as_dir/$0 && break
51526   done
51527 IFS=$as_save_IFS
51528 
51529      ;;
51530 esac
51531 # We did not find ourselves, most probably we were run as `sh COMMAND'
51532 # in which case we are not to be found in the path.
51533 if test "x$as_myself" = x; then
51534   as_myself=$0
51535 fi
51536 if test ! -f "$as_myself"; then
51537   $as_echo "$as_myself: error: cannot find myself; rerun with an absolute file name" >&2
51538   exit 1
51539 fi
51540 
51541 # Unset variables that we do not need and which cause bugs (e.g. in
51542 # pre-3.0 UWIN ksh).  But do not cause bugs in bash 2.01; the "|| exit 1"
51543 # suppresses any "Segmentation fault" message there.  '((' could
51544 # trigger a bug in pdksh 5.2.14.
51545 for as_var in BASH_ENV ENV MAIL MAILPATH
51546 do eval test x\${$as_var+set} = xset \
51547   && ( (unset $as_var) || exit 1) >/dev/null 2>&1 && unset $as_var || :
51548 done
51549 PS1='$ '
51550 PS2='> '
51551 PS4='+ '
51552 
51553 # NLS nuisances.
51554 LC_ALL=C
51555 export LC_ALL
51556 LANGUAGE=C
51557 export LANGUAGE
51558 
51559 # CDPATH.
51560 (unset CDPATH) >/dev/null 2>&1 && unset CDPATH
51561 
51562 
51563 # as_fn_error STATUS ERROR [LINENO LOG_FD]
51564 # ----------------------------------------
51565 # Output "`basename $0`: error: ERROR" to stderr. If LINENO and LOG_FD are
51566 # provided, also output the error to LOG_FD, referencing LINENO. Then exit the
51567 # script with STATUS, using 1 if that was 0.
51568 as_fn_error ()
51569 {
51570   as_status=$1; test $as_status -eq 0 && as_status=1
51571   if test "$4"; then
51572     as_lineno=${as_lineno-"$3"} as_lineno_stack=as_lineno_stack=$as_lineno_stack
51573     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: $2" >&$4
51574   fi
51575   $as_echo "$as_me: error: $2" >&2
51576   as_fn_exit $as_status
51577 } # as_fn_error
51578 
51579 
51580 # as_fn_set_status STATUS
51581 # -----------------------
51582 # Set $? to STATUS, without forking.
51583 as_fn_set_status ()
51584 {
51585   return $1
51586 } # as_fn_set_status
51587 
51588 # as_fn_exit STATUS
51589 # -----------------
51590 # Exit the shell with STATUS, even in a "trap 0" or "set -e" context.
51591 as_fn_exit ()
51592 {
51593   set +e
51594   as_fn_set_status $1
51595   exit $1
51596 } # as_fn_exit
51597 
51598 # as_fn_unset VAR
51599 # ---------------
51600 # Portably unset VAR.
51601 as_fn_unset ()
51602 {
51603   { eval $1=; unset $1;}
51604 }
51605 as_unset=as_fn_unset
51606 # as_fn_append VAR VALUE
51607 # ----------------------
51608 # Append the text in VALUE to the end of the definition contained in VAR. Take
51609 # advantage of any shell optimizations that allow amortized linear growth over
51610 # repeated appends, instead of the typical quadratic growth present in naive
51611 # implementations.
51612 if (eval "as_var=1; as_var+=2; test x\$as_var = x12") 2>/dev/null; then :
51613   eval 'as_fn_append ()
51614   {
51615     eval $1+=\$2
51616   }'
51617 else
51618   as_fn_append ()
51619   {
51620     eval $1=\$$1\$2
51621   }
51622 fi # as_fn_append
51623 
51624 # as_fn_arith ARG...
51625 # ------------------
51626 # Perform arithmetic evaluation on the ARGs, and store the result in the
51627 # global $as_val. Take advantage of shells that can avoid forks. The arguments
51628 # must be portable across $(()) and expr.
51629 if (eval "test \$(( 1 + 1 )) = 2") 2>/dev/null; then :
51630   eval 'as_fn_arith ()
51631   {
51632     as_val=$(( $* ))
51633   }'
51634 else
51635   as_fn_arith ()
51636   {
51637     as_val=`expr "$@" || test $? -eq 1`
51638   }
51639 fi # as_fn_arith
51640 
51641 
51642 if expr a : '\(a\)' >/dev/null 2>&1 &&
51643    test "X`expr 00001 : '.*\(...\)'`" = X001; then
51644   as_expr=expr
51645 else
51646   as_expr=false
51647 fi
51648 
51649 if (basename -- /) >/dev/null 2>&1 && test "X`basename -- / 2>&1`" = "X/"; then
51650   as_basename=basename
51651 else
51652   as_basename=false
51653 fi
51654 
51655 if (as_dir=`dirname -- /` && test "X$as_dir" = X/) >/dev/null 2>&1; then
51656   as_dirname=dirname
51657 else
51658   as_dirname=false
51659 fi
51660 
51661 as_me=`$as_basename -- "$0" ||
51662 $as_expr X/"$0" : '.*/\([^/][^/]*\)/*$' \| \
51663          X"$0" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
51664          X"$0" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
51665 $as_echo X/"$0" |
51666     sed '/^.*\/\([^/][^/]*\)\/*$/{
51667             s//\1/
51668             q
51669           }
51670           /^X\/\(\/\/\)$/{
51671             s//\1/
51672             q
51673           }
51674           /^X\/\(\/\).*/{
51675             s//\1/
51676             q
51677           }
51678           s/.*/./; q'`
51679 
51680 # Avoid depending upon Character Ranges.
51681 as_cr_letters='abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'
51682 as_cr_LETTERS='ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
51683 as_cr_Letters=$as_cr_letters$as_cr_LETTERS
51684 as_cr_digits='0123456789'
51685 as_cr_alnum=$as_cr_Letters$as_cr_digits
51686 
51687 ECHO_C= ECHO_N= ECHO_T=
51688 case `echo -n x` in #(((((
51689 -n*)
51690   case `echo 'xy\c'` in
51691   *c*) ECHO_T=' ';;     # ECHO_T is single tab character.
51692   xy)  ECHO_C='\c';;
51693   *)   echo `echo ksh88 bug on AIX 6.1` > /dev/null
51694        ECHO_T=' ';;
51695   esac;;
51696 *)
51697   ECHO_N='-n';;
51698 esac
51699 
51700 rm -f conf$$ conf$$.exe conf$$.file
51701 if test -d conf$$.dir; then
51702   rm -f conf$$.dir/conf$$.file
51703 else
51704   rm -f conf$$.dir
51705   mkdir conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null
51706 fi
51707 if (echo >conf$$.file) 2>/dev/null; then
51708   if ln -s conf$$.file conf$$ 2>/dev/null; then
51709     as_ln_s='ln -s'
51710     # ... but there are two gotchas:
51711     # 1) On MSYS, both `ln -s file dir' and `ln file dir' fail.
51712     # 2) DJGPP < 2.04 has no symlinks; `ln -s' creates a wrapper executable.
51713     # In both cases, we have to default to `cp -pR'.
51714     ln -s conf$$.file conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null && test ! -f conf$$.exe ||
51715       as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51716   elif ln conf$$.file conf$$ 2>/dev/null; then
51717     as_ln_s=ln
51718   else
51719     as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51720   fi
51721 else
51722   as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51723 fi
51724 rm -f conf$$ conf$$.exe conf$$.dir/conf$$.file conf$$.file
51725 rmdir conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null
51726 
51727 
51728 # as_fn_mkdir_p
51729 # -------------
51730 # Create "$as_dir" as a directory, including parents if necessary.
51731 as_fn_mkdir_p ()
51732 {
51733 
51734   case $as_dir in #(
51735   -*) as_dir=./$as_dir;;
51736   esac
51737   test -d "$as_dir" || eval $as_mkdir_p || {
51738     as_dirs=
51739     while :; do
51740       case $as_dir in #(
51741       *\'*) as_qdir=`$as_echo "$as_dir" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"`;; #'(
51742       *) as_qdir=$as_dir;;
51743       esac
51744       as_dirs="'$as_qdir' $as_dirs"
51745       as_dir=`$as_dirname -- "$as_dir" ||
51746 $as_expr X"$as_dir" : 'X\(.*[^/]\)//*[^/][^/]*/*$' \| \
51747          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(//\)[^/]' \| \
51748          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
51749          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
51750 $as_echo X"$as_dir" |
51751     sed '/^X\(.*[^/]\)\/\/*[^/][^/]*\/*$/{
51752             s//\1/
51753             q
51754           }
51755           /^X\(\/\/\)[^/].*/{
51756             s//\1/
51757             q
51758           }
51759           /^X\(\/\/\)$/{
51760             s//\1/
51761             q
51762           }
51763           /^X\(\/\).*/{
51764             s//\1/
51765             q
51766           }
51767           s/.*/./; q'`
51768       test -d "$as_dir" && break
51769     done
51770     test -z "$as_dirs" || eval "mkdir $as_dirs"
51771   } || test -d "$as_dir" || as_fn_error $? "cannot create directory $as_dir"
51772 
51773 
51774 } # as_fn_mkdir_p
51775 if mkdir -p . 2>/dev/null; then
51776   as_mkdir_p='mkdir -p "$as_dir"'
51777 else
51778   test -d ./-p && rmdir ./-p
51779   as_mkdir_p=false
51780 fi
51781 
51782 
51783 # as_fn_executable_p FILE
51784 # -----------------------
51785 # Test if FILE is an executable regular file.
51786 as_fn_executable_p ()
51787 {
51788   test -f "$1" && test -x "$1"
51789 } # as_fn_executable_p
51790 as_test_x='test -x'
51791 as_executable_p=as_fn_executable_p
51792 
51793 # Sed expression to map a string onto a valid CPP name.
51794 as_tr_cpp="eval sed 'y%*$as_cr_letters%P$as_cr_LETTERS%;s%[^_$as_cr_alnum]%_%g'"
51795 
51796 # Sed expression to map a string onto a valid variable name.
51797 as_tr_sh="eval sed 'y%*+%pp%;s%[^_$as_cr_alnum]%_%g'"
51798 
51799 
51800 exec 6>&1
51801 ## ----------------------------------- ##
51802 ## Main body of $CONFIG_STATUS script. ##
51803 ## ----------------------------------- ##
51804 _ASEOF
51805 test $as_write_fail = 0 && chmod +x $CONFIG_STATUS || ac_write_fail=1
51806 
51807 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51808 # Save the log message, to keep $0 and so on meaningful, and to
51809 # report actual input values of CONFIG_FILES etc. instead of their
51810 # values after options handling.
51811 ac_log="
51812 This file was extended by OpenJDK $as_me jdk9, which was
51813 generated by GNU Autoconf 2.69.  Invocation command line was
51814 
51815   CONFIG_FILES    = $CONFIG_FILES
51816   CONFIG_HEADERS  = $CONFIG_HEADERS
51817   CONFIG_LINKS    = $CONFIG_LINKS
51818   CONFIG_COMMANDS = $CONFIG_COMMANDS
51819   $ $0 $@
51820 
51821 on `(hostname || uname -n) 2>/dev/null | sed 1q`
51822 "
51823 
51824 _ACEOF
51825 
51826 case $ac_config_files in *"
51827 "*) set x $ac_config_files; shift; ac_config_files=$*;;
51828 esac
51829 
51830 
51831 
51832 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51833 # Files that config.status was made for.
51834 config_files="$ac_config_files"
51835 
51836 _ACEOF
51837 
51838 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51839 ac_cs_usage="\
51840 \`$as_me' instantiates files and other configuration actions
51841 from templates according to the current configuration.  Unless the files
51842 and actions are specified as TAGs, all are instantiated by default.
51843 
51844 Usage: $0 [OPTION]... [TAG]...
51845 
51846   -h, --help       print this help, then exit
51847   -V, --version    print version number and configuration settings, then exit
51848       --config     print configuration, then exit
51849   -q, --quiet, --silent
51850                    do not print progress messages
51851   -d, --debug      don't remove temporary files
51852       --recheck    update $as_me by reconfiguring in the same conditions
51853       --file=FILE[:TEMPLATE]
51854                    instantiate the configuration file FILE
51855 
51856 Configuration files:
51857 $config_files
51858 
51859 Report bugs to <build-dev@openjdk.java.net>.
51860 OpenJDK home page: <http://openjdk.java.net>."
51861 
51862 _ACEOF
51863 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51864 ac_cs_config="`$as_echo "$ac_configure_args" | sed 's/^ //; s/[\\""\`\$]/\\\\&/g'`"
51865 ac_cs_version="\\
51866 OpenJDK config.status jdk9
51867 configured by $0, generated by GNU Autoconf 2.69,
51868   with options \\"\$ac_cs_config\\"
51869 
51870 Copyright (C) 2012 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
51871 This config.status script is free software; the Free Software Foundation
51872 gives unlimited permission to copy, distribute and modify it."
51873 
51874 ac_pwd='$ac_pwd'
51875 srcdir='$srcdir'
51876 AWK='$AWK'
51877 test -n "\$AWK" || AWK=awk
51878 _ACEOF
51879 
51880 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51881 # The default lists apply if the user does not specify any file.
51882 ac_need_defaults=:
51883 while test $# != 0
51884 do
51885   case $1 in
51886   --*=?*)
51887     ac_option=`expr "X$1" : 'X\([^=]*\)='`
51888     ac_optarg=`expr "X$1" : 'X[^=]*=\(.*\)'`
51889     ac_shift=:
51890     ;;
51891   --*=)
51892     ac_option=`expr "X$1" : 'X\([^=]*\)='`
51893     ac_optarg=
51894     ac_shift=:
51895     ;;
51896   *)
51897     ac_option=$1
51898     ac_optarg=$2
51899     ac_shift=shift
51900     ;;
51901   esac
51902 
51903   case $ac_option in
51904   # Handling of the options.
51905   -recheck | --recheck | --rechec | --reche | --rech | --rec | --re | --r)
51906     ac_cs_recheck=: ;;
51907   --version | --versio | --versi | --vers | --ver | --ve | --v | -V )
51908     $as_echo "$ac_cs_version"; exit ;;
51909   --config | --confi | --conf | --con | --co | --c )
51910     $as_echo "$ac_cs_config"; exit ;;
51911   --debug | --debu | --deb | --de | --d | -d )
51912     debug=: ;;
51913   --file | --fil | --fi | --f )
51914     $ac_shift
51915     case $ac_optarg in
51916     *\'*) ac_optarg=`$as_echo "$ac_optarg" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"` ;;
51917     '') as_fn_error $? "missing file argument" ;;
51918     esac
51919     as_fn_append CONFIG_FILES " '$ac_optarg'"
51920     ac_need_defaults=false;;
51921   --he | --h |  --help | --hel | -h )
51922     $as_echo "$ac_cs_usage"; exit ;;
51923   -q | -quiet | --quiet | --quie | --qui | --qu | --q \
51924   | -silent | --silent | --silen | --sile | --sil | --si | --s)
51925     ac_cs_silent=: ;;
51926 
51927   # This is an error.
51928   -*) as_fn_error $? "unrecognized option: \`$1'
51929 Try \`$0 --help' for more information." ;;
51930 
51931   *) as_fn_append ac_config_targets " $1"
51932      ac_need_defaults=false ;;
51933 
51934   esac
51935   shift
51936 done
51937 
51938 ac_configure_extra_args=
51939 
51940 if $ac_cs_silent; then
51941   exec 6>/dev/null
51942   ac_configure_extra_args="$ac_configure_extra_args --silent"
51943 fi
51944 
51945 _ACEOF
51946 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51947 if \$ac_cs_recheck; then
51948   set X $SHELL '$0' $ac_configure_args \$ac_configure_extra_args --no-create --no-recursion
51949   shift
51950   \$as_echo "running CONFIG_SHELL=$SHELL \$*" >&6
51951   CONFIG_SHELL='$SHELL'
51952   export CONFIG_SHELL
51953   exec "\$@"
51954 fi
51955 
51956 _ACEOF
51957 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51958 exec 5>>config.log
51959 {
51960   echo
51961   sed 'h;s/./-/g;s/^.../## /;s/...$/ ##/;p;x;p;x' <<_ASBOX
51962 ## Running $as_me. ##
51963 _ASBOX
51964   $as_echo "$ac_log"
51965 } >&5
51966 
51967 _ACEOF
51968 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51969 _ACEOF
51970 
51971 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51972 
51973 # Handling of arguments.
51974 for ac_config_target in $ac_config_targets
51975 do
51976   case $ac_config_target in
51977     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/spec.gmk.in" ;;
51978     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot-spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/hotspot-spec.gmk.in" ;;
51979     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/bootcycle-spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/bootcycle-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/bootcycle-spec.gmk.in" ;;
51980     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh:$AUTOCONF_DIR/compare.sh.in" ;;
51981     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/Makefile") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/Makefile:$AUTOCONF_DIR/Makefile.in" ;;
51982 
51983   *) as_fn_error $? "invalid argument: \`$ac_config_target'" "$LINENO" 5;;
51984   esac
51985 done
51986 
51987 
51988 # If the user did not use the arguments to specify the items to instantiate,
51989 # then the envvar interface is used.  Set only those that are not.
51990 # We use the long form for the default assignment because of an extremely
51991 # bizarre bug on SunOS 4.1.3.
51992 if $ac_need_defaults; then
51993   test "${CONFIG_FILES+set}" = set || CONFIG_FILES=$config_files
51994 fi
51995 
51996 # Have a temporary directory for convenience.  Make it in the build tree
51997 # simply because there is no reason against having it here, and in addition,
51998 # creating and moving files from /tmp can sometimes cause problems.
51999 # Hook for its removal unless debugging.
52000 # Note that there is a small window in which the directory will not be cleaned:
52001 # after its creation but before its name has been assigned to `$tmp'.
52002 $debug ||
52003 {
52004   tmp= ac_tmp=
52005   trap 'exit_status=$?
52006   : "${ac_tmp:=$tmp}"
52007   { test ! -d "$ac_tmp" || rm -fr "$ac_tmp"; } && exit $exit_status
52008 ' 0
52009   trap 'as_fn_exit 1' 1 2 13 15
52010 }
52011 # Create a (secure) tmp directory for tmp files.
52012 
52013 {
52014   tmp=`(umask 077 && mktemp -d "./confXXXXXX") 2>/dev/null` &&
52015   test -d "$tmp"
52016 }  ||
52017 {
52018   tmp=./conf$$-$RANDOM
52019   (umask 077 && mkdir "$tmp")
52020 } || as_fn_error $? "cannot create a temporary directory in ." "$LINENO" 5
52021 ac_tmp=$tmp
52022 
52023 # Set up the scripts for CONFIG_FILES section.
52024 # No need to generate them if there are no CONFIG_FILES.
52025 # This happens for instance with `./config.status config.h'.
52026 if test -n "$CONFIG_FILES"; then
52027 
52028 
52029 ac_cr=`echo X | tr X '\015'`
52030 # On cygwin, bash can eat \r inside `` if the user requested igncr.
52031 # But we know of no other shell where ac_cr would be empty at this
52032 # point, so we can use a bashism as a fallback.
52033 if test "x$ac_cr" = x; then
52034   eval ac_cr=\$\'\\r\'
52035 fi
52036 ac_cs_awk_cr=`$AWK 'BEGIN { print "a\rb" }' </dev/null 2>/dev/null`
52037 if test "$ac_cs_awk_cr" = "a${ac_cr}b"; then
52038   ac_cs_awk_cr='\\r'
52039 else
52040   ac_cs_awk_cr=$ac_cr
52041 fi
52042 
52043 echo 'BEGIN {' >"$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" &&
52044 _ACEOF
52045 
52046 
52047 {
52048   echo "cat >conf$$subs.awk <<_ACEOF" &&
52049   echo "$ac_subst_vars" | sed 's/.*/&!$&$ac_delim/' &&
52050   echo "_ACEOF"
52051 } >conf$$subs.sh ||
52052   as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52053 ac_delim_num=`echo "$ac_subst_vars" | grep -c '^'`
52054 ac_delim='%!_!# '
52055 for ac_last_try in false false false false false :; do
52056   . ./conf$$subs.sh ||
52057     as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52058 
52059   ac_delim_n=`sed -n "s/.*$ac_delim\$/X/p" conf$$subs.awk | grep -c X`
52060   if test $ac_delim_n = $ac_delim_num; then
52061     break
52062   elif $ac_last_try; then
52063     as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52064   else
52065     ac_delim="$ac_delim!$ac_delim _$ac_delim!! "
52066   fi
52067 done
52068 rm -f conf$$subs.sh
52069 
52070 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52071 cat >>"\$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" <<\\_ACAWK &&
52072 _ACEOF
52073 sed -n '
52074 h
52075 s/^/S["/; s/!.*/"]=/
52076 p
52077 g
52078 s/^[^!]*!//
52079 :repl
52080 t repl
52081 s/'"$ac_delim"'$//
52082 t delim
52083 :nl
52084 h
52085 s/\(.\{148\}\)..*/\1/
52086 t more1
52087 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/\\n"\\/
52088 p
52089 n
52090 b repl
52091 :more1
52092 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"\\/
52093 p
52094 g
52095 s/.\{148\}//
52096 t nl
52097 :delim
52098 h
52099 s/\(.\{148\}\)..*/\1/
52100 t more2
52101 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"/
52102 p
52103 b
52104 :more2
52105 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"\\/
52106 p
52107 g
52108 s/.\{148\}//
52109 t delim
52110 ' <conf$$subs.awk | sed '
52111 /^[^""]/{
52112   N
52113   s/\n//
52114 }
52115 ' >>$CONFIG_STATUS || ac_write_fail=1
52116 rm -f conf$$subs.awk
52117 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52118 _ACAWK
52119 cat >>"\$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" <<_ACAWK &&
52120   for (key in S) S_is_set[key] = 1
52121   FS = ""
52122 
52123 }
52124 {
52125   line = $ 0
52126   nfields = split(line, field, "@")
52127   substed = 0
52128   len = length(field[1])
52129   for (i = 2; i < nfields; i++) {
52130     key = field[i]
52131     keylen = length(key)
52132     if (S_is_set[key]) {
52133       value = S[key]
52134       line = substr(line, 1, len) "" value "" substr(line, len + keylen + 3)
52135       len += length(value) + length(field[++i])
52136       substed = 1
52137     } else
52138       len += 1 + keylen
52139   }
52140 
52141   print line
52142 }
52143 
52144 _ACAWK
52145 _ACEOF
52146 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52147 if sed "s/$ac_cr//" < /dev/null > /dev/null 2>&1; then
52148   sed "s/$ac_cr\$//; s/$ac_cr/$ac_cs_awk_cr/g"
52149 else
52150   cat
52151 fi < "$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" > "$ac_tmp/subs.awk" \
52152   || as_fn_error $? "could not setup config files machinery" "$LINENO" 5
52153 _ACEOF
52154 
52155 # VPATH may cause trouble with some makes, so we remove sole $(srcdir),
52156 # ${srcdir} and @srcdir@ entries from VPATH if srcdir is ".", strip leading and
52157 # trailing colons and then remove the whole line if VPATH becomes empty
52158 # (actually we leave an empty line to preserve line numbers).
52159 if test "x$srcdir" = x.; then
52160   ac_vpsub='/^[  ]*VPATH[        ]*=[    ]*/{
52161 h
52162 s///
52163 s/^/:/
52164 s/[      ]*$/:/
52165 s/:\$(srcdir):/:/g
52166 s/:\${srcdir}:/:/g
52167 s/:@srcdir@:/:/g
52168 s/^:*//
52169 s/:*$//
52170 x
52171 s/\(=[   ]*\).*/\1/
52172 G
52173 s/\n//
52174 s/^[^=]*=[       ]*$//
52175 }'
52176 fi
52177 
52178 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52179 fi # test -n "$CONFIG_FILES"
52180 
52181 
52182 eval set X "  :F $CONFIG_FILES      "
52183 shift
52184 for ac_tag
52185 do
52186   case $ac_tag in
52187   :[FHLC]) ac_mode=$ac_tag; continue;;
52188   esac
52189   case $ac_mode$ac_tag in
52190   :[FHL]*:*);;
52191   :L* | :C*:*) as_fn_error $? "invalid tag \`$ac_tag'" "$LINENO" 5;;
52192   :[FH]-) ac_tag=-:-;;
52193   :[FH]*) ac_tag=$ac_tag:$ac_tag.in;;
52194   esac
52195   ac_save_IFS=$IFS
52196   IFS=:
52197   set x $ac_tag
52198   IFS=$ac_save_IFS
52199   shift
52200   ac_file=$1
52201   shift
52202 
52203   case $ac_mode in
52204   :L) ac_source=$1;;
52205   :[FH])
52206     ac_file_inputs=
52207     for ac_f
52208     do
52209       case $ac_f in
52210       -) ac_f="$ac_tmp/stdin";;
52211       *) # Look for the file first in the build tree, then in the source tree
52212          # (if the path is not absolute).  The absolute path cannot be DOS-style,
52213          # because $ac_f cannot contain `:'.
52214          test -f "$ac_f" ||
52215            case $ac_f in
52216            [\\/$]*) false;;
52217            *) test -f "$srcdir/$ac_f" && ac_f="$srcdir/$ac_f";;
52218            esac ||
52219            as_fn_error 1 "cannot find input file: \`$ac_f'" "$LINENO" 5;;
52220       esac
52221       case $ac_f in *\'*) ac_f=`$as_echo "$ac_f" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"`;; esac
52222       as_fn_append ac_file_inputs " '$ac_f'"
52223     done
52224 
52225     # Let's still pretend it is `configure' which instantiates (i.e., don't
52226     # use $as_me), people would be surprised to read:
52227     #    /* config.h.  Generated by config.status.  */
52228     configure_input='Generated from '`
52229           $as_echo "$*" | sed 's|^[^:]*/||;s|:[^:]*/|, |g'
52230         `' by configure.'
52231     if test x"$ac_file" != x-; then
52232       configure_input="$ac_file.  $configure_input"
52233       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: creating $ac_file" >&5
52234 $as_echo "$as_me: creating $ac_file" >&6;}
52235     fi
52236     # Neutralize special characters interpreted by sed in replacement strings.
52237     case $configure_input in #(
52238     *\&* | *\|* | *\\* )
52239        ac_sed_conf_input=`$as_echo "$configure_input" |
52240        sed 's/[\\\\&|]/\\\\&/g'`;; #(
52241     *) ac_sed_conf_input=$configure_input;;
52242     esac
52243 
52244     case $ac_tag in
52245     *:-:* | *:-) cat >"$ac_tmp/stdin" \
52246       || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5 ;;
52247     esac
52248     ;;
52249   esac
52250 
52251   ac_dir=`$as_dirname -- "$ac_file" ||
52252 $as_expr X"$ac_file" : 'X\(.*[^/]\)//*[^/][^/]*/*$' \| \
52253          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(//\)[^/]' \| \
52254          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
52255          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
52256 $as_echo X"$ac_file" |
52257     sed '/^X\(.*[^/]\)\/\/*[^/][^/]*\/*$/{
52258             s//\1/
52259             q
52260           }
52261           /^X\(\/\/\)[^/].*/{
52262             s//\1/
52263             q
52264           }
52265           /^X\(\/\/\)$/{
52266             s//\1/
52267             q
52268           }
52269           /^X\(\/\).*/{
52270             s//\1/
52271             q
52272           }
52273           s/.*/./; q'`
52274   as_dir="$ac_dir"; as_fn_mkdir_p
52275   ac_builddir=.
52276 
52277 case "$ac_dir" in
52278 .) ac_dir_suffix= ac_top_builddir_sub=. ac_top_build_prefix= ;;
52279 *)
52280   ac_dir_suffix=/`$as_echo "$ac_dir" | sed 's|^\.[\\/]||'`
52281   # A ".." for each directory in $ac_dir_suffix.
52282   ac_top_builddir_sub=`$as_echo "$ac_dir_suffix" | sed 's|/[^\\/]*|/..|g;s|/||'`
52283   case $ac_top_builddir_sub in
52284   "") ac_top_builddir_sub=. ac_top_build_prefix= ;;
52285   *)  ac_top_build_prefix=$ac_top_builddir_sub/ ;;
52286   esac ;;
52287 esac
52288 ac_abs_top_builddir=$ac_pwd
52289 ac_abs_builddir=$ac_pwd$ac_dir_suffix
52290 # for backward compatibility:
52291 ac_top_builddir=$ac_top_build_prefix
52292 
52293 case $srcdir in
52294   .)  # We are building in place.
52295     ac_srcdir=.
52296     ac_top_srcdir=$ac_top_builddir_sub
52297     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$ac_pwd ;;
52298   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]* )  # Absolute name.
52299     ac_srcdir=$srcdir$ac_dir_suffix;
52300     ac_top_srcdir=$srcdir
52301     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$srcdir ;;
52302   *) # Relative name.
52303     ac_srcdir=$ac_top_build_prefix$srcdir$ac_dir_suffix
52304     ac_top_srcdir=$ac_top_build_prefix$srcdir
52305     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$ac_pwd/$srcdir ;;
52306 esac
52307 ac_abs_srcdir=$ac_abs_top_srcdir$ac_dir_suffix
52308 
52309 
52310   case $ac_mode in
52311   :F)
52312   #
52313   # CONFIG_FILE
52314   #
52315 
52316 _ACEOF
52317 
52318 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52319 # If the template does not know about datarootdir, expand it.
52320 # FIXME: This hack should be removed a few years after 2.60.
52321 ac_datarootdir_hack=; ac_datarootdir_seen=
52322 ac_sed_dataroot='
52323 /datarootdir/ {
52324   p
52325   q
52326 }
52327 /@datadir@/p
52328 /@docdir@/p
52329 /@infodir@/p
52330 /@localedir@/p
52331 /@mandir@/p'
52332 case `eval "sed -n \"\$ac_sed_dataroot\" $ac_file_inputs"` in
52333 *datarootdir*) ac_datarootdir_seen=yes;;
52334 *@datadir@*|*@docdir@*|*@infodir@*|*@localedir@*|*@mandir@*)
52335   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: $ac_file_inputs seems to ignore the --datarootdir setting" >&5
52336 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: $ac_file_inputs seems to ignore the --datarootdir setting" >&2;}
52337 _ACEOF
52338 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52339   ac_datarootdir_hack='
52340   s&@datadir@&$datadir&g
52341   s&@docdir@&$docdir&g
52342   s&@infodir@&$infodir&g
52343   s&@localedir@&$localedir&g
52344   s&@mandir@&$mandir&g
52345   s&\\\${datarootdir}&$datarootdir&g' ;;
52346 esac
52347 _ACEOF
52348 
52349 # Neutralize VPATH when `$srcdir' = `.'.
52350 # Shell code in configure.ac might set extrasub.
52351 # FIXME: do we really want to maintain this feature?
52352 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52353 ac_sed_extra="$ac_vpsub
52354 $extrasub
52355 _ACEOF
52356 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52357 :t
52358 /@[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z_0-9]*@/!b
52359 s|@configure_input@|$ac_sed_conf_input|;t t
52360 s&@top_builddir@&$ac_top_builddir_sub&;t t
52361 s&@top_build_prefix@&$ac_top_build_prefix&;t t
52362 s&@srcdir@&$ac_srcdir&;t t
52363 s&@abs_srcdir@&$ac_abs_srcdir&;t t
52364 s&@top_srcdir@&$ac_top_srcdir&;t t
52365 s&@abs_top_srcdir@&$ac_abs_top_srcdir&;t t
52366 s&@builddir@&$ac_builddir&;t t
52367 s&@abs_builddir@&$ac_abs_builddir&;t t
52368 s&@abs_top_builddir@&$ac_abs_top_builddir&;t t
52369 $ac_datarootdir_hack
52370 "
52371 eval sed \"\$ac_sed_extra\" "$ac_file_inputs" | $AWK -f "$ac_tmp/subs.awk" \
52372   >$ac_tmp/out || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5
52373 
52374 test -z "$ac_datarootdir_hack$ac_datarootdir_seen" &&
52375   { ac_out=`sed -n '/\${datarootdir}/p' "$ac_tmp/out"`; test -n "$ac_out"; } &&
52376   { ac_out=`sed -n '/^[  ]*datarootdir[  ]*:*=/p' \
52377       "$ac_tmp/out"`; test -z "$ac_out"; } &&
52378   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: $ac_file contains a reference to the variable \`datarootdir'
52379 which seems to be undefined.  Please make sure it is defined" >&5
52380 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: $ac_file contains a reference to the variable \`datarootdir'
52381 which seems to be undefined.  Please make sure it is defined" >&2;}
52382 
52383   rm -f "$ac_tmp/stdin"
52384   case $ac_file in
52385   -) cat "$ac_tmp/out" && rm -f "$ac_tmp/out";;
52386   *) rm -f "$ac_file" && mv "$ac_tmp/out" "$ac_file";;
52387   esac \
52388   || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5
52389  ;;
52390 
52391 
52392 
52393   esac
52394 
52395 done # for ac_tag
52396 
52397 
52398 as_fn_exit 0
52399 _ACEOF
52400 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
52401 
52402 test $ac_write_fail = 0 ||
52403   as_fn_error $? "write failure creating $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52404 
52405 
52406 # configure is writing to config.log, and then calls config.status.
52407 # config.status does its own redirection, appending to config.log.
52408 # Unfortunately, on DOS this fails, as config.log is still kept open
52409 # by configure, so config.status won't be able to write to it; its
52410 # output is simply discarded.  So we exec the FD to /dev/null,
52411 # effectively closing config.log, so it can be properly (re)opened and
52412 # appended to by config.status.  When coming back to configure, we
52413 # need to make the FD available again.
52414 if test "$no_create" != yes; then
52415   ac_cs_success=:
52416   ac_config_status_args=
52417   test "$silent" = yes &&
52418     ac_config_status_args="$ac_config_status_args --quiet"
52419   exec 5>/dev/null
52420   $SHELL $CONFIG_STATUS $ac_config_status_args || ac_cs_success=false
52421   exec 5>>config.log
52422   # Use ||, not &&, to avoid exiting from the if with $? = 1, which
52423   # would make configure fail if this is the last instruction.
52424   $ac_cs_success || as_fn_exit 1
52425 fi
52426 if test -n "$ac_unrecognized_opts" && test "$enable_option_checking" != no; then
52427   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: unrecognized options: $ac_unrecognized_opts" >&5
52428 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: unrecognized options: $ac_unrecognized_opts" >&2;}
52429 fi
52430 
52431 
52432 # Try to move the config.log file to the output directory.
52433 if test -e ./config.log; then
52434   $MV -f ./config.log "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" 2> /dev/null
52435 fi
52436 
52437 # Make the compare script executable
52438 $CHMOD +x $OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh
52439 
52440 # Finally output some useful information to the user
52441 
52442   # Finally output some useful information to the user
52443 
52444   printf "\n"
52445   printf "====================================================\n"
52446   if test "x$no_create" != "xyes"; then
52447     if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes"; then
52448       printf "A new configuration has been successfully created in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52449     else
52450       printf "The existing configuration has been successfully updated in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52451     fi
52452   else
52453     if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes"; then
52454       printf "A configuration has been successfully checked but not created\n"
52455     else
52456       printf "The existing configuration has been successfully checked in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52457     fi
52458   fi
52459   if test "x$CONFIGURE_COMMAND_LINE" != x; then
52460     printf "using configure arguments '$CONFIGURE_COMMAND_LINE'.\n"
52461   else
52462     printf "using default settings.\n"
52463   fi
52464 
52465   printf "\n"
52466   printf "Configuration summary:\n"
52467   printf "* Debug level:    $DEBUG_LEVEL\n"
52468   printf "* HS debug level: $HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL\n"
52469   printf "* JDK variant:    $JDK_VARIANT\n"
52470   printf "* JVM variants:   $with_jvm_variants\n"
52471   printf "* OpenJDK target: OS: $OPENJDK_TARGET_OS, CPU architecture: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH, address length: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS\n"
52472 
52473   printf "\n"
52474   printf "Tools summary:\n"
52475   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
52476     printf "* Environment:    $WINDOWS_ENV_VENDOR version $WINDOWS_ENV_VERSION (root at $WINDOWS_ENV_ROOT_PATH)\n"
52477   fi
52478   printf "* Boot JDK:       $BOOT_JDK_VERSION (at $BOOT_JDK)\n"
52479   printf "* Toolchain:      $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION)\n"
52480   printf "* C Compiler:     Version $CC_VERSION_NUMBER (at $CC)\n"
52481   printf "* C++ Compiler:   Version $CXX_VERSION_NUMBER (at $CXX)\n"
52482 
52483   printf "\n"
52484   printf "Build performance summary:\n"
52485   printf "* Cores to use:   $JOBS\n"
52486   printf "* Memory limit:   $MEMORY_SIZE MB\n"
52487   if test "x$CCACHE_STATUS" != "x"; then
52488     printf "* ccache status:  $CCACHE_STATUS\n"
52489   fi
52490   printf "\n"
52491 
52492   if test "x$BUILDING_MULTIPLE_JVM_VARIANTS" = "xyes"; then
52493     printf "NOTE: You have requested to build more than one version of the JVM, which\n"
52494     printf "will result in longer build times.\n"
52495     printf "\n"
52496   fi
52497 
52498   if test "x$FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES" != "x"; then
52499     printf "WARNING: You have old-style ALT_ environment variables set.\n"
52500     printf "These are not respected, and will be ignored. It is recommended\n"
52501     printf "that you clean your environment. The following variables are set:\n"
52502     printf "$FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES\n"
52503     printf "\n"
52504   fi
52505 
52506   if test "x$OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" != "xyes"; then
52507     printf "WARNING: Your build output directory is not on a local disk.\n"
52508     printf "This will severely degrade build performance!\n"
52509     printf "It is recommended that you create an output directory on a local disk,\n"
52510     printf "and run the configure script again from that directory.\n"
52511     printf "\n"
52512   fi
52513 
52514   if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" = "xyes" && test "x$no_create" != "xyes"; then
52515     printf "WARNING: The result of this configuration has overridden an older\n"
52516     printf "configuration. You *should* run 'make clean' to make sure you get a\n"
52517     printf "proper build. Failure to do so might result in strange build problems.\n"
52518     printf "\n"
52519   fi
52520 
52521   if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes" && test "x$no_create" = "xyes"; then
52522     printf "WARNING: The result of this configuration was not saved.\n"
52523     printf "You should run without '--no-create | -n' to create the configuration.\n"
52524     printf "\n"
52525   fi
52526 
52527 
52528 
52529 if test -e "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log"; then
52530   $GREP '^configure:.*: WARNING:' "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" > /dev/null 2>&1
52531   if test $? -eq 0; then
52532     printf "The following warnings were produced. Repeated here for convenience:\n"
52533     # We must quote sed expression (using []) to stop m4 from eating the [].
52534     $GREP '^configure:.*: WARNING:' "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" | $SED -e  's/^configure:[0-9]*: //'
52535     printf "\n"
52536   fi
52537 fi
52538 
52539 
--- EOF ---
